reviews.title: Nice hotel, great service
reviews.content: My wife and I spent one night here this past weekend. The hotel was a great value for the price. We had an interior room (by choice) so we had no view, but we also didn't have any street noise. The room was nice, clean, and comfortable. It was cozy, but there was enough room for the two of us. The room had a small refrigerator, nice sized bathroom, and full closet with a safe. We experienced excellent service from check-in through check-out. We arrived earlier than official check-in time, but were lucky enough to have a room available. They offered to help us with our luggage, but we only had a small bag. (If the room was not available, they would have stored our bag). We dropped off the bag and ran right out to explore the city, but when we got back there was a message from the front desk staff making sure everything was ok. We checked out early the next morning, but stored our bag until the evening, with no problems. We would definitely stay here again.

reviews.title: Very Good Choice for NYC!
reviews.content: The Fitzpatrick Grand Central is a smaller and older hotel in Midtown NYC. The hotel is homey and comfortable and the rooms are well represented on the Fitzpatrick website. The bathroom appeared to be recently remodeled and everything was extremely clean throughout the hotel. What sets this hotel above many is the quality of the staff. Everyone was very helpful and accommodating and went above and beyond to make our stay a memorable one. Kudos to Max who offered various restaurant choices and took time to make a reservation on our behalf. My only negative comment about this hotel is that there were no drawers in which to put clothing. There were two small bedside tables, but the drawers were very small for this purpose. All in all, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Fitzpatrick and would recommend it to other travelers.

reviews.title: Exceptional hotel sevice
reviews.content: The staff at the Fitzpatrick hotel are superb. Very accommodating and a real home from home experience. Very friendly. Great location. Very clean rooms. Will definitely return. Good craic in the bar and restaurant

reviews.title: Excellent location
reviews.content: I would return to this hotel as the location is fantastic. It's off Lexington avenue, near grand central terminal, 5th avenue, and loads of great independent restaurants between e 41st and 50th. I literally walked everywhere from this hotel as it was so central. It's quieter than on the west side and has a nicer feel to the area. The staff are all very friendly and efficient. Rooms are comfortable and serviced daily. Free wifi in the lobby otherwise it's 14.99 usd per day. There's a fridge in the room. White robe and good towels. Good shower. Comfortable bed. Wheeltapper bar looks good although I didn't use it. Would definitely return.

reviews.title: Excellent
reviews.content: We've just returned from a great stay at the Fitzpatrick . Freindly and very helpful staff great location good food quality. Extra touch from the Fitzpatrick was a bottle of champagne fir our birthdays üçæ We would recommend this hiotel and we would return

reviews.title: Belmont week stay

reviews.content: My wife and I came in for the graduation of a family friend from middle school and stayed an extra day to spend with friends. The Fitzpatrick Grand Central is simply a delight! reviews.content: Our hotel was clean and tidy the staff were attentive polite and helpful and I would have no problem going back again, I would however like to see drawer units in the room so we could unpack and not live out of suitcases but that's just our opinion.otherwise comfortable pleasant stay. reviews.content: Excellent location and all staff very helpful and friendly. Very easy to access all sites just round the corner from Grand Central station so access to metro/underground so simple.Recommended John's Coffee Shop on the corner of44th and 2nd Avenue left when you come out of the hotel.Any thing you want excellent value for money and nothing to much trouble. reviews.title: In the city that never sleeps...check out the gorgeous comfortable bed in this hotel
reviews.content: Fab stay. After a long day sightseeing you can look forward to sinking into a gorgeous bed. Very central location. Walking distance to 5th Avenue. Staff were exceptionally friendly. Nice lobby area to sit and relax and access Wifi. Lovely bar and restaurant. Loads of delis nearby for coffee etc.

reviews.title: Amazing staff!!!
reviews.content: We spent our 4 day weekend at the Fitzpatrick and loved it. The location is close to interesting spots in the city and accross from Grand Central Station, which makes it easy to get anywhere. The property is perfectly kept. The staff is outstanding! From the valet (thanks Gregg) to the reception staff and housekeeping, everyone is committed to providing service excellence. Max in reception is the man! He took time to help and went out of his way to make our stay perfect and memorable. Look forward to staying at the Fitzpatrick again!

reviews.title: The Fitzpatrick
reviews.content: This is a great place to stay in Mew York. Right by Grand Central Station and only blocks from Times Square! You will feel welcome at this hotel from the moment you walk in. There is a lounge on site and restaurant with exceptional service and the food is great

reviews.title: Outstanding!
reviews.content: Spent 7 nights in this lovely hotel. It was close to everything. The staff was wonderful and very helpful. Special thanks to Chris (Pub), Sam (wait staff) , and Michael (concierge) for making our stay really special.

reviews.title: Fitzpatrick Grand... It really is!
reviews.content: Well situated near Grand Central Station, this lovely boutique hotel is staffed by warm, welcoming people who will go the extra mile for you. Good food can be had at the Wheeltapper Pub adjoining the hotel. A huge plus, the quiet nights, minus the sounds of traffic and horn honking that we had been warned about.

reviews.title: Loved this hotel
reviews.content: Great location- you can walk all around central manhattan for all the sites, 10-15 minutes walk from the madness of time square. The staff here are so friendly and helpful and as the hotel is small it's relatively quiet. Prices in New York are high anywhere and the wheel tapper pub was the same as everywhere else, lovely waitress staff really friendly- it can get busy in the week there with the office staff coming after work. Overall would definitely recommend hotel if you want to be Central but out of the madness that is Manhattan.

reviews.title: Fantastic location and great hotel
reviews.content: Spent 8 nights at this hotel. Lovely hotel and brilliant location with grand central station just across the street. Staff very helpful and jotel so relaxing after long day sightseeing. Would definitely recommend it and will stsy here again when we next return

reviews.title: A perfect 10!
reviews.content: Cute, boutique-style hotel in a perfect location. Staff was amazing- friendly and helpful! Room was larger than expected, very clean. I would recommend to a friend. I will stay there again when I'm in NY!

reviews.title: Start Spreading the News
reviews.content: Summary. Great place to stay in New York. I would come back no question. We were here to celebrate our anniversary and a niece's wedding. Last time I was here I was 12. This hit it out of the park. Next opportunity you have tell people about EWR to Penn Station. Minimize your exposure to NYC gridlock.

reviews.title: Great location, friendly staff and large room for NYC
reviews.content: I had a 2 day conference in New York for work and wanted a hotel near Grand Central to get around all the different locations I had to go to, and this was great. The staff on check in and out were very friendly. There was a bit of a mix up with internet and Maxamillion Alston was able to correct for me. The room was much larger than expected for NYC, clean and comfortable.

reviews.title: AMAZING Hotel
reviews.content: From check-in to check-out, everything about this hotel was amazing. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room were clean and well decorated. The beds were comfortable. The location was perfect. You could walk to several sites and if you needed to take mass transit, Grand Central Station was a block away. The pub and restaurant had great food and excellent staff. There was nothing that I didn't like about this hotel.

reviews.title: Phenomenal Hotel! Close to Sites
reviews.content: I booked this hotel for a four day getaway into the city for my birthday. The front desk, hearing that it was my birthday, sent up wine and strawberries. I was greeted by extremely kind folks everyday that were nice; the room was spacious (for NYC standards) and the hotel shower was the best ever. I'd strongly recommend this for folks visiting NYC to do tourist-y thing! It's not the best for queer late night events, but it does have lots of access to transportation.

reviews.title: Cosy feeling, friendly, helpful staff, great location
reviews.content: This hotel is in a superb location, literally a stones throw from Grand Central, 42nd St, you can access the whole city easily and quickly. Despite its name I was expecting US staff, but they are almost all Irish, which made for fabulous hospitality. All the staff were incredibly welcoming and nothing was any trouble. We stayed in two rooms during our stay, as we were offered an upgrade to a suite. The first room, their standard, was not as small as I was expecting, there was plenty of room to store everything and we had a view of 44th street, which we liked. We were then upgraded to a suite, which was lovely - it was a huge room! However, it's positioning was not as favourable in my opinion as it was above the bar/patio area, so the bathroom door needed to be closed to keep the room quiet, and there was no view. The bed was awesome though, absolutely huge. I would recommend this hotel for its hospitality and location.

reviews.title: Weekend Get Away
reviews.content: This is the second time we have stayed at the Fitzpatrick. Both were weekend get aways. Our experience was amazing. The Hotel is conveniently located close to Grand Central and since we took the train into the City it was only a very short walk to the Hotel, We plan on coming back in the next month or so.

reviews.title: City break
reviews.content: Great location great staff, rooms are a bit small but most are in NY, very clean hotel lovely comfy bed. Had breakfast twice at the hotel excellent quality but a bit pricey as are the bar prices. overall a very nice hotel we would stay here again.

reviews.title: Great stay at Fitzpatrick's
reviews.content: Had a short break at Fitzpatrick's Grand Central Hotel and would recommend it thoroughly. From the moment we stepped into Fitzpatrick's to the time we left, and everything in between, it was a great hotel. Although I noticed the staff are not mind readers. I say that because one guest was saying, for example, they had no kettle in their room. I don't know if that is standard not having a kettle but we had not got one in our room but a quick call to reception and we had one in two minutes plus milk plus extra tea bags. In fact, the staff could not do enough to make your stay as enjoyable as possible. If there is one stand out feature if Fitzpatrick's it is the staff. We really liked our room and the bed was too comfortable. That is, you don't want to leave it!! A big television is in the room plus all the toiletries you need. But don't spend all your time in the room as New York has too much to see and do that it would be sinful to stay in bed too late. The Wheeltapper bar in the hotel was really enjoyable. If you are into old CIE (Irish Transport Company) memorabilia then you are in for a treat as there are old photographs, train signs and other items that shows the Irishness of the pub. It can be fairly packed but that adds to the atmosphere like a traditional Irish pub. They serve food and we had breakfast served in the pub, which was delicious. Again, get to know the staff as they are extremely helpful. There is a mixture of Irish and American and other staff who work well together in providing a great service throughout the hotel. Some people said that they thought Fitzpatrick's was a dear hotel to stay in. Well it is not the cheapest but it is in a superb location right around the corner from Grand Central Station, which is one of the biggest and best stations I've ever come across and well worth a visit in it's own right. You will get cheaper hotels no doubt but I'd personally rather pay that bit extra for a class hotel. By the way, don't be afraid to engage with the concierges as they know New York well. They can get you discounts for various attractions and are really helpful in sorting out your travel arrangements on the subway and so on. I'm sure there are things I've left out but my overall view is what I wanted to get across. Engage with the staff. They are the friendliest bunch I have come across.

reviews.title: First Time in New York
reviews.content: This hotel was booked for us by American Sky. We stayed six nights and really enjoyed it. We were in our booked double room for two nights and were then offered a free upgrade to a Junior Suite for the rest of our stay. The staff were very helpful and probably the friendliest staff we have ever met. We believe the location of the Hotel is perfect for a sight seeing New York trip.

reviews.title: Wonderful!
reviews.content: We have just spent 5 wonderful days at this hotel, rooms fantastic, staff absolutely the best I've ever encountered. This hotel has a very family orientated atmosphere, nothing is to much trouble. They very kindly changed our room when we were given a double bed to share (myself and my daughter) booking agent had neglected to select twin beds. Champagne and strawberries delivered to our room to celebrate my daughters 21st birthday . We will definitely be back. I love this hotel.

reviews.title: Fantastic hotel
reviews.content: This hotel was amazing. Great rooms with a vibrant Irish Pub downstairs. Service was superb with very helpful and friendly staff. The hotel is situated in the heart of NY Manhattan which is a great location as most major attractions are within walking distance or otherwise a short hop with a taxi, bus or underground train. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

reviews.title: Very nice old style hotel
reviews.content: Let me start by saying this hotel was fine, room was adiquate but rooms on edge were noisy. So asked to move to the middle and they did move us without issue. Everybody at the hotel was nice helpful and friendly nice people. New York is great lots to see and do but it's very very expensive so make sure you have plenty of cash. Meal for two 1 wine each and a main only will cost you $90 to $130 dollars in a normal restaurant. Bottle of water $3 Beer $8 glass of wine $9 a cake $4 a sandwich $6 just an ideal of prices. Most places add local tax and 20% service charge without asking on top. But if you can afford it it's a great place to enjoy. One free thing is the Long Island ferry it's goes straight passed the Statue of Liberty. The 9/11 museum is great do not miss it its worth the entrance fee. Also walk across the Brooklyn bridge that is also a great free thing to do. The open top hop on/off.BigBus at $28 per person is very good and well worth the money.

reviews.title: Great location
reviews.content: A very good location near Grand Central. The staff from the bellmen, to the front desk staff, to the restaurant were all very cordial and professional. The room was decent sized and comfortable. The bed was top excellent. Our room faced an interior wall and that was fine with us. Very quiet for midtown. Full Irish breakfast was good and authentic Irish sausage. The only small complaint was no free wifi in the room. But it was free in the lobby. The next time we come to NYC it will be the first hotel we check for price and availability. Dear Bill P, Thank you for staying at the Fitzpatrick Grand Central and for taking the time to post your review of the hotel. I am thrilled to see that you had such an enjoyable stay with us and hope you have the opportunity to enjoy our outdoor patio on you next visit. Once again, thank you for choosing the Fitzpatrick Grand Central and I do hope it won‚Äôt be too long before we have the privilege of welcoming you back to the hotel. Kind Regards, Patrick Leyden General Manager Fitzpatrick Grand Central Hotel

reviews.title: Great Find!! Definitely will visit again!
reviews.content: Last minute booking, great price not far from Grand Central. Perfect spot to visit or for transportation to other parts of the city. Clean, nice rooms, excellent customer service. I'm not a big fan of five star reviews, as perfection is, well perfect. The only real complaint was the elevators were slow as molasses in January. Otherwise, a must stay. Dear McBags, Thank you for staying at the Fitzpatrick Grand Central and for taking the time to post your review of the hotel on Tripadvisor. I am very happy to read that you enjoyed your stay with us finding the location to perfect for sightseeing and getting around the city. reviews.title: Summer air conditioning issues...beware!
reviews.content: We stayed at the Fitzpatrick Grand Central mainly because of TripAdvisor reviews. We agree with those who reported friendly staff and a convenient location. However, during our first night the room was exceedingly hot as the air conditioner had frosted up and stopped working. We called housekeeping and Andrea came up to check on the situation. She saw the problem and offered to transfer us for the night to another room. We accepted and were given a junior suite with two air conditioners running. It was definitely cool enough! However, the room was very noisy as it was right over the pub patio. The noise continued until 11 p.m. Then all night long the air conditioners continued to shut off, start up, shut off, start up, over and over. The noise prevented me from sleeping for more than a few hours and I woke up exhausted. After that night we went back to our original room. While Andrea gave us two coupons for free breakfasts it really didn't make up for a basically sleepless night. My advice is to stay away from rooms anywhere near the pub patio and ask for a room with an air conditioning unit that works properly and quietly. Otherwise, don't stay here in the heat of the summer. With respect to the rooms, the beds are comfortable, the rooms are ordinary, the showers run hot/cold/hot/cold, so it is better to take a bath. Dear 20mar20, Thank you for staying at the Fitzpatrick Grand Central and for taking the time to post your review of the hotel. I am sorry to see that you rest was disturbed by noise and that you encountered a problem with the air-conditioning. We are in the process of replacing the older units in the guest rooms. Once again, thank you for choosing the Fitzpatrick Grand Central and please contact me directly at pleyden@fitzpatrickhotels.com if I can be of any assistance in the future. Kind Regards, Patrick Leyden General Manager Fitzpatrick Grand Central Hotel

reviews.title: East Coast History Tour
reviews.content: Our second stop after Bostons North end. Hotel location was fantastic. Across the street from Grand Central Station in midtown east. It's a 15 minute walk to Time Square and or the Theater district. You can grab the subway to anywhere NYC from Grand Central. (The Oculis is a must see @ the base of One Freedom Tower.) The Hotel is clean and the staff was fantastic. The hotel is older but updated. We had a deluxe king room and with luggage for a two week tour the room was tight. If you want ice in your room you have to order it or get it in the pub... City noise at night, well it's the city and garbage trucks run and sirens go. The city that never sleeps. The beds are comfortable and the little coffee shop next door is great. I would stay here again. I would also like to mention a little diner at 135 E 50th. The New York Luncheonette. A great little place for breakfast and lunch. Happy Trails... Off to Phillie. Dear stang698, Thank you for staying at the Fitzpatrick Grand Central and for taking the time to post your review of the hotel. I am delighted to see that you found the hotel to have an excellent location and the proximity to Grand Central Station allowed easy access to the rest of the city. Once again, thank you for choosing the Fitzpatrick Grand Central and I wish you all the best for the rest of your tour. Kind Regards, Patrick Leyden General Manager Fitzpatrick Grand Central Hotel

reviews.title: Murphy Reservation
reviews.content: Overall, we were very pleased with the hotel. It was in a great location. The staff were very helpful and accommodating. Room was just a standard size, but overall cleanliness was good and room was updated. reviews.title: Great Hotel & Accommodations
reviews.content: My University booked this hotel for a conference that I was attending. Initially I was concerned because I have never stayed at a Fitzpatrick hotel and I can be very picky when traveling on business. All of my concerns were set aside with the highly professional reception upon arrival. The highly skilled and responsive staff attended to my every need. The concierge was also helpful offering us umbrellas for use after directing us to restaurants that we had chosen. The rooms are "just right" for Manhattan. They are luxurious, and the bed was divinely comfortable. The bath is very large and stacked with amenities. I will seek this hotel out from now on when coming to NYC. reviews.title: Perfect location helpfull and friendly staff
reviews.content: Myself and may husband stayed here as part of our honeymoon tour of New York and las vegas and from start to finish it was amazing the hotel gave us a complimentary bottle of champagne and sum chocolate covered strawberrys for our honemoon which was so nice check in was fast reception staff and all other staff were so friendly and very helpfull loaction was perfect walking distance to empire state and time square taxis in New York we found fast and cheap also gorgeous city ‚ù§ enjoy your travels Dear seanstephen, Congratulations and thank you for you for staying at the Fitzpatrick Grand Central. I am very happy to read that you enjoyed your stay with us finding the team to be friendly and very helpful and the location perfect walking distance to the Empire state and Times square. Once again, thank you for choosing the Fitzpatrick Grand Central and I do hope it won‚Äôt be too long before we have the privilege of welcoming you back to the hotel. Kind Regards, Patrick Leyden General Manager Fitzpatrick Grand Central Hotel

reviews.title: Couldn't have been better
reviews.content: What a great time we had in FitzPs - the location beside Grand Central is just fantastic - everywhere is walkable. The room was spotless and very large thankfully for our needs - double double i.e. 2 double beds for myself and my daughter. Bathrobes, slippers, plenty of towels and toiletries, hairdryer, lashings of hot water and air con and heating - whichever was needed. It was a celebration trip so the hotel kindly provided strawberries and champagne for our arrival. Front of house staff could not have been more helpful and the girl behind the bar on Saturday night was lovely and kind and we enjoyed a bit of SNL with her and had a hoot - couldn't recommend this spot enough. Would definitely return. Dear HelMcG1, Thank you for staying at the Fitzpatrick Grand Central and for taking the time to post your review of the hotel on Tripadvisor. I am thrilled to see that yo had such an enjoyable stay with us enjoying the room amenities and the Wheeltapper bar. Hopefully you will have the chance to relax on our patio during your next trip. Once again, thank you for choosing the Fitzpatrick Grand Central and I do hope it won‚Äôt be too long before we have the privilege of welcoming you back to the hotel. Kind Regards, Patrick Leyden General Manager Fitzpatrick Grand Central Hotel

reviews.title: Outstanding Hotel
reviews.content: The Fitzpatrick is a wonderful hotel. The staff are very friendly, the room was clean and inviting, and it's in the center of the heartbeat of New York. I extremely enjoyed my stay and highly recommend. Dear sondrar459, Thank you for staying at the Fitzpatrick Grand Central and for taking the time to post your review of the hotel on Tripadvisor. reviews.title: Quick trip
reviews.content: I like this hotel. It has a sense of intimacy..... friendly staff, comfortable beds and casual restaurant and bar. Lobby us welcoming area to sit and read or people watch. Hotel is close to shopping and sites.

reviews.title: Ask for a calm room before booking
reviews.content: The hotel is ok. Rooms are big for ny standard but I had to change room because of the noise of my first room. Second room was ok Bed confort is on average - room are clean - try nails spa close to the hotel

reviews.title: Excellent Stay and Value
reviews.content: I have stayed at the Fitzpatrick Grand Central for many years and I highly recommend it as a "Hidden Value" for NYC. Please try a stay for business or personal. This place even has a very nice outside patio bar!

reviews.title: Wedding visit
reviews.content: Great location just by grand central station. Good deal wedding rate. (Tip :ask for a high floor on the inside. No view but much quieter. We got a Nice queen room large for NYC. Helpful staff a pleasant experience

reviews.title: Lovely hotel and brilliant staff
reviews.content: Was treated to 5 nights in New York by my mom for my 30th birthday. Arrived to Fitzpatrick's on the 9th of May and from the moment we walked in we felt it was a home away from home. The staff couldn't do enough for us and gave us a upgrade to the Noel Pearson suite and champagne with chocolate covered strawberries as it being my birthday. The staff gave us suggestions of where to go and the best way to get there especially Thomas and Fiona. When we go to New York again we would not stay anywhere else!!!! Ann and Jennifer Dennehy Dear Jennifer D, Happy Birthday and thank you for staying at the Fitzpatrick Grand Central. I am very happy to read that you had such pleasant stay with us felt the hotel was your home away from home. I know the team will be thrilled with your feedback, especially Thomas & Fiona. Once again, thank you for choosing the Fitzpatrick Grand Central and I do hope it won‚Äôt be too long before we have the privilege of welcoming you back to the hotel. Kind Regards, Patrick Leyden General Manager Fitzpatrick Grand Central Hotel

reviews.title: Great hotel, fantastic location
reviews.content: This hotel was an absolute gem in Manhattan. Located by E44 & Lexington Ave, it's location is superb for getting around all areas of New York not just Manhattan. We had a twin queen size room which was inward facing. This meant we heard nothing at all and slept like logs although our view was non existent. But who visits New York to see it from their hotel room??? The room was super clean, spacious and had very comfortable, big beds. The reception staff were polite but the star of our show was Michael the concierge on duty. He patiently listened to our plans for our short 2.5 day stay, suggested itineraries, made a dinner reservation for us and gave details of everything we needed to do to complete our sightseeing. He chatted to us like we were old friends and made us feel so welcome. Thank you Michael - you're a credit to the Fitzpatrick Grand Central and New Yorkers in general! Dear Vanessa D, Thank you for staying at the Fitzpatrick Grand Central and for taking the time to post such a positive your review of the hotel. I am thrilled to see that Michael was able to assist you make you feel so welcome and thank you for taking the time to mention him. Once again, thank you for choosing the Fitzpatrick Grand Central and I do hope it won‚Äôt be too long before we have the privilege of welcoming you back to the hotel. Kind Regards, Patrick Leyden General Manager Fitzpatrick Grand Central Hotel

reviews.title: First time in New York
reviews.content: We had a great few days and the hotel was perfect location wise. Our Junior Suite was lovely but unfortunately there was a constant hum from possibly air conditioning outside the window which made sleep difficult. Food was excellent but service at times a bit haphazard. Staff at reception were wonderful and very helpful. Dear sylvia47, Thank you for staying at the Fitzpatrick Grand Central and for taking the time to post your review of the hotel. I am very happy to read that you enjoyed your overall stay with us and thank you for mentioning how wonderful and friendly the reception team are. Once again, thank you for choosing the Fitzpatrick Grand Central and I do hope it won‚Äôt be too long before we have the privilege of welcoming you back to the hotel. Kind Regards, Patrick Leyden General Manager Fitzpatrick Grand Central Hotel

reviews.title: Relaxed, lovely stay but not much else in the area.
reviews.content: We stayed here for five nights on a combined work/holiday visit and found it to be very comfortable and well located beside Grand Central Station if you want to use the subway system. It's not quiet as it's central Manhattan but the noise was outside rather than inside. It‚Äôs not the best location if you‚Äôre looking for restaurants and bars in the evening time, though their own bar is very nice if terribly dark. We didn‚Äôt eat in the hotel but found a brilliant NY diner called The Comfort Diner round the corner down one block which was great for breakfast. If you‚Äôre prepared to walk, this is a lovely hotel with quiet charm, but is not in the thick of things as it appears to be mainly office land.

reviews.title: Lovely hotel
reviews.content: This hotel was recommended to me and I can quite understand why. All the staff, from front desk to bar staff, were all very friendly, Has an outside bar, unusual for NY, with heaters and necessary covers as is open to the elements. Very busy during the week as full of workers but lovely and quiet at the weekend. Good breakfast selection with proper tea!!!! Had a very tasty sirloin steak with pepper sauce, the steak just melted in the house. Fortunate enough to get a junior suite with a king size bed. Huge bathroom and lovely thick bathrobes. Will definitely go back Dear blackrider, Thank you for staying at the Fitzpatrick Grand Central and for taking the time to post your review of the hotel on Tripadvisor. I am delighted to see that you had such an enjoyable stay with us and that you had the opportunity to relax on the patio. Once again, thank you for choosing the Fitzpatrick Grand Central and I do hope it won‚Äôt be too long before we have the privilege of welcoming you back to the hotel. Kind Regards, Patrick Leyden General Manager Fitzpatrick Grand Central Hotel

reviews.title: Wonderful Week in New York
reviews.content: We visited New York last week to celebrate my wife's 30th birthday. We decided to stay at the Fitzpatrick Grand Central for 5 nights. We were not disappointed. From the moment we arrived we knew we'd made a good choice. Front desk staff very nice and welcoming which made a very good impression. We had a king room on 5th floor, large enough and clean with comfortable bed. Small bathroom but adequate. Fresh towels every day was great. We also received a lovely turndown service on our first night with champagne & Strawberries lovely touch from the hotel. Great location beside Grand Central Station we used to subway a lot to get around the city. We had some drinks in the Wheeltapper Bar but did not eat. Bar staff very nice and helpful. Will definitely stay here again when we return for our next visit. Dear Derek K, Happy Birthday and thank you for staying at the Fitzpatrick Grand Central. I am very happy to read that you enjoyed your stay with us and appreciate your very kind comments about the hotel and the service you received. Once again, thank you for choosing the Fitzpatrick Grand Central and I do hope it won‚Äôt be too long before we have the privilege of welcoming you back to the hotel. Kind Regards, Patrick Leyden General Manager Fitzpatrick Grand Central Hotel

reviews.title: Old school charm
reviews.content: I can't say enough about the friendliness and professionalism of this hotel staff. From the moment we arrived the staff made us feel very welcome . Hi The reception area had fresh water with fruit available and seats so you could sit whilst you are checking in. There are waiting areas with comfortable seating close by reception. The rooms were quite small to accommodate two queen sized bed. The bathroom was also quite small but quaint with ample towels and products of top quality. The shower was not as powerful as I would have liked. The Ac. Was quite noisy and if you opened the windows it was quite noisy . The bar area was fantastic, full of life and quite spacious with a smoking area. Staff and patrons were very friendly . I didn't eat here as breakfast was quite limited . I would return as the staff were very accommodating and the rooms were small but very comfortable and the hotel has a certain charm .

reviews.title: Family get together
reviews.content: The hotel is centrally located & the staff friendly & accommodating. The room & bathroom were dated but the beds were very comfortable & the room were good size. I would stay there again & recommend it to friends.

reviews.title: A Fantastic Time in NYC
reviews.content: A great place to stay in NYC. The concierge was awesome the check in staff was cheerful and efficient. Right near Grand Central to travel around the city. Housekeeping was also great. The room was larger than any I have stayed in in NYC.

reviews.title: Amazing place to stay
reviews.content: The hotel was very central,staff were very friendly and helpful and rooms were clean and overall experience was amazing.will most definitely be staying here again would highly recommend it couldn't fault any bit of it üòÅüòÅ

reviews.title: Charming and Convenient!
reviews.content: I loved this hotel. Quaint and charming. Located close to everything! The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. The room was very nice..spacious, comfortable bed. The bath was really nice complete with anything one might have forgotten, And a really nice robe!! I'd come back!

reviews.title: Good value for NYC
reviews.content: Bathrooms were a little worn out but bed was comfy. Clean room and wonderful service so overall a good experience. We took an Uber to the docks for a wedding and it was only $15 each way which wasn't bad.

reviews.title: An amazing stay again, with staff who will go out of their way to help with anything you need.
reviews.content: Having stayed at the Fitzpatrick Grand Central on numerous occasions over the last ten year, our latest trip made us feel that we would never stay anywhere else in New York. Everything promised was delivered, from the location to the facilities with everything in between. The staff are at the heart of this place, and should make the company very proud. As mentioned before we had a medical emergency whilst away and had to extend our stay, the staff made our stay feel like a home away from home at a difficult time.

reviews.title: Fabulous stay here. a real home from home
reviews.content: Myself and my two daughters are just back from New York yesterday with a 3 night/4 day trip of a lifetime for me. My condition was to stay in Fitzpatricks hotel because it was so central. And indeed it was. We could walk to Time Square , Grand Central Station, Rockerfelller Centre, to name but a few. From the moment we arrived through the doors of the hotel we felt so welcome and at 'home'. Nothing was a problem. When they heard that it was always my dream to come to New York and stay in the hotel, that night we came back to our room to find A bottle of champers and chocolate covered strawberries. It was such a lovely touch. We really appreciated it. I have to say all the staff everywhere in the hotel were so lovely. So friendly good humoured and nothing was a problem, It seems a very happy place to work.

reviews.title: Lovely hotel, friendly staff and lovely food.
reviews.content: This was our third time staying in Fitzpatricks Grand Central. After a very long journey where we missed one of our flights we were greeted by a very nice and helpful Irish receptionist. He went above and beyond to help us and even upgraded our room for free. He also gave us vouchers for a free drink. The room was clean and had a very comfy bed. The staff in the restaurant were very helpful especially Eilish who even when run off her feet, will stop and ask how your day was and will help you with directions or tips on where to go. Lovely hotel with great atmosphere. Can't wait to go back!

reviews.title: Wonderful stay at Fitzpatrick's Grant Central !
reviews.content: My husband and I recently visited New York and stayed in Fitzpatrick Grand Central Hotel. This was my first visit to New York and on learning that we were there to celebrate our joint birthdays, on our second day they upgraded us to a garden room on the penthouse floor. Fabulous room with our own rooftop garden ! On the day of our birthdays we returned to the room to find complimentary champagne and strawberries. All in all our stay with Fitzpatricks was amazing. I must mention Andrea and Shona on reception who made our stay so very special. The only thing I would mark the hotel down on is the cost of their breakfast - very expensive. Fitzpatricks Grand Central is situated midtown, across the road from Grand Central Station and close to Times Square, Rockefeller Centre, Central Park and of course Grand Central Station which is worth a visit for the architecture and shops. To get downtown, we didn't use the subway and found the yellow cabs to be quite inexpensive and quick although a bit nervewracking !! There is a flat rate of $52 from JFK to Manhattan and on top of this you need to add toll charges of $8 plus their tip. Fastest way to get from the airport to Manhattan. Dear Olinda23, Happy Birthdays and thank you for staying at the Fitzpatrick Grand Central. I am delighted to see that you had such an enjoyable experience with us and enjoyed your your upgrade amenities. Both Shona and Andrea will be thrilled your feedback and thank you for mentioning the service the provided. Once again, thank you for choosing the Fitzpatrick Grand Central and I do hope it won‚Äôt be too long before we have the privilege of welcoming you back to the hotel. Kind Regards, Patrick Leyden General Manager Fitzpatrick Grand Central Hotel

reviews.title: A touch of Ireland in mid-town NY!
reviews.content: The Fitzpatrick Grand Central is in a perfect location...mid-town. I loved being next to Grand Central taking the Shuttle to Times Square, shopping at Farm-To-Table, easy access to the Upper East side as well as easy access to One World Trade Center downtown. Dear Adrien f, Thank you for staying at the Fitzpatrick Grand Central and for taking the time to post your review of the hotel on Tripadvisor. I am very happy to read that you enjoyed you found the location to be excellent with easy access to the Times Square and Grand Central station. Once again, thank you for choosing the Fitzpatrick Grand Central and I do hope it won‚Äôt be too long before we have the privilege of welcoming you back to the hotel. Kind Regards, Patrick Leyden General Manager Fitzpatrick Grand Central Hotel

reviews.title: Will definitely return!!!!
reviews.content: All I can say is Fitzpatricks cannot be topped. Five stars all the way. Couldnt be more helpful. Anything we asked was there for us. And champagne and steawberries on arrival was just the nicest touch. Dear edrenad, Thank you for staying at the Fitzpatrick Grand Central and for taking the time to post your review of the hotel on Tripadvisor. reviews.title: Good Central Location
reviews.content: So, we stayed here 7 nights and the best thing about the Fitzpatrick GC is the location. You are just around the corner from Grand Central Station which provides great access to trains and the subway. Room was good, great air conditioner, comfortable bed. Huge shower as it was an ADA room. Fresh towels daily, water and mints every day. Complimentary bath robe to use during your stay. Not sure if you will get charged if you keep it (better ask). No need for an umbrella because the room has one in it, and this they will charge you $25.00 if you decide to keep it. They will secure a $100.00 credit card deposit for "incidentals" or $200.00 cash. Upon checkout I was told this should get put back on the card in roughly 3 business days. They tried to charge us for a long distance call, but on that day we were out sightseeing. Basically keep track of stuff and always review your bill before you acknowledge payment. Staff was very courteous and professional. Rates are comparable to other hotels, but it is mid town Manhattan so prices are high anywhere you stay. Would I stay at the Fitzpatrick again? Considering it's proximity to getting around? Absolutely. Dear WWF4G, Thank you for staying at the Fitzpatrick Grand Central and for taking the time to post your review of the hotel on Tripadvisor. I am delighted to see that you had such an enjoyable experience with us and will look into the telephone charge issue. Once again, thank you for choosing the Fitzpatrick Grand Central and I do hope it won‚Äôt be too long before we have the privilege of welcoming you back to the hotel. Kind Regards, Patrick Leyden General Manager Fitzpatrick Grand Central Hotel

reviews.title: Pretty Mediocre for a Midtown Hotel
reviews.content: Just got back from a short NYC weekend at the Fitzpatrck and the best I can say about this property is the location. Its really central to most places that you want to visit in NY, but the property itself does not impress. Our room was really outdated, there was some patched up carpet in the room, the bathroom floor tile was chipped and not very clean, the towels were not great and were kind of hard. There was no dresser for clothing so we had to use the night table for clothes, the TV had pretty limited channels, the AC roared on and off all night, and they charge $15 for internet, which in today's day and age is almost free everywhere. So while the location was great the hotel is pretty outdated and the staff was pretty lame. Sorry Fitz, but we wont be coming back again. Dear sircaralot, Thank you for staying with us and for taking the time to post your review of the hotel on Tripadvisor. Despite enjoying the location I am very sorry to hear that we do not meet your expectations and that you had such a disappointing stay. Thank you for staying with us please let me know if I can be of any assistance in the future. Kind Regards, Patrick Leyden General Manager Fitzpatrick Grand Central Hotel

reviews.title: New York
reviews.content: Excellent hotel. Staff very helpful and nothing was a bother to them. Max and Adam were brilliant. Staff in wheeltappers were attentive and the food was great too. This was our first time in New York and this hotel is in a great location with most attractions in 20 to 30 mins walking distance. The mini Easter eggs left outside hotel room was a lovely touch. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting New York. Thank you for making our first visit to New York a memorable one. Dear Thank you for staying at the Fitzpatrick Grand Central and for taking the time to post your review of the hotel on Tripadvisor. I am delighted to see that you had such an enjoyable experience with us find the location to be great. I hope you had the opportunity to relax on our patio, it is an excellent place to relax after a busy day. Once again, thank you for choosing the Fitzpatrick Grand Central and I do hope it won‚Äôt be too long before we have the privilege of welcoming you back to the hotel. Kind Regards, Patrick Leyden General Manager Fitzpatrick Grand Central Hotel

reviews.title: Friendly and clean
reviews.content: The staff here are really friendly and helpful, which really helped with our first trip to New York. It's well situated for walking to most of the main sites eg Times Square, empire state etc. Grand central station is a stones throw away. The local are feels safe. There is a bar attached to the hotel which is nice. However, Wed and Thurs is where the local city slickers socialise after work, and it can be quite noisy, but this is new york so I feel a little party atmosphere is to be expected and it did only go on until 11pm. Our rooms were at the back and on the 2nd floor which meant we could take advantage of the free wi fi in the lobby. Apparently rooms at the front are at risk of being able to hear the 24hr sounds of new York city, but think that would be bearable...it is new york after all. Staff are happy to advise you of alternative places to eat or drink. I would definitely stay here again. Dear jackster1, Thank you for staying at the Fitzpatrick Grand Central and for taking the time to post your review of the hotel on Tripadvisor. reviews.title: Love this hotel
reviews.content: The Fitzpatrick Grand Central is very close to excellent transportation. In the rain, you can easily slip into Grand Central Station for trains, or grab a cab. The rooms are lovely, the people welcoming and it's fairly priced. Dear Nina L, Thank you for staying at the Fitzpatrick Grand Central and for taking the time to post your review of the hotel on Tripadvisor. reviews.content: Another fab stay at the Fitz GC. The Wheeltappers is a great pub/restaurant with atmosphere. The rooms are comfortable NY style. reviews.title: Excellent
reviews.content: Perfect hotel to visit NYC, excellent accommodations and the room very nice settings... enjoy it a lot.... if we visit NYC again we will be staying in this hotel great location........... great staff, the restaurant's very nice old school pub, the bartender great personality makes you feel welcome... reviews.title: Super friendly employees and a great room
reviews.content: This is my first review on this site, and I'm writing it because this hotel deserves it! My wife and I recently spent 3 nights here and I'm so glad we did. The staff was quite eager to help with anything we wanted. We stayed in one of the Garden Rooms, which has its own private terrace on the roof and an incredible bathroom. If you're into having your own outdoor patio in the city, or you like large bathtubs and showers made for two, then this is the room for you. And there are only three rooms on the entire floor so it's unlikely you'll be disturbed. We were celebrating a birthday and the hotel sent us a complimentary bottle of champagne and some chocolate-covered strawberries as soon as we arrived. Nice touch! They also checked in with us each day to make sure we had everything we wanted. The only cons I have are these: - The restaurant connected to the hotel is just so-so. Not much of a variety and the food was mediocre. But there are plenty of other dining options in the area so this wasn't a big deal for us. - The handle on the bathroom door fell off. It happened about an hour before we were checking out so I just told them on my way out. They apologized more than once and asked if there was anything they could do to make it right. I'm sure it was taken care of immediately. The bottom line is I thoroughly enjoyed my stay here and would definitely stay again. Dear Leo P, Happy Birthday and thank you for staying at the Fitzpatrick Grand Central. I am very happy to read that you enjoyed your stay with us and that you enjoyed your amenity. The Garden rooms are great option with current weather. Once again, thank you for choosing the Fitzpatrick Grand Central and I do hope it won‚Äôt be too long before we have the privilege of welcoming you back to the hotel. Kind Regards, Patrick Leyden General Manager Fitzpatrick Grand Central Hotel

reviews.title: Terrific hotel in superb location
reviews.content: Just back from a 5 night family holiday at this hotel and can highly recommend. It's in a terrific location with lots of main attractions in walking distance. The front desk staff are amazing - incredibly warm & welcoming. My initial room request at time of booking was accommodated and then when I followed up with a second request for a room change on arrival, this was also accommodated. Excellent customer service. Rooms are spacious, spotless and comfortable - the king size bed was amazing. Rooms were serviced every day, lots of clean towels etc. We had rooms at the front of the hotel, high up. There was some noise from road works & construction going on in the area but that's to be expected in NYC - bring earplugs! I have to name check the concierges Mike,Gregg & Garfield who were very helpful & friendly and most especially Janice on reception for whom nothing was a problem. She is the embodiment of excellent customer service. Dear Imelda M, Thank you for staying at the Fitzpatrick Grand Central and for taking the time to post your review of the hotel on Tripadvisor. I am delighted to see that you and your family had such an enjoyable stay with us. The team will be thrilled with your feedback especially and thank you for mentioning them. Thank you for choosing the Fitzpatrick Grand Central and I do hope it won‚Äôt be too long before we have the privilege of welcoming you back to the hotel. Kind Regards, Patrick Leyden General Manager Fitzpatrick Grand Central Hotel

reviews.title: A nice hotel in a great location
reviews.content: Having stayed on a business trip previously we opted to stay at the Fitzpatrick Grand Central again. We arrived rather late due to a delayed flight and were shown to our room which was exactly the same as the room we had had before, although on a higher floor. Nothing wrong at all but rather small for two people with cases etc. Next morning we enquired whether it would be possible to get a larger room. The staff were very helpful and understanding and were happy to move us to a larger room at no additional cost. Our room was clean with TV and fridge and restocked with tea coffee and bottled water each day. On our first night due to the lateness of our arrival we had a meal in the pub come restaurant in the hotel. It was ok but nothing special and I wouldn't recommend eating here. However we were given a complimentary breakfast on our first day which was fine. On our last day as we had an evening flight they offered an extended check out time to 2pm. We cannot fault the staff at this hotel, all very friendly chatty and helpful. Would recommend and stay here again. Dear rblows26, Thank you for staying at the Fitzpatrick Grand Central and for taking the time to post your review of the hotel on Tripadvisor. I am very happy to read that you enjoyed your stay with us and appreciate your very kind comments about the hotel and the service you received. Once again, thank you for choosing the Fitzpatrick Grand Central and I do hope it won‚Äôt be too long before we have the privilege of welcoming you back to the hotel. Kind Regards, Patrick Leyden General Manager Fitzpatrick Grand Central Hotel

reviews.title: Great place superb location
reviews.content: Ideal location for exploring NYC, literally a stones throw from Grand Central and the underground network. Lovely hotel, rooms are nicely appointed with everything you need including a coffee maker, a little compact but you don't go to New York to spend time in your hotel room.. Nice bar and patio area to get a drink and eat, good food and not too expensive (although not cheap). The staff at the hotel were very warm and welcoming and we received great service especially from Laura who checked us in and organised a special meal for us and Thomas the duty manager, many thanks. A couple of little niggles, paid Wi-Fi in the rooms, it is 2017 guys it is no longer acceptable to pay extra in a hotel for Wi-Fi, you offer it free in the lobby so why charge in the rooms and the bar area. Air conditioning unit in the room was noisy and largely ineffective I noticed mention of this in previous reviews, this needs to be addressed the units look old and tired and should be changed. Overall a great place that I would definitely return to and recommend to others. Sort the couple of niggles out and it would be perfect. Dear Anthony O, Thank you for staying with us and for taking the time to post your review of the hotel. I am very happy to read that you enjoyed your overall stay with us and do apologize for the issue you experienced with the air-conditioning. We are in the process of replacing the units. Once again, thank you for choosing the Fitzpatrick Grand Central and I do hope it won‚Äôt be too long before we have the privilege of welcoming you back to the hotel. Kind Regards, Patrick Leyden General Manager Fitzpatrick Grand Central Hotel

reviews.title: The best Irish hospitality in New York City
reviews.content: If you don't get to visit Ireland and want to experience a tast of Irish hospitality at its best just take a New York City break & stay at Fitzpatrick's Grand Central Hotel, from the moment you enter the door you are greeted by a well trained hospitable team. The rooms are small but very comfortable, a good breakfast, very convent location. Excellent value for money. reviews.title: Fantastic Stay - Wonderful Hotel Again!
reviews.content: Just back from celebrating my tenth wedding anniversary in Fitzpatrick's. Firstly,I was in touch with reservations months ago and the deal they offered was excellent for New York. When I informed them that we were returning to the hotel where we celebrated the start of our honeymoon 10 years ago they said they would do their best to make our stay enjoyable and they surpassed expectations. Upgraded to a lovely room with one of the most comfortable hotel beds I have ever slept in. Lovely surprises in the room and lots of nice touches. All in all,from all the front desk staff and concierges they simply apply a touch of genuine class and friendliness. I will definitely be back for my twentieth anniversary or before if I get the chance. Dear Brianp01, Happy 10th Anniversary and thank you for staying at the Fitzpatrick Grand Central. I am very happy to read that you enjoyed your stay with us and appreciate your very kind comments about the hotel and the service you received. Once again, thank you for choosing the Fitzpatrick Grand Central and we look forward to welcoming you back for your 20th anniversary. Kind Regards, Patrick Leyden General Manager Fitzpatrick Grand Central Hotel

reviews.title: Outstanding once again
reviews.content: Writing this review on behalf of my parents. This was their second trip to the Fitzpatrick and enjoyed it just as much as the first time. From the moment they walked through the doors they said everyone was so welcoming and made them feel like they were home. Many of the staff recognised them from their first visit and went out of their way to make sure they had everything they needed. A massive thanks to Chris. I had been in touch with him before my parents went informing him it was their 25th wedding anniversary and my Mam's 50th and once again he pulled out all the stops, upgrading my parents and helping me to plan some surprises. He had done this two years previously for their first visit. Also a big thanks to Fiona, Adam and Robert who also looked after them. My parents said all the staff were very friendly, helpful and up for a laugh. The beer garden was amazing. They ate in the restaurant almost every night. Said it is a little more expensive than other places but the quality of the food can't be beaten. Already planning their next visit! Dear Sarah R, I am delighted to see that we were able to make your parents double celebration so memorable. I am sure that the team will be delighted with their feedback and I am happy to see that they had the opportunity to relax an enjoy our outdoor patio. It is a great space. We look forward to welcoming your parents back the Fitzpatrick Grand Central. Kind Regards, Patrick Leyden General Manager Fitzpatrick Grand Central Hotel

reviews.title: Great staff, Convenient location
reviews.content: This was our third time staying at this hotel. It is a convenient location to Grand Central Station and lots of other places in NYC. The staff here is always willing to help and pleasant. Our bed was not as comfortable as past trips- a little soft and caved toward the center. The room was clean and they gave us extra towels as requested. There was a refrigerator which was convenient for leftovers. Rooms have space especially compared to some places in NYC. Dear 515cey, Welcome back and you for returning to the Fitzpatrick Grand Central. I am very happy to read that you enjoyed your stay with us and I will look in to the mattress issue to ensure that it is resolved. Once again, thank you for choosing the Fitzpatrick Grand Central and I do hope it won‚Äôt be too long before we have the privilege of welcoming you back to the hotel. Kind Regards, Patrick Leyden General Manager Fitzpatrick Grand Central Hotel

reviews.title: Excellent Small Hotel
reviews.content: Because of business and pleasure trips to NYC over the last 40 years I have stayed at more hotels than I can count. None of them were nearly as good as the small/boutique Fitzpatrick on East 44th. It is blessedly quiet -- has wonderful comfortable beds and a staff that is not just super friendly and courteous -- but also takes an interest in your activities and helping you enjoy the fun things in NYC. It doesn't have the glamour of the big chains -- if you want that forget this hotel. If you want a good, quiet place to sleep that is perfectly located in midtown -- pick this hotel. Dear Mike S, Thank you for staying at the Fitzpatrick Grand Central and for taking the time to post such great review of the the hotel. I am delighted to see that we have become your favorite hotel in NYC. I am sure the team will be thrilled with your feedback and I hope you have the opportunity to relax on our patio during your next stay. Once again, thank you for choosing the Fitzpatrick Grand Central and I do hope it won‚Äôt be too long before we have the privilege of welcoming you back to the hotel. Kind Regards, Patrick Leyden General Manager Fitzpatrick Grand Central Hotel

reviews.title: Went for my daughters 40th birthday.
reviews.content: This hotel is one of the best I have stayed in, outstanding service and attention to detail. Would really recommend this Hotel, staff very, very helpful. Had a little bundle of Easter eggs left at our hotel room on Easter Sunday, little things like that made this a lovely experience. Very sad to leave we enjoyed it so much. If we went back to NY I wouldn't even bother looking for other hotels, I would just book this one again. if I could give it 11 out of 10, I would. Dear Linda M, I am delighted to see that you had such an enjoyable experience with us. I am glad you enjoyed your Easter Sunday amenity that you had such an enjoyable time with us. Once again, thank you for choosing the Fitzpatrick Grand Central and I do hope it won‚Äôt be too long before we have the privilege of welcoming you back to the hotel. Kind Regards, Patrick Leyden General Manager Fitzpatrick Grand Central Hotel

reviews.title: Easter week in New York
reviews.content: The Fitz Patrick was in the perfect location for walking to the sites the staff was very friendly the room was clean and large we were in the back of the hotel it was very quiet the outside bar area was unique . We would definitely stay here again Dear T5506IMpeterr, Thank you for staying at the Fitzpatrick Grand Central and for taking the time to post your review of the hotel on Tripadvisor. I am very happy to read that you enjoyed your stay with us and appreciate your very kind comments about the hotel and the service you received. Once again, thank you for choosing the Fitzpatrick Grand Central and I do hope it won‚Äôt be too long before we have the privilege of welcoming you back to the hotel. Kind Regards, Patrick Leyden General Manager Fitzpatrick Grand Central Hotel

reviews.title: Make things crystal CLEAR to prevent errors
reviews.content: -Walked in on by maid w/o a knock -Front desk did not read reservation notes -I was accidentally charged for someone else's valet parking, we didn't even have a car -Another persons card was on file for my suite....

reviews.title: Brilliant Hotel
reviews.content: Very central, easy to walk to many attractions. Extremely friendly and helpful staff. Worth paying that bit more for this hotel. Little touches such as mini Easter Eggs, sparkling wine, dipped strawberries were lovely gestures. Would highly recommend this hotel. Dear Teresa D, Thank you for staying at the Fitzpatrick Grand Central and for taking the time to post your review of the hotel on Tripadvisor. I am delighted to see that you had such an enjoyable experience with us and that you enjoyed your Easter amenities. Thank you for choosing the Fitzpatrick Grand Central and I do hope it won‚Äôt be too long before we have the privilege of welcoming you back to the hotel. Kind Regards, Patrick Leyden General Manager Fitzpatrick Grand Central Hotel

reviews.title: special holiday
reviews.content: 25 anniversary and 50 birthday celebration made really special by the staff at front desk to the bar staff to the resturant which by the way we had beautiful meals in and would recommend even the out door area was lovely after a warm day spent in central park even the cleaners met you with a smile great hotel that seems to make everyone welcome nothing to much trouble Dear 778hazelr, I am thrilled to see that you enjoyed your double celebration with us. I see you had the opportunity to enjoy our patio area. It is a great place to relax after a busy day exploring the city. Once again, thank you for choosing the Fitzpatrick Grand Central and I do hope it won‚Äôt be too long before we have the privilege of welcoming you back to the hotel. Kind Regards, Patrick Leyden General Manager Fitzpatrick Grand Central Hotel

reviews.title: Incredible!! Perfect location....great staff
reviews.content: In our opinion this hotel is greatly under priced. Adam checked us in and navigated us to an amazing lunch. The location cannot be beat. You are central to anything you could need. Beautiful hotel....courteous staff. Worth every single penny. Thank you for everything..... we had an incredible visit and we will be back!

reviews.title: Excellent Location and Friendly, helpful staff!
reviews.content: Fantastic week in this hotel in April 2017. I stayed with my 14 year old son and my friend stayed with her 15 year old daughter. The location was wonderful within walking distance of everything. Staff were so friendly and helpful and gave us lots of advice ,organising visits to tourist areas etc. They were always willing to help and always with a smile! Lobby area was very welcoming and a comfortable place to sit and relax, really felt like a home from home by the end of the week.Food was lovely and rooms were clean and homely. The bar and restaurant had a lovely atmosphere and was suitable for families/ friends/ business trips.Only recommendation I would have is perhaps free wifi in the rooms as opposed to just the lobby area. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone and we will be back!!

reviews.title: Excellent hotel
reviews.content: Wonderful staff in the hotel, the were very helpful at all times, nice rooms with very comfortable beds, it is a very Central location right beside grand central station. It's close to fifth ave, times sq and the empire state building

reviews.title: Location and Service
reviews.content: The location of this hotel was perfect for us as we knew we were going to be all over Manhattan during our short stay. The staff was wonderful in our limited interactions. I actually did feel welcomed. The room was more than adequate, but don't expect too much. As most rooms in NYC are our room was very small. My only real complaint was that the room was a bit humid. It was raining out but just seemed a little humid the whole time. We ate at the "pub" next door. I don't recommend it. The hotel though, I would definitely return for a nice place to stay.

reviews.title: Fab hotel and location and Adam was great
reviews.content: We booked to stay here last minute we usually always stay up in the other fitzpatricks, but they were full so we tried here instead and I'm so glad we did we were on our honeymoon in Mexico and had to leave early so Adam looked after us in a stressful situation and got everything booked for us straight away,the staff were all so friendly in the hotel makes you feel like your at home in Ireland.amazing location,so close to everything time square the shops etc, the little out side bar was so chilled and we enjoy drinks and dinner out their the food was great also, our room was spacious and so clean had great sleeps, over all all excellent and will definitely be back, thanks Adam and all the staff who looked after us!

reviews.title: Most amazing service I've ever had
reviews.content: After a rough flight and trip into the city by a yellow taxi we were greeted by such professional and friendly staff. My friend had emailed ahead to tell them it was my 21st birthday which was why we were traveling and they moved us into a beautiful suite. We had a huge bathtub with a tv for us to watch in the bathroom. A huge room with a gigantic comfortable bed. Just as we were ready to explore the city a knock came at our door and the fantastic receptionist provided us with champagne and strawberries dipped in chocolate. After spending all day exploring the city we arrived back to the hotel were the staff greeted us everytime just like we really belonged there! I spoke with The concierge everyday who gave me the most amazing tips for New York and vegas where he worked before New York! We ordered room service one night also and it was the nicest meal we had in New York. I honestly couldn't imagine staying anywhere else in New York now. It felt so like home in such a big city.

reviews.title: Birthday celebration holiday
reviews.content: Staff excellent, room was large for New York hotel. Service excellent location very easy to get to. Would recommend only issue I had was room was cold as heater was not working properly but I was provided with blanket when asked for one. Pillows and bed very comfortable,tea & coffee provided in room.traffic noise sometimes disturbed sleep but expected this in New York

I came here with my family for a 1 night stay on the weekend. This was simply a leisure visit to the city and the hotel was chosen due to positive reviews as well as the central location. We arrived fairly early (I believe about 10:30am) and they were able to check us into a room right away. The staff were very polite and friendly. They do offer valet parking for $70 (that's the SUV price) per day. I drove to the next block and paid $53 for the day and parked it myself. The room was fairly small but clean and attractive. The AC unit fan functioned but it didn't adjust to temperature requests. It wasn't worth complaining about since we were only staying for the 1 night. I will say that I included a note with my original reservation and not any pet of it was acknowledged. Luckily they had a quiet (rear facing, higher floor) room available for us anyway. We went out for a walk shortly after checking in. When we came back to the hotel, the woman that checked us in came around her desk to give our son a toy train. This was a great gesture - especially considering he loves trains. The only negative with this hotel would be the restaurant but that is a separate review. The location is great and it's not on a busy street. We would certainly stay here again. It isn't a fancy place but we were comfortable and felt well cared for.

reviews.title: Great choice. You won't be disappointed
reviews.content: Stayed for 5 nights and really enjoyed our stay. Room 612 was quiet as New York genuinely never sleeps. The hotel is in a great location. The staff are very nice and friendly. Mike the concierge is extremely helpful and very knowledgeable about places to visit, and local bars and restaurants. Had a bottle of bubbly and strawberries on arrival. We plan on returning to New York and would have no doubts about staying here again.

reviews.title: Amazingly Huge Room, super clean, very pleased
reviews.content: We were so surprised to see our room at check in. We are staying in room 1201. It's HUGE!! Two rooms with a king bed in each. The bathroom is amazing with three shower options (normal, hand held, and directly above ( like rain)! We would stay here again in heartbeat! Also, book straight through the hotel for extra perks like free wifi. Three letters...W-O-W! Exactly what we needed after a long day of traveling!

reviews.title: Nice hotel
reviews.content: Hotel Wellington is in good location 5 minutes walk to central park on times Square I spent 3 nights with a 11 year old this was my second time staying here beds very comfortable clean hotel staff very good would come back again

reviews.title: lovely stay
reviews.content: The Wellington Hotel; it has an extremely homely feel even in the middle of The City That Never Sleeps.its a 3* hotel From the hotel you can reach Times Square, Central Park and 5th Avenue in less than 10 minutes on foot, Our room/suite was, by New York standards, huge and after a full day of travelling was very welcome. The bed was amazingly comfortable, which coupled with the amount of walking I did each day, meant I slept soundly every night.I was fairly high up, but would still recommend you take earplugs. as you can hear street noise and if you have visited New York before you will know how noisy the streets can be, especially 7th Avenue The decor of myroom was very much in keeping with the lobby area of the hotel, with thick carpets and wallpaper¬†covered walls. I think it‚Äôs important to point out that this is not an ultra sleek modern hotel with Ikea style furniture, it is a homely and cozy and most of all comfortable. It is important to remember that The Wellington Hotel is a 3* hotel and even though the hotel is great value for money, you do in reality get what you pay for. The hotel is clean and comfortable, yes it is missing a few facilities and amenities that higher rated hotels may have and it may not be as modern and contemporary as other hotels in the city, This mid range hotel gets big thumbs up, and I will certainly love to stay here again in the future.

reviews.title: Fabulous
reviews.content: First time in New York to celebrate our birthdays. I couldn't have chosen a better hotel. The staff on the front desk, the porters, the concierges were all a credit to the hotel and we found them very welcoming and extremely helpful on every occasion. Would highly recommend this hotel.

reviews.title: Excellent trip for my 21st
reviews.content: The hotel is in a brilliant location within a 10 minute walk of all the liveliness of bustling Times Square! A subway station is directly outside of the doors of the hotel so transport links are not a problem at all. Hotel staff are all very friendly & helpful and helped us out with directions on the subway/walking directions when we needed them to get our bearings on where we were. The hotel has wifi but is charged at different rates based on however many days you wish to purchase. The room we had was up on the 21st floor, room was very clean & tidy and was maintained everyday by the hotel maids. Tv in the hotel room but rarely watched it as we were so busy. The room had two windows which opened slightly to let in some air. The bathroom wasn't huge but enough room for what we needed. The bedroom also wasn't huge but again had plenty enough space for what we needed, bed was very comfy and pillows were nice & big too. Room service was offered in the hotel amongst luggage storage, and other services. I would definitely stay in this hotel again due to the location and the cleanliness. Brilliant trip to New York!!

reviews.title: Birthday celebration
reviews.content: The hotel location was perfect,walking distance to time square. service was fabulous, staff was helpful and pleasant. rooms were nice, we didn't get the original room we booked but got an upgrade for the same price

reviews.title: The fantastic
reviews.content: The location is fantastic. The room was clean and the bed comfortable. The deli across the street has a fantastic breakfast, pastrami on rye and a chocolate layer cake to die for! Also, try a coconut macaroon as big as your fist. The staff at the Wellington was friendly, helpful and we felt safe at all times. So close to the Carnegie, you could hear the piano. (Just kidding, although if there was one downside, you can hear loud talking, jumping on the floor above you etc) Oversll, our experience was wonderful, we highly recommend the hotel just a couple blocks from Central Park to the right and Times Square to the left.

reviews.title: Location, location, location
reviews.content: The best thing this hotel has to offer is it's location, only a few blocks from Central Park and the yellow line subway is right out the door. It's an old hotel and was comfortable enough, but there is little attention to detail. In our room, Wallpaper was loosening from the walls, sink faucets dripped, the bathroom door didn't latch, and the shower water kept fluctuating between hot and cold. The bathtub stopper did not work. The elevators are very small and on the slower side. The staff is not very friendly. I found housekeeping friendlier, but the front desk staff need to put a smile on their faces and have better telephone etiquette. It can't be that they are New Yorkers because I found New Yorkers to be very friendly. We were also overcharged on the early check in fee.

reviews.title: Holiday
reviews.content: First time for myself and husband, but my two sons stayed at the Wellington before, on a previous visit to New York, hotel is fabulous, it just reminds me of a hotel in the old films, like 'Annie', rooms are comfortable and clean, we couldn't fault it, would stay again, staff are lovely, and it is not far from Central Park, and the other amenities, We hope to come back soon.

reviews.title: Wellington Hotel
reviews.content: We stayed at the Wellington Hotel last Feb. for 8 days. When we got there, we were confused by the signage that said use other door. We went around the corner where that door was locked and then realized they meant the other front door right alongside the closed one. Funny, but after a 14 hour travel day, a bit annoying with heavy bags. Thought it would have been nice to be greeted outside. Inside, the lobby is beautiful, art deco paintings, dramatic chandeliers, really love it. Old building but clean, no musky smells and management was very helpful in general. Went to the starbucks across the street (no coffee in rooms) most mornings. Great location to walk to many things, and easy to catch a subway if not close.Diner around the corner that was outstanding. Rooms not huge but not small. Loved the darkening shades that pulled down inside the curtains. Street can be noisy but we were up high so made a huge difference. Maids were outstanding. We would stay again.

reviews.title: Great location
reviews.content: We stayed at the Wellington Hotel for the third time and once again, could not have been more pleased. We traveled with another couple and both rooms were clean and quiet. The staff was very pleasant and helpful from the valet to the front desk to Nick who always seems to be the one helping us with our bags. Looking forward to returning.

reviews.title: Bad service and quite noisy
reviews.content: Got a room at the 14th floor towards 7th Avenue and it was quite noisy even though it was fairly high up since there was no sound proofing at all. Even heard people shout down at the street. Rooms are small (like in the rest of NY) and a bit rundown. The cleaning though is something that needs a major overhaul. When I got back to the hotel at 4 pm there were still breakfast leftovers from an adjacent room lying around in the corridor and bundles of laundry didn't make it easier to navigate back to my room. When leaving again a bit later I told the reception staff about it and they said they were going to call it in, but it felt like they really wasn't in a hurry with it. Internet pricing is a joke though. 4.99 USD for an hour and only two devices. Talk about rip off! GO over the street to Starbucks and it's free.....

reviews.title: Not a Boutique but good value for money
reviews.content: got the hotel via hotwire , who described the hotel as Boutique hotel with WI FI access. it's not a Boutique hotel by any definition and the WI FI is NOT free. it's and old hotel but rooms were renovated and it looks like they were trying to keep some of the old charm with modern facilities , the result is fine not amazing ' but you need to remember it's a 3 star hotel. got a tiny room ( was a single traveler) looking to nothing . room was very clean , bed was comfi and the water were hot. the location is really good , 2 min walk from central park , so I am quite satisfied concerning the price I paid. .

reviews.title: Great hotel except 1 thing
reviews.content: Ok I really think for the price I should have a coffee maker in the room or have in the lobby. I made a last minute reservation and was upgraded and checked in early The room was quiet 12th floor. Bed was very comfy. Water pressure FANTASTIC. I would stay here again, great location. 10 minutes walk from Time Square. 10 minutes from Central Park. Subway Station right outside. Staff friendly and everything clean!

reviews.title: Brilliant - Book to stay here.
reviews.content: Visited NYC from 30 May - 2 June 2017 for my daughters 21st birthday. Our stay at the Wellington Hotel was excellent. All the staff were lovely and very helpful. We were allocated a corner room on the 24th floor and both windows looked out onto Times Square, this was a real treat. Our room was very large and the air con worked perfectly, there was also a safe in our room. Bedding and towels were changed every day, what more can you ask for. The staff in this hotel work really hard and it shows. It's in a great location with Starbucks opposite. I will return to NYC and the Wellington Hotel will be my first choice. Book this hotel you won't regret it. We booked our holiday with Virgin and the attention to detail on the flights is superb, fabulous staff as well. ENJOY.

reviews.title: Recommended
reviews.content: I would recommend this hotel for anyone visiting New York. It is clean, comfortable, has large closet with a safe in the room. It is in a great location just a few blocks away from central park, Times Square.

reviews.title: Old Type Charm, reminded me of America
reviews.content: Myself and my daughter spent 6 nights here, we were checked in almost immediately. Given the room we had asked for. The room was clean, and cleaned every day. The Staff were friendly and happy to help. We aren't the type of people to moan, or need constant attention so apart from asking about the safety deposit box we didn't really need to contact staff at any other time, as we are pity independent and were out and about all the time. The beds and pillows were very comfortable, apart from the sirens it was pretty quite, and we slept well.
