The location was absolutely perfect, We had the metro literally next door which we used constantly every day, we had central park to the right and times square to the left. Overall I would stay here again with hesitation

reviews.title: Very happy!
reviews.content: This hotel has that old charm that I love. Beautiful chandeliers, ornate furnishings, and very helpful staff. We were welcomed and treated warmly for several days. I never saw the staff be rude or rushed. We had a suite so there was plenty of room for us plus a kitchen area. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. Absolutely no noise was heard from the 10th floor. There was no wait for the elevator. We got free WiFi by booking on the hotel website directly. We were allowed to stay a little past checkout by asking. There were a couple of problems though. Our room did not have enough towels for 3 people. No shower curtain until the second day. There were many stairs throughout the hotel that I did not expect. Overall, I was very happy with this hotel and would definitely stay here again.

reviews.title: Theater, World Trade Center, Wedding!
reviews.content: 3 nights in a 1br. Suite with the family of 1 teen and 2 parents. Really worked well for us as we had everything close and subway stop right in front. Liked having the little store and cafe right in the lobby. Will stay again!!!

reviews.title: good location
reviews.content: this hotel was very nice but the room was rather small. the bathroom was very small. there was about 6 inches from the wall to the bed. the hotel was very clean and the staff was very nice. the location was great too. the caf√© was very expensive but had access from the lobby. we had asked for extra pillows during reservations but did not receive them.

reviews.title: good for short visit
reviews.content: Bathroom is very small only one person could be in there at a time, everything else was excellent...just a few blocks from Times Square. Would recommend for a short stay and if you don't plan on being in the room a lot of the trip.

reviews.title: Great Location
reviews.content: We drove our car to the hotel and we promptly unloaded by the friendly staff. Our suite newly refurnished and sparkling clean RM 601 was perfect with a separate room for my in-laws, 3 TVs, huge comfy beds and a handicap accessible shower with three shower heads. Valet parking was $45. My only gripe was that upon departure, the staff was less than attentive and had to be cajoled from the conversations they were having with each other. They also did not load my car, only bringing our luggage to the side of the building.

reviews.title: NYC
reviews.content: Our family of four, children 10 &13, were coming to the city for a week after attending a graduation at West Point. I booked this hotel because of its location and ease of getting around. I could not of been more pleased. I knew it was an older hotel that has undergone some renovations but again I was interested in its close proximity to Times Square, Central Park and subway. I had booked a deluxe double and upon check in inquired about queen size instead. They were very busy and I am not sure they even had that available but told me they had upgraded me to a suite. That was fine and we were very pleasantly surprised with our two room, one king and one double room. It was very spacious. We had no view but the room was very quiet. Free wifi for the week as well. Our housekeeping staff was very friendly and our room was made everyday. I found the hotel staff to be very helpful and had to utilize them several times in order to print some vouchers for some attractions. The doorman greeted us each time and were always helpful with directions. We had a wonderful stay and I will return and would recommend this hotel. Thanks Wellington, we had a great time!

reviews.title: Holiday
reviews.content: We staying in The Wellington Hotel for a week. After reading the mix reviews we was a bit worried we booked a two bed room. Was upgraded to a 2 bedroom room, the rooms are very dated and need a upgrade. But the beds are very comfortable and the pillows lovely. The bathroom is very small and smells awful. The hotel is in a good location has a subway right out side and central park & time square is right on the door step. Staff very pleasant and helpful. Free safe at reception but no free wifi.

reviews.title: Bed bug situation in Room 2345 and rude attitude from mgt
reviews.content: Stayed at Room 2345 - small, old, AC unit not functioning and worst of all, ran into bed bug situation and had to move out the next day. Mgt refused to refund for rest of the stay (4 nights) and throwing attitude around claiming there's no hard proof of bed bugs. Horrible experience and will never stay here again.

reviews.title: Nothing special but right in the middle of it all
reviews.content: The Wellington hotel is located very near Times Square and the Rock and you don't have to walk very far for a hop-on-hop-off bus or Central Park. The hotel itself has small rooms and our view was to the "back yard" of the building. The interior is a bit worn out. The staff was not exactly overwhelmed with swedish tourists but ok.

reviews.title: Centrally located!
reviews.content: Centrally located is the only plus point of this run down hotel! Unfriendly staff.. w/o a smile to welcome u ! Housekeeping sucks...after 4 calls for bath towels..the staff conveniently opens my room with their key . .walks in and announces 'housekeeping' ..is that even allowed ..?? Check out is noon..but I guess 1hour up is allowed...so 12.45pm we get a call from front desk..that if you don't check out in 15mts ie1pm ..there will be an additional charge of 40++$ Wow...that was close coz we were ready n about to leave the room..! Why didn't they inform us about it during check in..?? 15mts is a pretty short notice.. Rooms are old ...carpets dirty..no mugs no tea etc .. The window air conditioners are noisy. .rickety old ones .. My suggestion..Don't bother ..many many more to stay in n actually enjoy your stay in New York.

reviews.title: Great location-hotel was suitable for short stay
reviews.content: Stayed at the Wellington Hotel for 2 nights in May. Great location just a few blocks from time square and central park. Right next to the subway line. Coffee shops and pubs very close to the hotel. Price was decent compared to other hotels in the area. No free wifi which was disappointing. Room aircon switched from hot to cold throughout the night which disturbed our sleep. Overall a good hotel.

reviews.title: Cozy and close to everything
reviews.content: I have no complaints about The Wellington. While it is an older hotel, everything was nice and clean and cozy. The location is great! We were steps from food and fun and shops. They even have a visitor center where you can book a shuttle for your return to the airport. We will definitely be back!

reviews.title: Great location, average hotel
reviews.content: I came to the Wellington on my second visit to New York and I was impressed by the location as central park is a five minute walk away, and Times Square is pretty close too. The staff were friendly and helpful, we were stopping for 10 days and when we paid for WiFi they gave us 5 days free. There were flaws with this hotel however, the room was small, there was barely room to move round the double bed. The room was hot and switching the air con only worked for awhile then it would pump out hot air. In the bathroom the toilet made the most horrendous noise when it flushed and if it got stuck on the flush the awful noise carried on for a while until it wasn't stuck. Maids would often try and get in the room when we had put out the 'Do not disturb' sign.

reviews.title: Great address / mediocre hotel
reviews.content: Hotel is very well placed half way between Central Park en time square. Unfortunately it is the only good point. Booking is very messy, my reservation was cancelled for the two first nights for an unknown reason, one of my colleague had no reservation, an other one had two reservations for one night... Lifts are very old and very busy at rush hours.Rooms are extremely small.AC is very noisy. Rooms are very dark on courtyard side but probably more quiet than street / avenue side rooms. I paid online an extra to get a wifi access. Unfortunately the access code never worked. I sent an email to the help desk. Hopefully I got a refund. I definitely do not recommend this hotel.

reviews.title: Great location, great room size and that is it
reviews.content: We stayed her for 6 nights in may with our children aged 2 and 8 months. The hotel is in a fantastic location. Great size room. We had a one bedroom suite but ended up having 2 bedrooms. Which was so handy with 2 young children. The hotel is not accessible unless by steps. The least being 4 steps. When you have a pushchair with shopping and 2 children it is heavy lifting it up and down. The bell boys never helped unless we asked. When I was alone with the children I had to wait 10 mins for anyone to help me. Not ideal with 2 young ones. The staff all seemed to have an attitude problem. The room is incredible outdated. There is no coffee and no safe. We had a microwave and a fridge that even on the warmest setting froze everything so in the morning when we wanted to give our children cereal we had to heat the milk up to defrost. The taps in the bathroom made the loudest screeching noise unless on full. Not ideal when you want to shower or bath and the kids are sleeping. The ac in the room was very old. Not great if you are staying here in the summer. Every bath tile in the bathroom seemed cracked and desperately needed redoing. The hotel lost one of my parcels. When I kept asking for it they got rude. I waited 7 hours until they found it. For the price we paid I would rather stay in a nicer hotel for with less space in the room for the same price. The lifts are very small and at busy times we had to wait several times before we could go down in the lift. Having the pushchair meant we couldn't go down 7 flights of stairs to reception. We also asked for 2 cots in the room. When we got there we had to call and wait for them to be put up. After a 13 hour flight and 2 hours in the taxi this wasn't ideal when we just wanted to put the kids to bed. Don't ask for any special requests on the booking form if you aren't going to honour them. Definitely won't be going back.

reviews.title: Junior/Senior High trip
reviews.content: On a group trip of junior/senior high students from Idaho. Drove into Manhattan with two vans (one over size) and I drove directly to the hotel with no problems, well visible and amazing valet services. With more than 20 pieces of luggage the valet took care of everything for us! The hotel was clean, friendly, and very accommodating to a larger group. The location is perfect between Central Park and Time Square for walking, with a subway one block away. Our group loved it! Though not all rooms had a balcony, my group's room did and had a great view of Time Square. A few of the others had a good window view looking towards Central Park. Was a great hotel to work into our fundraiser budget for our students, even if it was only 2 days.

reviews.title: Mixed feelings!
reviews.content: I stayed here four nights with my adult daughter at the end of April start of May . First impressions where ok, staff friendly enough, lobby looked dated and in an old fashioned style. We were on the seventh floor . Now the room, granted it did look like the pictures on the site and TA in terms of the decor , which on the pics looked ok, up close and personal it was very dated indeed. The room was also quiet small, I've stayed in NYC twice before and it was smaller than a more budget priced hotel I'd stayed in. There was no wardrobe but a weird walk in cupboard, no light and few hangers. Our view was a brick wall and another window in spitting distance which looked as though it was in a room being refurbed, it meant we hardly opened the blinds and my daughter saw someone staring through one day whole looked like a work man. The bathroom was even smaller. I mean really tiny, stand up to brush your teeth then sit on the toilet tiny. We had problems with all the taps too which where really old, this meant the shower was hit and miss and we called the bath, more a stand for the shower the "borrowers bath" as they're the only people who could have actually bathed in it! It was also warm and we slept with the window open as the air con unit was like something out of the arc and really really noisey. A few positives though as it's not all doom n gloom. The bed was really comfortable , one of the best I've slept in and the location is brilliant. Two blocks down from Central Park, a two minute walk to a subway and minutes from Times Square . In fact this is the hotels main sell . I'm not saying there aren't nice rooms, just that we didn't see one.

reviews.title: Hasn't changed in 11 years since I was last there
reviews.content: Old fashioned hotel but excellent front desk staff helpful and friendly. We had an issue with booking- not hotels fault - dial a flight changed booking and didn't inform us. However, they sorted it out and found us a room. Clean comfortable room and bathroom. Would always chose here as central location near to cental park, rockefeller centre and a few blocks from times square.

reviews.title: Great location, needs some updating for the price they charge
reviews.content: The location was great, room spacious, clean and comfortable. The price was rather high for just one night and the decor and furnishings were a bit out of date. There was no safe or coffee/teapot in our "suite" (bedroom/living/room/bathroom and entrance small fridge/microwave. Also, no breakfast included for the high price we paid. Needs to be a better value if they are going to charge as much as a more well-known hotel.

reviews.title: Great HOTEL
reviews.content: Awesome location, It is 2 blocks from Central park and 4 blocks from Time Square, You have best of both worlds. The subway is right on front of the hotel, everything is super close and accessible. GREAT LOCATION!

reviews.title: very good location!
reviews.content: This is the second time we have stayed at this hotel and we really liked the location, near to everything you would want to visit in Manhattan. The rooms are comfortable, warm, well appointed, all of things working, though it appears to be an old building. If I have the chance, I'll be back there for sure.

reviews.title: Great location but lacking detail
reviews.content: This hotel really is in an excellent location for visiting New York - Central Park and a Times Square both an easy walk away. We had a small suite which was spacious and initially clean, but our room was not serviced at all after our second night. We mentioned this at the desk, declined the offer of a service that evening but asked them to make sure we had a thorough service the following day. We returned to our room the next day to find towels left in the shower had been removed and not replaced with no other evidence of any cleaning at all. This time we allowed for our room to be cleaned while we were out for the evening and returned to find it as it should be. This hotel is not cheap and we were disappointed by this poor service. Also agree with other reviewers about the wifi. We had ours deducted from the bill following our complaint about the lack of cleaning but, in a vacation which took us to 6 city hotels in the US in 6 days this was the only one not to offer unlimited free wifi.

reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Staff
reviews.content: Me, my daughter and my best friend have just arrived home after 4 nights at The Wellington and what can I say BRILLIANT BRILLIANT. From Frank and Mike on Front Desk to the Maids everyone was so so friendly and helpful. Location was perfect. Room was perfect and you all made my 50th birthday and my daughters 21st amazing. Thank you Wellington we will be back.

reviews.title: Nice locationÔºåpoor condition
reviews.content: I stayed at this hotel for a friday night. The room was tiny, equipments looked old. The AC was too noisy and I can't even turn it off. I couldn't sleep because of it. My room was close to elevator, I could hear the sound of opening door and people talking in the lounge. There is no beverage like coffee or bottled water in the room or at the lobby. But the location was really great, walk distance to time square and subway.

reviews.title: Large, clean room. but Wifi was pricey.
reviews.content: Our double room was very large for Manhattan. The bathroom was small with almost no counter space for toiletries. The room and bath were very clean, but the room really needs updating...think heavy floral window valances, maroon and gold tones. The major downer--and the reason I would not return-- was that wifi was only available at a very high cost. It really should be free to guests, given the room's price and overall need for updating. The room is in Times Square, which many guests would find ideal, given proximity to theaters.

reviews.title: Great location
reviews.content: I stayed here for one night on business and was quite happy with the hotel. The location was great for access to the subway and Times Square is just a short walk away. The room was a bit dated and could do with updating, I can't remember the last time that I saw a shower with separate hot and cold taps (which some people might consider character). I was disappointed that this hotel charge for the use of wifi as even budget hotels offer it for free these days.

reviews.title: Not so Well(ington) for disabled
reviews.content: First let me say that our room was very clean and very big! It was a suite as we had four people. We asked for a handicapped accessible room w/roll in shower, which we got. So why do I give it only 3/5? NO WAY to get up and down stairs if you are in a wheelchair without having to wait for them to put up the portable ramp. Now, we are fortunate in that my daughter can walk up and down stairs (slowly!) and walk a few short steps, but so many people cannot. We decided it was easier to just have her walk up and down while two of us carried the wheelchair up and down. The first time we asked for the ramp we got an eyeroll! Some days the doorman would see us and offer to help carry it up/down, other days not. I never thought to ask if the lobby was accessible since they had accessible rooms! So bottom line: if mobility is not an issue, it a nice clean hotel, and close enough to walk to many attractions. However, if you are in a wheelchair this is not the hotel for you! Were the wheelchair not an issue I'd have given it 4.5/5--the half point being for the elevators being very very small!

reviews.title: Ideal location for Times Square experience!
reviews.content: Wellington Hotel is a great location for Times Square, Radio City Music Hall, 5th Ave, etc. They are all in walking distance from the hotel. The Wellington is a clean, quiet place to stay. We had a two bedroom suite - very pleased with the accommodations. The hotel doesn't offer a free continental breakfast but is there are many places near it to have breakfast or any other meal. The staff was friendly and very helpful if you have any questions. Nice place!

reviews.title: Great location!
reviews.content: Walking distance to Central Park and Times Square. Surrounded by souvenirs shops. Lovely hotel, but boring breakfast... WI-Fi you have to buy $ 4.99 a day! Very enjoyed staying where because of location.

reviews.title: Great location
reviews.content: Pros: excellent location, right in the heart of Manhattan. Good comfy beds and clean rooms and bathroom. Great price for a hotel in the heart of city. Cons: there was no view at all (which is usually common for hotels in Manhattan), the window was facing a wall.

reviews.title: Mr
reviews.content: Great location. Staff was very friendly. We enjoyed the quiet space on the mezzanine. A suggestion would be to enlarge the coffee condiments area which was always overcrowded, sometimes with long waits. We walked to Times Square, Broadway and Central Park. Subway access was easy at 51st or Grand Central.

reviews.title: Very nice stay but a bit expensive
reviews.content: This is the fourth time I have stayed at the Wellington and I like the hotel very much. The location is terrific, the staff very nice and the room cleans and, while small (to be expected in Manhattan) very nicely appointed. I have previously stayed here in the winter when the prices were lower. This time it was much more expensive but it was hard to find something suitable in midtown that was significantly cheaper so I stayed here again. I was not disappointed at all but again, the price seemed high.

reviews.title: Wellington hotel Nyc review
reviews.content: The hotel is ideally situated for any trip to NYC the hotel its self is nice enough we found it to be clean and well maintained, i would advise anyone who is staying here to take a copy of your booking information as we had an issue with this , we booked a room with 2 double beds but were given a room with just one double bed,after bringing this to the attention of the young lady at the check in desk we were told pointedly that "we were wrong" and "did we have any proof that we booked a twin room" we did and after a few minutes were given the correct room.. we found the room to be immaculate but a bit small.apart from that our stay was excellent and without issue ,the rooms were cleaned daily and the linen changed . the staff are very helpful polite and courteous, the door men are superb , would i stay here again ? definitely. would i recommend it ? absolutely .....

reviews.title: Honeymoon
reviews.content: I LOVED NYC. It was the highlight of the trip for me. The Wellington Hotel is in such a great location, best locarion. So close to everything, walking distance to Times Square, Rockerfella Center, The Empire State Building and Central Park. The subway is right out front so to get down to 9/11 memorial and ferry to The Statue of Liberty was so easy. Food is so easy to find anywhere but the best place we found was just around the corner from the hotel, Pasta Lovers on 142 W 49th St, New York, NY 10019, USA. AMAZING Pasta. The hotel was clean and staff were friendly. Room we stayed in was quite small and they have issues with the shower, it'll be scalding hot one minute then freezing the next, we got burnt so be careful. Apart from that the hotel was good.

reviews.title: Location, Location and so much more!
reviews.content: This is a great hotel. Great staff from bellman to front desk staff and housekeeping. Everyone is friendly and genuinely cares about the guest. Room was large and the bed was very comfortable. The location is very convenient as well.

reviews.title: Excellent stay
reviews.content: My family and I and husband stayed there over Easter lovely friendly people rooms spotless , sink and microwave in room .Perfect location. Perfect location turn right out of hotel to Central park turn left to times squarekads of eating places around ,hotel has breakfast bar and restaurant.

reviews.title: Great location and value
reviews.content: Booked at this hotel via Kayak.com at the last minute when my flight got delayed to the next morning. Really nice room and great city view. Room is a little small, but you're really there to sleep (in a such a great city as NYC) so it's fine. Very nice furnishings and linens. Bell staff was really nice and interesting. Wish I had stayed at The Wellington the entire time. And the Greek restaurant on ground floo is really good (dressy)...I recommend.

reviews.title: Fantastic base
reviews.content: This hotel is a fantastic base for exploring New York. It's within a 10 minute walk of Times Square, Broadway, Central Park, 5th Avenue, St Patricia Cathedral, Radio City and the Rockefeller Centre. The staff are extremely helpful and friendly. I would definitely stay here again.

reviews.title: Aright for the price
reviews.content: Nothing special, rooms super small and they don't seem to be familiar with concept of fitted sheets also housekeeping has strict requirements to come into your room /clean/"spy" for safety reasons if you decline service 3 days in a row, you'll get a letter saying they're coming the next day whether you like it or not, this makes for an interesting experience if you're on a conference call in the room...

reviews.title: Weekend Getaway to see Wicked
reviews.content: You get what you pay for....price was right, .location was good but hotel is old and needs updating. Disappointed Staff was not very helpful and quite frankly seemed pretty shady. We kept getting phone calls in our room that were hang ups. I think just checking to see if we were there.

reviews.title: Very good hotel
reviews.content: Excellent location just a short walk away from Times Square and Central Park. Room was very small but that's to be expected in New York. However it was clean. Bed was large and comfy. The heating system in the room was a bit loud during the night. We requested a room with a view and we got one - A lovely view of Central Park.

reviews.title: Great location...lost a star on the Wi-Fi extra?
reviews.content: This hotel is in fantastic location, it's also very clean and the staff I met was nice and helpful.. two things that need improvement on we couldn't have our room temperature no heat it had been raining and we be no way to dry out our things.. also a charge for Wi-Fi 5 dollars for 1 hour? I came from Europe and relied on Wi-Fi to keep in touch with people to meet them really is something you most in improve with. Other than that Wi-Fi and air con situation it's a great hotel and I would to return if you have free/included Wi-Fi. Employees are very nice people. So central.

reviews.title: Was in town for 4 night
reviews.content: Location is pretty good but for the price i paid for the room, Wifi should've been free. No kettle to make a tea or coffee. The room was good for me on my own . If there was another person though it would be tight. NYC has got expensive

reviews.title: good value close to sites
reviews.content: I booked a suite here for the weekend travelling with my wife, daughter and her friend. The suite met our needs with a king size bed in the main room and two double beds in the bedroom. The hotel was centrally located a couple of blocks south of central park and a few blocks north of Times square. The service was good. The check in check out folks were not super friendly but they were efficient on the way in. Leaving they were a bit short staffed and it took a little long. The bellmen were ready to assist and housekeeping were very accomodating in getting us extra towels for our showering needs. The room did not have a safe . The room we had was on the 6th floor. The room is not soundproof so you do get quite a bit of noise from 7th avenue. Fire trucks came by very early Sunday morning and interrupted our sleep. Overall for the price and location we were satisfied with the hotel.

reviews.title: Poor choice
reviews.content: This hotel doesn't respect wake up calls. I asked for a wake up call at 5:30 am. They didn't call because "it wasn't in the system". I trusted the hotel and it was their responsibility. Because of this, I missed a day tour for Washington and had no chance of going again because I had no days left in NY. Wouldn't come back again.

reviews.title: Outdated
reviews.content: Wellington - we stopped for 3 nights on our way home from Vegas. Hotel was really old school, old fashioned and outdated. Lifts took forever - we were on level 10. Me and my partner found it really spooky. We joked we had a ghost in our room because we kept hearing noises, old pipes im hoping. Although it's a quick walk into Times Square I'd go for something more modern.

reviews.title: So so
reviews.content: This hotel was booked last minute and we needed a room with 2 beds. The two beds were comfortable and the location was great. Those were the only positives of this hotel. It was very dated, the elevators were slow, the staff was slow and it didn't have much of a lobby. Thank goodness it was just two nights.

reviews.title: Exellent location.
reviews.content: Excellent location near central park and times square. Hotel is large. It is very clean. check in and check out was very easy and efficient. Room was small but very tastefully decorated. Have valet parking but it is down the street so it does take some time to get your car.

reviews.title: Excellent Value Hotel! Great Location! Great Stay!
reviews.content: Fabulous busy city hotel with "the most" comfortable king size bed ever, divine white cotton bed linen and sumptuous feather pillows. Our room was serviced and cleaned really well every single day, with the nice option for any/all towels and bed linen to be changed on request. We stayed 5 nights Feb/Mar 2017 and enjoyed a superb double room on the 26th floor (27th is the highest floor), with a brilliant window view over adjacent building roof tops across Central Park, Harlem and beyond! It was cold during our stay, often minus 10 at night, but our room was always warm and comfortable. The sash window opens 30cms and could stay open 24/7 if you like fresh air. The high room meant the sound of the traffic below even with the window open was not intrusive and the air clean and fresh. There are ample service lifts. Just across the road is Tisserie for pastries and coffee and the subway right outside and Times Square a quick walk away!

reviews.title: You're in it
reviews.content: Don't consider if you're used to high end hotels. We're used to mid-range hotels. We're used to stopping and madly scanning booking sites for the best value for the night. We'd arrived a day early and a bomb exploded in Chelsea so pressure was on. There was a little fist pump at finding this one under $200 USD. It boasted a view of Central Park.... so we lashed out a bit. Isn't this a reason to be here? 27th Floor! Although it's uncomfortable for us not being unable to regulate the air much in the room, we were really happy. Although the check in line was a sea of bags and weary travellers, we were still so excited. It's a great bargain. Even after dragging all our luggage straight through Times Square on a Saturday afternoon, we knew we'd got ourselves into a great location. (btw: I don't recommend walking with your gear ... of course we stood out like tourists. A young girl with some sort of preconceived bias towards our luggage, kicked at it as we went past. 'Never found out why she was so into suitcase bashing. It wasn't bad luggage and the poor thing was only a small wheelie one.) Once we settled into NY, we found the subway one of the easiest in US to get the hang of. In fact, once you're in there. navigating NY makes sense. This hotel is a great place to explore from. Just take your strong handbag though. They are looked on a lot. I mean looked on a lot more favourably.

reviews.title: best holiday
reviews.content: The bell on the lifts was the only downside, Hotel was in great location just a couple blocks from times square and central park. Already planning on going back. the bed was so comfortable and the room was nicely decorated.

reviews.title: Trip for my daughters 30th
reviews.content: We booked our package through Thomas Cook, the Hotel was brilliant, the staff were very helpful and our cleaner was a treasure. We had no issues with the hotel we had large good clean accommodation as we mostly used it as a base it was perfect. We asked for the room with a little kitchen area and this was invaluable. We bought the NY pass prior to travelling so got a good deal and made the most of it we were exhausted going home but well worth it.

reviews.title: Amazing Hotel with a perfect location..!!
reviews.content: We stayed there for three days and got a very big suite for a very good price.. It was a steal deal. We loved it.. very close to all the attractions and was very convenient. Would go again anytime.. :)

reviews.title: A good place next to alot
reviews.content: this is our 2nd stay here, and perhaps the luster has rubbed away. when we first got in the room with the bellhop carrying our bags, the room was blisteringly hot. the bellhop looked at the (non-working) modern thermostat and said 'its automatic' well, really, if it didn't come on in this heat, it wasn't going to. Turns out, the old fashioned, radiator-like AC was by the window and it was off, so we switched it on. the Bellhop should have been well versed in how to cool the rooms. Nonetheless, the AC was weak at best. We spent the entire day out and when we got back, it was still warm, despite having set it to Hi Cool. It really needs to be replaced. we also had to wiggle the toilet flush in a variety of ways to get it to flush. and the drains for both the shower and the sink drained very slowly. As well, the bottom of the tub was very slippery and needed a good scrub of its sliminess. Not too appealing. this was on the 9th floor, where the elevators were slow and tiny, only able to accommodate 5 people at a time. on our last visit we stayed on the 4th floor and it was much better overall., though the room was smaller, and it was right over the busy street, everything was clean and worked well. And the cost of this room was crazy each night varied, I'll post: Sunday, 30 April, 2017 : $170.80 per Night Monday, 1 May, 2017 : $240.80 per Night Tuesday, 2 May, 2017 : $391.30 per Night Total Room Price : $802.90 City Tax $47.17 for all nights Occupancy Tax $6.00 for all nights State Tax $71.26 for all nights Visitor Tax $4.50 for all nights Total: $931.83 I get all the taxes, but the varying rate of each day was nuts!. Now this hotel is close to 5th Avenue and a lot happens here so it was close to a lot, as well as close to Central Park. On this visit though, we took UBER to many places further away, Wall Street, Brooklyn, etc. And there are a lot of good places to eat nearby, or stores to buy water and snacks. I'm sure we would stay here again, we would probably ask for a lower floor room. If you're in a hurry, upper floors don't cut it with the slow elevator.

reviews.title: Full of coach parties
reviews.content: Visited for business. Hotel not suitable. Foyer always full of suitcases. I think the hotel specialises in large parties. Bar/restaurant was excellent and seemed a quite separate entity. Never slept in a smaller room but fine for two nights. will not stay again. Needs more lifts.

reviews.title: Served a great purpose!
reviews.content: The Wellington Hotel was perfect for what I needed - a hotel in Midtown that was cheap, clean, centrally located, and had a "New York" vibe to it :) Loved the prewar old-school feel of the place, and that it wasn't part of a big chain. Felt unique! Also was very pleasantly surprised by how close it was to Central Park and Fifth Avenue. Good pick if you need an easy place to stay for a night!

reviews.title: 21st Birthday Celebrations
reviews.content: We were visiting New York for my nieces 21st birthday present. I booked the Wellington through the UK website booking.com and the rate was really good. (Be advised that the price doesn't include the state taxes). We got checked in early and given our room. It was small but manageable. Wifi isn't free but 4 devices per plan. Room is noisy but you're in the city centre so all hotels are the same. The room temperature was controlled and we never got it right. I would stay here again, basic but clean and good location. Hair dryers in the room and lots of plug sockets!

reviews.title: Hot and cold!
reviews.content: Great location, good desk service. Showers were brutal and I compared notes with other visitors on different floors who confirmed that the water ran from scorching hot to cold with multiple transitions over the course of a normal shower. If I didn't get clean, I would have given the hotel 1 star! There was no valet to take my car to the parking garage - no big deal it was only a block away. It was the shower that was pretty tough.

reviews.title: Tired & lacking
reviews.content: I thought long and hard about this review. The hotel is in a great location but its just not great accommodation. The rooms are tiny! Far too small for a couple. We struggled to move around at the same time and getting the ironing board out was a military manoeuvre! The doorman was no where to be seen to help us check in. Wifi is $25 a day!! The room was clean but the decor is just tired and needs a facelift. If it was going for retro it would have been cool, but it was just old and tatty. There are no rooms safes and not enough room for coffee making facilities, so you are getting a basic room. A very small basic room at that!

reviews.title: Amazing hotel with a great location!
reviews.content: My husband and I went to New York for our honeymoon in Dec 13 and stayed in the Wellington. The hotel is great and right in the heart of the city! It's a 5 minute walk to Central Park and about the same to Times Square. It also has a great diner attached, The Park Cafe. The staff at the hotel are always so friendly and helpful and that's we keep going back! We have stayed the last 4 years in a row and we will hopefully be back again this year. I would highly recommend the Wellington to anyone.

reviews.title: Old world charm
reviews.content: TheWellington is an old world hotel shortly north of Times Square. The rooms are small but well appointed. Small bathroom and barely room to move, but I literally on came to the room to sleep. Checking in can be a grind but is par for the course. Would definitely stay there again.

reviews.title: Very central
reviews.content: This was a smaller hotel, but very central, to everything, straight down the avenue to Time's Square, , the hop on hop off buses were opposite side of the road,a few blocks down. We had a nice room on 27 floor, wasn't a modern hotel, but clean and all you needed for our stay. Staff were very good, pleasant,and helpful.

reviews.title: Good location
reviews.content: We stayed in this hotel for a short break to New York City. The hotel was located quite close to Times Square so was great location. There was a restaurant in the hotel, although I wasn't quite sure if the hotel was actually owned by the hotel or if it was just conveniently located. The food was OK, but a bit expensive. The hotel itself was a little dated, but that's not unusual for a hotel in the City. The room was quite small but had en suite bathroom and was comfortable. We we on the 21st floor which was nice and we had a brilliant view of Times Square. It could be a little noisy at times, but New York is so exhausting, we slept through the noise. Overall the hotel was nice in a good location.

reviews.title: Wedding weekend
reviews.content: Visited this hotel which is very well placed for all the attractions of New york and surrounding area . The reception staff checked us in very quickley and the bell hop brought our luggage to the room within a few minutes.Every one that we came in to contact with were very polite and welcoming.Our room was very large which was a suprise and nothing was to much trouble. This is our opinion and I cannot speak for anyone else.

reviews.title: Amazing location
reviews.content: Booked the hotel in the very last minute before my 4 days trip to New York. The hotel is close to everything, it's in a walking distance to all the places a tourist might want to visit. Rooms are small, hotel is old, but very comfy and warm! I would definitely recommend it if you are looking for a place to stay at with a limited budget.

reviews.title: Small wonder
reviews.content: I did not expect much since we didn't pay a whole bunch for this room (a touch over a grand for 3 nights after all was done....not much given the quality & location). However, it was a wonderful surprise! Yes, the spaces were relatively small but not anything that bothered us. Since we had our two kids, the two separate bedrooms with their own TV areas were great!!! When we booked a "deluxe double" this is not what we expected. The bathroom was also small but very nice, clean, and updated. Free wifi was also a big plus. The location was PERFECT!!!! Right in the center of everything we wanted to do. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because the elevators on our wing (north?) was tiny. If I could, I'd give this one 4.5 stars. Next time we come here we're staying here again for sure!!!!

reviews.title: Good value in the Theater District
reviews.content: This is an older hotel, but the rooms are updated nicely. Large for a standard room. And there is a convenience store and diner connected to the lobby. Also there are computers in the lobby if you don't want to pay for the Wifi.

reviews.title: Handy location but Wifi Extra?
reviews.content: Happy with the location of this hotel, about 5 blocks south of Central Park and 10 blocks up from Times Square. Room was basic with no British TV channels on the TV. Small compact bathroom with up and over mixer shower and the smallest of bath towels that barely covered your modesty. My biggest disappointment however was the cost of WIFI in the room. $5 an hour. Why must these establishments charge for such a service, it's just pure greed and spoilt my stay. New York has become an expensive place to stay, especially for us English where the exchange rate is getting ridiculous. The view consisted of a brick wall and side window of an adjoining room, but considering it's so central was quiet. Staff weren't rude but nor exactly friendly or welcoming.

reviews.title: great location
reviews.content: very nice room with two beds - a hard find in NYC. convenient to grand central, times square, columbus circle. lots of restaurants all around. because it's a busy area of the city, you can hear street noise. did not bother me, but could be a problem for a light sleeper. also, you may have to pay for internet. the desk clerk comped me wifi service, but I don't think it was part of my package. i did appreciate the gesture and made me feel very welcome when i arrived at 10pm on a friday night. i would def stay here again.

reviews.title: Location the only positive
reviews.content: For whatever reason NY was even more expensive than normal this week. This was cheaper than a lot of the other, but it was very ordinary. The room was very dated, check in was so slow. Checkout even slower. We had to wait for over half an hour to get our bags from storage.

reviews.title: Convenient location, reasonably priced suites available. (great for families with young children).
reviews.content: Family of 4 here, we just returned from a 3 night stay here. We were able to book a one bedroom suite for less than most regular hotel rooms (which was great). (Also, be sure to price out rooms on different site. Same room on different site was $150 more). So nice to have space to move around and kids had separate room to sleep in.(and that is hard to come by in NYC!). Location was vey good, walking distance to both Central Park and Times Square. There is a diner attached, although it was very expensive and food was just ok. (was $100 for 4 people). Several other diners close by and a Starbucks across the street. Subway stop right next to side door. Staff was fine, not rude but not overly friendly either. We were celebrating a birthday which I let them know on reservation but it was not acknowledged. Elevators were rather slow and neither thermostat worked great but really those were the only negatives. Overall we were happy with our stay. We would stay here again and would recommend.

reviews.title: Three star hotel at asupurb location
reviews.content: Prewar building. First, I want to say that my expectations were low, so I was pleasantly surprised and releaved. The check in time is 4pm, I arrived at 10am and by 10:15 I was already in my room. The staff was polite and efficient. The room was small (too small for two people) but clean and pleasant: typical interior for a boutique hotel, in beige and blue color with classical looking furniture. Since I read all the negative reviews, i was on the watch out for bugs, i saw none. The bathroom was fine and clean and had a big window (unusual for hotels). The room decor was pleasant. My room was on the 9th floor overlooking the courtyard (that is the windows of other rooms, no view). the room was next to the elevator. I did not hear the elevator at all. The room was very quiet, you can hear in the background faint city noise and a low hum like from some air-conditioner way below. The window opens sufficiently to let air in. The heater/air-conditioner does not make more noise than expected. If the hotel was kept in a better shape it would have been quite quaint. The bed sheets were clean and crisp, but there was a hole in one sheet, the bathroom towels were tin at spots, the bathroom fixtures were missing some caps, the night lamp had to be twisted in a specific angle in order to work, the curtains were very dusty and grayish rather than white color. The water pressure was strong but the shower head was no good and rather than a shower it was pouring the water. I needed a hotel for the day, at this specific location, and at this affordable price, the Wellington served the purpose. The whole hotel is non smoking.

reviews.title: Great location!
reviews.content: We were here in early March 2017 for the National Art Education Conference. This hotel was one block away from the conference and close to all the New York sites we wanted to visit. The MoMA was right down the street! Central Park, St. Patrick's Cathedral, Rockefeller Plaza, and much more just blocks away. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was large for four people. Included a refrigerator and a sofa. This hotel was perfect for us and I would recommend to anyone wanting to visit New York.

reviews.title: Good base for a New York stay
reviews.content: We've just returned from a 4 night stay here, celebrating our 40th birthdays and feel it's a great location. They say it's the "city that never sleeps" and that is very true ? Wherever you stay in the city, you can't escape the traffic noise, so be prepared to put up with it, and a bit of advice, the higher the floor you stay on, the further from noise you are This hotel is very clean, staff are very efficient and it's got a great location. Wifi is not free though and New York is very expensive. Buy the New York Pass. It saves you a lot of cash if you do the main sites A 3 minute walk uptown gets you to Central Park and 6 minutes walking downtown, sees you on Times Square ! Being on 7th Avenue means you're only one parallel street away from Broadway and obviously just 2 away from 5th Avenue ! To gage distance, each block of 20 streets equal 1 mile exactly ! Great city, very good hotel and wouldn't hesitate in going back there with our teenage daughters next time !

reviews.title: Seeing NYC
reviews.content: I would just like to thank the Wellington hotel for a fabulous stay while in NYC. Our room was a good size in a king room, it was cleaned on a daily basis and the shower was always hot. It was the perfect location to see and shop in NYC. A two minute walk to time square and Central Park plus a bonus of a subway stop right outside the door! This hotel is nothing fancy but in NYC you don't spend anytime except some hours of sleep in your room there is too much to see and do, so this hotel is the perfect location if that's what you are going to New York for.

reviews.title: Perfect place
reviews.content: Me and my parents travelled to New York City back in February for a 5 night break. We stayed in the Wellington Hotel and I can't fault the place! As soon as we arrived, we had a warm welcome where we were quickly checked in and given our room keys. Prior to our booking we requested a city view on a high floor of the hotel which they provided for us, giving us a room on the 26th floor with absolutely stunning views of Central Park. Me and my parents shared a room and it was brilliant as there was a wall which separated the two beds to give some privacy with an en suite next to both bedrooms. The rooms were spacious with two windows and brilliant views! From lying in my bed, all I had to do was look straight ahead where I could see the skyline, I could lie in the bed all day! Rooms were spotless with the cleaner coming in everyday while we were out so we always come back to a tidy room. The location of the hotel was brilliant as my mum struggles with walking too far due to us being less than a 5 minute walk from Times Square. Central Park was also less than a five minute walk away and popular attractions such as the Rockefeller Centre and Empire State Building being a few blocks away. There are subway stops right outside the hotel entrance with two ways to get to the hotel, the front entrance has heaters to keep guests warm if they are standing outside. There are also plenty of restaurants and shops right outside the hotel so you don't need to go far. There are plenty of leaflets and brochures downstairs in the lobby for guests to find out about local restaurants, attractions and sightseeing tours so you can make the most of your stay. There are also plenty of comfy seats if you fancy a rest in the lobby although there is a gift shop and cafe joined to the hotel with entrances in the hotel lobby for people who are staying at the Wellington. We never visited the shop but we went to the cafe a couple of times for a hot chocolate or milkshake. We didn't purchase any food but from the looks of others, they offered good portions and excellent quality. All members of staff were talkative and very friendly, giving you a warm welcome and forming a good rapport. Overall, the Wellington Hotel was brilliant for us and we had no problems. We were given everything we asked for and would stay at the Wellington again in a heartbeat if we came back to New York City. I would definitely recommend this hotel as it is absolutely famous with brilliant prices.

reviews.title: Great location
reviews.content: Stayed 4 nights, brilliant location! Stayed on the 20th floor in a king room, with an extremely comfy bed. Staff were always helpful. There was no free wifi and there was a constant buzzing noise with any light on. But if the price was right, we would stay again.

reviews.title: Just perfect
reviews.content: This hotel is perfect for a trip to NYC . Amazing location 3 minutes to Central Park 10 to Times Square! Family room huge, master bedroom and separate room for 15 year old son. Reception so helpful and concierge great. Book it can't recommend enough. A massive thanks from us, we will be back !

reviews.title: Visit
reviews.content: We stayed at the Wellington hotel last week and left yesterday. On arrival we checked In and was shown to our room. We were very disappointed as it was extremely small ( kingsize) there was only a shower in a very tiny bathroom. My husband went and spoke to the manager who was extremely helpful and who couldn't do enough to help. Problem solved easily and quickly. The hotel is in a fantastic location. 5 minute walk to times square and 10 mins in the other direction to central park. There is a Greek restaurant downstairs which serve some amazing food. I would definitely stay here again!

reviews.title: NYC trip, Wellington Hotel :-)
reviews.content: our 1st time in New York, and we stayed at the Wellington from 31/03/17 - 5/04/17. the hotel is old or art decor whatever way you want to look at it, but i think it adds to its character. the location is superb, 5 mins to central park, 10 mins to Times square. The staff are very friendly and helpful in what is a very busy hotel. we had a suite on the 10th floor ,on the east wing, which was very spacious in that my wife and i had our own bedroom and my daughter had her own bed in the living room, which was a fold out (fair size to!). so we all had privacy. i must admit i had read and heard differing views on this hotel and was apprehensive when arriving, but my fears were unfounded. i would recommend this hotel and would/will use agan upon my return to NYC.

reviews.title: Great Location
reviews.content: This hotel is in the perfect location if you want to be near Times Square. The hotel staff are excellent, the room was very good, clean. The room we booked was a twin bedded but when we arrived we had been upgraded to a suite which was good considering we had a 13 year old daughter so it was good that we all had our privacy. We had a kitchenette so we thought we could make drinks and have things to eat but when we looked there was nothing in it except a microwave. No kettle, no cutlery or crockery. Even if we used the microwave we couldn't have eaten the food except with our fingers. We asked at reception for a kettle which we got with polystyrene cups but no spoons. Apparently it is hotel policy not to supply anything else. We actually take our own kettle etc with us on holiday but on this occasion we forgot it. So I suggest if you are staying at this hotel and have a suite that you bring your own cutlery and crockery. Other than that it is excellent.

reviews.title: Delightful
reviews.content: This hotel is ideally located in Times Square and has a brilliant diner attached to it where they serve the most delicious breakfasts, try the lumberjack breakfast and you wont need lunch!. The hotel bedroom I stayed in was oldie world but very warm and comfortable. I would definitely stay there again.

reviews.title: The Wellington Hotel is classified as a 3.5 star hotel with an excellent location, services, and accommodations!
reviews.content: Excellent location to all the sights & sounds; from Times Square to Central Park, Theaters & Restaurants. Well within walking distances to everything. If further, then the subway, taxis, and hop-on/hop-off buses are immediately available for a reasonable fee. The hotel is rated 3.5 with many of the accommodations of a larger rated hotel. The standard one-bedroom was reasonably priced, adequate in size, with a small one-person clean bathroom. The staff were helpful and knowledgeable. The valet parking was $35 per 24 hour period was very reasonable in comparison to comparable hotels. You are out and about most of the day visiting the sights and sounds of the area. It was a nice stay at reasonable cost. We plan on returning back to NYC in the future and plan on staying at the Wellington once again. No, I am not paid to provide this information, simply a survey by the Trip Advisor.

reviews.title: The Best Choice
reviews.content: This hotel is magnificent. The room size is amazing. We stayed in a Junior Suite. We have stayed in other NYC hotels and even though it's just the two of us, we are usually climbing over each other and have no room to put things. Not the case at The Michelangelo! So much room, so comfortable! Our room was recessed from the front of the hotel, so our view was of a little courtyard. You could see the street from a small distance. We were on the fifth floor. Not sure if all the Jr Suites are like that. But it made it extremely quiet. We were off the elevator, and I got a little worried, but we never heard it. Our room was immaculate. Housekeeping came while we were out and the room always looked nice. The staff was friendly and professional. The location is convenient. We highly recommend The Michelangelo.

reviews.title: Delightful surprise
reviews.content: what a delightful surprise to find The Michaelangelo, we were treated royally by all, the location was excellent, near the theater district but not in the hellhole that is now Times Square. Short walk to Radio City and 5th Avenue and close to Central Park and Lincoln center. Also not many steps to the subway

reviews.title: Don't waste your money! Rude Staff, out dated decor
reviews.content: We recently traveled to NY for a wedding and chose this hotel because of its reviews. Upon arrival we were abruptly "greeted" by the doorman who was curt and made us feel as though we were putting him out by having our luggage stowed until our room was ready. We found the same attitude from the wait staff when trying to order drinks we were often ignored while they chit chatted with the regulars who frequent the hotel. For the price we expected the professionalism to be much higher. We overheard one of the staff members tell other guests that the hotel was under new management and so they were in the process of a transition and taking full advantage of it.

reviews.title: The Michelangelo New York first time stay
reviews.content: We went on our family vacation to New York and stayed at the Michelangelo hotel. It is very close to Times Square and there is a small shop near by to get items you need like water (at a reasonable price) and snacks. When you enter the Michelangelo, you get the feeling that it is an older hotel. The lobby should be updated with newer furniture. The check in person was very nice and helpful. The room was spacious (which is what we wanted for this vacation); however, there were stains on the carpet (so that should be addressed). We also had a stain on our bed cover but called immediately and it was replaced -- but I was surprised that when they brought it up to us that they didn't fix the bed -- they just handed it to us and took the stained one. They only gave us 3 towels and 1 roll of toilet paper which wasn't enough. You have to request more if you want them. There was construction outside of the hotel and we were woken up at midnight two nights in a row by a jackhammer! Not pleasant! The door man never opened the door for us (except when we first arrived). Overall, the room was nice though and we enjoyed the room. The Michelangelo is close to everything but not right in the middle of Times Square. It was a good location because of this. Use the subway for about $2.50 per person, it is worth it to travel this way instead of Uber or taxi in the city. Uber from Michangelo to the Freedom Tower was about $35 vs. subway at $7.50 for three of us.

reviews.title: Excellent stay at the Michelangelo
reviews.content: The staff were courteous and helpful. The hotel was very clean, and the room was pristine. Frankly, the location cannot be beat for business at Rockefeller Center or tourism at Times Square. My only minor dissatisfaction was the bathroom was a little cramped. For those not on a budget, this is a great place to stay.

reviews.title: Great Hotel near Times Square
reviews.content: The Michelangelo is a lovely hotel just a few blocks from Times Square. The lobby was beautiful, and very "old school European" in feel. The desk staff and bellmen were all very professional and friendly. Our room was also quite large, comfortable and well maintained. This will definitely be the first hotel I will check for the next time I come to the City. There was also a small bar in the lobby that was good for a night cap; however, because it is not a party spot, there was only one bartender when we were there, which sometimes caused service to be a little slower than I would prefer.

reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.content: From the moment we checked in, everything was beyond perfect. I mentioned my granddaughter's birthday when I made the reservation, and the room was decorated accordingly. This is not our first time staying there and won't be the last Thanks for the great rating and review, Sharon! We're thrilled that you have enjoyed your experiences while staying with us! We're pleased to hear that you were satisfied with the room decor for your granddaughter's birthday. We aim to please! We look forward to your next visit and sharing another amazing experience with you! Have a lovely day!

reviews.title: Fantastic hotel
reviews.content: We have stayed in lots of New York hotels, but this one surpassed the others. It was the perfect spot to celebrate our grandmother's 80th birthday, and the staff went out of their way to help her feel special. Thanks for the wonderful rating and review, Gib! We're so pleased to hear that you enjoyed staying with us! We're delighted that our team was able to take such great care of you and your grandmother on her birthday. That's what we like to see! We look forward to your next visit and sharing another excellent experience with you again! Have a great day!

reviews.title: Good location and old style luxury, lacks many modern facilities
reviews.content: Expensive mandatory residence charge (35 USD) gets you free internet and unlimited phone calls (who makes phones calls any more?) plus 10 USD credit per day at the bad. Not a good deal. No coffee or tea facilities in the room, should be there for a hotel at this price level. Staff at door not so friendly when handling luggage. No sauna or steam room in the gym. Excellent location in mid-town Manhattan. Luxury appointments and big room (junior suite) with large bathroom and tub. Very comfortable bed. Fast internet. Nice gym. The hotel has an air of old class luxury rather than modern comfort and facilities. We appreciate your review and feedback, Marco. We're happy to see you had a pleasant experience with us and enjoyed our prime location and comfortable bedding. However, it is unfortunate that your stay with us was anything less than perfect. We strive to offer top-notch service and comfort for our guests. We'll be addressing your concerns with the appropriate members of our team moving forward. We look forward to your next visit and providing an even better experience with you. Have a great day.

reviews.title: An Elegant Gem of a New York Hotel
reviews.content: Our hotel of choice over the years has been The Michelangelo. Perfectly located for theatre hopping, this lovely "home away from home" offers wonderful accommodations, attentive staff, and a quiet ambiance as a way to escape the frenzy of the city. Dear Guest, Thank you for the wonderful rating and review! We are thrilled that you have enjoyed your experiences while staying with us! It is a pleasure to hear that you have been able to enjoy and appreciate our accommodations and services. We aim to please! We look forward to your next visit and providing you with another amazing experience! Have a lovely day!

reviews.title: Come Home to The Michelangelo!
reviews.content: After discovering this gem several years ago, I will not stay anywhere else in NYC! The hotel is beautiful - impeccably maintained and cared for. The rooms are huge and plush with very comfortable beds and an abundance of pillows! Very luxurious! But most of all, I feel like I'm coming home each and every time I return here. The faces of the staff stay the same - some have worked here for decades. They love their jobs and it shows! Henry, the doorman goes above and beyond to make sure you feel pampered and special ( example : He brought our shopping bags up to the room so we could immediately relax in the bar. He literally would do almost anything within reason to make you feel like you are the only guest at the hotel)! He is just amazing. But not just Henry - Each and every staff member wants the guests to feel Grand - and I have never been disappointed! Oh, and location, location, LOCATION! So close to Broadway/Times Square, shopping, museums, etc. Save on taxis! Thank you for the fantastic rating and review, Laura! We're thrilled that you have had such great experiences while staying with us! It is wonderful that you were able to enjoy our prime location as well as our luxurious rooms! We are also delighted to hear that our team has been able to accommodate your needs and assist you in any way possible. Henry is a valuable member of our team, so it is no surprise that he has taken such great care of you! That's what we like to see! We look forward to your next visit and providing you with another excellent experience! Have a wonderful day!

reviews.title: Classy
reviews.content: This is an old school joint that is super shiny classy and a haven for the nouveau riche and they spouses. I like that it is away from the tourist nightmare of Times Square. Rooms is clean and the lobby is spacious. Thanks for the great review, Alzor! We're thrilled that you enjoyed your experience while staying with us! It is wonderful that you were able to enjoy our grand interior and your room accommodations! We look forward to your next visit! Have a lovely day!

reviews.title: Note to Owner: Your Reservation staff is hurting you.
reviews.content: I booked a four night stay at the hotel from Friday through Tuesday. My plans changed and I wouldn't make it Friday evening and needed to just stay on Saturday evening. I called up and discussed the situation with a staff member in reservations. I offered to pay for the first night I wouldn't be there and then the second night when I would be there. Somehow, the only response was "if you aren't in the hotel by midnight then we will cancel the reservation and charge you for just one day." As I was concerned that the hotel would be fully booked I persisted to suggest that it made sense to simply modify the agreement as they had already agreed that their policy was to not charge me for the last two nights I was cancelling. I also pointed out that the concept that I paid for the first night and would be there for the second night would logically hold my reservation on the second night. The gentleman on the phone was unable to get a supervisor on the phone after putting me on hold for a while. When he came back he said the supervisor was unavailable and would give me the same answer. The solution - while waiting for the supervisor. I booked the same room on line for $40 bucks less. Then i told the operator to go ahead and cancel the original reservation. I rightfully paid for the unoccupied first night and then reduced my cost to the hotel by 40 bucks on night two. I run a 5000 employee business and would be appalled if this were my operation. By refusing to think the issue through the hotel lost money. Hopefully, I'll enjoy the hotel tomorrow. I have several times in the past. We appreciate your review and feedback, Scott. While we are pleased to hear that you have enjoyed your past experiences while staying with us, we are deeply disappointed that you faced such challenges with our services. Your happiness and satisfaction are important to us so we'll be addressing your concerns with the appropriate members of our team moving forward. We do look forward to your next visit and providing you with an even better experience. Thank you.

reviews.title: Little Disappointed
reviews.content: The hotel was very clean. The staff was very helpful. However they need to have new mattresses and pillows! Very disappointed in the sleep. Location was good as well. The decor in the lobby needs to be updated. Thanks for the rating and review, Rich! We're pleased that you were able to enjoy your overall stay with us! However, it is unfortunate to hear about your discomfort with our beds. We'll be addressing your concerns with the appropriate members of our staff moving forward. We look forward to your next visit and providing you with an even better experience. Have a great day!

reviews.title: Great stay
reviews.content: We stayed at the Michelangelo for a week. It was a perfect location right in the middle of everything. The room was lovely and the service was superb. The staff was friendly and attentive, especially Henry who greeted us every morning on our way out for a morning run. Thanks for the perfect review, MaryAnn! We're delighted to hear that you had an amazing stay with us! It's wonderful that you loved our central location as well as your room. We're also very pleased that our team provided you with friendly and attentive service. We can't wait to see you again soon for another incredible experience! Thanks for sharing and have a terrific day!

reviews.title: Anniversary
reviews.content: Beautiful hotel. Great location. Huge room. Beautiful bath. Friendly staff. Nice restaurant and bar. Great location. Highly recommended. Have stayed in area before but this is the nicest hotel we have stayed. Thanks for the perfect review, Timothy! We're delighted to hear that you had an excellent stay with us! It's wonderful that you loved the size of your room and we hope everything was comfortable for you. We're also very pleased that our team provided you with friendly service. We can't wait to see you again soon for another fantastic experience! Thanks for sharing and have an amazing day!

reviews.title: WAIT! A room this size in New York City?
reviews.content: Our corner room had two king beds and still plenty of room for three of us. We had a good view of 7th Ave and never were bothered by any noise. The curtains are excellent for blocking light. The room was spotless and the decorations were appropriate. The bath was adequate and the separate dressing area helped in the mornings. We are also very impressed with the speedy elevators; during our last visit to the City we stayed in a hotel just down the street and spent a fair amount of our time waiting for the two slow elevators. Not at Michelangelo! We never ate there, though I think breakfast could be ordered. Our check-in was flawless, as was checking out (we checked our bags on the last day so we could continue sightseeing until time to head to the airport). Housekeeping was very discreet and very thorough. This place knows their business! Dear Guest, Thank you for the wonderful review! We're thrilled that you had such a positive experience while staying with us! It is fantastic that you were able to enjoy our spacious and comfortable rooms along with the beautiful view of 7th Avenue! We are also delighted to hear that our team was able to take such great care of you. That's what we like to see! We look forward to your next visit and sharing another amazing experience with you in the future! Have a lovely day!

reviews.title: What a great hotel
reviews.content: This was my first time staying at the Michelangelo and I couldn't have been more pleased. The room was beyond my expectation and the staff was ultra-professional. I was provided an unexpected room upgrade to a suite and the accommodations were really impressive. Thanks for the wonderful review, John! We're thrilled that you enjoyed your time while staying with us! We're delighted to hear that our team was able to accommodate your needs and assist you in any way possible. We aim to please! We look forward to your next visit and sharing another amazing experience with you! Have a lovely day!

reviews.title: Girls Trip to NYC
reviews.content: The accommodations were fabulous and the hotel is beautiful.. The staff was extremely courteous and friendly. The beds and pillows are very comfortable. The internet service is terrible and you have to pay for it daily. As much as the hotel is per night the internet service should be complimentary. I was disappointed there were not coffee pots in the room. Thanks for the great review, Renee! We're thrilled that you enjoyed your experience while staying with us! We're delighted that our team was able to take such great care of you. We aim to please and your appreciation lets us know we're doing our job! However, it is unfortunate that our services did not meet your expectations. We look forward to your next visit and sharing an even better experience with you! Have a great day!

reviews.title: Recommended Midtown Hotel
reviews.content: Great location for a multi day stay in Manhattan; room was very nice and spacious, clean. Sure, its not brand new but working and impeccable. Subway around the corner or a block away. Staff is friendly, helpful and courteous but lacks the charm. Thanks for the 4-star rating and review, Ignaz! We're thrilled you had such a pleasant time with us! We strive to offer top-notch service and convenience for our guests. It's fantastic you enjoyed and appreciated our prime location and comfortable accommodations. That's what we like to see! We look forward to sharing an even better experience with you next time. Have a lovely day!

reviews.title: Brilliant Location for a vacation
reviews.content: Visited beginning of June for a 4 night stay. Perfect location, very close to Times Square, Rockafella Centre, Broadway. I broke my leg 5 days before our trip so was wheelchair bound but found it very easier to get around. We walked to Central Park & Empire State. Only time we used taxi was to 9/11 Memorial. Staff at hotel were very good. Room very spacious and spotlessly clean with a great view of Times Square. Slippers & robes a nice touch. My only disappointment was no tea/coffee facilities in room. We had everything else in the mini bar which was well stocked but I love to wake up to a cuppa! NYC is a wonderful place, very busy anytime of day and can see why it's called the City that never sleeps. Got see to see most landmarks but we have vowed to return. If you like a bit of class & luxury then this is the hotel for you. Thanks for the 4/5 rating, Vicky! We're thrilled you had such a pleasant experience with us! It's excellent you took advantage of our prime location and that you enjoyed our comfortable and spacious accommodations. That's what we like to see! It's lovely our team made you feel so welcome. We strive for excellence so we look forward to sharing an even better experience with you soon! Have a lovely day!

reviews.title: Great place to stay
reviews.content: The rooms are wonderful and large with a sitting area and great large bathrooms. The internet could be improved but the general rooms are brilliant. Location is suburb too. Staff are friendly and discreet and the rooms are cleaned to a high standard daily. Highly recomended Thanks for the wonderful review, Rob! It's fantastic you had such a lovely experience with us. We're thrilled you enjoyed our prime location and comfortable rooms. That's what we like to see! We're looking forward to sharing another amazing experience with you soon! Have a beautiful day!

reviews.title: Favourite location, favourite Hotel in New York City !!!!!
reviews.content: We were on a business trip and extended our stay by 3 days just to get the feel of this hotel that I have been reviewing on Trip Advisor. It was a unique and rare experienc, feel of the place is very warm- from the support staff to the General Manager- Vikram Sardana, truly outstanding !!! Thank you for the outstanding review, Ekta! We're delighted your experience with us was so wonderful! We endeavor to make all of our guests feel welcome and relaxed during their time with us. It's fantastic our team could accommodate your needs and assist you in any way possible. We look forward to sharing another amazing experience with you! Have a lovely day!

reviews.title: Our favorite hotel in NYC
reviews.content: We recently stayed at Michelangelo hotel for 3 nights. This is our favorite hotel in NYC. It is very conveniently located and is a quiet oasis just off the busy Times Square. The rooms are very comfortable and roomy, quite rare in the city. If you drive in, use the valet parking at the hotel, it allows you to drive right up to the front door and is no more expensive than the self parking. The staff knew it was our 20th anniversary and sent up a complimentary bottle of champagne. The doormen are very knowledgeable of the area and are a great help when planning your trips around the city. I would highly recommend the Michaelangelo. Thanks for the wonderful review, Jack! It's fantastic you had such a lovely experience with us and that we were able to help you celebrate such a special occasion. We're thrilled you enjoyed our prime location and comfortable accommodations. That's what we like to see! We aim to please and your praise lets us know we're doing our job! We're looking forward to sharing another amazing experience with you soon! Have a beautiful day!

reviews.title: Perfection As Always
reviews.content: My wife an I, along with family at times, have thoroughly enjoyed our many visits to the Michelangelo. Employee service is a highlight. Every employee we we encounter is pleasant, helpful and cordial. We feel like a part of the Michelangelo family. For us it's easy in and easy out. No surprises. We were part of a 70 year old family business ourselves so we know how how critical customer service is to maintain customers. The Michelangelo certainly has that same philosophy. Great location for shows, top flight restaurants and sights. When it's NYC time, we know the Michelangelo will make our trip that much more enjoyable. Thank you for the outstanding review, Dale!
