reviews.title: Recommended
reviews.content: Location: in the heart of the theatre district. Times Square is literally around the corner but noise was surprisingly minimal in our room on the 5th floor (noise was mainly sirens from ambulances/police cars and not late night revellers). Within easy reach of Central Park, Rockefeller Centre, Radio City, Bryant Park, NY Public Library, St. Patrick‚Äôs church and Fifth Avenue shopping (about 10 ‚Äì 15 minutes walk from the hotel). Caf√© Duke is just a few doors down and open 24 hours. Great to grab a breakfast/lunch or even dinner (they have cooking stations for fresh pizza, Korean or pasta). Starbucks is over the road on 52nd and a better option than the hotel coffee in my opinion. Rooms: my family of 4 stayed in a room on the 5th floor overlooking the Winter Garden Theatre where ‚ÄòSchool of Rock‚Äô was performing. I emailed ahead to ensure we were provided with 2 x twin beds rather than a King and roll-away. The response from Michelangelo was prompt and friendly. We arrived at 1.30pm and our room was not ready; however, we knew check-in was 3pm so this didn‚Äôt bother us. We simply stored our luggage with the concierge and headed out to explore. When we returned at 4pm, we were not disappointed. Whilst not sleek and ultra modern, the room was very spacious and very much encapsulated the feel of Rome, which we loved. The bathroom was large with his and hers basins, a toilet, bidet and a huge bathtub with powerful and hot overhead shower. There was a separate dressing area with large storage cupboard between the bathroom and bedroom. We were even provided with a pastry/fruit platter and 2 large bottles of water on arrival which we thought was a nice touch. There were ample toiletries if you needed them, bathrobes, slippers and they had even thought of umbrellas for New York‚Äôs unpredictable weather. The beds were the most comfortable I have slept in. Having read an earlier review about the pillows being too soft, I could not disagree more. The mattresses were very deep and comfortable and yes, whilst you sink into the pillows, there are 2 of them per person and they are so big you could have folded them over if you‚Äôd wanted to. Amenities: we didn‚Äôt have much need to contact the hotel staff but when we did they were polite and very professional. Checkout is 12pm. On our last day, the doorman stored our luggage to allow us time to take in the final sights of NYC and booked a taxi to take us to the airport on our return. My only criticism of this hotel is the ‚Äòcharge‚Äô added to your bill at the end of the stay. I was aware of this when we booked through Expedia but it does leave me wondering exactly what I am getting for my money - $200 for 5 nights stay? This fee is applied for use of the hotel‚Äôs internet, use of a gym (I think) and a $10 credit that can be used daily against sundries. It would be nice if this was optional as we never used the gym, had 2 filter coffees one day (costing $10.89 + tip) which I‚Äôm afraid were not good, and yes, we used the internet but we never used up the remainder of our daily credits and they could not be carried forward to another day. Either incorporate this into your room rates (if it is not optional) or give your customers a choice to select internet, gym etc. Please note: the hotel no longer offer free buffet breakfast, tea/coffee or complimentary transport to Wall Street as is sometimes advertised on Google. We loved this hotel, the staff and its location. Well done Michelangelo! Dear Guest, Thank you for the outstanding review! We're delighted your experience with us was so wonderful! We endeavor to make all of our guests feel welcome and relaxed during their time with us. It's fantastic our team could accommodate your needs and that you appreciated our comfortable accommodations. We aim to please and your praise lets us know we're doing our job! We're thrilled you enjoyed our prime location and proximity to so many of the city's best attractions. That's what we like to see! We look forward to hosting you again soon and to sharing another amazing experience with you! Have a lovely day!

The restaurant on the first floor was more of a lounge. While the place itself is cosy, I would have liked to see a wider breakfast selection. This being a boutique hotel, some of the requests that would normally be answered positively in other larger hotels like hyatt were turned down here. For instance, when I asked for a tea kettle, they had none available to place in the room. However, I was able to get hot water to go at the restaurant downstairs. The service was very friendly. All in all, a good hotel, but I'd probably not stay there again. Thank you for the review, Marina. We apologize that your visit with us did not exceed expectations and was disappointing. reviews.title: First Time at the Michelangelo
reviews.content: So I travel to NYC a few times a year and at least once with a good friend(s) for a girls long weekend. I try to visit different hotels (although I've gone to the midtown Andaz more than once because of good experiences- but I digress because this review is about the Michelangelo). I did some research and the Michelangelo was highly rated by both Trip Advisor and Cond√© Nast. So it helped with the decision. Upon arrival there were issues with my upgrade (prior guest caused the room to need extra work) but the manager met us in the lobby and explained and I wouldn't be charged for it. It was a disappointment because it was a high floor and would've helped with the noise but couldn't be helped by the hotel and I appreciate how it was communicated. That was Thursday afternoon- I don't recall his name. The room and hotel were nice. It was stately and opulent. It was also historic. As such there aren't the modern things that you'll get in the newer and more renovated hotels. But that also brings positives. It is big....we had a 2 bed studio - very spacious with a great bathroom and vanity area.....2 women- we had bags for days and it was great. The heavy curtains helped with street noise and lights. Great location- walking distance to many things - diners and theaters- and good and helpful staff rounded out the pros. There were a few cons....there are a few housekeeping items that could use better attention- literally...like dust and the carpets need replacing or deep cleaning. Room service is not 24/7- AM for Breakfast and PM until 11:30 for dinner, but once you know that and because of the city that's something to which one can easily adapt. Also the duvet was stained when we arrived but replaced (by one with a burn, but clean) and the extra security latch on the door did not work. But speaking of security, Michelangelo is "on point." We ordered Door Dash late a couple of nights post theatre and they were not getting upstairs without a security escort. I loved it! I stand by my 4 star rating. There were more pros than cons and I think it's a solid 4 star hotel. I would recommend staying knowing that it has good sized rooms (my one was great), great location and good staff. Thank you for the rating and review. We are happy to hear that your stay was enjoyable and appreciate your recommendations. We are happy you chose us upon a multitude of hotels in the city. We apologize for the housekeeping and maintenancing not meeting expectations. We appreciate that you enjoyed the room otherwise along with the bathroom. We hope to see you back here again in the future. Have a wonderful day.

reviews.title: Comfortable rooms, good location, but lacking its former hospitality
reviews.content: The location of this hotel speaks for itself; the lobby is attractive, the rooms clean, the bathrooms particularly comfortable with their generous bathtubs. Having been a regular visitor to this hotel for many years, though, I miss the old Michelangelo's attention to the needs of busy people in the city. The self-service continental breakfast, once included in the price of the room, was a great convenience that I miss. The "facilities fee" (renamed "residence fee" in more recent notices) now tacked onto each bill has taken its place! This appeared only in the small print of my original reservation, and I'm glad I read it before arriving at the hotel so that I could digest this unpleasant surprise in private. If not warned when making the reservation, be aware of this additional charge. (Wouldn't it make sense to include that fee in the room charge, since it is not optional?) Each room used to have a card listing services available from housekeeping, and upon arrival one was offered a choice of newspapers, to be left outside the door of the room. Now one needs to make special requests to receive the turn-down service or a newspaper. Be sure to ask for these if you want them, they are still available, even if not advertised! I hope these tips help visitors to this hotel make the most of its services, even as it shifts its attention away from the comfort of guests. Except for the front desk, the service at the hotel is still excellent. Those in charge should take an example from the housekeeping staff and doormen! Thank you for the review. We are happy to hear that your stay with us was comfortable and you are a returning guest. We apologize for the changes and take your suggestions into consideration. The rooms are comfortable with thick rugs, large bathrooms and are nicely maintained but will feel old school European to you. Grab your espresso on the way out in the lobby bar. reviews.title: Second Time and There Will Be A Third
reviews.content: First let me say that we reserved several months ago and obtained a great rate. Through iPrefer and Visa, we had a larger room with a full breakfast and the rate was less than a smaller room with no breakfast. When we arrived, the room was not ready and they said it would be about 10 to 15 minutes. No problem, not in a rush, so we walked about twenty five feet to a table in the lounge. The room was ready in about 15 minutes but we were having such a good time in the lounge, we just hung there for about an hour and a half. Thanks to Jimmy the Bartender, our trip started on a positive note. Room 710 which faced 7th Ave. These room are very spacious, clean, and just very comfortable. As for noise, well we slept with the window open. Window open or closed, you will hear an occasional siren and horn. This is New York City. Location. The Michelangelo is in the heart of the Tourist and Theater District. It's very nice to walk over to see a play but yet be able to catch the subway and go wherever you need to be. It's very crowded in this area but we are OK with it. Our breakfast was enjoyable, plenty of choices, no complaints. Overall review is that we like The Michelangelo. People like Henry, Jimmy the Bartender, Jimmy the Breakfast guy, and Carmen the Bartender, make this a very welcoming, comfortable and enjoyable stay. Thanks for the stunning review! We're delighted to hear that you had a fantastic stay with us! It's wonderful that you loved the size of your room and that everything was comfortable for you. reviews.title: Best Choice for Our New York Adventure!
reviews.content: After much research about which hotel to pick for our recent New York visit, we settled for The Michelangelo Hotel, and I could say that we couldn't have picked a better one! I was traveling with my husband and 2 kids aged 12 and 14, and we booked a room with 2 king-sized beds. The room was spacious, clean, & elegantly furnished. The hotel location is just perfect! The hotel is just a few blocks, easy walking distance to Time Square, but the entrance is just around the corner away from the hustle and bustle of it all. There is a caf√© just nearby (Caf√© Duke) where we bought cooked Chinese/Asian fusion food for lunch and dinner if we felt like eating in. There was also KFC, Pizza Hut, Nathan's & Tom Horton's at the back of the building, as well as other choices. We walked almost everywhere, and when we found it a little far, we could either take the nearby metro, or ask the doorman to hail a cab, or used uber. Surely, there were some things like having to pay for a beverage allowance of USD10 per room per day, but we just got free drinks from the bar to avail of our daily "allowance". There is no kettle and free coffee in the room but I go down to get coffee or tea at the bar and got to chat with the friendly bartenders who were always so courteous to all. The Michelangelo is a charming hotel. The location can't be beat, especially if you come to watch Broadway shows. We watched more than a few shows and the theaters were so close to our hotel! The staff were friendly and especially nice, and sincere in looking after our needs as well as kind to our children. We love the Michelangelo and we'll definitely come back! Thanks for the stunning review! We're delighted to hear that you had a fantastic stay with us! It's wonderful that you loved the size of your room and we hope everything was comfortable for you. Thanks for sharing and have an incredible day!

reviews.title: I've been here before and will return again
reviews.content: We love this hotel for the location, clean rooms, attention to detail, comfy beds and efficient, modern bathrooms. The Spyglass rooftop bar is a great place to unwind after a long day or start an evening on the town. We will keep returning here for our NYC weekends.

reviews.title: Luxurious Home away from Home
reviews.content: As always our stay at Archer was perfect. The service, the room, the beds, the food, the rooftop are all outstanding. Archer provides a true Home away from Home with a first class twist. Thank you Archer, we will be back!

reviews.title: Perfect!!
reviews.content: What a fantastic find! This hotel, and its staff, exceeded my expectations by a long way. From the moment we arrived we were treated like royalty by the fantastic, friendly, professional staff. The lobby is modern and super clean. The rooms aren't massive but are big enough without feeling squashed in. Very cleverly designed and spotlessly clean. Great housekeeping with turn down service and a different little treat left every evening. The hotel is ideally located for everything. A few blocks from the Empire State and Grand Central Station. Easy walk to Broadway and Times Square. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. The staff made our experience so special and really went the extra mile. Special mention to Troy for his great breakfast recommendations (Moonstruck on 38th and Madison) and for bringing us towels when we returned to the hotel in a torrential downpour. Book it, enjoy it, you will not regret it!!!

reviews.title: Great place to stay
reviews.content: Wonderful hotel with very clean and lovely rooms. Central location in Midtown, ideal for Sightseeing Time Square and other highlights. Spectacular view at the Empire State Building. Very friendly staff.

reviews.title: Relaxing Visit
reviews.content: Our first time stay was rewarded with a friendly, courteous staff, easy and quick check-in. The room is on the small side but once you orient yourself and see the storage under the bed on both sides everything fit for our 6 day stay. The room and bathroom were immaculate. The Charlie Palmer restaurant's food was excellent and the service was impeccable. I recommend this hotel/restaurant for anyone looking for a rewarding boutique experience.

reviews.title: Here for Redken Summitt business classes 5 days
reviews.content: I loved this hotel from the minute we arrived!! And I'm so glad since we were here 5 days on business! The front desk staff went out of their way to make sure all our questions were answered. They greeted us with smiles and great attitudes all week long! (Very helpful on restaurant selections too) Great location so close to Fifth Ave The rooftop bar has beautiful city views. The hotel restaurant we tried the last evening was also very good food and great service. I also have to mention the housekeeping staff. We needed their help one evening and the were there in 2 min with smiles and above average attitudes. She even went as far as to say don't worry you are at home here!! And Yes we were!!! We all said we would definitely return and tell our friends to stay here also!! We are all in the customer service industry and give you hotel 6 stars you did everything right!!! Thanks for a wonderful week

reviews.title: Amazing Hotel - Best Staff!
reviews.content: This hotel is amazing. I arrived late and exhausted on a business trip and the staff was extremely quick, friendly, and every attentive. Jonathan in particular was amazing because I was on a time crunch and had to rush from work to get back to the hotel so I can make it to the the airport during rush hour to make my flight. He made sure everything was set and ready when I arrived to the hotel so I wouldn't be late. He even offered my water for my trip and made everything super easy, all with a friendly smile. Archer has beautiful view of the empire state building, many great amenities, and overall a wonderful and charming hotel experience. I was only here for one night, but I will definitely be returning.

reviews.title: Boutique hotel in Manhattan
reviews.content: We had an excellent experience at Archer. The staff is friendly, helpful, and efficient. The room is tastefully decorated, spotless, and comfortable. The room was quiet, bed was comfortable, temperature perfect. I would certainly recommend this hotel.

reviews.title: Return visit
reviews.content: This was a return trip with a friend as I had such a great experience with my daughter in April. We were given a room early and did not have to wait until check in which gave us the freedom to explore the city. A bottle of champagne was sent up to celebrate a birthday! We enjoyed the brunch with the donut tray with dipping sauces and. Bottomless mimosas. The theater and Penn Station are an easy walk which makes this very central. The rooms are quiet and beds very comfortable making this an oasis. I will return soon as the staff are excellent and make one feel special!

reviews.title: The best hotel ever
reviews.content: This hotel gives new meaning to luxury, wonderful amenities, and sheer pleasure. The staff, from the concierge and front desk staff to the cleaning staff, are polite, pleasant, and unfailingly helpful. I have never had such an outstanding hotel experience, and whenever I am in New York in the future, I will stay at the Archer.

reviews.title: Amazing view, lovely room, caring staff.
reviews.content: We had never stayed in Midtown before but were drawn to the idea of a room with an Empire State Building view. It did not disappoint! In addition, the room was immaculate, contemporary but not impersonal and had a nice degree of edge and energy in the decor. The staff took pains to introduce us to all of the amenities and ensure that we were content. Best of all, I had let them know we were celebrating our daughter's college graduation and they gave her a delicious personalized dessert and a note of congratulations. We were only there for a single night but I would be happy to return!

reviews.title: Impeccable service
reviews.content: The staff couldn't have been friendlier or more accommodating! It was easy to maneuver the city from this central location. The hotel was spotless, and the beds were very comfortable. Would stay again, without a doubt!

reviews.title: The Archer Hotel in NYC is World Class in Hospitality
reviews.content: I was in NYC for business for a few weeks late in 2016, and also recently got been engaged to my beautiful fianc√©. Mr. Jason Sturtevant, the Senior Sales Manager personally wrote me a note to ask if there were any accommodations that I would like to have during my stay. I replied with my situation of working in NYC for a few weeks and that my new fianc√© would be joining me for the weekends. Jason, to my pleasant surprise took this heart and made my experience with my fianc√© at the Archer a dream come true. It made my entire stay extremely happy and comfortable, better than most because of the personal touch and genuine heart that thy have in every detail of the Hotel. From the first greet at the door to the bell hop, and the bar staff, the housekeepers and turn down services- everyone was absolutely friendly, caring, and accommodating. We received countless little reminders of just how special of guests we were to them in so far as hors d‚Äôoeuvres, champagne and surprise deliveries to the room with hand written notes and signatures- it was simply amazing! While I was in NYC for work it felt more like the entire stay was a mini honeymoon as it was so nice to be surrounded and comforted by a world class team of experts in hospitality. I have recommended the Archer Hotel in NYC to all of my numerous coworkers based in the US for their travels to the city where our firm's global headquarters are located. I envy the next opportunity to stay at the Archer Hotel in NYC, as it is the best hotel in the city and after traveling to and staying at five star hotels in LA, Paris and Miami recently- I'd take the Archer Hotel in NYC over every other place in the world. Best hotel experience one could ever dream!

reviews.title: Mid town finest!!
reviews.content: This is the 2nd time we've stayed here while visiting NYC. First off most of the staff members remembered us for our prior stay which was last year Sept, that's a plus for me! Due to all patrons they serve on a daily basis. Our room was clean as we expected, the bed was neatly made. House keeping left treats.. yummy! If we needed a cab or help with our bags Johnathan, Byron, and Chris were there to assist. If we needed directions Michael and Jacob definitely would get you there. In terms of any other issues Evan and Reenie would be sure to accomdate you to make sure your stay is enjoyable, as it was! See you all next time

reviews.title: Great for family of 4
reviews.content: Great hotel - I'd definitely recommend. Very nice decor, concierge was great, room was small but sufficient for family of 4. We selected this hotel based on location and it was perfect - we walked everywhere!

reviews.title: Concierge Service
reviews.content: On several occasions I used the services of the concierge at the Archer Hotel, Anthony Bosco, to arrange theater tickets for me and my wife. Anthony was incredibly helpful and has always been able to secure great seats for us, even at some shows where good seating is hard to come by. He is extremely professional, and the follow up is fantastic! We look forward to using his services again soon.

reviews.title: Preferred the Andaz, but nice hotel
reviews.content: This hotel definitely has some great qualities. The lobby is beautiful and it offers a very nice rooftop bar. The furniture is of good quality and the bathrooms are styled nicely. The staff is all very nice and helpful. But, I will say that for the price the room was tiny. And I know that is typical of NYC, but the last time I stayed in NYC, I stayed at the Andaz on 5th Ave and I much preferred the location, hotel in general, and the room. The room and bathroom were much larger and very eye appealing. Plus the area directly around the hotel was much nicer. The Archer is near all of the action, but the actual street it was on wasn't my favorite environment. Thank you, txhjgirl. We are delighted to hear you enjoyed many aspects of your stay with Archer, especially our sincere service and Empire views. Guests like you are a joy to host and we hope you will join us for another New York adventure soon. In Hospitality, Michele - GM

reviews.title: Mrs. Claire Graham
reviews.content: This is the most amazing hotel that I would recommend to everyone looking for a hotel in New York. The service at the front desk, housekeeping and restaurant is impressive. Anyone who operates a hotel should observe the service that this hotel delivers. A warm welcome at the hotel but watchful eyes on incoming and outgoing guests - very important on these dangerous times. The housekeeping service came, replaced towels, made up truly comfortable beds without intruding. Having a donut is usually a great treat but one should not miss this delicious and fun splurge. (The leftover donuts are stored for every guest in case one cannot resist taking them home when they leave). There is also a comfortable seating patio at the entrance of the hotel. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. Thank you, Mrs. Claire Graham. We are delighted to hear you enjoyed many aspects of your stay with Archer, especially our sincere service and those decadent donuts from Charlie Palmer Steak. Guests like you are a joy to host and we hope you will join us for another New York adventure soon. In Hospitality, Michele - GM

reviews.title: LOVE!!!
reviews.content: I have stayed at several midtown hotels and the Archer is hands down my favorite! Jonathan, the bellman, greeted us with the biggest smile and was so helpful the entire stay. Nicki and Michael at the bar were so much fun that I didn't want to leave! The food was amazing, the entire staff was friendly, and the location was convient to everything! The rooms were tastefully decorated with THE most comfortable beds, and my view of the Empire State Building from the 18th floor was gorgeous! Can't wait until my next trip to NYC! Thank you, Lee L. We are delighted to hear you enjoyed many aspects of your stay with Archer, especially our Archer sleep experience, sincere service and Empire views. You are so kind to mention many of our hosts by name, we will be sure to pass along your comments. Guests like you are a joy to host and we hope you will join us for another New York adventure soon. In Hospitality, Michele - GM

My room was a little more worn than my first visit a couple years ago (ex, curtains had a rip in them) But it was clean and nicely decorated. I will come back. Thank you, zat04. reviews.title: Great Hotel

The amenities were great-- comfortable bed, clean room, and the bathroom was so nice I took photos for when I redo my bathroom at home! I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. The staff was very courteous and even emailed to see how my stay was going. Thank you, Katelyn H. reviews.title: A very pleasant surprise.
reviews.content: We had booked a room with The Renwick hotel. However, at the arrival we were informed that the hotel was full. The Renwick hotel arranged a new hotel for us, the hotel they had arranged was Archer Hotel. The Renwick also arranged transport for us to the Archer. Arriving at the Archer was a delight, the staff in the reception was very friendly, efficient and professional. The room itself was as the personnel in the reception stated very intimate, however there were many smart solutions to store your belongings. There was a feeling of good quality of the room. The view from the room was strait to the Empire State building. We used both the restaurant in the hotel and the roof top bar, both were with very professional and pleasant staff, we had a blast at this hotel. Thank you, FredStavanger_Norway. It is always a pleasant surprise to welcome friends from The Renwick and we are delighted to hear you enjoyed many aspects of your impromptu stay with Archer. reviews.title: Excellent Stay!

reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel!
reviews.content: This is a wonderful place to stay. Very central location to everything and the staff was as amazing as the hotel itself. The rooms are a little small but that's New York. The view from the Double Empire View room was incredible. We will definitely stay here again! Thank you, Lisa K. reviews.title: I had an NEVER BEFORE EXPERIENCE at Archer Hotel New York. EXCEPTIONAL SERVICE.
reviews.content: I arrived at Archer with my 86 years old mother. The objective of the trip was to provide to my mother most probably her last international trip, due to her age and overall conditions. She worked in international offices and has been travelling worldwide for over 50 years. Her dream was to go to New York once again. When we arrived early the first impression was just perfect. The front desk attendance lady sensitivity was huge, and once it was possible, provided an early check in. The same happened in the check out. During the stay the concierge was very supporting in several occasions, including the reception of a wheel chair. The room services helped in latter hours to freshen the room with a nice and clean environment. Others as the restaurant, suitcase storage and outside door reception were always respectful and polity. Definitely a hotel in New York to stay . Will recommend always to friends, apart from the personnel, it‚Äôs in an excellent location, with great view and in my opinion with the right size, making it an experience, not only a stay. Thank you, K8202GPrichardb. Our hosts were only too happy to assist you and your mother with this very special trip to New York, and we are delighted to hear you both enjoyed Archer's sincere service as well as our central location and Empire views. We are honored to be a small part of the special memories created during your visit, and if there is anything else we can assist with please let us know. In Hospitality, Michele - GM

reviews.title: Fantastic Midtown Hotel
reviews.content: Loved our stay at this wonderful boutique hotel. Extremely comfortable beds, lovely bathroom, incredible service and a great central location. Small thoughtful touches make it memorable. Will definitely return! Thank you, jr0sser. We are delighted to hear you enjoyed many aspects of your stay with Archer. Guests like you are a joy to host and we hope you will join us for another New York adventure soon. In Hospitality, Michele - GM

reviews.title: Cant fault this hotel!
reviews.content: Great location in midtown, allowing good access to all the sightseeing locations, spotlessly clean modern contemporary rooms with great views of the ESB and fantastic service by the staff. All of my family were more than happy to return here again, as we probably will do next year. Thank you, 543 nigelr. reviews.title: Great Spot
reviews.content: Archer hotel was a step above the run of the mill chain hotel experience. Lovely, up-to-date rooms, nice touches like turned down bed at night, amazingly comfortable beds. If felt like a luxury boutique hotel without being insanely expensive, at least for New York. Gracious and very accommodating staff. Easy walk from Penn Station, subway nearby, walkable to theater district. Would definitely stay here again. Thank you, Anne M. We are delighted to hear you enjoyed many aspects of your stay with Archer, especially our central location, delightful details, sincere service and Empire views. reviews.title: Very nice hotel
reviews.content: Been there 3 nights with friends. A very good service from all of the stuff. Nicely designed rooms, cleen and very convenient. Top roof pub with a very nice view. Little bottles of water are given for free, when ever you ask for. You can Also get free umbrellas when it's rain. Hotel location is Excellent. Close to metro and to all major city major attractions, by foot. I definitely will come back on my next one in NYC Thank you, ishaiw. We are delighted to hear you and your friend enjoyed many aspects of your stay with Archer, especially our central location and sincere service. reviews.title: The Archer NYC
reviews.content: Very well located hotel and great staff always making you feel welcome and at home. Great steak restaurant and one of the highlight of the stay. will recommend and certainly go back. Would love though to have (if possible) a wider variety of breakfast with a more 'health oriented' offer Thank you, jeanfrancoisd129. reviews.title: Real New York experience in a beautiful hotel with great service!
reviews.content: We spent three nights at Archer and loved our stay. Room was on the small side but well planned, you have all you need and more. Bed was extremely comfortable and bathroom was amazing. Location is great if you wish to be close to action; shopping, Times Square, Broadway etc. Thank you, piakristinam. We are delighted to hear you enjoyed many aspects of your stay with Archer, especially our central location, delightful details and sincere service. Guests like you are a joy to host and we hope you will join us for another New York adventure soon. In Hospitality, Michele - GM

reviews.title: Loved the Big Apple and Archer Hotel
reviews.content: The Archer Hotel was a great choice for our stay in NYC! This was the first time my 12 yr old son had visited the city. I've been to the city many times as I used to live in the area. The location is a very convenient walk from several subway lines/stations. It is midway between 5th and 6th Avenues so noise wasn't an issue in the room, very quiet. We also felt safe in this neighborhood, no matter the time of day. Every staff member we met was friendly, courteous, and willing to go the extra mile to make our stay perfect. The room was efficiently NYC. In other words, very European. In more words...not roomy. Which was perfect for us, we were very comfortable with only two people, three people would not have fit. If you need a big hotel room, then you will need to pay an exorbitant price at another hotel or change the expectations, this is NYC. The bathroom had plenty of room and the shower was amazing. Housekeeping kept the room very clean and they were very helpful. Nice bonus: the room coffee was delicious! (it needs to be a headache emergency before I will touch room coffee). The second surprise bonus was finding a delicious sweet treat in the evening. Not the usual chalky gross square of chocolate, but a different good quality treat every night. Another notation on how the Archer is willing to go above the norm to please customers. We utilized the onsite restaurant only once, for brunch on Sunday. It was delicious and prices were parallel to other places of similar quality. All said and done, we had an amazing stay at the Archer and will definitely plan a return trip. Thanks! Thank you, marthaer. We are delighted to hear you and your son enjoyed many aspects of your stay with Archer, especially our central location, delightful details, sincere service and Empire views. Guests like you are a joy to host and we hope you both will join us for another New York adventure soon. In Hospitality, Michele - GM

reviews.title: Great stay
reviews.content: Looking for a small but nice hotel check out this hotel it was good service, small room but enough to live with and very clean. It also has a great roof bar which you need to check out even if your not staying in the hotel.. you also get little sweets delivered every night which so cute as they are different every day Thank you, Michael B. We are delighted to hear you enjoyed many aspects of your stay with Archer, especially our delightful details, sincere service and Empire views. Guests like you are a joy to host and we hope you will join us for another New York adventure soon. In Hospitality, Michele - GM

reviews.title: Great hotel in mid town NYC
reviews.content: We stayed here for 6 nights. It's a great location in mid town. Close to everything with easy access to a number of subway stations. We received a very warm welcome from the staff on arrival. It was also our wedding anniversary so the staff looked after us as well. Very clean and modern hotel with a lot of nice little touches. The hotel also has a roof bar with great views over the Empire State Building so that is also worth checking out. Only downside is small rooms...however it is NYC so that is to be expected. Definitely recommend this hotel Thank you. We are delighted to hear you enjoyed many aspects of your anniversary stay with Archer. Guests like you are a joy to host and we hope you will join us for another New York adventure soon. In Hospitality, Michele - GM

reviews.title: Loved The Archer Hotel
reviews.content: Great location, great amenities, great service. An oasis in the city! The beds and pillows were the most comfortable compared to any other hotel stayed in. The bathroom was clean, updated and had a spacious shower! Loved the 42" TV, plenty of storage ,a safe and delicious treats left for you on arrival and at night. The Charlie Palmer Steak House restaurant in the hotel was always busy - a sign of a great restaurant. Thank you, maryK621UO. We are delighted to hear you enjoyed many aspects of your stay with Archer, especially our central location, delightful details, sincere service and Empire views. Guests like you are a joy to host and we hope you will join us for another New York adventure soon. In Hospitality, Michele - GM

reviews.title: Friendly staff, but tiny rooms
reviews.content: I'll start off by saying that the staff in this hotel are great - very friendly and helpful. I experienced good customer service before arriving at the hotel and during my stay. The hotel theme is also very modern and trendy and that was much appreciated. Lastly, the location is great - walkable distances to most touristic places. However, the room size is unreal - but in the bad way. I am a frequent traveler and never (not even during past trips to NYC) have I stayed in such a tiny room. There was barely any space to move around, much less to put any suitcases. This was really disappointing and why I gave this hotel a 3 star. At the same price point there are lots of other centrally-located hotels available that have more decently sized rooms. For the unbelievably small room size, I would NOT recommend this hotel. Thank you, XDINOX. We are delighted to hear you enjoyed many aspects of your stay with Archer. You make some excellent suggestions for improvement which we will take into serious consideration as it comes time for updates within the hotel. We hope you will join us for another New York adventure soon. In Hospitality, Michele - GM

reviews.title: Great hotel in a great location
reviews.content: I stayed here in May 17 at the back end of a work trip so wanted a nice hotel is a convenient location. My room was a standard King Room which was pretty small but was fine as I was traveling alone. The room was very clean with a comfortable bed. It had a Nespresso machine and the pods were replaced daily. The bathroom was high quality and was very well maintained and clean. The shower head was really good and the amenities were high quality. Nightly turn down service was appreciated and there were always some treats left there. Staff were courteous and willing to help with anything. The Spyglass rooftop bar is high end, reasonably priced and great views of the Empire State Building. The location is just one block from the subway station makes getting around town or to JFK easy if that is your thing. I like walking and the location of the hotel was great for the High Line, Flatiron, Times Sq, Central Park, 5th Ave etc (all of which I walked to which was nice). I highly recommend this hotel for single travellers or couples. Too small for kids. Thank you, Gareth T. We are delighted to hear you enjoyed many aspects of your stay with Archer, especially our central location, delightful details, sincere service and Empire views. Guests like you are a joy to host and we hope you will join us for another New York adventure soon. In Hospitality, Michele - GM

reviews.title: Great Hotel in Midtown
reviews.content: Great Boutique Hotel in midtown. Staff is friendly, rooms are adequately sized for NYC boutique hotel with nice amenities. Always super clean and you will have a relaxing quiet sleep here! The on site Charlie Palmer restaurant has wonderful service, ample portions, delicious meals (even for those of us who do not eat meat). The Skybar has an unprecedented view of the Empire State Building. Lived in NYC for many decades and as a New Yorker I always enjoy this hotel. Only drawback, for those of us who are frequent business travelers, is that you do not earn any points or rewards here - as you would at a larger chain. Also, it can be a bit pricey at times--there are less expensive local options for midtown stays--but the Archer is worth the extra $. Thank you, NYTrvlGal2014. We are delighted to hear you enjoyed many aspects of your stay with Archer, especially our central location, delightful details, sincere service and Empire views. Guests like you are a joy to host and we hope you will join us for another New York adventure soon. In Hospitality, Michele - GM

reviews.title: Tiny rooms, but service and location almost make up for it
reviews.content: I stayed in the Archer Hotel in May and needed to be near Bryant Park. It was one of the more reasonable higher end hotels that I looked into in terms of price. It's located on a side street and is a narrow small boutique hotel. The room was tiny! The king bed pretty much takes up the whole room. There's a desk, but it's filled with yummy treats they give you nightly and a tray of inexpensive snacks you can buy. The bathroom was conventional in size and very nice. I had no view since I got in past midnight, but I hear the upper floors can have a view. The hotel was pretty quiet and room service was good (ordered it twice for breakfast). The service at this hotel was outstanding. Whatever I wanted, they delivered. I asked for extra gourmet fortune cookies dipped in chocolate and sprinkles and they brought them up in a nice black bag that was labeled with a note on a silver tray. The room had very nice amenities, small touches here and there. I'm not sure I would stay here again if it were not just me though b/c I can't imagine being in that room with more than just me. I felt a bit claustrophobic truthfully, but it really is a nice hotel in all other ways. Thank you, Victoria C. We are delighted to hear you enjoyed many aspects of your stay with Archer, especially our central location, delightful details, sincere service and Empire views. Our rooms are intimate but guests often enjoy the smart design elements and thoughtful touches that make it feel like home. Guests like you are a joy to host and we hope you will join us for another New York adventure soon. In Hospitality, Michele - GM

reviews.title: Great hotel in Midtown
reviews.content: Stayed at Archer for a quick weekend trip to NYC and loved this little hotel. Staff was super nice, room was very clean (a little small but who stays in the room in NYC anyway).....we were there giving our Chinese girlfriend the tour of New York. Beds are comfortable, nice treats left for a nibble and noise factor is much lower given it's on more of a side street. Very convenient to major attractions. We loved it. And a pretty nice restaurant as well, Charlie Palmer. All around a great value and nice little hotel. Thank you, SueBurlingtonNC. reviews.title: CLEAN, CONVENIENT, COOKIES
reviews.content: Every time I travel to NY for business, I make it a point to try out a new boutiquey hotel. I really enjoyed my stay at the Archer, and think I'll be booking again (which is a HUGE win for me as a very picky traveler). It is conveniently located in mid-town, and in the heart of the city. Great restaurants nearby (check out korean restaurants). Granted, the room was one of the tiniest I've been in, but it was super CLEAN, had every amenity I expect - MALIN & GOETZ toiletries, Nespresso machine, robes, and cute slippers. Great restaurants/bars onsite. And a huge plus - walk across the street to Culture Espresso - DELICIOUS LATTES AND WARM CHOCOLATE COOKIES! My other favorite in NY is Crosby Street, but their rates have become ridiculously out of touch. Archer's rates are def reasonable for what you get. I left my stay feeling like everything was absolutely lovely. Only thing keeping it from a 5 star would be a larger sized room. But definitely a gem and worthy of my repeat business! Thank you, Eunice S.We are delighted to hear you enjoyed many aspects of your stay with Archer, especially our central location, delightful details, sincere service and Empire views. Guests like you are a joy to host and we hope you will join us for another New York adventure soon. In Hospitality, Michele - GM

reviews.title: Solid choice in NYC!
reviews.content: Second visit to NYC but decided on a different hotel this time. Archer seemed a good option given the good reviews. Great location, close to Times Square, Broadway and Fifth Ave. Subway and Penn Station close by. We weren't able to check in on time so were offered free drinks - a nice gesture. Lobby is quite small, no room to hang out really but it serves its purpose. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Rooms are quite small, but I expected this when booking. Small armoire for hanging clothes, space under the bed for storing suitcases. If you have huge cases storage may be a problem. Bathroom and shower were great, comfy beds. Nespresso machine in room and nightly turn down service with a treat. Rooftop bar has lovely views of Empire State Building. Nice seating area but stiff drink prices. The bar was often booked for private events when we were there so guests were either segregated to certain parts of the bar or kicked out all together. Would have sucked if you didn't get to experience it. It's a nice hotel and I would recommend it. It's not super luxurious but a good option in central NYC. Thank you, jolliette. We are delighted to hear you enjoyed many aspects of your stay with Archer, especially our central location, delightful details, sincere service and Empire views. Guests like you are a joy to host and we hope you will join us for another New York adventure soon. In Hospitality, Michele - GM

reviews.title: Archer Excels
reviews.content: Archer isn't a typical 5 star htoel but I'm giving it the highest rating anyway for truly understanding what makes a difference to travellers. For starters, property is very well-located, the rooms are spotless, and the linens and bed are first rate. But the little things move this past four stars, each done in a quality way: not just complimentary bottled water, complimentary FIJI water. Not just an umbrella in the closet, a stylish MoMA umbrella. Darling slippers that you may consider taking home. Malin & Goetz bath products. A reading light, a book. Free WiFi. The only negative is the room size. Mine was very small even by Manhattan standards. Believe the fellow at check-in; he's telling the truth. Thank you, LLfromNYC. We are delighted to hear you enjoyed many aspects of your stay with Archer, especially our central location, delightful details, sincere service and Empire views. reviews.title: Excellent hotel in a great location
reviews.content: The Archer Hotel is in a great location just a few minutes walk from the Empire State Building and Times Square. The hotel Staff are welcoming and very helpful and the rooms are modern and very clean and had enough space for the 3 of us. We stayed in a Empire view room (1807) with 2 double beds which were very comfortable and a large shower in the bathroom. The little treats left every evening were delicious as was the Birthday cake on our arrival for our Daughters 21st Birthday. We ate in the Restaurant and the food and cocktails were also really delicious and the staff were friendly and professional. The roof top bar is fab with great views. New York is an amazing city and if we are lucky enough to be able to return we will definitely stay in The Archer Hotel again. Thank you. We are delighted to hear you enjoyed many aspects of your daughter's 21st birthday celebrations with Archer. It was a pleasure to take part in her memories. The location was great, access to stores, restaurants and tourist attractions, yet quieter than the Times Square area. The rooms are small, but well appointed and comfortable. The shower is nice and roomy. There is turn down service at night which is a nice touch. Thank you, Kristi B. What made my stay so memorable was the Sky bar with a terrace which overlooked the Empire State building which on our first night at the Sky bar was lit up pink, the food is also very good. I received a small birthday cake & card from the Hotel which was a nice touch. The staff were excellant and could'nt do enough for us. On our last evening we wanted to go up to the Sky Bar but it was full the Sky bar manager came and apologised asked us to take a seat in reception to wait, within a few minutes we were given vouchers for a free drink and were on are way upto the Sky bar excellant. Overall we had a super holiday and recommend the Archer Hotel Thank you, kathy187046. reviews.title: First time in NYC
reviews.content: Location of hotel is very good and within walkable distance to everywhere. Staff helpful and welcoming but overall pictures on website make everything look bigger than it is. We had the Empire Double Double which on the website looks spacious but sorry to say it isn't. The room was snug with 1 small wardrobe for 2 of us. No drawer space so we kept our jumpers, underwear and other folded items in our suitcases. Too much clutter of snack items on the furniture in the room leaving little space for personal items. Everywhere also looks tired and needs renovation. We encountered problems with Wi-Fi which hotel staff were aware of and trying to fix but for the 6 nights we spent there, it didn't work most of the time. The hotel centrally was convenient but it needs renovation and a better layout downstairs in the reception area. Thank you, ittamar. reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel In A Great Location to Explore
reviews.content: Spent 4 nights in the Archer Hotel for a birthday celebration... Beautiful room with view of Empire State Building (you pay extra for this). We were there for St Patrick's Day celebrations and Empire State on that day was lit up Green... Our room was well suited to two adults and one child. We were on a room only basis but lots of places around to have breakfast. We did try dinner one night in the hotel restaurant. Lovely food and great selection. Every night when we returned to our room there was a selection of Cookies or Chocolates which was a lovely touch. There is a roof top area but sadly we did not get to see it but by all accounts it is great for a few cocktails (no children allowed). All in all Archer Hotel is a wonderful modern hotel with great staff and service. Can't wait to go back. We were very central for doing all our sight seeing, walking to a lot of places. Thank you, FussyTraveller55. We are delighted to hear you enjoyed many aspects of your birthday and St. Paddy's Day stay with Archer, especially our central location, delightful details, sincere service and Empire views. We do have to abide by NYC laws which do not allow anyone under the age of 21 in Spyglass Rooftop Bar during operating hours, however, we are always happy to bring you up for a photo opp during the day before the bar opens. Guests like you are a joy to host and we hope you will join us for another New York adventure soon. In Hospitality, Michele - GM

The staff was very helpful and friendly, and we went to the Spyglass Bar a few times - so fun! Our only complaint is that we had people in the room next to us and could hear EVERYTHING through the adjoining doors and hallway. Would have been a much bigger inconvenience if we'd spent more time in the room. Thank you, EK514. We are delighted to hear you enjoyed many aspects of your stay with Archer, especially our central location, delightful details, and sincere service. reviews.title: Our new favorite hotel in NYC
reviews.content: This was one of the best weekends we've ever had in New York, and a good deal of the reason is the Archer Hotel. The hotel is beautiful, the service is impeccable, the restaurant and bars are fantastic, the views are spectacular and, though the rooms are "cozy" (aka, a bit on the small side) ours was absolutely stunning (exposed brick walls) with a beautiful (and nice sized) marble bathroom, a heavenly bed and an unmatched view of the Empire State Building. Plus, while still in midtown and within easy walking distance to Times Square and the Theater District, Penn Station, St. Patrick's, as well as other sites of interest, it's on a relatively quiet side street (for NYC), and there are plenty of delis, cafes, restaurants and bars in close proximity. Oh, and it was pretty affordable, especially for such a high-end boutique hotel in midtown Manhattan. Finally, though we did not dine at the restaurant (we did dine at another Charlie Palmer establishment), we very much enjoyed both the Foyer Bar and the Spyglass rooftop bar (where the views cannot be beat). The Foyer Bartender, Nicki, was very friendly and personable; and the rooftop bartender, Arel (sp?) was friendly, interesting and extremely talented, making us some out of this world cocktails, both new twists on classics and completely original creations. The Bar Manager and Sommelier, Amanda, also went out of her to be helpful and accommodating, and she was an absolute pleasure to converse with. Though I have pointed out these few people with whom we interacted most during our stay, I want to add that every single person we encountered at the Archer was friendly and professional, from the housekeepers to the bellman, concierge, front desk personnel, servers and even a couple of maintenance guys we ran into. We had a fantastic time, felt like we made new friends at the hotel and will go back again (and again and again). Thank you, Cruizin_Fool. We are delighted to hear you enjoyed many aspects of your stay with Archer, especially our central location, delightful details, sincere service and Empire views. You are so kind to mention many hosts by name and we will be sure to pass your comments along to the Charlie Palmer Group and their team. Guests like you are a joy to host and we hope you will join us for another New York adventure soon. In Hospitality, Michele - GM

reviews.title: My go-to hotel when in NYC
reviews.content: I stay at the Archer Hotel every spring for an annual girls trip. For the price, you really can't beat it. It's still fairly new, exceptionally clean and comfortable. The staff is very accommodating and the rooms are really quite nice and on the larger side for NY. I've had some great meals here as well - both lunch and dinner. They have a nice downstairs bar but the rooftop bar is impressive (don't miss out). You have to grab at least one cocktail at sunset. It's worth it despite the crowds. Just booked my fourth stay a few weeks ago and I'm looking forward to it. Other reviewers have mentioned the location and I have to concur. It's in the perfect spot. Close to Bryant Park and nearby metro stops. Love it. Thank you, Amy L. We are delighted to hear Archer has become your go-to hotel for your visits to NYC. reviews.title: Great hotel in central location
reviews.content: I had a very pleasant stay at Archer Hotel. The hotel is quite new, so the interiors are still very fresh and show little signs of wear (unlike many New York hotels). Housekeeping did a pretty good job of cleaning, however I noticed that the glass-topped bedside tables and desk were not wiped every day. My room was certainly 'intimate' i.e. very small but this is quite common in NYC and to be honest it didn't really bother me at all. Loved the little treat which were left in my room every evening, this was a really nice touch. Spy Glass rooftop bar was okay, nothing special. The food from Charlie Palmer's steak house was great (although I only sampled this in-room). Check-in and checkout was very efficient and the hotel staff were always very polite and willing to help out / answer any questions I had. Overall, a great little hotel. Thank you, christopheralexa2017. We are delighted to hear you enjoyed many aspects of your stay with Archer. We hope you will join us for another New York adventure soon. In Hospitality, Michele - GM

reviews.title: Excellent - Archer Hotel Loved it
reviews.content: I got theatre tickets for my husband‚Äôs birthday and wanted to plan a great extended long weekend in NYC. I spent a lot of time researching hotels in NYC, location, price etc. I narrowed it down to my top 3 and finally choosing The Archer Hotel. Before I we even checked in I contacted the hotel to see what their process was for having a bottle of champagne waiting in the room for when we arrived. They were so great on not only providing the champagne but a little mini chocolate cake with a card. So far so good. Location: Excellent! Walking distance to theatre without being right in all the madness of Times Square. Room: ‚Ä¢ Nice touch of complementary water (2 bottles) and caramel candy when you arrive in your room. ‚Ä¢ Most reviews noted how small the rooms were. They are right, the rooms are tiny but 2 of us were able to work it out. Not really a lot of space to place your clothes. The nightstand had drawers but they are very small. There is place to hang clothes and storage under the bed for your luggage. ‚Ä¢ The room was very clean and loved the high ceilings and one exposed brick wall ‚Ä¢ The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was nice and clean and very modern looking ‚Ä¢ Turn down service nightly with a different treat left for you each night. ‚Ä¢ Our room had an almost perfect view of The Empire State Building. If you want a full view don‚Äôt book our room 1508 and save yourself the upgrade fee Extras: ‚Ä¢ Free Wi-Fi ‚Ä¢ Spyglass Rooftop Bar ‚Äì Excellent view of The Empire State Building, especially at night. ‚Ä¢ Charlie Palmer Steakhouse ‚Äì Dine one day here and it was very good. ‚Ä¢ Foyer Bar ‚Äì We sat outside in nice little lounge area on the hotel patio ‚Ä¢ Staff- Great Issues: (if I really had to find anything wrong) ‚Ä¢ Room 1508 shouldn‚Äôt be a full upgrade price due to half a view of The Empire State Building. They should let you know the view is somewhat obstructed. But then again how often are you looking out the window. Go the rooftop bar grab a drink and get the best view ever. ‚Ä¢ Room cleaning a little late in the day. I‚Äôve been in larger hotels and the rooms were done earlier in the afternoon. I was told by a not so friendly desk clerk that their policy is room cleaning service has until 6pm to be cleaned. Could have been told that without the attitude from the guy at the front desk. Bottom Line: Would I stay at The Archer Hotel again? YES. Give this little gem a try. My next trip I will definitely stay at The Archer again. They were great! Thank you, SWing63. We are delighted to hear you enjoyed many aspects of your husband's birthday stay with Archer, especially our central location, delightful details, and sincere service. Guests like you are a joy to host and we hope you will join us for another New York adventure soon. In Hospitality, Michele - GM

reviews.title: Room Uncomfortably Small
reviews.content: In the Archer's defense, the web site identifies the rooms as small. However, they are so small that they are completely impractical. I was traveling alone for only an overnight stay. It is not possible to open a full size roller bag without putting it on top of the bed. There are amenities in the room but they take up what little space exists: between a Nespresso machine and a minibar tray on the desk, it's not possible to work. The nightstand is so small, you can't put anything on it because the hotel phone takes up the entire surface. It's not a dirty hotel, but it's not terribly clean either. I saw lots of debris on the 4th floor public corridor carpet (the rooms are also carpeted; it seem more sanitary and much nicer for newer hotels to have wood floors or hard floors). I would definitely not stay here again. The Refinery is two doors down and the rooms are much more spacious (the room rates there are probably a little higher, too). But worth it. reviews.title: Believe the hype
reviews.content: You've read the reviews and you might be thinking, surely this is just hype, surely this hotel isn't that nice. Think again. It is all that and a bag of chips, my friend. Let me start first with the location. The hotel is on a quieter street in Midtown. You barely notice any of the city noise from the room but you are still close enough to subway stops and destinations. We walked everywhere without any issue. The hotel itself is thoughtfully designed. The elevators are so quiet you can barely detect them, even if your room happens to be right off the elevators (mine was and I thought it would be an issue. Boy was I wrong). The Spyglass bar is also a nice feature. We enjoyed a relatively decent drink with some killer views and excellent service. The views alone are worth the drink price. Now to the room features...The rooms are small, yes, but so thoughtfully designed that you find that don't mind the lack of space. They have engineered the rooms to take advantage of each square foot and have included so many thoughtful features. The sleeping space has a comfortable bed with both fluffy and flat pillows! Both for each person! The beds are flanked with mounted lights on dimmer switches, and can I tell you how much I appreciate proper dimmer switches on hotel lights?! There is a desk if you need to work and the desk chair hits well above its weight. The extra padding provides comfort without adding bulk and taking up too much space. You also have a Nespresso machine with proper espresso cups and coffee cups so you don't have to endure a hideous cup of coffee. Full length mirror on the external bathroom door and under the bed storage help to provide you with the extra features you need to get yourself ready for your time in NYC. The bathroom is actually quite large and I'm glad they didn't skimp on the space here. Two people can easily get ready in that space. I also want to take a moment to mention the Malin+Goetz toiletries. I love this company and it was a serious bonus to know I wouldn't have to bring my own toiletries. They also provide thoughtful touches such as welcome treats, turn down service (with its own treats!), large umbrellas for you to use while you are there, and slippers to keep. For me though, the best part of the Archer is its killer staff. These hospitality specialists gave this hotel the 5 star ranking. There are many hotels that offer the kinds of features that you find at the Archer but few compare to its customer service. You are met right away by a friendly staff member who is quick to offer a greeting and assistance and every other person you meet is on that same level of quality. They are friendly, informative, and happy to meet any request you may have. We were celebrating a birthday and I asked if there was anything they could do to help make the evening memorable and they came through with a birthday cake and sparkling wine in-room amenity. It was great! Their attention to detail was everywhere. When we needed extra toiletries they were brought up in a themed black bag. When we were checking out they immediately asked if we needed luggage storage and transportation without any prompting. They also offered up some water bottles when we returned from a day of exploring. They anticipate your needs and meet them before you are even aware that you have a need. To me, that sets this hotel apart from the numerous other available options. If you have a chance, stay at this hotel. You won't regret it. Thank you for your thoughtful review, 716mdr. We are delighted to hear you enjoyed many aspects of your stay with Archer, especially our central location, delightful details, sincere service and Empire views. Guests like you are a joy to host and we hope you will join us for another New York adventure soon. In Hospitality, Michele - GM

reviews.title: Great Stay

(I couldn't have done it so I let her know that we'd had it - kinda weird that she didn't thank me for being honest, but all was good. We had a voucher for the wine anyway.) - The room was lovely - we were in a double double room. Really pleased with shower size. Overall, a small room, but they all are in the city for the most part. They used the space well - a sliding door for the bathroom saves a lot of room. Would have liked a bit more lighting - in particular when you move the bathroom door, the mirror on the outside ends up in too dark an area to really see if you're doing makeup in that mirror. - Beds were comfortable, linens cozy, and decor was nice. - Complimentary caramels and chocolate are a nice touch. reviews.content: Hotel is conveniently located within walking distance from the subway and Penn Station. The room is compact, but has everything you need for a short stay. I was worried about the noise from the traffic, but barely heard a sound. The closet was tiny, but there's plenty of space in the dresser drawer and bedside tables. My room.had a view of the Empire State Building.

reviews.title: Fantastic week in NYC!
reviews.content: I've been to NYC several times before, but this was my first stay at this HGI. From the time we checked in until the time we left, everything was flawless! The room was a little smaller than what I've had near Times Square, but we weren't there but to sleep. The front desk staff went above and beyond and were friendly at check in and check out. The concierge (female) made it a point to tell us to have a nice day every time we walked out and welcomed us back on our return each and every time. The breakfast staff (all of them were great), but especially Chef Luis and our server Jakiya were fantastic! They chef remembered our omelette order every single morning after the first day and Jakiya remembered our drink order every single morning after day one as well. I'd definitely recommend this property to anyone traveling to NYC and I will likely return here on my next visit. If you're coming into Penn Station, this hotel is ideal as its only a block or two away and easy walking. Its also conveniently located right next to Macy's at Herald Square and only about a 5-10 minute walk to the center of Times Square! Thanks for a great trip! Thank you for the outstanding review, Casey! We're delighted your experience with us was so wonderful! It's fantastic our team could accommodate your needs and assist you in any way possible. We aim to please and your praise lets us know we're doing our job! We're thrilled you appreciated our top-notch location as well! We look forward to hosting you again soon and to sharing another amazing experience with you! Have a lovely day!

reviews.title: Hilton Garden Inn on 35th Street
reviews.content: The location was great, in the middle of Manhattan. People were nice, able to leave bags for the day after check to see the City was a great perk. I would recommend it. There was a club next door at a different property and I never heard anything from it (which made a good night sleep). AND I HAD A VIEW OF THE EMPIRE STATE BUILDING - how cool is that.

reviews.title: Excellent Hotel
reviews.content: The hotel is conveniently located. The rooms are clean and well appointed. As well, the hotel is in the middle of a refresh so I'm sure they will get even better. Staff is pleasant and helpful. The only problem (and this is true of most NYC hotels) is that there are only three small elevators. This can make getting out of the hotel difficult during the prime check-out rush as the elevators always are full.

reviews.title: Great Room - Great Location - Excellent Service!
reviews.content: We stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn 35th St location in New York City for 4 days. Our room was very nice. It was larger than I had expected after seeing all of the reviews that stated the small size of New York City hotel rooms. The cleanliness and the comfort of the room was excellent. Our city-view looked upon the Empire State Building was incredible. Access to the subway system was only about 150 feet from the entry. We interacted with a number of different staff members. Every time our experience was excellent which to me indicates that it is well managed and run. We would definitely stay here again when we return to New York City.

reviews.title: Convenient Mid Town Location
reviews.content: Great location, walking distance from Penn Station. Good restaurants within a block. Rooms were small. The lobby restaurant was being remodeled and bags were stacked up in the Lobby when I checked in. Plan on eating out. The Empire State Building is very close as well as the NY Public library and the Piermont Morgan Museum.

reviews.title: Under Renovation
reviews.content: We like Hilton Garden Inns generally but not this one, not now. It is under renovation and the business center was closed -- no where to print boarding passes, the cafe was closed. They were fully booked and the lobby area is small. When we needed to check bags they ran out of room (used the closed cafe) and the line blocked the elevators. There is no way to get to any floors above the lobby except by using the elevator which resulted in lines. I don't recommend. We appreciate the feedback, Kirk. We're disappointed your time with us was less than ideal. We regret the inconvenience caused by our renovations and that our accommodations and services didn't meet your expectations. We hold ourselves to a higher standard so we'll address your concerns with our team moving forward. We do hope you give us another opportunity to share a more positive experience with you soon.

reviews.title: Wonderful location!

All other sites and areas of NYC can easily be reached via subway since there is an entrance to the 34th St-Herald Square stop steps away from the entrance. Penn station is only a short walk away for any lines not serviced by those at the Herald Square stop. The hotel is so central I would return to the hotel to take mid-day sightseeing breaks without skipping a beat. The hotel room itself was clean and comfortable, and the staff friendly and helpful. Without request, I was even given a room with a view of the Empire State Building. Highly recommended! Dear Guest, Thanks for the wonderful review! reviews.content: This is my 3rd or 4th visit to the Hilton Garden Inn on 35th & 6th Avenue for its convenience to Penn Station and the incredibly friendly staff. I was a long time NYC resident and had to leave the city for health issues. Needless to say, I have to come back in for medical reasons and try to bunch them together. So, I find myself staying over and it's easy to leave my suitcase on the last day at a hotel just a few blocks from Amtrak. The first person to check me in more than a year ago was Janis at the front desk. She was effervescent, eager to help and so funny. I knew immediately I had found a hotel where I'd feel at home. Janis also gave me a coupon to use at Macy's which was fabulous! Every time since has been nothing but professional and always so welcoming and helpful. They were also extremely respectful my last stay when I requested complete privacy for an entire day to recover from a medical procedure. They only offered anything they could do. I know many stay here because of it's proximity to transportation but the folks inside treat guests like they've arrived at a special place. Thank you for the outstanding review, Dawn! Herald Square St next door, Penn Sta 1 block away, Empire State Bldg 1 block away and within view of your room. If traveling with children you McDonald, Chick Fillet, Burger King around the corner. Yes, rooms are small but manageable. We had a room with two double beds for our family of 4 and it was fine. First impression is lack of space for luggage but we managed. I really appreciated the security measures, starting at the front door all the way to our room since you have to use your key card in order to work the elevator. My family felt safe. Thank you! Thanks for the wonderful review, Zaida! It's fantastic you had such a lovely experience with us. We're thrilled you enjoyed our prime location and proximity to so many of the city's best attractions. That's what we like to see! It's lovely you appreciated our security measures and comfortable accommodations. We aim to please! We're looking forward to sharing another amazing experience with you soon! Have a beautiful day!

Great location and the rooms were very quiet considering the elevator was right outside my room. It's great to have a microwave and small frig in your room. But plan accordingly, which means bring paper plates and utensils if you plan on staying in to eat. The front desk staff is incredibly friendly and helpful in giving directions or whatever your needs are. I'd come back if given the opportunity!! Thanks for the fantastic review, Dee! We're thrilled you had such a wonderful experience with us! It's excellent you enjoyed our prime location and comfortable accommodations. We aim to please and your praise for our team lets us know we're doing our job! We look forward to sharing another amazing experience with you soon! Have a lovely day!

reviews.title: Truly awful customer service
reviews.content: I had a Hilton rewards giftcard, and I was having a hard time redeeming it using the online system. I called Hilton customer service and made the reservation over the phone. The customer service agent told me to present my giftcard upon check-in at the hotel, and I would be issued a refund to the credit card I used to book. When we arrived at the hotel, we explained the giftcard situation. The desk agent informed us that we would have to ask tomorrow about the giftcard. We asked a different desk agent the next day, who told us submitting the giftcard for a refund would be no problem (echoing what we'd been told on the phone by customer service), but we would have to do it upon checkout. At checkout we spoke with the same desk agent who had checked us in-- Elizabeth Akisanya-- who (now that she could no longer pass the buck) said there was no way that she could honor customer service's promise that we could have the giftcard value refunded to our credit card. She refused to contact her manager, and quite rudely told us there was nothing more she could do. We feel entirely scammed, and we have wasted hours on the phone and in person arguing and being given the run-around just to redeem our giftcard. We still have not been able to successfully redeem it. The hotel is itself was not worth the steep price (especially given the fact that neither wifi nor the TV remote worked in our room)-- but with the rude service we received, I wouldn't stay there again even if it was free. There are hundreds of better hotel options in the area, where you can expect to be treated like a guest. Avoid this hotel at all costs. We appreciate the feedback, Cait. We're disappointed that your time with us was less than ideal. However, it's simply not possible for any facilities or hotels to authorize one card and put the authorization back to a different card. There was also no charge processed during your stay, so we unfortunately could not refund any transactions that didn't exist. Hopefully this explains the situation. Have a great day.

reviews.title: GREAT Location
reviews.content: The past few years we have stayed in Times Square. This year we decided to stay away from the chaos and look for somewhere a little "quieter", yet still close enough to walk to a Broadway show. This is the SPOT! Not nearly as crazy and busy as Times Square but only a 10 minute walk away. The subway is literally just steps away from the front door. That alone is a plus when it comes to getting around the city. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. There was usually someone in the lobby to greet us as we came and went. They offered bottles of water at check-in and check-out. I haven't been offered that at more expensive hotels in the city. The complimentary coffee, variety of teas and hot chocolate that are served in the lobby in the morning is nice. (There was a Keurig in the room but I couldn't get it to work) The coffee was that good that I didn't even think of visiting a local coffee shop. There were only a couple of issues. The elevators are some of the smallest I've seen in a hotel. 4 people and their bags will just about fill the elevator. Due to their small size there were a few times that we had to wait longer than normal to get on. On multiple trips down, as we'd stop at a floor, people weren't able to get on due to the elevator being full. The bigger issue was the size of the beds. Our room had 2 double beds. Now they were comfortable and I can say I slept well but be aware that you'll be crammed and maybe a little uncomfortable depending on you sleeping arrangements. The overall size of the room was smaller than some other rooms in NYC but I'm going to presume there are smaller ones. All being said, we did enjoy our stay and would definitely stay again. I'd actually probably look at this hotel first when planning my next trip to NYC. Dear Guest, Thank you for the 4-star rating! We're thrilled your time with us so wonderful.
