reviews.title: Beyond excellent service, but the rest needs improvement (not on par for Hilton)
reviews.content: I always choose Hilton and one other major hotel brand because of the typical cleanliness and service I receive at each. I've stayed in many Hilton properties and am an Honors member. The below is based solely from a Hilton perspective. SERVICE: Front-desk service was as good, if not better than, the Ritz Carlton! I can't say enough about how courteous and helpful they and concierge were. ROOMS: The rooms have been recently renovated and are quite nice, but we had issues (all reported to front desk and the service/repair happened immediately): 1) the safe wouldn't work so it was replaced; 2) the fridge wasn't cooling so maintenance had to work on that too; and 3) the closest ice maker wasn't working so I took my bucket to the front desk and the staff filled it for me while I waited. It seems a quality-control checks and balances should be in place for these pieces of equipment. BREAKFAST: Price was included in our room rate (highly recommend because it equated to less than 25% of the per person cost). One of the servers was excellent and the rest were a little slow on their feet-- they are only setting the tables and taking beverage orders; rest is self serve. One morning a non-U.S. native guest decided to help himself to the veggies, etc. on the omelet station. Only the omelet chef is to access these. I could tell the omelet chef was extremely frustrated so I finally said to the female, "he's not supposed to be doing that." She spoke English and stopped him in their native tongue. I then explained to her it was not sanitary. Hotel management needs to place a sign over that area that says hotel guests should ask if they want any items from behind the glass (and this would be a good idea in ALL of the Hilton properties with an omelet station). I do not eat pork/bacon for health reasons and would have liked a healthier option (turkey bacon or chicken link sausage) on the breakfast buffet. Management should investigate this too. HOUSEKEEPING: I did not report these as I could bear it, but think Hilton needs to visit this. I believe all NYC hotels outsource the laundry because of space, so I'm not sure if the provider is a Hilton company or not. The comforter cover had a stain on it that appeared to have been laundered and dried in. Housekeeping should inspect these with each room change and replace when needed. My sheets had two small blood stains, that also appeared to have been laundered and dried in (my sheets did get changed midpoint of our 6-day stay with no further issues); and one of the hand towels had similar stain (so I just pulled it and replaced it with a clean one from the extras in the shower). CAR SERVICE: DO NOT USE IT!!! The front-desk staff informed us of a car service (and clearly noted it was NOT a Hilton company). The rate the staff quoted was competitive with Uber. I was told the driver would arrive and wait for us. I made the reservation the day before departure; checked the morning of departure to ensure it was reserved for 6pm pick up; and at 6pm no car service! The luggage captain called to check on it and the car arrived at 6:15pm. Luckily I always allow for schedule hiccups, but I would have assumed since it was a private service that the driver would have been EARLY rather than late. The front desk told me that the service prefers cash, but credit cards are accepted with an additional $2 fee (makes sense because of the credit card service fee). Once the driver got us to the airport I pulled out my credit card, he went into this long discourse that he wanted cash, that there was a $5 surcharge (well in excess of even a 5% credit card fee based on the fare), and that he would have to pay taxes if I used the credit card. HMM . . . that's a huge red flag for a "cash only, tax-evading business." I felt like I was in a "gypsy cab" from the 1990s (which actually happened to me the first time I traveled to NYC on business). I don't think Hilton should be doing business with this company and I highly recommend taking Uber-- we took it from the airport which was a lifesaver (over 2 hours from LGA to hotel due to Queens tunnel construction). If we'd taken a NYC yellow taxi to our hotel I bet our fare would've been over $200. So, although the hotel service was great, this particular Hilton hotel needs somes improvement. Dear Guest, We appreciate the feedback. We're happy you had a pleasant experience with us. It's lovely our team took such great care of you and assisted you in any way. However, we're disappointed your time with us was less than perfect. We strive to offer quality service and convenience for our guests. We appreciate your feedback regarding our laundry services and housekeeping. We regret the challenges you had with the car service. Your satisfaction is important to us so we'll address your concerns with the appropriate members of our team moving forward. reviews.content: My girlfriend and I were celebrating a special event, and we were pleasantly surprised at the support we received from your exceptional staff. When we arrived, we were immediately welcomed by Tameika and were checked in expeditiously. After getting settled in our room, we noticed that the room had recently been renovated, and that there was a beautiful bottle of wine sitting on the desk to welcome us to NYC. That meant a lot to us, as my girlfriend was celebrating her birthday and we were both toasting to several significant milestones in our lives. We both recognize superior service because we have been in sales our whole lives, and we pay close attention to customer relations and service. We know the Hilton chain is a reputable chain, and you have proven your commitment to excellence with your attention to detail and superior team. WOW. Impressive! Amy, Jakira, Mohammed, and Luis were all fantastic!! We felt right at home and cannot wait to return. Whenever we needed help, whether it is directions, restaurant ideas, subway routes, entertainment & theatre options, your concierge and front desk team accommodated us and was quick to suggest great recommendations. It is not often that we receive ‚Äúred carpet‚Äù treatment, and we wanted to acknowledge the wonderful job you all did to make our trip superior to other trips to NYC. reviews.title: Great location; Housekeeper and breakfast servers were great but front desk was average
reviews.content: I wish there was a rating for 3-4 stars. My daughter and I stayed here for 3 nights/4 days for a mother and daughter trip early April. We first booked a room at Hilton at Times square but wanted to do some shopping and thought this location was better since it was so close to shops including Macy's and Korean town and walking distance to Penn station since we arrived by bus from Northern Virginia. Though we are Hilton members and we had chosen our room the day before when we arrived, the room was not ready.We were 2 hours early so they gave us another room, on a lower floor (22nd). I was worried about noise level but it wasn't bad throughout our stay. We did have neighbors on the first day but once they checked out it was quiet. Our room was typical NYC room-small but clean and perfect for our stay. We had the view of the empire state building. Please note that this hotel is very tall and narrow. Each floor only has few rooms therefore, you will be close to elevators. Our housekeeper was friendly and room was cleaned before we returned during mid-afternoon. We did the breakfast buffet which we included in our stay and from the person who made the omelet and our waitress had a smile. But if you didn't have a breakfast plan included in the cost of the room, there are plenty of places to eat especially 2 blocks around in Korean Time. Yummy bakeries...try Tous Les Jour. The only thing negative thing was the elevator...it was so slow and one day one of the elevators did not work so it took a long time but we were alright with it.Btw, the elevators are so small. Never been in a elevator that small. We did watch a show Wicked and that was fabulous. The subway is just around the corner so the location is perfect. I was trying to figure out something that was missing from this hotel and couldn't pinpoint it till half way through our stay. It was the attitude of the front desk. It wasn't that they were not helpful. They were quite expressionless and lacked the friendly smile that Hilton usually has. When I asked questions about late check out to where things were, it was quite matter of fact. I stopped asking questions after the first day because they seem unapproachable. When I was in the lobby on the last day, we spend 3 hours there trying to kill time and I observed the interactions of the front desk with customers. What I noticed was that with some people they were quite friendly and with others, they responded with a matter of fact. Needs improvement in this area. A friendly smile and eye contact is all they need to do with all people! Overall, it was a good stay because the service at breakfast and housekeeping covered what the front desk lacked and the location was ideal. Dear Guest, we appreciate your feedback. We strive to offer our guests quality service and comfort. However, we regret that your stay with us didn't exceed your expectations. We'll be addressing your concerns with the appropriate members of our team. We'd love to see you again in the future for a more positive experience.

Our room was right next to the elevators which concerned us, but we never heard them - even though the heads of our beds were on the elevator wall. Our room was on the back of the hotel so there was certainly no view, but there was also no street noise. The mattresses were brand new and quite comfortable. Thanks for the 4/5 review, Melody! The location is great close to Times Square, but far away from the craziness of it when you're ready to rest. Subway station is steps away from the door. Concierge was helpful. Secruity kept our luggage at check-in until our room was ready or whenever we came back to retrieve it because we were out and about past check-in time which is 3p so that was a plus. Secruity was also, helpful in hailing us cabs in the evening when we were going out. They offered a car service to the LaGuardia airport for a flat fee of $58.00 at check out which was nice, except for the driver charged us $63.00 instead. I informed the hotel and I am suppose to be compensated with HHonors points for the mistake of the driver. I am still waiting to verify because the HHonors website has been down. Coffee maker - fridge and microwave in the room along with a wardrobe plus room to park the suitcases out of the way were all a welcome bonus given the fantastic location. Although we were on the 8th floor with a street view, we never heard any street noise which amazed us. Complimentary coffee at reception in the mornings was such a welcome bonus along with cold iced water and cookies in the afternoon . Check in was perfect, room cleaning was perfect and we enjoyed a lovely hot breakfast on one of the mornings with eggs cooked to order. We received a very thoughtful personal note and complimentary bottle of wine to mark our wedding anniversary. Will also have to mention Sean in the rather compact bar who was very hospitable and friendly . reviews.content: This hotel offers a pretty good value considering you're in the heart of the city. It's only a 10-15 minute walk from Penn Station. There's a subway stop literally steps away and a wonderful and a very reasonably priced sushi restaurant in the next building ( with some of the best sushi I've ever tasted). The hotel had a nice array of breakfast items. All of the staff were helpful and welcoming. I would gladly stay here again. Thank you for the excellent review, Clinton! It's fantastic you had such a lovely experience with us. We're thrilled you enjoyed our prime location and proximity to so many of the city's best attractions. That's what we like to see! It's wonderful our team took such great care of you and made you feel so welcome. We aim to please! We're looking forward to sharing another amazing experience with you soon! Have a beautiful day!

reviews.title: Fantastic Stay! I will return!
reviews.content: Had a wonderful view room of the Empire State Building. The location of this hotel is great. Steps from the Herald Square subway stop. The hotel is dependable as I expected from a Hilton Garden Inn. What tops it all is the hard work of the staff on my behalf from the chef & server at breakfast, front desk, security, concierge & person who cleaned the room. They all made adjustments for my needs & remembered me. Dear Guest, thank you for the fantastic rating! We're delighted to hear you had a great stay with us and enjoyed our location and stunning views! It's very pleasing to hear our staff took great care of you. We appreciate your compliments regarding our hardworking team. We pride ourselves on providing excellent service to our guests and we strive to go above and beyond expectations. We look forward to hosting you again in the future! Thank you again for sharing your review. Have a wonderful day!

reviews.title: Great hotel, great staff, great location, great price (for NYC)
reviews.content: We chose this hotel because of being in the Hilton Honors program. The location (near Penn Station) was perfect for us and the price for NYC was really good. From our greeting at the entrance to our final goodbye, the staff were wonderful. My only complaint would be that, through the luck of the draw, we were picked as "guests of the day." We had a choice of prizes and chose free breakfast the next morning. The dining room was very nice and the staff great. However, the buffet wasn't that great and it was $19.95 per person. I would have been upset to pay that much for that breakfast. It wasn't any better than some hotels put out for free. Dear Guest, thank you for the fantastic rating! We're delighted to hear you had a great stay with us and enjoyed our location! It's very pleasing to hear our staff took great care of you. We appreciate your compliments regarding our hardworking team. We pride ourselves on providing excellent service to our guests and we strive to go above and beyond expectations. We look forward to hosting you again in the future! Thank you again for sharing your review. Have a wonderful day!

reviews.title: New York City Trip
reviews.content: A two day trip to see the city, catch a show, and see the 9/11 museum. Very pleased with the hotel, staff, food and bar. We arrived well before check in and the staff was more than happy to check our bags so we could get out and enjoy the day and sights. Staff was very helpful with where to go, eat and local sights in the area. Would recommend the hotel for anyone who wants to see the Big Apple. Thanks for the 5/5 review, Gordon! We're delighted to hear that you had an excellent stay with us! It's wonderful that you enjoyed our luggage holding service! We're also very pleased that our team provided you with helpful service - that's what we like to hear! We can't wait for your next stay with us! Thanks for sharing and have a terrific day!

reviews.title: People make the difference! Chef Luis! Alex!
reviews.content: I never write reviews, but had to acknowledge the people at HGI 35th St who consistently make my stay such a positive experience. First, for breakfast in the City, this is the tops! Chef Luis is a pro, he remembers what I like and makes my omelet or other eggs exactly how I like them. Great guy! Nice fresh fruit, too. The waitstaff is attentive and friendly. Alex, at check in, always remembers my name and has a smile. He knows which rooms I like and is very accommodating! The people here really steer my choice to stay at this hotel! Thanks for the stunning review, Frank! We're delighted to hear that you had an outstanding stay with us! It's wonderful that our team provided you with attentive and friendly service - that's what we like to hear! We're looking forward to having you back again soon for another excellent experience! Thanks for sharing and have a fantastic day!

reviews.title: Great Location, Great Deal!
reviews.content: I arrived at 7 am after travelling all the way from Virginia Beach and tried to check in but unfortunately, there is no available room (I understood). But the front desk lady was kind enough to put me in room wait list and take care of my luggage. I was finally checked in around 12:30 pm. The room was small but everything that I need was there. It was very clean. I am looking forward to stay in this location again soon hopefully if there is a great deal going! Thanks for the 5/5 review, Archelle! We're delighted to hear that you had an excellent stay with us! We strive to offer our guests quality service and comfort, so your praise lets us know we're doing our job! We can't wait for your next stay with us!

reviews.title: Great location but don't be mislead by the pictures about the rooms
reviews.content: I was searching for a hotel, that was decent price range and located in the heart of the city. The location was perfect and we even had a view of the Empire State Building. New York is busy and noisy but the hotel was quiet. My impression about the staff was mixed. We have people who were kind, helpful and went out of their way to help us. Some might have had difficult days :( The rooms looked a lot bigger on the pictures, so having to people with two big checkin suitcases and two carry-ons caused traffic jam in the room. Yet it does not matter as you come to NYC to visit the city and not sit in the room. The rooms were clean enough. Thanks for the 4/5 review, Peter! We're thrilled to hear that you had a great stay with us! It's wonderful that you loved our location and the view of the Empire State Building! We'd love to have you back again soon to share an even more positive experience with you.

reviews.title: grate location, average experience
reviews.content: the location is perfect for new your travelers, with nearby underground station therooms are small and typical NY decoration. be awere that there are only 3 elevators serving the entire hotel and waiting time for them in the mornings is unreasonable. We appreciate the feedback, Eran. We're happy you had a pleasant stay with us and enjoyed our prime location. However, we're disappointed that your stay with us was less than ideal. We'll address your concerns with our team moving forward. We look forward to hosting you again soon for a more positive experience.

reviews.title: A little gem
reviews.content: We have had the most wonderful stay in this great hotel, super location, reception staff went out of there way to make sure we were happy with everything, always greeted us with a hello or goodbye and have a nice day. Breakfast was an added bonus the staff were attentive and friendly, the breakfast itself was lovely and set you up for the day, we had omelettes made while you wait with an array of fresh veg and cheeses added, the chef was a kind, friendly man who went out his way to make you feel welcome, nothing was too much trouble and each morning he made pancakes for my children, he is a credit to this hotel. Our room was clean and tidy, beds very comfortable. We had a magnificent view of the Empire State Building. Thank you for the outstanding review, Gary! We're delighted your experience with us was so wonderful! We endeavor to make all of our guests feel welcome and relaxed during their time with us. It's fantastic our team could accommodate your needs and assist you in any way possible. We aim to please and your praise lets us know we're doing our job! We look forward to hosting you again soon and to sharing another amazing experience with you! Have a lovely day!

reviews.title: Perfect
reviews.content: Property in prime spot for all major attractions, amazing view from our room of the Empire State Building. Decent size room with fridge and microwave, powerful shower, comfortable beds and very clean. Excellent selection of breakfast items and lovely omlettes cooked from a very pleasant chef called Samit, enjoyed a chat every morning with him. Front desk staff extremely helpful, especially Alex ( my kids thought he was wonderful) who was always on hand to help us if needed. Thank you Ryan Malone for the help prior to our arrival. We had an amazing vacation and if we ever have the chance to visit this wonderful city again, I would only stay here. Thank you! Thanks for the wonderful review, Samantha! It's fantastic you had such a lovely experience with us. We're thrilled you enjoyed our prime location and proximity to so many of the city's best attractions. That's what we like to see! It's excellent you enjoyed our convenient services and features and that our team took such great care of you! We aim to please! We're looking forward to sharing another amazing experience with you soon! Have a beautiful day!

reviews.title: Great location and price
reviews.content: The location is key! Next to the Empire State Building, on Fifth Avenue, and within a couple minutes walking of Time Square. The price was good too and the breakfast was great. This is a good hotel but my only gripe is that the rooms are very small. Thanks for the 4/5 review! We're thrilled to hear that you had a great stay with us! It's wonderful that you loved our location right next to the Empire State Building! We'd love to have you back again soon to share an even more positive experience with you.

reviews.title: Family fun!
reviews.content: The room was just big enough for our small family of four. The beds were comfortable and everything was clean! Staff was very friendly and helpful. Our bags were kept after we checked out so we could explore more of the city without them! Thanks for the perfect review, Christopher! We're delighted to hear that you had an incredible stay with us! It's wonderful that your beds were comfortable - that's what we like to hear! We're also very pleased that our team provided you with friendly and helpful service! We can't wait for your next stay with us! Thanks for sharing and have an outstanding day!

reviews.title: Great property great location good staff
reviews.content: Great property great location good staff lots of fun and a great area convenient to restaurants and shopping would gladly stayed at this property again looking forward to my next trip to New York in this property right near Herald Square Thanks for the perfect review, Stephen! We're delighted to hear that you had an excellent stay with us! It's wonderful that you loved our location and proximity to many exciting attractions! We'd love to have you back again soon for another fantastic experience! Thanks for sharing and have an outstanding day!

reviews.title: Great hotel if you have a baby
reviews.content: We stayed at the Garden Inn for six days during mid April 2017. It was our first trip with our baby (8 months old at the time). We looked at different hotels around the area and this one seemed like the most baby-friendly. We were right. Our room was located next to the elevators but we didn't hear a single thing. We had really noisy neighbors (if you stepped out into the hallway you could hear them fighting) but the sounds were muffled inside the room. The crib provided by the hotel was comfortable enough. Our baby slept, well, like a baby the entire time we were there. The shower and tub were also good for her baths. Good water pressure, water warmed up in seconds. No problem there either. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel because of the hotel's location: we found it better to just walk outside and eat at one of the many, many restaurants nearby. (Props to Best Bagel and Coffee, two blocks away. Amazing bagels.) And that's another great thing about the Garden Inn. It's near enough to Times Square to be smack-dab in the middle of NYC but without all the noise and crowds. It also has a subway entrance right in the same block and uptown buses run about three blocks away. (The special bus to the Bronx Zoo, where we took our little one, leaves from Madison and 29th, a five-minute walk.) Wifi has three options, one free and two for high-speed internet (movies, Netflix, etc.). We went with the free version and it worked just fine. Staff was really friendly and accommodating. Laundry was fast and clothes came back great. (I'd like to make a special mention of the gentleman who runs the baggage deposit. Didn't catch his name but he was incredibly friendly.) All in all, a great hotel if you have a regular budget and are traveling with kids. We'll definitely stay here when we return to the Big Apple. Thanks for the 5/5 review, Esteban! We're delighted to hear that you had an excellent stay with us! It's wonderful that you loved our central location and proximity to Times Square! We're also very pleased that our team provided you with friendly and accommodating service! We'd love to see you again soon for another fantastic experience! Thanks for sharing and have an amazing day!

reviews.title: April 2017 good value
reviews.content: Nice location and value in NYC, free bottles of water, good choice of breakfast items and chef cooks eggs as you like them, friendly front desk staff, too small of bar, could use fresh up of elevators and hallways but room and bed and bathroom are very nice for value. Dear Guest, Thank you for the 4/5 rating! We're thrilled you had such a pleasant experience with us! It's excellent you enjoyed our prime location and delicious breakfast offerings. That's what we like to see! We strive for excellence so we look forward to sharing an even better experience with you soon! Have a lovely day!

reviews.title: Clean , Nice , good location
reviews.content: Great location naar times Square and empire state Good hotel , Nice beds , coffee machine in the room Take breakfast outside the hotel much cheaper and same or better quality Around corner breakfast restaurants Thanks for the 4-star rating and review, Eveline! We're thrilled you had such a pleasant time with us! We strive to offer top-notch service and convenience for our guests. It's fantastic you enjoyed and appreciated our prime location and comfortable bedding. That's what we like to see! We look forward to sharing an even better experience with you next time. Have a lovely day!

reviews.title: Hilton Garden Inn W. 35th, New York City
reviews.content: Front Desk Tameika Palmer is the best. She is polite, caring, knowledgeable and efficient. Hilton should be proud to have her on its payroll--- Tameika is a true professional! We did not feel like a impersonal number; rather we felt welcome and important as guests of the hotel. Thank you for the 4/5 rating, Richard! We're thrilled you had such a pleasant experience with us! It's outstanding our team made you feel so welcome and assisted you in any way. Tameika is a valued member of our team so it's no surprise she took such great care of you! We look forward to sharing an even better experience with you soon! Have a lovely day!

reviews.title: One of the best hotel experiences we've had
reviews.content: I loved this hotel. At first I was a little bummed that we were only on our the third floor, but we didn't spend much time in the hotel anyway so it wasn't a bad location. The rooms were very quiet. The front desk staff was top notch. Alex and Tony were always more than helpful, assisting us with which subways to take to various locations, and offering food recommendations. We were always offered complimentary water. I had quite a few blisters on my heels from walking everywhere and they always gave me free bandaids. The location of the hotel was perfect. Close proximity to two subway stations that go both uptown and downtown, as well as the train to the Bronx. We will absolutely be back to this hotel. Thanks for the stunning review, Amy! We're delighted to hear that you had an excellent stay with us! It's wonderful that our team provided you with helpful service and great recommendations! We're also very pleased that you loved our central location and proximity to the subway! We can't wait for your next stay with us! Thanks for sharing and have an outstanding day!

reviews.title: Wonderful experience
reviews.content: My adult daughter and I stayed at the Warwick for three nights in June. Everyone at the hotel treated us wonderful from the moment we checked in. The rooms were large and comfortable. Everything was extremely clean and updated. The breakfast menu at Muriel's was on the expensive side but we had the breakfast package which included a delicious buffet breakfast with a large selection so this really didn't matter to us. The location is perfect. On a quiet street but within walking distance to many shows/restaurants. This will be our new go to hotel in the future. I looked into many hotels and read many reviews before booking. We were presently surprised by the Warwick. Thank you for a great getaway!

reviews.title: Good stay
reviews.content: We have a wonderful vacation at the hotel. Nothing to complaint about it. If i return to new york i shall return to the warwick. The personell was very good and the rooms too. Room Could be a litlle bit bigger.

reviews.title: Great location, clean and cozy!
reviews.content: After reading reviews here on TripAdvisor, I booked a room for our family of four. We just returned from a 5 night stay at the Warwick New York. Our room on the 18th floor had a view of an adjacent building but we didn't mind this. It was very clean and our room was at the end of the hall and was very quiet. Though we were on the end, still it was not far from the 3 elevators (which we never waited more than a minute to get on). We loved the hotel's location on the corner of 54th & 6th avenue which made walking to all the sights including Central Park easy. We had the breakfast buffet at the restaurant Murals on 54 within the hotel and it was very, very good. I would recommend booking with the breakfast included. The staff from the housekeeping, concierge, front desk, doormen and staff from Murals were all very friendly and attentive. We would definitely come back!

reviews.title: Delightful visit!
reviews.content: We had an amazing stay at, for NYC, a very reasonable price. The room was very comfortable and the staff was extremely accommodating. Robert, the concierge, is a gem! He was helpful in providing restaurant, theater and transportation information and knew the city like the back of his hand!

reviews.title: A Golden Location at a Very Decent Price
reviews.content: I was able to get a room at Warwick New York for $185 online, exclusive of the $25 service fee the hotel collects from all quests. I was given a room on the 25th floor facing Sixth Avenue - view was of the Hilton and an office building across the street. Little street noise but street was blocked off for some reason right in front of the hotel so I lucked out! Room was nicely furnished with more than enough outlets for iPhones and laptops. You can manipulate the light fixtures from both the night stand and foyer. Bath was small but much nicer than the Hilton across the street and having stayed at both I would opt for the Warwick New York, I checked in early and was given a key to the room! This has never happened to me during my many NY visits. The only negative I have about this hotel is the Randolph Bar-Bistro. Pouring down rain kept me in the hotel Saturday afternoon and I ate there. Service was beyond Slow for both my lunch. The kitchen is located downstairs. Waitress was apologetic but only after I had complained. I would NOT recommend this place to eat; I spent too much for what I had: iced tea (no free refill), burger, fries and chocolate cake - to be fair they were good but not at these prices.

reviews.title: Great Experience!
reviews.content: We love the Warwick Hotel and we're pleasantly surprised to be upgraded to a beautiful suite. It is a charming and very tastefully decorated hotel in a great location with access to shopping, restaurants and the theaters. We will definitely stay there each time we are in New York!

reviews.title: Nice hotel
reviews.content: Good hotel, good staff specially Billy their front desk officer/staff was too nice to us and also gave us an upgrade. Excellent location, you come out and you're on the 6th Avenue (Times Square) so you can't beat this location. Pricing is what bothered us. We paid $400 per night so it's expensive. Why? I probably don't know, could be the location or could be the room size. They have big rooms compared to other hotels at Times Square.

reviews.title: Air conditioner did not work and no one came to fix it after it was reported.
reviews.content: I have stayed at this hotel many times and will say that the room is beautiful and staff is always friendly. Normally we feel very special when we stay here. This time the air conditioner stopped working at around 12 pm and was reported around 7:30 am after everyone woke up. Nto one came to our room to fix the air conditioner and we ended up leaving NYC in the morning since everyone in my family did not sleep well. The manager who did take off $100 of the room was not at all concerned about our situation. Thank you for staying with us again on this recent visit to the Warwick and for taking the time to share with us your experience. As you are aware from past stays, our team strive to deliver the best service to all of our guests. I am terribly sorry this was not the case on this particular visit. If at all possible, would you give me a call at 212-314-7785 or at bkang@warwickhotels.com? I would love a chance to speak with you directly to gather a bit more information to your recent visit. Thank you again for your patience and I look forward to speaking with you soon. Warm Regards, Billy K Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: Excellent location in midtown Manhattan, clean and spacious room. Good fitness center. Good service.
reviews.content: Old style hotel at excellent location in midtown Manhattan. Clean and spacious room. Good fitness center. Good service. Good business center with computers and printers attached. Good value for the price. Thank you so much for sharing your positive experience during your recent visit to our hotel. We were delighted to hear that you had such a great time and hope to see you again in the future. Warm Regards, Billy K Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: Expect more for the price
reviews.content: For $495, I'd expect more. They gave me a suite on 33rd floor, but the there was about 90 degrees (F). A bathrobe would have been nice. Had to wait 10 minutes to get bag from storage. It is a good location and a decent hotel. Thank you so much for your recent stay and for sharing your feedback online. We were disappointed to read that you did not get the 5 star service we strive to deliver to all of our guests. If possible, I would love a chance to speak with you regarding your visit. I can be reached at 212-314-7785 or at bkang@warwickhotels.com. Thank you again for your feedback and I look forward to speaking with you soon. Warm Regards, Billy K Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: Great Hotel and location
reviews.content: We came to NYC for a weekend and everyone was so nice and helpful. Very clean and wonderful place to stay. Location was great, within walking distance of everything!! We arrived early (before check in) and the lady at the desk helped find us a room that was ready and if she could not find one she offered to take our bags so we could explore. Thank you for staying with us recently and for sharing your feedback online. We were happy to hear that you enjoyed your time with us and we hope to see you again the next time you visit New York. Warm Regards, Billy K Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: Friendly staff, great location
reviews.content: Such a great location, close to Times Square, Central Park, Radio City Music Hall, and the lesser known Magnolia Bakery. My room was very clean and all the staff were extremely helpful. My only complaint is that the bathroom did not have nearly sufficient counter space or convenient outlets for the blow dryer or curling iron. Everything else was great. Thank you for staying with us on your recent visit to New York City and for taking the time to share with us your experience. We were happy to read that you enjoyed your overall visit. We do have rooms with extra counter space so please do not hesitate to reach out to me on your next visit so that I can ensure you a spacious room. Warm Regards, Billy K Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: AMAZING
reviews.content: If I could describe this hotel in one work it would be AMAZING! There was delicious breakfast and lunch there with very nice staff. Our hotel room was spectacular and also very clean. Other hotels would have very dirty bathrooms, but this hotel surprised me with the most clean bath tubs ! The front door was very fancy and so was the lobby. There were 30 floors and I stayed on the 19th, hotel rooms consist of pictures, chairs, automatic turn on lamps and very neat beds! If you ever go to downtown New York, go to warwick. Thank you for staying with us recently and for sharing your feedback online. We were happy to hear that you enjoyed your time with us and we hope to see you again the next time you visit New York. Warm Regards, Billy K Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: Well located gem
reviews.content: The Warwick is very well located in midtown on the corner of 54th and 6th, near Central Park, 5th Avenue, Times Square and many other venues. It has a storied history and while not as modern or as luxurious as some newer (and more expensive) hotels, it was low key and very comfortable. I requested a quiet room and was given a corner room with an interior view, which was perfect as their was zero street noise. The lobby is small but well staffed and there are two restaurants, one for breakfast and the other for lunch, dinner and drinks. Thank you very much for the kind and detailed comments following your recent stay with us. We were thrilled to hear that you had a great time while staying with us and we certainly hope that we will see you again in the future. Warm Regards, Billy K Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: Would come again
reviews.content: Great service, courteous staff. Central location easy to get to subway stations. Walking distance to time square, Central Park . We were a family of 5 had 3 rooms all by each other which worked out great as one one member need assistance and the housekeeping staff was most accommodating.. Thank you for staying with us recently and for your review online. We were happy to read that you entire family had a fabulous time with us and hope to invite you back again in the near future. Warm Regards, Billy K Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: Great Classic Hotel in the Heart of Midtown
reviews.content: The Warwick Hotel was recommended by a friend and I couldn't be more happy that we were able to secure a room for our recent trip to NYC. We were able to get a great rate on Expedia. From looking at the website and previous reviews, I knew it was going to be great. The location was also a deciding factor. You really are in the middle of everything at this hotel. We walked everywhere easily. The hotel exceeded any expectations I had. The Door men and Front Desk staff were very kind and professional. The staff at Randolph's Bar were amazing. They were friendly and funny and made us feel like this was our Bar. We met several travelers there that told us they only stay at The Warwick when they come in to the city. Our room was very large, and well appointed. We had a city view room overlooking 6th avenue. The room was quiet and comfortable with very nice bedding and a marble bathroom. I highly recommend putting the Warwick on the top of your list when considering a hotel in the city. Thank you so much for sharing your positive experience during your recent visit to our hotel. We were delighted to hear that you had such a great time and hope to see you again in the future. Warm Regards, Billy K Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: Close to Central Park and MOMA
reviews.content: I've stayed at The Warwick more than a dozen times. Most of them for business, when it didn't matter too much what the window looked out onto since I was just going to be going back and forth to the office (on 6th Ave so VERY convenient). My most recent visit was for fun with friends. While we had a nice suite and could host a pre-dinner glass of wine, the windows all faced other buildings or brick walls. The good news is that Central Park is very close, as is the MOMA (across the street). If you hope to look out your window and watch the city or the skyline this hotel has limited options. With that in mind, the location is fabulous and the service very good. Thank you kindly for your loyalty to the Warwick! Since you have stayed with us several times you might consider joining Warwick Journeys, at no cost! By doing so, you accumulate points leading to many perks, including free upgrades. Also, by becoming a member you avoid the daily facility fee. We hope to welcome you back upon your next visit to the NYC area. Have a wonderful week! Jenelle Almanzar Front Office Manager

reviews.title: Very Charming
reviews.content: My family and I stayed at the Warwick for two nights. It is perfectly located to go to Broadway, Central Park, Times Square, etc. it had wonderful ambience and old time charm with modern amenities. The staff was very friendly and knowledgable. Would definitely stay here again. Really great restaurants and shopping all around. We also walked the mile to the pier to leave for our cruise! Great location! Thank you for staying with us recently and for sharing your feedback online. We were happy to hear that you enjoyed your time with us and we hope to see you again the next time you visit New York. Warm Regards, Jenelle Almanzar Front Office Manager

reviews.title: A homely hotel
reviews.content: 3rd stay at the Warwick. We arrived very early and was given a nice room with a view of a brick wall. Room was clean and neat but my side locker draw handle fell off. No bath robe given. The bar called Randolphs was great we went there every day for coffee or a drink or food. Location is superb. 5 blocks from Central Park and 1 block from 5th Avenue. Great value and brilliant staff Thank you for staying with us recently and for sharing your feedback online. We were happy to hear that you enjoyed your time with us and we hope to see you again the next time you visit New York. Warm Regards,

reviews.title: A quietly managed classic
reviews.content: My wife and I just spent a long weekend here. Check-in was far less time consuming and painful than almost anywhere I've checked in over the past two years. The location of the property is ideal and offers great access to just about anywhere a person would want to go in the city. The elevators were fast and readily available. Our room was maybe slightly larger than one typically finds in NYC, although it would not be construed as particularly large. The bed was comfortable and the amenities were good. Staff was friendly and efficient all throughout the hotel. There is a restaurant on site, but we ate elsewhere our entire stay so I have no comments about that. Checkout was a breeze and they were very helpful in storing our bags until the time came for us to head to the airport. I would highly recommend this hotel! I'm sure we will stay there again the next time we go to NYC. ps. For those of you old enough to remember him, Cary Grant lived at this hotel for about 12 years on the 27th floor. Thank you so much for sharing your positive experience during your recent visit to our hotel. We were delighted to hear that you had such a great time and hope to see you again in the future. Warm Regards, Jenelle Almanzar Front Office Manager

reviews.title: Such An Excellent Experience
reviews.content: Not only was the hotel in a phenomenal location, but it was affordable, the staff was overly-accommodating (they facilitated an early check-in and treated us to a surprise for our birthdays), the rooms were in fantastic condition, and everyone was so eager to be helpful. Thank you for staying with us recently and for sharing your feedback online. We were happy to hear that you enjoyed your time with us and we hope to see you again the next time you visit New York. Warm Regards, Billy K Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: Visited during Footwear show
reviews.content: Nice rooms and good signage for the Footwear show. I spend a half day seeing different vendors and they were very easy to find. Wish I could stay at the hotel but it is too expensive for my companies budget.

reviews.title: Great hotel and perfectly located
reviews.content: My wife, infant, and I really enjoyed our stay here. The location is incredible, and we were able to walk to Times Square, Central Park, and many museums. The great shopping on 5th avenue is a block away. It is expensive (but that's NYC) - and doesn't even include breakfast (most hotels include it in my travels around the world). The room was very attractive and bed and bedding extremely comfortable. There were also very nice 24 hour gourmet markets around the corner and a great food truck (The Halal Guys) across the street. I would stay here again. Thank you for the kind and detailed comments following your recent stay with us. We were thrilled to hear that your entire family had a great time while staying with us and we certainly hope that we will see you again in the future. Warm Regards, Billy K Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: 28th Wedding Anniversary ......
reviews.content: My wife & I love NYC and that is where we chose to go for this anniversary ... but we wanted to stay somewhere different this trip and after stoping at the Warwick for drinks when we were in town last October we just fell in love with it ... it was built in 1926 by the media magnate William Randolph Hearst for his beloved mistress Marion Davies .... the hotel calls you back to a time of gracious living and opulence ... the Randolph Bar with its mahogany covered walls creates an atmosphere where you truly want to linger over a martini at the end of a hectic day ... the staff is excellent ... the rooms are immaculate with period pieces of furniture and plush comfy beds .. the view from our suite was directly up 6th Avenue so we could see all the way up to Radio City Music Hall ... we were there 5 nights .. we loved every moment ... now, having said that one might ask themselves why we did not give it a 5 star rating instead of a 4 ... well, they made one BIG blunder ... no one connected with the hotel even acknowledged our anniversary !!!!!! I made them aware when I booked it months prior, followed up with a phone call the day before arrival and told them again when we checked in because they ASKED if we were celebrating anything special ... not a drink, not a rose or a box of chocolates not even a card ... we even upgraded to a suite but sadly they did nothing ... such a classy hotel acted very pedestrian about something that was a really big deal to us .... Thank you very much for having stayed with us for your special anniversary trip. Although we were glad to read that you enjoyed your stay, the entire team and I were disappointed to find out none of our staff acknowledged your special trip. I would like to reiterate that this is not the standard of our hotel and I would like to apologize. I would love a chance to speak with you directly and would greatly appreciate if you can contact me at bkang@warwickhotels.com. Thank you again for your time. Warm Regards, Billy K Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: Friendly NYC hotel
reviews.content: If you like a classic hotel in a great NYC location look no further. Randolph's is a great bar/lounge with a dark wood/library atmosphere. If you're into chrome, glass and glitz find another spot to enjoy NYC. 4 streets to Rockerfeller Center, 5 streets to Central Park, and 1 Ave + a few streets to the theater/Times Square district. Hard to beat. Thank you so much for sharing your positive experience during your recent visit to our hotel. We were delighted to hear that you had such a great time and hope to see you again in the future. Warm Regards, Billy K Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: Outstanding service and location!
reviews.content: The Warwick is a lovely hotel with a great location near Central Park. The staff were amazing and truly made us feel welcomed. Our king sized room was quite large for NY and very comfortable. The bathroom was a bit small, but there was lots of storage space for personal belongings and for two people it worked out fine. I would definitely return and recommend this hotel to anyone. Thank you for staying with us recently and for sharing your feedback online. We were happy to hear that you enjoyed your time with us and we hope to see you again the next time you visit New York. Warm Regards, Billy K Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: Hotel in Manhatten
reviews.content: The hotel was superb and in a good location , 5 minutes walk from Central Park and a few minutes more to Times Square.The hotel is situated on 6th Ave and 54th street.The Warwick is very clean throughout and serves very good food,although it can be a bit pricey ,the staff are very friendly and helpful.I would certainly visit again.There is also a Subway close by, where you can catch a train to Downtown Manhatten. Thank you for staying with us at the Warwick New York and for the 5 star review on Trip Advisor. We appreciate you remembering our staff members and for highlighting our hotel's central location in midtown Manhattan. Please come visit us again soon. Warm Regards, Billy K Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: Elegant
reviews.content: This is our second visit to this hotel and again we were not disappointed. Great location and close to everything you need but without the crowds. The checkin was fast and the desk staff were very nice. This time we booked a suite which was a few dollars more then a normal room. The room overlooked 54th Street and The Avenue of the Americans. Rooms are clean and large for New York City. Try this hotel you will not be disappointed. We want to thank you for visiting us for the second time and for the glowing review online. The team and I were thrilled to have made your stay comfortable and we hope to see you again in the near future. Warm Regards, Billy K Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: A Gem Among Lodgings
reviews.content: The Warwick New York is our hotel of choice because it is perfect for its character, charm, excellence in customer service, restaurant and bar, and location. The staff is friendly and helpful. I want to mention a few for accolades. I arrived on the evening of May 4th after a challenging travel day, and was greeted by Vilma at the front desk. Vilma was impressive - professional, helpful and friendly. She made for a smooth, expeditious check in, and assigned me (and my adult daughter who was to arrive later) a lovely suite with a view of 54th Street and Sixth Avenue. A few days before our arrival, an email arrived from Mr. Louis Vanheusden welcoming us to The Warwick and providing useful information for our visit. The day after our arrival, we found a plate of fruit with a welcoming note from Mr. Vanheusden. These touches made a difference and distinguish The Warwick. And the Concierge, Kevin proved to be an invaluable and essential asset to a wonderful stay! He is an example of someone who excels in his profession. I was grateful for his expertise, advice, and help. (BTW, I recommend the New York Times column on ‚ÄúHow to Best Use Your Hotel Concierge,‚Äù May 28, 2017 Travel Section to TripAdvisor readers.). Sam, the Doorman, was unrelenting persistent in getting us a cab to the United Nations at a particularly busy time. Jes√∫s, the Bellman, was cheerful and helpful. Murals on 54, the hotel's breakfast restaurant, has buffet choices that were expansive, attractively arranged, and flavorful. Randolph‚Äôs Bar and Lounge is the perfect place to relax with a drink and food. Housekeeping excelled in maintaining the room and the property. Our stay at the Warwick New York was simply perfect, and we are looking forward to our next stay in July. Thank you very much for having stayed with us recently and for taking the time to write about your experience. We want to thank you for highlighting a few of our team members by name and look forward to making your stay in July just as memorable. Warm Regards, Billy K Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: Spacious rooms, great location
reviews.content: We drove from 4.5 hrs away and stayed for 3 nights with our toddler in tow - not the easiest way to visit New York City! - but the Warwick Hotel did make things quite pleasant for us. Our 24th-floor room had a king bed and access to a patio (which we didn't use, cf. toddler), and was quite spacious by NYC standards. Easily fit a rollaway twin bed. The extra bed and mini fridge required additional fees. Big windows, good light, decent a/c, which was great because we visited during a heat wave. We wanted to be close to Central Park and other amenities; this fit the bill, being just a few blocks south. Nearby were lots of coffee places, bakeries (Maison Kayser), convenience stores etc, the Plaza Food Hall was an upmarket but nice option to have, of course lots of restaurants at every turn. Service was prompt and friendly, decor was old-fashioned and charming. Carpets were a little old and slightly grungy, could use a refresh. Didn't get to use the gym or eat/drink in house, but maybe next time? All in all, a positive experience considering the challenges of visiting the Big Apple with an active toddler! Thank you for staying with us recently and for taking the time to share your feedback. We were happy to read that you enjoyed your time with us and hope to invite you back for another visit. Warm Regards, Billy K Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: The calmest in the loud New York
reviews.content: I love my stay at the Warwick. I was there from Friday to Sunday and I was so happy to know how close it is to walk to Central Park and Times Square. But, in the room you won't hear anything from the outside. It was very calm, serene, and simply amazing. I love the location and the service as well. The bed was soooo relaxing, I just want to be in my bed. I love New York and Warwick hotel made my stay memorable. Thank you! Thank you for staying with us recently and for sharing your feedback online. We were happy to hear that you enjoyed your time with us and we hope to see you again the next time you visit New York. Warm Regards, Billy K Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: Perfect experience, great customer service, the charm of old New York
reviews.content: If our readers bother to check our reviews, they will see that we have - more or less- stayed in every Midtown Manhattan hotel, including the five stars ones, and the most recent experience received at Warwick is one of the best. Yes, some parts of the hotel are not that brand new, certain things perhaps require renovation, but the characteristic charm of the old glorious days of NYC makes Warwick one of the most authentic and best hotels in the city. The check-in process was exemplary good; though we arrived before 11 AM and were ready to leave our luggage and hit the city, we were courteously given our room, and that is more than 4 hours earlier than the official check-in time (3 PM). Our room (#1410) was tucked away from the elevators area, the overall soundproofing was very good. The almost unobstructed view to 6th Ave was also a nice surprise, that is, compared to the most of Manhattan Midtown hotels. The room amenities were all there, from the fully stocked mini-bar and selection of snacks to the decent size TV, nice toiletries by London's Gilchrist & Soames, adequate number of electrical outlets for charging personal electronic devices (behind the night tables, certain inconvenience but not the terrible one). The bathroom is smallish, with one person - excuse the details - seated on the toilet, it is almost impossible to open the door, but the shower stall, inlaid with marble, was of a good size. The bed, its comfort, and the sleep quality were all very good. Even though the window gave on the bustle and hassle of 6th Ave the noise never felt like a problem. A huge advantage is the separate closet and luggage room, quite spacious, that would accommodate even some serious amount of one's suitcases. The elevators are rather small, which results in some waiting time in the peak hours, but nothing too annoying. The basic WiFi is free, the registration process is easy (doesn't require multiple screens) and works fine. The hotel is a home to Randolph's Bar & Lounge, proudly named after William Randolph Hearst, and Murals at 54, serving both a la carte and buffet breakfast. We have been to the latter before and just for the purpose of admiring the wonderfully restored murals by the popular American illustrator Dean Cornwell, commissioned by for the hotel's original owner, media magnate William Randolph Hearst, it is worth your while to stay at Warwick. Very satisfying experience. Highly recommended. Thank you very much for the kind and detailed comments following your recent stay with us. We were thrilled to hear that you had a great time while staying with us and we certainly hope that we will see you again in the future. Warm Regards, Billy K Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: Classic, soul of New York, great Americana style.
reviews.content: I screen a lot of NYC hotels before that trip. Decided to stay near Central park and shopping centre and Broadway. My idea was to have original Americana hotel in the heart of NYC. The Warwick is in the city center corner of 54th and 6av, inbetween of Broadway, 5th avenue, near multiple metro station and easy to arrive from JFK by metro, easy to reach all NYC attractions: MET, Empire building, Central park, surraunded by restaurants, shops, caffes, new Park, Madisson avenue, near all Fashion brands shops, Louis Vuitton, Gucci, Prada etc. Broadway with all theatres, all musicles are near by. I got excellent suite #2906 with three sides windows on 29-th floor with amazing view of 6 th and 54 streets, view of skyscrapers, roofs with small gardens, with a lot of space, working table and two big rooms. Classic and style. Thank you for staying with us recently and for sharing your feedback online. We were happy to hear that you enjoyed your time with us and we hope to see you again the next time you visit New York. Warm Regards, Billy K Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: Great stay, great hotel
reviews.content: Your classic quality New York hotel. An all too brief stay but a hugely enjoyable one. Rooms are well sized, but the bathrooms certainly do make efficient use of space. Has a nice boutique feel to the place. Great location just steps away from Central Park, 5th Ave, Radio City Music Hall and the heart of Manhattan. Definitely be staying here on a future visit to NYC. Thank you for staying with us recently and for sharing your positive feedback. We were happy to hear that you enjoyed everything our hotel has to offer and look forward to your return visits in the future. Warm Regards, Billy K Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: Aging Hotel
reviews.content: The non-friendliness of the staff, the old rooms and the small size of the Twin beds will not make us come back to this hotel anymore. However, The situation was good. Walking distance from many nice places. Thank you for staying with us and for taking the time to share with us some of your observations. I am terribly sorry you did not have the same positive experience the vast majority of our guests have. This is not the high standards we hold ourselves to. We hope you will give us another opportunity at turning this experience around. Please let me know when you plan your next visit to New York City so that I can ensure you have a flawless visit. Warm Regards, Billy K Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: Classy and Covenience
reviews.content: We stayed for 5 nights in this beautiful and historic hotel. Great location and service. Be aware there are no microwaves or fridges in the room. The mini bar leaves no room for your items. The website says "free breakfast" but if you book with a third party this will not be for you. Thank you for staying with us on your recent visit to New York and for your review online. We do offer microwaves and refrigerators upon request so please let us know when you plan your next visit so that we can ensure these are set up in your room prior to your arrival. Warm Regards, Billy K Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: Home Away from Home!
reviews.content: The Warwick Hotel has made some positive changes since my last visit a couple of years ago. The same, great people are there but with some wonderful additions, namely, the very intelligent and helpful concierge, Robert, and Lee, at the front desk as well as Daley in the receiving/package room. Vlad is always there to greet you with a friendly smile and HANDSOME, charming Johnny, the doorman, is his usual kind, helpful, charming self. The Warwick is my "go-to" destination, conveniently located and reasonably priced! The food is also EXCELLENT, especially the grilled salmon. Thank you for the glowing review following your most recent stay. We appreciate your kind words about our team and we hope to continue to welcome you back for many years. Warm Regards, Billy K Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: Warwick Hotel: Excellent Location and Value
reviews.content: We have stayed at the Warwick 8 or 9 times. Location @ 54th St. and 6th Ave. is unbeatable. Rates are a great value compared to other NYC hotels. Staff are courteous, professional and helpful. Rooms are well-appointed and larger than similarly priced NYC hotels.

reviews.title: Excellent midtown choice
reviews.content: I stayed 3 nights on during a business trip. The hotel is very conveniently located. The rooms are very clean and nicely decorated (nothing too extravagant). The breakfast is obviously at NY prices but at least you get what you pay for. I especially appreciated the variety of fruits. On the down side: I would not recommend the room service, I had a Caesar , expensive for an ok quality no more (85 $ for the salad , a beer and a slice of cheese cake..). Service was good (I appreciated the rapid and dilligent check in and check out).

reviews.title: Great size room, clean, and perfect location
reviews.content: I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. I'm super picky and read reviews like crazy before I book anything. Everything was pristine, the room was quite large for New York City. Great location at 54th and 6th Ave, so close to Central Park, theatres... Absolutely wonderful. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay here and will definitely come back.

reviews.title: Great location, decent rooms, bad bathrooms
reviews.content: Stayed 3 nights at Warwick while in town for conference. Pretty good deal for NYC hotels and its location. Pros: Good wifi, large rooms, clean, comfortable (good beds). Excellent location. Cons: Street facing rooms are super noisy. Bad bathrooms; small, very poor water pressure. busy hotel with tons of lobby traffic

reviews.title: Great Location, Comfortable, Classic
reviews.content: Just finished a three night stay at this hotel, and would stay here again. We were travelling with a toddler, so wanted to find a place close to Central Park. This was the best option we could find, at a reasonable price compared to other hotels in the area. The location is really ideal, only five blocks from the park, and near many restaurants and sights (e.g. Rockefeller Center, Fifth Avenue, the Plaza, Central Park Zoo, Times Square, etc.). Particularly for families with small children, the location near the park is terrific. Hotel itself is quite comfortable. More of a classic New York hotel, older, but well-kept. Small lobby, and not very flashy, but understated and quite nice. We had a pretty large room for New York, with a terrace and seating outside on the terrace. Room was spacious and clean. Bathroom was a bit small, but perfectly serviceable. Bed was comfortable, and everything was laid out in a convenient manner. Service was quite good throughout. Front desk was responsive, and housekeeping was quite good. All of the employees we encountered were very friendly and nice, particularly the doormen. If you decide to book a room, definitely join their club, as you can get a discount and also free wifi. All in all, we were very happy with our stay and would stay here again.

reviews.title: Quite nice and well-located
reviews.content: I stayed here because it was the host hotel for the group I was with, and just a block away from the University Club, where we were having a banquet. Modest lobby, pleasant front desk staff, and really very nice rooms. The bath was a bit small, but nicely fitted out and perfectly acceptable for a single. My room was on the 9th floor, overlooking 6th Avenue, but there was virtually no traffics noise. The HVAC system worked very well. All in all, one of the better places one might stay in Midtown, without the 'flash' of other places (a positive attribute, in my opinion). Thank you for staying with us recently and for sharing your feedback online. We were happy to hear that you enjoyed your time with us and we hope to see you again the next time you visit New York. Warm Regards, Billy K Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: Convenient
reviews.content: I stayed at the Warwick hotel for a week. The staff were great, including arranging a move to a quieter and darker room to help me cope with jet lag. Regardless, I cannot give the hotel five stars. Their restaurant, Randolphs, is horrible; and the hotel itself is tired. It enjoys a great location and quality staff - which brings it up from three to four stars. I will almost certainly stay there again, but it is miles away from making five stars. Thank you for staying with us for your week visit to New York. We were happy to read that you enjoyed your overall stay despite your not-so-great experience at our restaurant. Please know that your comments have been shared with our restaurant managers. If you are available, I would love a chance to speak with you directly to gather a bit more information as to your experience. I can be reached at bkang@warwickhotels.com. Thank you again for the time to share your thoughts and I look forward to hearing from you soon. Warm Regards, Billy K Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: Love the Warwick NYC
reviews.content: Our family has been staying at the Warwick NYC for approximately 15 years. We live in California and have visit New York for vacation at least 2 times per year. Our daughter just finished her first year of college in NY. We visited her 3-4 times this year. On one visit we stayed at another hotel closer to her college; however, we were terribly disappointed, We will never do that again. We love the charm of the Warwick, and the fact that all rooms are close to the elevators. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The Warwick is within walking distance to museums, restaurants, Central Park, Time Square, Rockefeller Center and the subway. It's always a pleasant surprise to have the doorman welcome us by name upon our arrival. The staff in Randolphs Lounge also greet us by name as soon as we walk in and remember our favorite meals and drinks. Some of the rooms can be small; however, since we joined the Warwick Journeys Program, we have been upgraded and stayed in more spacious rooms. The rooms are always clean, and housekeeping is prompt and efficient. The beds are very comfortable. The staff at the front desk are always helpful and friendly. We recommend the Warwick to all our family and friends, and they are never disappointed. Thank you very much for being one of our many loyal guests over the years and for taking the time to share some of your thoughts on Trip Advisor. The team and I were thrilled to read that you have found a home in New York and we hope to continue to welcome you back for many future visits. Please also congratulate your daughter for finishing her first year in college! Warm Regards, Billy K Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: Updated yet retained its old New York Charm
reviews.content: The Warwick exceeded my expectations. Our room was comfortable and very clean. It was spacious for a New York hotel room. The staff was professional and friendly and couldn't do enough for us. I will definitely return. Thank you for staying with us recently and for sharing your feedback online. We were happy to hear that you enjoyed your time with us and we hope to see you again the next time you visit New York. Warm Regards, Billy K Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: Central, friendly, comfortable
reviews.content: The location is excellent, easy to get to Central Park, MOMA, Lincoln Centre. Good eating places very handy. Breakfast v good but busy. Room comfortable, clean and quiet. Recommended for visitors wanting to have easy walk to many sites. We enjoyed a Spring day in Central Park and the views from Rockefeller Centre. Thank you so much for sharing your positive experience during your recent visit to our hotel. We were delighted to hear that you had such a great time and hope to see you again in the future. Warm Regards, Billy K Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: Quality, Comfort, Convenience
reviews.content: Recently spent two nights in City at the Warwick. Has a lovely suite, comfortable room, great service. the location cannot be better. It's got a quiet, mannered and a professional excellence that's hard to find at any price. Thank you very much for staying with us recently and for sharing your positive feedback. We were delighted to hear that you enjoyed everything our hotel has to offer and we look forward to your return visits in the future. Warm Regards, Billy K Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: Big Room - Tiny Bath
reviews.content: The Warwick provides old New York ambiance in the middle of Midtown. A little down on its heels and scruffy around the edges - the blackout drapes in the room were soiled but the bed was comfy with lots of pillow options with 6 different kinds on the king bed. While the room was spacious the bathroom was tiny. The shower was about the size of a phone booth. Missed the efficiency of a larger hotel when checking out - it was quite slow. Shout out to the bellman who walked me over to 6th Ave to make sure I got a cab. Thank you for staying with us recently and for taking the time to share some of your experiences. Although we were glad to read that you enjoyed your overall visit, we were disappointed that this particular stay was not as flawless as we aim to deliver. Our housekeeping managers have been notified about your remarks with the blackout shades and we thank you for bringing this to our attention. Please do not hesitate to let me know when you plan your next trip so that we make your next stay a 5 star experience. Warm Regards, Billy K Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: HOTEL CLOSE TO EVERYTHING
reviews.content: Our stay at the Warwick was very pleasant. Our window looked at a brick wall, but the room was very quiet! We saw all the scenery we needed to out on the streets. We had a 2-double bed room. It was large, clean, and affordable. We would stay there again on our next visit. Thank you for staying with us and for your positive remarks. We were glad to read that you were able to take advantage of our hotel's central location in midtown Manhattan and look forward to welcoming you back again. Warm Regards, Billy K Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: Fabulous Botique Hotel
reviews.content: The Warwick is an elegant, yet comfortable hotel for business or leisure travel. Staff is well-trained, friendly and helpful. As is often the case in New York, rooms can be on the small side (especially bathrooms with limited counter-top space), but they are well appointed and comfortable. Bedside lighting controls are a real plus, lots of outlet options have been added to the rooms over the years. In many trips here, I have never had an issue with any level of service. Thank you for staying with us recently and for sharing your feedback online. We were happy to hear that you enjoyed your time with us and we hope to see you again the next time you visit New York. Warm Regards, Billy K Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: Art Deco type designed by or for Randolph Hearst.
reviews.content: Mid town Manhatton close to Empire State, Central Park,Chrysler Building,Radio City Music Hall,Times Square etc. Great central location for sightseeing,eating out or in. Reception staff very helpful. Short walk to Central and Penn stations so travelling further afield is not difficult also with a good underground system. Thank you so much for sharing your positive experience during your recent visit to our hotel. We were delighted to hear that you had such a great time and hope to see you again in the future. Warm Regards, Billy K Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: Great Location, Friendly Staff
reviews.content: This is an old school hotel, and small at only 75 floors! It is a short walk to Central Park, Time Square, 5th Avenue - Rockerfeller etc. The room was nice, although no view. You pay extra for that! Would stay again.

reviews.title: Weekend trip with the girls
reviews.content: Excellent location for seeing all the spots in NYC. Easy walk to Central Park, museums, Radio City Music Hall, Broadway shows and Times Square. Close to subway station. Rooms are pretty nice size for NYC. Staff is amazing, very service oriented, polite, generous and friendly. This is an older, quaint vintage-style hotel. Both the restaurant (Mural's on 54th) and bar/lounge (Randolph's) onsite are excellent and convenient. If you want something a little quirky and not a cookie-cutter franchise, stay here! You won't regret it!

reviews.title: Lovely Hotel
reviews.content: This is a find! I've stayed in every kind of hotel in NYC and this one was terrific - reasonable, comfortable, centrally located and sporting nice amenities. The staff is helpful and courteous; this is not always the case in New York. I highly recommend the Warwick. Thank you for sharing your positive experience during your recent visit to our hotel. We were delighted to hear that you had such a great time and hope to see you again in the future. Warm Regards, Billy K Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: Great Hotel in a Great Location
reviews.content: I brought my 3 adult daughters to New York for a long weekend and chose The Warwick because we could all stay in one room. (Many hotels will only accommodate 2 adults in a room) The room size was pretty good for a New York hotel and we managed very well. The location was great as we could walk to the theater, restaurants, shopping and also to Central Park. All staff was very helpful and friendly. Thank you for staying with us recently and for sharing your feedback online. We were happy to hear that you enjoyed your time with us and we hope to see you again the next time you visit New York. Warm Regards, Billy K Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: Great hotel with good resturant and bar, Rooms were airy and bright which gave a freindly feeling of home
reviews.content: Service was very competent in all areas, front desk. restaurant, bar and room service. The rooms were bright clean and of a nice size. The housekeeping staff were their usual congenial nature and all areas of need were attended to in a very efficient manner. A joy to stay there, all employees are extremely congenial. Thank you so much for sharing your positive experience during your recent visit to our hotel. We were delighted to hear that you had such a great time and hope to see you again in the future. Warm Regards, Billy K Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: Beautiful hotel with Perfect location
reviews.content: We stayed for two nights this past week at the Warwick. It had been 20 years since our last stay there and it was just as wonderful as we remembered. Our room was truly magnificent! Our corner suite was beautifully decorated and incredibly spacious. What a welcome retreat! And best of all, the customer service was impeccable, from the reservation making process and front desk reception, to the valet, to room service, to housekeeping. We didn't want to leave. Perfect getaway! Wow! Thank you for returning back to us after a 20 year break. Our team could not have been more thrilled to read that you enjoyed every aspect of your stay. Please do not hesitate to contact me on your next visit so that I can ensure you have another flawless experience. Warm Regards, Billy K Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: So glad we stayed at the Warwick
reviews.content: The Warwick has customer service down pat.....we couldn't have been made to feel more welcome. Breakfast buffet was wonderful and had a good variety of food. Our room was a good size and comfortable - only minor issue is that the a/c is very loud so needed to be kept off all night. Will definitely return! Thank you for having stayed with us and for the glowing review online. We were delighted to read that our team were able to make you feel right at home. With regards to the noise from the A/C , our mechanics have been inspecting all the units in our building to prevent similar instances from occurring to other guests. Thank you again for your time and remarks. Warm Regards, Billy K Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: Great location and ambiance
reviews.content: I have stayed here before and had a great visit this time. Just a great older hotel that is very quiet and has a classic feel. Request hight floor, larger bathroom and a coffee maker and you will be pleased. If you are staying for a longer period of time, pay for a frig ($20 per stay) is nice. Room service was very good and on time both mornings and drinks and dinner (at Randolph's) was memorable. Great bar to see and be seen! Concierge very helpful in reservations and suggestions. I would definitely recommend to friends and will return. Tip: join Warwick frequent stay program for some extra benefits. Easy walk to pretty much anything. Thank you for choosing to stay with us again and for taking the time to share with us your experience. We were delighted to see that you had a wonderful time. We certainly appreciate you highlighting our membership program and advising the fellow reviewers to join. We can't wait to welcome you back again for another visit. Warm Regards, Billy K Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: Two lovely days in Manhattan
reviews.content: The hotel is beautiful. There was a movie filming while we were there, such fun! The staff from the door to the room were fantastic! Great location for shows with very nice attached bar and restaurant. We walked to the theater, museum and High Line. We asked for a room upgrade and they made it complementary. The parking package was only $30 additional, a bargain and easy in-and-out. We're New Yorkers and we're planning to stay again!! Thank you so much for having stayed with us recently for two nights. We were happy to hear that you had a blast in New York and we look forward to see you back again on your next adventure to the Big Apple. Warm Regards, Billy K Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: A Gem in the middle of Midtown
