reviews.content: I am a native New Yorker who currently lives in another city but returns a couple of weekends a month to NYC for leisure stays. For over 25 years, I always stayed at the same 5 star hotel in Midtown. This winter, a friend highly recommended the Warwick for a change of scenery. My friend was 100% right- the Warwick provided 5 star service and facilities for a more reasonable price than the place I had been staying. I stayed in a suite which was not only enormous but beautifully furnished and immaculately kept (with great views of 6th Ave). The staff, from the front desk to housekeeping, treated everyone like they were the most important guest staying there. Randolph's Lounge was a wonderful surprise as well. The vibe was very comfortable yet upscale. The staff were all friendly and attentive. The location is very central whether you are a "tourist" or someone familiar with the city who just needs quick access to the MTA and favorite stores (5th Avenue is one block away!). Long story short, the Warwick is now my hotel of choice in NYC. I just wish I had discovered it sooner. Thank you for your glowing review following your first visit to the Warwick. The team and I could not have been more thrilled to read that you thoroughly enjoyed your time with us. We sincerely hope to see you back more often in the future! Warm Regards, Billy K Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: Great staff
reviews.content: Rudy at the front desk was amazing!!! And I wish for that alone I could provide 5 stars but unfortunately despite having our room changed the temperature in the room never made it below 70 even though in both case the thermostat was set to 62. So both night spent at the hotel was not restful sleeps. I would NOT recommend breakfast in the hotel, the coffee was marginal and was $8 per person!!! T he oatmeal also overpriced and an extra charge for other toppings was ordinary, take the short walk to Norma's for breakfast. The hotel room was nicely appointed and the hotel is clean. Thank you for staying with us and for providing your valuable feedback. Although we were glad to read that you enjoyed your overall stay, we were disappointed that the room temperature could not be lowered. Our engineering mechanics have been looking at all the units in house and we thank you for bringing this to our attention. We hope you will join us again your next adventure to New York. Warm Regards, Billy K Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: Love this gracious hotel!
reviews.content: Shortly before our stay, we were offered the opportunity to try for a room upgrade for a very reasonable price, so we did! Our room was quite large, and even had a wet bar! Wish the bathroom was a little bit larger, though (our only complaint), or offered more storage. But other than that, we were extremely comfortable. Do note that if you want turn down service at night, you have to request it, but housekeeping did a lovely job. All staff made us feel welcome throughout our stay. Hope to visit again soon! Thank you so much for sharing your positive experience during your recent visit to our hotel. We were delighted to hear that you had such a great time and hope to see you again in the future. Warm Regards, Billy K Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: Exceeded our expectations
reviews.content: My sister and I were in town for a full weekend of events at Juilliard. This was an excellent location, a pleasant walk to the Lincoln Center area through Central Park. It was also close to Times Square, and we felt perfectly safe walking back after a Broadway show. We booked a City View King for 3 nights. Check in was smooth despite a significant flight delay (we had an unexpected late arrival at 3:30 AM). The room was spacious and clean and the bed and linens were very comfortable. We were concerned about noise because it was on the 3rd floor, directly over the entrance on 54th Avenue and adjacent to the fitness center, but we found it to be extremely quiet during our entire stay. The "view" was of the rooftop over the entrance, but if you craned your neck just-so you could catch a glimpse of 6th Avenue. Since we spent most of our time out of the room this didn't bother us. The bathroom was nice, a little small, and didn't have a lot of counter space. Only one robe was provided, and the second one we asked for never arrived. We were disappointed there wasn't a coffee maker in the room. When we realized this at 4:00 AM there was nothing we could do about it. We also didn't have time for a full breakfast in the hotel restaurant before we had to be on the Upper West Side, so that made our first morning a bit foggy. But thankfully, with a quick call to housekeeping, a coffee maker was sitting in our room when we returned that evening. We kept meaning to check out the hotel bar for a late night drink, but being on West Coast time we never managed to get back before the12:30 closing. The facade, entrance and lobby of this grand old hotel are so charming. The room exceeded our expectations. And we loved the location. Overall this was an excellent base for our time in NYC. Thank you for having stayed with us and for your detailed remarks following your visit. I apologize your second bathrobe was never delivered to your room even after requesting for one. Our housekeeping managers have been informed of your comments and we want to thank you for bringing this to our attention. Our team were happy to read that you enjoyed your stay and hope to welcome you back again. Warm Regards, Billy K Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: Again, a superb stay
reviews.content: Again, we love the staff, the decor, the quality of the hotel. The location is ideal and if we can afford the rate, this will always be our choice. Our only "con" is that the food prices are quite high so we don't eat at the hotel. But there are lots of options nearby, so it doesn't stop us at all! Thank you for staying with us for another visit and for the glowing review online. Our team were thrilled to read that you enjoyed this visit and hope to see you back again for many future visits. Warm Regards, Billy K Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: Perfect
reviews.content: I stayed there for 6 days with a friend. It was perfect ! The hotel is located near everything you need : metro station, Times Square, Rockfeller, Central Park, shops, restaurants, bars... The personnel is very kind and helpful. Rooms have everything you could need and are comfortable and clean. Very nice stay.... Thank you very much for staying with us for a total of six nights for your getaway trip with your friend. We were happy to read that you enjoyed everything we have to offer and hope to welcome you back again in the near future. Warm Regards, Billy K Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: Horrible customer service
reviews.content: Upon check out I received a statement under my door documenting that an unused $25 food and beverage credit had been applied to my fees and taxes. While I found this surprising since the statement clearly documented this I didn't think to ask about it. After getting home and reviewing my credit card statement I noticed that I had been charged a different higher amount. When I called the hotel to clarify I spoke to Billy K. who claimed he was the manager. He was very rude and unhelpful to me. Would not let me finish explaining the situation and kept talking over me. Basically told me it had been a glitch in the system and there was nothing he would do. Even if he didn't want to refund me the money his approach to customer service and acknowledging the mistake that was made by the hotel could have been handled much better! Dear Ms. mt769, Thank you again for staying with us. We appreciate your feedback. I would like to apologize that your inquiry was not handled following the high standards we keep in the hotel. Please contact me directly jfabian@warwickhotels.com so I can investigate further and assist you further. Regards, Joel Fabian Director of Front Office

reviews.title: Back again!
reviews.content: Back again to The Warwick, this time a holiday, a long weekend, 4 days, with Wife and Parents. Parents first time in the US, my fifth time at The Warwick. Still a fantastic Hotel, staff cannot do enough to make sure you have a great time, rooms and facilities are great, superb comfortable bed. make for a good nights zzzzz! Will be back next time in NYC for sure. Thank you very much for having stayed with us again and with the entire family on this particular visit. We could not have been more thrilled to read that you enjoyed your time and hope to welcome you all back for many future visits! Warm Regards, Billy K Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: Worth a visit
reviews.content: We were not staying here but only visiting the cafe attached. We had the opportunity to visit the 2nd floor and were quite surprised. The main hallway is very old and elaborate from a bye gone era. Quite beautiful. The stairway down to level 1 was a bigger surprise - you must see the photos of the old stars who have stayed at this hotel. I am not going to say, as it spoils the surprise, just go and look. This hotel truly has an eloquent past! Thank you for visiting our bar and lounge, Randolph's, and for taking the time to comment on our hotel's rich history. We hope you will have the opportunity to stay in one of our rooms. Warm Regards, Billy Kang Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: Great place to stay with a intimate feel!
reviews.content: This was our second time staying at the Warwick. The hotel has older world charm and glamour, with the updated conveniences needed for today. We have had the Avenue suite twice, but we also traveled with our friends that each had a standard king room. The standard room was a nice size for New York standards, as well as clean and elegant. Thank you very much for staying with us recently and for acknowledging the historical aspect of our hotel. We were thrilled to hear that you enjoyed everything we have to offer and we hope you decide to stay with us again the next time you visit New York City. Warm Regards, Billy K Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: Gem in Mid-town
reviews.content: I stayed here for a get away weekend with friends. This is a gem of a hotel located in the heart of everything!!! If you are a walker this is the place for you. Within walking distance to theaters, restaurants, sites, shopping, subway stations, literally everything! We had drinks at the comfortable, cozy bar Randolph's and even ate there twice! Heavy appetizers after the theater and once for a late dinner prices and the food were spot on for NYC. The staff are exceptionally attentive and friendly. They helped to make our 3 night stay perfect. Will definitely stay here again. Thank you for staying with us recently and for sharing your feedback online. We were happy to hear that you enjoyed your time with us and we hope to see you again the next time you visit New York. Warm Regards, Billy K Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: We'll Definitely Return
reviews.content: We enjoyed our first stay at the Warwick and will definitely stay there again on our next visit to NY. It's well-located, within walking distance of Central Park, theaters, restaurants, shopping and across the street from MOMA. The staff were all friendly and gracious. Our suite, 2601, although located next to the elevator, was very, very quiet. Both the sitting room and bedroom were spacious and having two closets made it especially easy for us to enjoy the warm, tasteful decor without clutter. The bathroom was tiny but serviceable. Kudos to The Warwick for doing such a great job! Thank you for staying with us for the first time and for the honest and helpful review of our hotel. We were happy to read that you had such a great time that you will be joining us on your next trip to New York. Please let me know when you return so that I can ensure another excellent stay. Warm Regards, Billy K Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: Superb Hotel
reviews.content: Have stayed at the Warwick in the past with my husband but had not stayed there for some time. My overnight stay exceeded all expectations. I picked the Warwick this time for it's proximity to Carnegie Hall and was very pleased with the rate. When I arrived I was told that my room had been upgraded and had a lovely room with a view on the 21st Floor. The Room was spotless and very comfortable and well lit and the bathroom was huge. Had lunch with a friend at Randolph's and the food was delicious, would highly recommend the Quiche. The next morning had breakfast at Murals and it was exceptional most especially the variety and the fresh fruit, pricey but well worth it. Checked out at Noon and asked directions to the Westside Highway and the desk clerk told me that I could go to the garage and exit on 53rd street and go directly there, and when I said I couldn't manage that because of my luggage, the Bellman offered to take it across to the garage. The Warwick is an exceptional hotel, very comfortable and elegant with an absolutely excellent and friendly staff. My room was #2221. I can't wait for my next visit to New York City and a stay at the Warwick. Thank you for visiting us after some time and for the 5 star review online. The staff were delighted to have made such a positive impact on your stay. Please come visit us again soon. Warm Regards, Billy K Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: Long weekend in New York
reviews.content: We spent 4 nights at this hotel. The room was very comfortable as was the bed. The hotel is located just south of Central Park (easy walk) and very close to subway entrances. Walking distance to many Central Manhattan sites and eateries. Thank you for having stayed with us for 4 nights and for your glowing review. We were happy to read that you enjoyed your overall visit and the team and I look forward to welcoming you back again in the near future. Warm Regards, Billy K Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: Just OK hotel
reviews.content: The location of hotel was the most positive aspect of our stay. The room size was adequate but the bathroom was so small that only one person could enter at one time . No counter space to place toiletries etc. The lounge area was quite nice but last call was at 12 AM and we were asked to leave bar area by 12;30. Knowledge of bartenter in making special drinks was quite limited at was selection of cordials Will pass next time we are in city Thank you for having stayed with us and for your review. I am sorry you did not have the 5 star experience we try to deliver to our guests. Your remarks regarding our bar have been shared with our restaurant managers. Please let me know when you plan your next visit so that I can ensure you are blocked in a spacious room. Warm Regards, Billy K Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: great hotel!
reviews.content: first time in this hotel. we enjoyed every day and we stayed 12 nights... big rooms, very convenient location, on 6th av between 54 and 55th st. the staff are very friendly clean rooms. the bathroom is little small and the ac is noizy! Thank you for staying with us recently and for sharing your feedback online. We were happy to hear that you enjoyed your time with us and we hope to see you again the next time you visit New York. Warm Regards, Billy Kang Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: Great location!
reviews.content: Perfect location if wanting to be near theaters, shopping, Central Park and great restaurants. This is an "older" hotel - meaning it's more traditional and conservative in decor and furnishings. Lovely foyer and simple but tastefully decorated rooms. Closet was a little small, but the room itself was big. Check In/Out service was easy, concierge was helpful, noise levels were not an issue. ( We were on the 28th floor). We didn't eat at the restaurants on the property but we did visit the bar - it's open late for an after the show night-cap.

reviews.title: Reasonably priced very comfortable great location
reviews.content: Right in the middle of things in Manhattan, surprisingly large modern rooms, very comfortable bedding, breakfast at the hotel's restaurant was better prepared than most, friendly staff, and reasonably priced for the location. Thank you for staying with us recently and for sharing your feedback online. We were happy to hear that you enjoyed your time with us and we hope to see you again the next time you visit New York. Warm Regards, Billy Kang Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: Derek
reviews.content: This is a well placed hotel it is clean and all rooms well serviced, it does have two major problem's, the first is the quality and price of the breakfast, we ate here once and due to poor service and cold food ate elsewhere for the rest of our stay, the second is the service by waiters and waitress's, the concentrate on business men and women and tourists are treated very poorly by waiter staff, NOT however by front of house staff, after complaining of the breakfast we were reimbursed by the front desk staff. Thank you for staying with us on your recent visit to New York and for your honest feedback. Although we were happy to read that you enjoyed your overall visit, we were disappointed to read that you encountered some difficulties with our restaurant wait staff. Our comments have been shared with our Food & Beverage managers to improve our level of service. We hope you will stay with us again on your next visit to New York! Warm Regards, Billy Kang Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: Wonderful Warwick
reviews.content: Great hotel, superb location to everything: coffee, subway, shopping, Central Park - right in the heart of 5th and 6th ave - in fact just anywhere!! Very good service, friendly check in and concierge staff. Randolph's Bar close to hand for night cap post theatre or jazz. We will return.... Thank you for staying with us recently and for sharing your feedback online. We were happy to hear that you enjoyed your time with us and we hope to see you again the next time you visit New York. Warm Regards, Billy Kang Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: Wonderful hotel
reviews.content: Always stay at Warwick when we are in NYC. Lovely, upscale hotel with absolutely excellent service. Great location, close to theaters and some great restaurants. Love Randolph's ..... always stop in for a drink in this beautiful, cozy bar. Thank you for staying with us recently and for sharing your feedback online. We were happy to hear that you enjoyed your time with us and we hope to see you again the next time you visit New York. Warm Regards, Billy Kang Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: Perfect Spot Near Central Park
reviews.content: We stayed at the Warwick for an anniversary trip on the recommendation of a co-worker. I now owe that co-worker big time! The place was beautiful, the rooms clean and decent sized and all the employees were genuinely helpful and friendly. (I have to point out that this may be the only hotel I've ever been where the mattress did not feel even slightly worn. It was extremely comfortable!) But a big part of the Warwick benefit is the convenience. You are walking distance from many of the city highlights - including only a couple minutes from Central Park and maybe 15 minutes from Times Square. There is also a very convenient subway stop only a couple blocks away. Thank you very much for deciding to stay with us for your anniversary trip to New York City! We were thrilled to read that you enjoyed every aspect of your visit and certainly hope to see you back again in the near future. Warm Regards, Billy Kang Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: Excellent Customer Service and Great Location
reviews.content: My husband and I were celebrating our anniversary with dinner and tickets to see Hamilton. The location was very good. Far enough from Times Square but close enough to walk there and to the theatre district. When we checked in we discovered that I made a reservation for the day of departure instead of arrival. The reservationist was very sympathetic and went out of his way to ensure that we were accommodated at the same rate. The room was fine. It is an old hotel with period decor but clean and classic. The bathroom was shocking. I have seen bigger bathrooms on cruise ships. It was very awkward and tiny. We had drinks in the hotel bar before dinner. Outrageously expensive! The buffet breakfast which was included was very nice, exotic fruits, meats, perfect scrambled eggs and juicy english sausage. We did not actually check out since we had our bill so I forgot to inquire about the $25.00 facility fee. What the heck is that? Also, there was a charge for wi-fi. I refuse to pay for wi-fi and really hate hotels that do this. Thank you for your glowing review and Happy Belated Anniversary! We were happy to read of your comments regarding one of our front desk agents who ensured you into our hotel. Internet access is included with the facility fee you pay and I hope this will not deter you from staying with us again. Please let me know when you plan your next visit to the Big Apple and I will ensure you are blocked in one of our rooms with large bathrooms. Warm Regards, Billy Kang Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: Good hotel, sub-par service
reviews.content: Good hotel, sub-par service. We had two rooms reserved, one for me and my partner and one for my mother and father. I had paid for a room with a city view foe my parents. When we arrived we were greeted by friendly staff but they checked us both into interior rooms. We left our rooms immediately after check-in to make it to a performance we were attending and did not realize the mistake until we returned from dinner, at which point we did not wish to change rooms. When we notified the front desk staff of the mix up during check out, we were treated with an accusatory tone and told that we must have requested rooms on the same floor (we did not) and that was why we did not receive the room we had booked. The price difference was refunded but there was no apology or attempt to make up for the error at check-in I expected more from the Warwick than an accusatory attitude following an error by the hotel staff at arrival and check-in. Thank you for having stayed with us recently and for taking the time to share with us your review. I am terribly sorry for the way you felt treated by our staff. I would love a chance to speak with you directly to gather a bit more information. I can be reached at 212-314-7785 and I look forward to hearing from you soon. Thank you again for your time and remarks. Warm Regards, Billy Kang Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: The Warwick is a Find
reviews.content: The Warwick is well located for easy access to the theater district. The accommodations are excellent and the rooms quiet. The staff are thoughtful and friendly - from the doormen, to the concierge, to the waiters in The Murals. I can't imagine staying anywhere else when I visit NYC. janecP4060ZD, Thank you for staying with us recently and for your lovely review about our property and staff. We were delighted to read how we exceeded your expectations and hope to welcome you back again. Warm Regards, Jenelle Almanzar Front Office Manager

reviews.title: Nice but pricey
reviews.content: We stayed here by accident when realized we booked a non-refundable rather than refundable room by accident. It was more than we wanted to spend. When we arrived the receptionist told us we could have saved on fees and received complimentary breakfast ($32/person/day!) had we booked direct thru them rather than online booking agency. Don't make that mistake! Location can't be beat- walked EVERYWHERE as far as the Met to the north and Garment district to the south. Nice and close to Central Park and far enough from Times Square. Did not try restaurant or bar because too pricey. They did bring us a mini-frig for use in our room for only $20/week, well worth it. Also got use of a coffee maker for free, gotta ask though. Wifi login was a hassle but at least it is free if you go thru the steps. kbs02, Thank you for staying with us and for sharing your review on Trip Advisor. In regards to the facility fee, I would encourage you to join our Warwick membership program. Enrollment is free and easy. Members who book directly with us are eligible to have this fee waived, as stated by the front desk agent. We hope to invite you back again for another visit. Thank you again for your time and remarks. Warm Regards, Jenelle Almanzar Front Office Manager

reviews.title: Always top notch
reviews.content: We stayed at the Warwick once again. It is our go to place when staying near Midtown. Superb service, clean rooms and an interesting place overall. We had a late lunch in the restaurant. Food was quite good and service was acceptable. We will go back to the Warwick again for sure. AvalonJoe, Thank you for staying with us recently and for your lovely review about our property. We were delighted to read how we exceeded your expectations and hope to welcome you back again. Warm Regards, Jenelle Almanzar Front Office Manager

reviews.title: The Classic New York Hotel
reviews.content: If you are staying in the City, the Warwick Hotel is the best choice. It is a beautiful hotel-well located, extremely quiet, with great restaurant amenities. You will stay nowhere else once you have stayed her. Criag514, Thank you kindly for your 5 star review! We are elated to know we are your hotel of choice when visiting NYC. Thank you for sharing your experience with us. Have a lovely weekend, Jenelle Almanzar Front Office Manager

reviews.title: Great location, and a lovely hotel
reviews.content: Stayed here in March, 2017 for 6 nights. I will strongly consider staying at the Warwick again. You can't beat the location, no matter which attractions you want to visit in NYC--it's centrally located so you can get anywhere in the city relatively easily. It is a smaller hotel (I like this) and our room was a King bed which had a street view. We were surprised by how large the room was for NYC. Both the bed and bath were super clean, room service was prompt and friendly-- all good. My only complaint with the Warwick was there are no in-room coffee makers. As is the case with most room service fees in most major cities, the food and beverage were very over-priced, but there are multiple coffee chops nearby if you need morning coffee. I only wish we wouldn't have had to leave the hotel to get our first cup. All in all, I'd recommend this hotel and would strongly consider staying again. EXCELLENT LOCATION! SJSF, Thank you for choosing The Warwick for your most recent 6 night stay in NYC! We are centrally located in the heart of the city and we are glad you were able to take advantage of it. As for the coffee makers, please note they are available upon request; all suites have one. We hope to welcome you back in the near future, coffee will be on me! Have a wonderful weekend, Jenelle Almanzar Front Office Manager

reviews.title: Great - but check which room you get
reviews.content: Superb location for Central Park, Rockefeller Centre and Manhattan and size of rooms is big for New York hotels. Bed was REALLY comfortable and I love that there is a bath as well as a shower for weary travelers. First room I was allocated looked into a dark 'light' well with a big, noisy extractor fan. They changed it quickly and second room was peaceful and bigger but still with little daylight (I have had much nicer rooms in the past so I know they exist). Doorman and Concierge both really helpful. Randalls is good for drink/bite but breakfast rather ordinary. Barbara H, Thank you kindly for sharing your feedback with us. We are glad you loved our bed and that we were able to quickly accommodate you into a new room. We hope to welcome you back for another visit in the near future. Have a wonderful weekend, Jenelle Almanzar Front Office Manager

reviews.title: According to my wife: the best bed ever!
reviews.content: Perfect location, close to everywhere. We also have free sleepers after request. The room is very clean although you cannot see anything from the window based on what rooms you pay for. The resort fee ($25 per night) cannot be waived if you book on Expedia, and you have to book on their official website. This point is not very kind though. Thank you for staying with us on your recent visit to New York City and for the glowing review online. We were thrilled to read that your wife had a great night's sleep in our comfortable beds. Please do not hesitate to contact me directly for your next reservation so that I can make sure you are not billed for the facility fee and to ensure another flawless stay. Warm Regards, Billy Kang Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: Lovely hotel
reviews.content: The location for our two-day trip was perfect. We either walked everywhere ‚Äì or took the subway just two blocks away. Love staying in these older hotels. So much charm and character. We had a premier king on the 16th floor (corner unit) and it was unusually large with high ceilings, spotlessly clean and decorated nicely. Very comfortable. We were there celebrating my significant other‚Äôs birthday and the hotel surprised him with a bottle of Prosecco and chocolate-covered strawberries. A very thoughtful and appreciated way to start our stay. The only negative I had at all is the bathrooms are quite small and there‚Äôs literally no place to put any toiletries or things we typically use. I‚Äôd suggest hanging a few shelves either above the towel rack or over the commode which would be a huge plus. Everyone working at the hotel was friendly and welcoming, making our stay that much nicer. We didn‚Äôt eat in any of the restaurants since we already had plans with others so I can‚Äôt comment on any food. If you join their FREE rewards program (Warwick Journeys), you get free WIFI and room upgrades when available. Check it out for other member benefits. I would definitely stay here again. Thank you very much for staying with us recently and for providing us with your feedback via Trip Advisor. We were happy to hear that you enjoyed your overall stay with us, even if the bathroom size was not to your complete satisfaction. We appreciate your honest review and hope to see you again in the near future. Warm Regards, Billy Kang Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: First Choice For NYC
reviews.content: We happened upon this property using Priceline quite a few years ago but just fell in love with it. The location is perfect. Rooms are very nice and well appointed. Another key is the staff who each seem to take the time to make the experience personal. Since that first stay, we no longer shop hotels when visiting New York, we stay at the Warwick. From a location standpoint, an easy walk to Central Park, Broadway, and everything in between. Just an excellent location. We just left the Warwick yesterday, but have already begun planning our next trip. Oh, this was the first trip that we tried out a suite, as we were taking our nephew, very very nice! Thank you for staying with us recently and for taking the time to share with us some of your experiences. We were happy to read that you had an enjoyable visit and we hope to welcome you back again in the near future. Warm Regards, Billy Kang Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: Unexpectantly disappointed in Warwick
reviews.content: After booking months ahead at a not inexpensive price, was really disappointed to find view in my double room was of a brick wall. Very dreary inside the room. Could not be moved to another room without paying an uncharge. If I had known, I would have booked elsewhere. No clock, no robes and except for front desk, staffers were cold and seemed bothered when asked a question. I would not go back here next time I am in NYC. However, the buffet breakfast was quite good. Thank you very much for staying with us recently and for providing us with your feedback via Trip Advisor. I am terribly sorry you did not have the same positive experience that vast majority of our guests have. It seems you booked your room for one of our interior rooms which is why we were unable to relocate you into a room facing the city. We hope you will give us another chance at turning this experience around. If your travels bring you back to the city, please do not hesitate to contact me so that I can personally handle your reservation. Warm Regards, Billy Kang Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: I couldn't be more satisfied.
reviews.content: I travel to NYC once a year with my daughter for Mom-daughter time together. We always stay at the Warwick. It is in a great location for tourist attractions, dining, walking, getting to Central Park and there are several nearby Metro stops for more distant attractions. I love the ambience of the hotel. It is very clean, staff are friendly and very welcoming. The Randolph lounge is the perfect spot for a glass of wine and relaxation and the food is delicious if you wish to stay in and eat. I do not even investigate other accommodations.......this is where I want to stay. It is a part of what makes the visit to NYC so special. Thank you for staying with us recently and for sharing your feedback online. We were happy to hear that you enjoyed your time with us and we hope to see you again the next time you visit New York. Warm Regards, Billy Kang Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: We keep coming back
reviews.content: Spacious suite with the perfect blend of old world charm and modern amenities. Excellent location is walking distance to all the shows... and a short stroll up to Central Park. Staff is super friendly and helpful - the doorman even greeted us by name! We are in NYC several times a year and this has become our go-to place to stay. We love coming back to the Warwick! Thank you for staying with us again and for sharing your most recent experience online. We are always looking for way to improve so our team were extremely encouraged reading your review. We hope to see you again in the near future! Warm Regards, Billy Kang Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: Great Christmas pied-a-terre in NYC
reviews.content: Great old-style NYC hotel that has the perfect Christmas vibe. Beautifully lit and decorated, it makes you feel like you step back in time. Until you enter the lobby. NYC during the Christmas season is very busy and obviously crowded, but for such an elegant external appearance, the lobby/reception area was very crowded and a bit disorganized. That being said, our room was very large, especially for an NYC hotel. We had a view of 6th Avenue. Very comfortable bed, sitting area and large closet area. We were in NYC for only a night, yet had a very pleasant experience and would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants easy access to midtown and other NYC attractions. Thank you very much for having stayed with us during the holiday season last year. It is too bad that you didn't have more time to spend with us, but we hope that your next stay with us will be longer and just as enjoyable. Warm Regards, Billy Kang Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: Luxurious blend of Old & New
reviews.content: Had the pleasure of staying at this wonderful establishment in February for two nights on a business trip. From the moment you enter the establishment it‚Äôs one classy place, extremely clean, very grand feeling, filled with history. Check in was a breeze, rooms/bed comfortable, clean and charming. Loved all the fresh flowers in the lobby in the middle of winter. The restaurant/lounge in hotel (Randolph‚Äôs) was kind enough to serve something off the lunch menu for dinner and it was the best grilled cheese sandwich and tomato soup ever. The staff were kind enough to assist us with making transportation and dinner arrangements-went to the ‚ÄúBar American‚Äù which was a short walk from the Warwick. Overall loved everything about this place, especially since it‚Äôs not your average cookie cutter hotel-it has a lot of character, history and class. Thank you very much for staying with us recently and for acknowledging the historical aspect of our hotel. We were thrilled to hear that you enjoyed everything we have to offer and we hope you decide to stay with us again the next time you visit New York City. Warm Regards, Billy Kang Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: Very good hotel!
reviews.content: This hotel has an excellent location at the corner of 54th and 6th. The staff here has been really excellent - friendly and helpful across the board. Our first room was a "premier king" on the 6th floor. While the room itself was fine, it faces the back of the hotel which is surrounded by other taller buildings. It was a beautiful day outside and we could not see the sun at all from our room. The front desk told me that this is the case with all of the premier king rooms. Even if we moved up to the 23rd floor, there would still be no sun. It was pretty claustrophobic. We ended up paying to upgrade to a room on the other side of the hotel which made a huge difference. Room is spacious, clean and attractively decorated. I really like this hotel and would return for sure on future visits. Thank you for staying with us recently and for your honest review online. We were happy to read that you enjoyed your room after upgrading to one of our exterior rooms. We appreciate your nice comments about our staff and we hope to welcome you back again. Warm Regards, Billy Kang Guest Relations Manager

reviews.title: No Compassion
reviews.content: Planned a three night stay. Unfortunately, we had to leave a night early and fly across the country for a funeral due to a sudden death in the family. The desk clerk initially said we would not be charged, but the manager overruled her. I wrote the company after the fact, but received no response. They are not obligated to do this, but it would have been the right thing to do. The room was cleaned, and available for another guest - not that it was needed on a Sunday night. I have stayed at their hotels several times in the past, but will probably not return.

reviews.title: Central
reviews.content: My first time in New York. Hotel fine for quick stay but I think any hotel expecting their guests to drink out of plastic cups for coffee and tea with little brown sticks for stirring really let themselves and their customers down. This is what you expect at music festivals not in the middle of New York. Come on what happened to the normal service of cups and saucers. Apart from that hotel fine for stop over to somewhere else.

reviews.title: Good spot for exploring
reviews.content: Spent 3 nights at NYMA. Great location. Rooftop bar on 17th floor with great view of the Empire State Building which is a couple of blocks away. Comfy beds, fluffy towels and a hot shower made this a great stopover. Rooms are clean and comfortable although the windows and curtains could do with some work. Excellent Wi-Fi. Basic breakfast on offer, the bagels are a must! In the Korean district so lots of restaurants close by. HOHO bus stop just at the end of the street for exploring.

reviews.title: Lovely location
reviews.content: Clean room, floor 16th.. We did the booking online .. Tip , you can always request in the comments an earlier checking, and if they're available to accommodate you, they will make it happen.. Let me tell you, they did.. I'm so thankful for the extra mile.. This place Rocks

reviews.title: There are Better locations
reviews.content: We stayed at this hotel for one night before going on our cruise. The rate was good but honestly there are hotels for the same rates that are in much better location. Lots of Garbage cans on street in front. Lots of Chinese restaurants all around hotel. Area is messy and dirty. Honestly I would not stay here again but only for this one reason. Hope that helps.

reviews.title: OK
reviews.content: This is my 2nd trip to NYC. 1st time here at this hotel. We stayed on the 6th floor......I forgot to request a room high up to get away from the street noise. The 1st couple nights was traffic or roadwork noise that woke me up at 4 am.. The 3rd night it sounded like there was a gang fighting outside! The room was small but clean. Location is good. We never ate breakfast there. Staff was ok, not particularly friendly, but you know if you are nice to people it seems to get a nice response back. The good part of being on the 6th floor was taking the stairs down each day, the elevator takes forever as it stops everywhere along the way, and when it does get to you its full. Not sure if I will stay again. I really liked LaQuinta last time.

reviews.title: Great Location
reviews.content: My Husband and I were visiting New York to attend a family wedding and booked the NYMA as it was close to the venue. We didn't realise just how good a location we had until we arrived. Stones throw from the Empire State building, 20 minute walk to Times Square and Grand Central Station, short subway ride to Central Park, 9-11 Memorial and Statue of Liberty. The hotel itself was perfect for what we wanted. 24hr reception, free WIFI throughout (no password needed), concierge service, breakfast included, roof top bar, ice machine on each floor and daily maid service. Our room had its own private en-suite with bath/shower, toilet, sink, etc. A hairdryer was provided in the bathroom and shower gel, shampoo, hand soap and body lotion were also provided. The room contained a safe (no extra charge for use), iron, ironing board, large bed, flat screen TV, alarm clock with ipod docking station, telephone, filter coffee machine, dressing table, chairs, large chest of drawers and wardrobe. We did not have a view as we had requested a quiet room away from street traffic, so this was by choice. The breakfast that is provided includes toast, bagels, fresh doughnuts, cereal, yoghurt, fruit, breakfast juices and coffee. We did not see any tea in the breakfast area but you could buy teabags from the local shop and just use the hot water if necessary. The drinks at the roof top bar were expensive but was the same price as other bars and restaurants in the area. We went to a bar outside of the hotel and the were charging roughly ¬£7.50p per pint! Beers purchased in the supermarket were also fairly expensive so not much difference. The hotel was a really good find and if we return to New York in the future we would definitely book to stay here again. Dear mickeymacc, I‚Äôm thrilled to hear that you enjoyed your stay so much! We are so lucky to be in such an amazing neighborhood and love being able to share it with our guests. Thank you for taking the time to review your stay. We hope to see you again soon! Liz from Apple Core Hotels

reviews.title: Good spot to explore from
reviews.content: Located close to most of the places you will want to visit and well connected with the mass transit system. Breakfast was a bit of a squeeze but the rooms we OK for the price and in reality we spent most of the time out and about

reviews.title: Views from the roof top bar of empire State worth seeing, though it is expensive for drinks
reviews.content: Staff very helpful on reception, not as warm at breakfast !! Breakfast rooms are small considering the number of guests staying, rooms and beds fine. Lifts were not as bad as reviews had made out and we were on the 17th floor. Great venue to be in the middle of everywhere... Dear davidwakefield4, I am glad to hear that you enjoyed our location! We do our best to put you in the center of the Big Apple and all that it has to offer. Thanks for taking the time to review. Hope you‚Äôll visit us again during your next trip to New York. Liz from Apple Core Hotels

reviews.title: Amazing location and cool rooftop bar
reviews.content: Located right near the Empire State Building, this old-school hotel (with a refurbished lobby) is in a great location with tons of excellent restaurants and bars. It's also on a street of Korean restaurants (with karaoke booths if you feel like a song) and a short walk from the subway. The rooftop bar has views of the Empire State so it's excellent for selfies with the skyscraper. The rooms are a little bit shabby (so much brown decor!) but they get the job done. TV worked fine and the air conditioner kept things cool. Bathroom was small but serviceable. Beds are comfy too, and if you ask nicely you can get an Empire State view from the window. This was my third stay and I'll definitely go back again. Dear beagleskin, Thanks so much for taking the time to review‚Äî I‚Äôm so glad to hear you took advantage of the rooftop bar! Aren‚Äôt those views amazing? It‚Äôs our pleasure to do whatever we can to make your trip to New York great AND affordable, and I hope you‚Äôll visit us again. Liz from Apple Core Hotels

reviews.title: Overall, great!
reviews.content: Lovely staff, helpful and personable. No complications with check in, nice, busy area. Breakfast was filling (though your orange juice could be a bit better), amazing transportation links. Only qualm is that there were queues for the lifts and the room decor is a bit dated, but I would stay again! Dear Nahid O, Thanks so much for taking the time to review your stay! I'm so glad to hear that you enjoyed your time with us and especially thrilled to hear that you enjoyed our complimentary breakfast. We look forward to welcoming you back in the future! Best, Liz from Apple Core Hotels

reviews.title: Great location - poor staff :(
reviews.content: Location is wonderful! Staff is a joke. Rude Rude Rude. Because the location was so fantastic we decided to stay another night. I called down to the concierge to see if we could reserve another night. The gentleman I spoke to said "absolutley", told me the price and agreed to "add it to my bill". When I spoke to concierge the next morning the lady working was a beast! Told me that she could not honour that price as I did not have a confirmation number. I told her what time I called, and who I spoke to. Blamed me for not getting a confirmation number when I was not given one at all. I told her how disappointed I was and she made it clear to me that if I was not happy with that rate there are many other visitors in NYC that would be happy to take it. I will never return. Too many other hotels I would feel better about giving my money to. Dear stevin666, I'm glad to hear that you enjoyed our location but I am truly sorry to hear that we didn‚Äôt create a better experience for you during your stay. As much as we love hearing about what we've done well, it's through the constructive criticism and feedback that we can better our experience for our guests. So thank you for taking the time out of your day to do so. Additionally, I would like to apologize for the rude reception interaction that you experienced. Please know that we are continuing to work with our staff members to ensure friendlier customer service in the future. Thank you again for bringing it to our attention. I do hope that you enjoyed your time in New York and that you‚Äôll consider giving us another chance in the future. Best, Liz from Apple Core Hotels

reviews.title: Good Hotel
reviews.content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 days in June with 2 friends. Good hotel, had no problems whatsoever but you get what you pay for, we only really used the hotel as a base to sleep, shower etc. The hotel is in a great location, next to the Empire State Building and close to Times Square, good distance from all main attractions really. The rooms are slightly dated but have everything you need and are clean and comfortable. The breakfast isn't the best but again you get what you pay for. The rooftop bar is great. Overall I would stay here again if visiting New York.

reviews.title: great hotel
reviews.content: This hotel is relatively well located in Manhattan The big drawback of the hotel is the elevator. There are 2 elevators and are not enough to serve the hotel guests. There is always a load and they have to wait a long time. In addition, hotel employees have repeatedly disrupted the elevators to increase their equipment while guests wait Besides the advantages of the hotel: The room is large Very clean Large bed but not particularly comfortable Great internet On the 17th floor there is a pub with views towards the Empire State The disadvantages are: Except for the elevators Low toilet Low bath The furniture is old fashioned The wallpaper is peeled Silcon needs to be replenished in the bath There was a burnt bulb on the ceiling A broken towel rack Breakfast is relatively good Served with disposable utensils Dear ◊©◊ô ◊ë, I am glad to hear that you enjoyed our location! We do our best to put you in the center of the Big Apple and all that it has to offer. And how great are those Empire State Building views? Thanks for taking the time to review. Hope you‚Äôll visit us again during your next trip to New York. Liz from Apple Core Hotels

reviews.title: You get what you pay for...but be careful
reviews.content: Location can't be beat...a block from the Empire State Building, 2 blocks from Macy's, 15 minutes to Times Square. Hotel is very basic, but basically clean. I did not find the front desk stafff to be especially friendly, but the bellman were great and very polite when storing bags. My biggest concern....while I am use to being asked to see my ID, I did not at all appreciate them taking a photo copy of my credit and drivers license, talk about identity theft risk. I was appalled they did this and the desk clerk told me not to worry...they shred it in a week. Really?!? By then the damage could be done, I asked to blacken out my DL number and other info and she let me. But I think this is a terrible policy. No other hotel has ever done this when I have checked in. Could never find the breakfast room. And yes, the elevators are very slow.

reviews.title: Okay, It's Not a Four Seasons But Still.....!
reviews.content: I've stayed at this moderately priced and well-located hotel many times through the years, always aware of the fact that its main appeal is a reasonable room rate in the heart of Manhattan. This last time, though, might have been the deal breaker. The rooms are becoming really worn, the elevator is hopelessly slow, and the quality of the food in the breakfast room keeps skidding. It's just ghastly cheap, for example, of them to serve pre-shelled hard boiled eggs, like the sickly smelling Chinese made bath amenities in wall dispensers. The only reason to do this is to prevent people from taking hard-cooked eggs back to their rooms or making off with little bottles of shampoo and shower gell, and these details tell the whole experience of staying at this hotel. Every last detail has been refined to make it as cheap, cheap, cheap as possible. Again, I get it. New York is a very expensive city, but on the other hand, the deal breaker here for me is that I now know I can find much more comfortable accommodations at similarly reasonable prices through AirBNB or on other websites. I doubt I'd stay here again.

reviews.title: Great location - great staff
reviews.content: Stayed here a few times and it's always great. Location is perfect, staff is friendly, and simply being able to get coffee onsite (all the times, & especially in the AM) is so helpful. Rooms are clean (some are a bit smaller, but not by "nyc standards") Some of the king rooms have a fridge & microwave, which is super helpful for longer stays. Dear gsouerwine, Thank you so much for those kind words! We love our staff and location and are thrilled that you did too. It‚Äôs our pleasure to do whatever we can to make your trip to New York convenient and affordable, and I hope you‚Äôll visit us again soon. Liz from Apple Core Hotel

reviews.title: Good Hotel
reviews.content: My family stayed for a week and enjoyed a very quiet room - bliss in New York! The beds were comfy, the hotel was clean and all the staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. The only slightly negative comment I have is regarding the rooftop terrace bar as we discovered that it was for over 21s only. We were allowed to look at the views but then had to go (it was about 5pm). I appreciate this may be to do with US laws and I don't what to make a big thing if it as the hotel is really good.

reviews.title: Good price - Good Location
reviews.content: Our main purpose was to be near MSG for the Billy Joel concert. The location was perfect for our plans. The rooms as very small but very clean. The bed was comfortable which was one of my concerns. The hotel staff was friendly as well. We went to the upstairs bar although very nice to be outside it was too crowded. The drinks are pricey but it's New York so we weren't surprised. The continental breakfast was cereal, hard boiled eggs, coffee, bagels, etc. It's included in the price so there were not complaints although we didn't eat anything. The air conditioning did not work in our hotel but we were able to open the windows. I did not inform the staff since we were able to open the windows. Since I got the room on a discounted rate I'm assuming that's why our room did not have a view. If you get room 510 ask to be moved. The view is the adjacent building with no natural lighting (we thought it was raining outside since there was no sun) The only issue with the place is that there are only 2 elevators for 17 floors. If you have to be somewhere give yourself extra time (or take the stairs) However, with all my little comments we were happy with our stay. Dear Danie1010, Thanks for taking the time to write such a thorough review! We truly aim to provide our guests with the best accommodations, amenities, and service (without breaking the bank), and it's always such a joy to hear when our guests have enjoyed their visit. We can‚Äôt wait to welcome you back on your next trip to New York! Best, Liz from Apple Core Hotels

reviews.title: They charge for your deliveries!!
reviews.content: I had my assistant deliver some items to my room, and this hotel charged me an additional fee for an extra person, even though she did not stay in my room. I tried to reason with the manager, who barely spoke English to no avail.

reviews.title: THE ONE AND ONLY- NEW YORK-URBAN JUNGLE
reviews.content: We (my husband and I) stay at Nyma the New York Manhattan hotel for 7 nights.We arrive at 11.15 am local time at JFK, we used NYC taxi, you only need to do is to stand in line and you will get receipt. Estimate time to hotel was 45 min , cost with tip 65$. Our room was immediatelly ready, room was very clean, spacious, super comfortable bed, enough space for clothes.Free wi-fi everywhere. Breakfast was on 2nd floor, they served coffee, milk, skimed milk, OJ, pancake, 4 kind of bread, boiled eggs, fruit yogurt, fresh fruits, glaze for pancake and dounuts, cup cake, butter, cream cheese. no meat .but you will not stayed hungry. Our room on 8th. Position of hotel is in Korea way, perfect, only 5 minutes to Empire state building (ticket for adult 34$), 8 minutes to Madison Squre garden- we go to basketball game- one of a kind show). When you leave hotel just accross the street there is a fabulous store with Japanese cake and bread, sandwiches (Tous Le jours), price from 1,5$, you must try lemon iceing cake-look like slice of bread, very tasty and soft like everything in store. Also if you like korean skin care ther is 2 stores with good prices of products. We did not use metro , we walk 16-20km every day and so you can feel that urban jungle and see so many things from great buildings, restaurant, architecture, people, everything. Americans are very polite and frinedly. If you want to shop- no problem , just 5 minute from hotel there is Macy's, Manhattan shopping mall, victoria secret, Uniqlo, GAP, H&M,CVS pharmacy-good price from water- cosmetic, witamins, everything you need. just name it. Must try street food, hot dog, falafel,,,,very chip 1-3$. In Soho you can find very nice galleries, designer shopps, jewelry. We also visit, MoMa (free entrance friday from 16-20pm , sponsor Uniqlo,entrance 54 street), Brooklyn bridge-really breath taking bridge, Little Italy- great choice of restaurant- everyone is great- take cheese cake, pasta with shrimps. In China town you will feel like you are in China , if you like chinese kitchen you are on the right place. We also go to central park, just go and sit and enjoy. Times squre is really fascinating, for someone maybe kitch, for me future. Great Seans pub in 46, 48 street with great food and perfect Super New York cheese cake. Prices in america is without tax, tax is 8,8%..Flatiron building is 15 minutes from hotel and you also have park, you can also find great korean restaurant Barn Joo, they have happy hour from 4pm-8pm, drinks, and remarkable oyster 6pieces 6$, 6 jumbo shrimp 6$, spicy chicken wings 6 pieces 5$, very fashion restaurant, great staff. Over all , in New york is everything fast, big, great, tasty, fashion, sparkly-you will do it again Dear Maja Obili Sara O, Wow‚Äì what a lovely review! I'm so thrilled that you enjoyed both you stay at the hotel and the Big Apple. It's our pleasure to do whatever we can to make your trip to NYC the best it can be and I hope that you'll visit us again soon. Thanks so much for taking the time to review. Best, Liz from Apple Core Hotels

reviews.title: Most boxes are checked
reviews.content: Pros * The rooms, although are small, are very clean. *The air felt fresh. No stuffy. *The bed is very comfortable. *The black out curtains worked a little too well (slept in til 830). *Cleaning staff is sweet and do not disturb when you put the little card out. *The shower had great pressure and temp *Coffee/hot chocolate/cafe mocha/ and filtered water all available up the stairs from the lobby *Complimentary breakfast had plenty and they refilled constantly (cereal, awesome bagels, apples, bananas, pancakes, yogurt, coffee, tea, donuts, toast, hard boiled eggs, cream cheese/jams etc). *Location is super convenient *Roof top bar is beautiful *Zara (not sure of the spelling), the lady seated downstairs is very helpful when planning tours. Cons *The public can use the rooftop bar and do. Zero seating! I believe it should be for guests only. Also this doesn't give a very safe feeling knowing that anyone can waltz into the building when they want. *Every review said the elevators are slow and I thought before I went that it wasn't really a big deal. However I've changed my mind. I killed a lot of time 'elevator commuting' and it was super annoying to wait 10 mins to go down for breakfast and forget something upstairs and wait to go up and wait to go back down. I wouldn't stay there again for that reason alone. I stayed downtown so I could just walk outside and not have to waste time commuting. This wasted a lot more time than i ever expected. *Parking is supposed to be discounted and we had a very difficult time finding it and just chose a different one. That should be a little more clear before check in. Even a picture of the entrance to help or a map of where on the street one can find the entrance. *We requested a room with a view and didn't receive it (we had 710 the smallest). Our view was of a building. I know they can't always accommodate it but it would have been nice if they could have contacted us to tell us it wasn't possible. We would have upgraded our room to get a better view.

reviews.title: Good hotel - good price
reviews.content: The hotel is simple and clean for those without great luxury benefits but who still want a good housing. It is not worth having breakfast, little choice of food and low quality. There is a kitchen-corner with tea and hot drinks available 24/h and it is useful especially in winter for a break when returning from long walks or in the night before sleeping! Staff helpful and efficient reception. Bed is comfortable and quite big (queen size) bathroom clean and practical. Reasonable prices.

reviews.title: Nyma Hotel
reviews.content: Stayed for 4 nights. Really centrally located. All tourist attractions within 15-20 min walking distance.. central park.. times square.. Macys& Empire state 5 min walk. Free breakfast. Comfy beds & clean nice rooms. Great wifi. Not enough elevators & too slow for the volume of traffic in the hotel. Dear Claire F, Thank you so much taking the time to review your experience! We‚Äôre so glad that you enjoyed your stay with us. I hope you had a wonderful time in New York and that you‚Äôll visit us again soon. Liz from Apple Core Hotels

reviews.title: Reasonably priced for location
reviews.content: We've stayed here multiple times. Great place, if you come up from the DC area on Vamoose. The rooms are clean and relatively large. Not fancy, but how much time do you send in your room, when Manhatten is outside your door? Staff is friendly and helpful. Free breakfast available, but not that good compared to what's available elsewhere. Dear RonFG, I‚Äôm so glad to hear you've enjoyed your stays with us! We truly aim to provide our guests with the best accommodations, amenities, and service (without breaking the bank), and it's always such a joy to hear when our guests have enjoyed their visit. Thank you for taking the time to review and for choosing nyma. We hope to see you again soon! Best, Liz from Apple Core Hotels

reviews.title: Great hotel, good location, hilarious bellboys!
reviews.content: I was in NYC for a conference for a week, so the company had booked accommodation at Nyma and I'm glad they did! Located in Koreatown, Nyma is a hop, skip and a jump away from the Empire State Building, Madison Square Garden, Penn Station and some delish Korean food ( & cheap pizza, if you're into that, which my colleagues most definitely were). In other words, perfect location still in the throng of NYC but not overly busy! I stayed in a room on level 16 with two double beds, an ensuite and a telly, and had awesome views across the city. The only downside was that wifi was having trouble that week and wouldn't work in my room - so I needed to sneak out into the hallway to skype home (and by home, I mean my dog). There was a lot of choice each morning for brekky - from fruit to waffles, pancakes, donuts, fruit juice and tea and coffee, bagels and toast with jam, butter, cream cheese etc - and it was all you can eat (not as many options for vegans like myself, but this is totally not a complaint as I'm used to having to cater for my dietary choices). Although the two ladies who often worked at reception weren't the most helpful nor delightful, the young man (I wish I had have gotten his name for you) was a delight and very, very helpful (particularly when we were enquiring about the wifi issue) and provided great customer service. Also, the luggage men were very helpful (and always had a cheeky quip or two as we left and walked back into the hotel) which made for a jovial environment. I can't comment on the price - as I didn't pay - but I was thrilled with my stay (and the rooftop bar). The lifts are notoriously slow but all in all, great experience here. Dear jesscotttt, Wow- thank you for taking the time to write such a thorough and lovely review! I'm thrilled to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. And isn't that rooftop bar great? We are so lucky to have those views and love being able to share them with our guests. We hope you'll be back to visit again soon! Best, Liz from Apple Core Hotels

reviews.title: Good location slow lifts
reviews.content: This is a small decent hotel in a good location. It's near Penn Station in Korea Town, pretty easy to get to many popular sites. Rooms were surprisingly spacious and clean. I had a view of the Empire State Building. The price was good compared to many other hotels. On the downside, the elevator was slow in the mornings around breakfast time. My room was on the 15th floor and on the first day I think I read War and Peace while waiting for the lift and was about to make a start on Anna Karenina. Talking of breakfast, it was included. The breakfast room was rather crowded. There was a spread of cereals, waffles, donuts, some rather tired looking scrambled egg and some fruit. We decided to eat elsewhere. But overall a decent and reasonably priced hotel in a good location.

reviews.title: Falsely advertised & overpriced, rude, ruthless manager
reviews.content: My family booked 4 days here but wanted to leave after being offered a musty smelling, dark cramped room. Unfortunately we had pre-booked so the manager wouldn't let us out of our commitment. After we voiced our concerns we were shown another, similar room. My husband suggested the rooms were nothing like advertised and we were eventually given a lighter upstairs room. The ice machine spat ice loudly all night so we hardly slept! The breakfast room is a help-yourself canteen with no windows, paper plates and cups and bad coffee. There is no service and no cleaning up in the cramped room but...a large "tips" box. The next day my family crossed the road in Koreatown and found a clean, bright hotel with kind and helpful concierge, large bright rooms and for almost US$100 less a night! Dear J H, I am truly sorry to hear that we didn‚Äôt create a better experience for you during your time here. We do our best to provide an accurate representation of our rooms on our website, however, I understand how frustrating it must have been to feel like that wasn't the case. Additionally, I would like to thank you for taking the time to provide your feedback about your stay‚Äì we know that you took time out of your day to do so, so please know that your review will be used to help us improve our ability to meet and exceed our guests‚Äô expectations going forward. I sincerely apologize for any inconvenience this may have caused and hope you had a wonderful trip to New York regardless. Best, Liz from Apple Core Hotels

reviews.title: Decent Price, very simple, good location
reviews.content: My first visit back to NYC in 20 years. If you're looking for bells and whistles, this is not the place, however if you just want a decent place to sleep and shower then this is the place. The continental breakfast was surprisingly decent. A simple breakfast of a bagel and fruit is all we needed and it filled us up. The juice was horrible from the machine and they don't have half and half for the coffee if that's what you prefer. Parking was convenient, although my husband was turned away and I had to ask the manager to help us, so after a few circles around the block, they finally allowed him to park in the garage. The garage was packed with cars and I felt like they just didn't want to deal with anyone else. but that's not the fault of the hotel. the room was very basic not overly modern but clean. the view could have been better and I almost felt like I was looking out of a window of a jail house it was dirty and old. You spend such little time in the hotel it really doesn't matter, As long as my sheets and bathroom were clean which they were that's all that mattered to me. Housekeeping seemed very nice the front desk was not very welcoming at all and in fact, a bit rude. Perhaps they need to pay them a bit more to smile and make people feel welcome, but it's NYC so I guess it was nice for them. They probably deal with a lot of craziness and rudeness themselves. The rooftop bar was nice, but the prices are outrageous . We paid close to 40.00 for 3 mixed drinks. NYC is expensive everywhere. 10.00 for a beer. I had the unfortunate experience of leaving my wallet and Credit cards in the hotel safe. I realized this after returning home. I called and was greeted with a very uncaring attitude and was told to call back at 930 and speak to housekeeping. This girl offered no assurances, or cared at all. I did ask for a return call from the GM (which I never received) It was just another day to her and another guest calling to bug her, or so it seemed. I spoke to the Manager of Housekeeping who was very nice and I was so lucky that the staff turned our personal belongings in. I explained that you can't be too trusting of anyone these days and that I truly appreciated the honesty of their staff. At first didn't understand why they wouldn't call and then she explained the privacy issues surrounding calling and I understood. So after all was said and done, I can say that the hotel is a good location, clean and simple and decent prices (except the bar) and continental breakfast was ok. I would recommend this hotel and would possibly consider staying again but next time, but I think I will shop around a bit more as far as hotel choices go. If you go to NYC make sure you have plenty of spending money because nothing there is cheap, but it's a fun city and a beautiful city for photo ops if you like that type of stuff.

reviews.title: Over Rated Hotel
reviews.content: Great location 5 minutes away to Time Square Garden right behind empire state building. 17th floor deck bar such a cool place to hang out. check in process was very disappointing after a 18 hours flight exhausted booking was no where to be found. Front desk staff that morning were not accomodating at all. And rude i checked in march 11 2017 Rooms are spacious however hallway stinks room is booked with complimentary breakfast not bad at all but dining area is the worst ever. Will not recommended at all. I know new yorks hotels are pricey but this hotel does not worth it at all Dear r12bam, I am glad to hear that enjoyed the location but am truly sorry to hear that we didn‚Äôt create a better experience for you during your stay. I am especially sorry to hear about your experience at check in and sincerely apologize for the rude service ‚Äì please know that we will continue to work with all of our staff to ensure friendlier customer service. I also wanted to thank you for taking the time to give us your feedback about your visit. Please know that we take these reviews very seriously and use them to improve our ability to meet and exceed our guests‚Äô expectations going forward. I hope you enjoyed your visit to New York. Best, Liz from Apple Core Hotels

reviews.title: Friendly staff, good location
reviews.content: We needed to stay another nite in the city and found Nyma for its location and price. It would have been better if we knew where the parking garage ahead of time but that's where the problem occurred . Unloading our luggage in front of the hotel before check-in time we left our vehicle unattended for few minutes . When my husband got back the parking police already writing us a ticket .unbelievable ! Just hoping its waived because it would be a very expensive stay . Other than that we like the hotel . Friendly polite staff . The rooftop bar have a great view of The Empire State Building that is beautifully lit at nite. The rooms are typical NYC size . There's a complimentary continental breakfast It's located in Koreatown and a short subway / Uber ride to Times Square . Lots of restaurants (Korean) and such around . Nightlife is safe . Manhattan Mall is a block away. It's easy to navigate around with a google map. Dear topaktao, Oh no! So sorry to hear about the ticket. I truly hope that was able to be sorted out. That aside, I am glad to know that you enjoyed your stay with us. Thanks for taking the time to write such a thorough review! I hope you had a wonderful trip (ticket aside) and that you'll be back to visit us again soon. Best, Liz from Apple Core Hotels

reviews.title: Well situated hotel, close to Times Square.
reviews.content: I was disappointed on arrival simply as the price had increased (¬£200) considerably since booking it on Booking.com, never do that again. The hotel is well situated for tourists, one very good thing is that breakfast is included, a good selection for most people. the staff were friendly and helpful. Overall the room we stayed in looked quite tired, but generally good all round.

reviews.title: Weekend Trip
reviews.content: Hotel is in a good location, although if you are not looking you will miss it. It kinda blends into the street. Got there early, checked luggage, and was offered coffee. Came back in the afternoon to get room, and opened door to room, and it was a mess! Sheets on floor, dirty towels on floor. Turned around, and went back to front desk and was given another room, and front desk person apologized. So no big deal. Was given another room on higher floor which was nice. Room was clean and normal size for NYC. Breakfast in the morning was good, although pancakes and waffles need warmed up, cold in middle. All and all, would stay there again, cause if you are spending all your time in the room, you need to stay home! Roof top bar is cool with a cool view. Would like to go back and experience that when it is warm, went up to get a quick pic. Only big complaint smell of pot in elevator and floor, more comical than a problem. However I am sure that is not what the hotel wants as an image, especially if you are booking families. Dear Jamie- Dickey U, Oh no! So sorry to hear about the mixup with your first room. Our apologies about that one. Additionally, thank you for letting us know about the smell in the elevator. I sincerely appreciate your light heartedness on the issue, however, it's certainly something that will be brought up to management. That aside, I am glad to hear that you enjoyed the higher floor and rooftop views. Isn't it just gorgeous up there? Definitely come back when it gets warmer! It's a wonderful space to be able to enjoy a drink and take in the city. Thanks for taking the time to review‚Äì we hope to see you back very soon. Best, Liz from Apple Core Hotels

reviews.title: Good Hotel at a Convenient Location
reviews.content: It is difficult to find a hotel at a budget rate in the heart of Manhattan and I found this hotel very convenient and centrally located for my business meetings. Though the rooms were a little smaller than I expected however, they were comfortable and the breakfast was pretty standard.

reviews.title: In the middle of the partyzone
reviews.content: Stayed here with 2 teenager children. Spot is perfect situated: just behind Empire State Building, only one block away from Times Square and near the main subway stations. Beds were perfect but the rooms were dusty (especially the vents, windows the wall decoration and the carpet could be cleaned once more. The breakfast was.....well how should we put it.... if you think a yoghurt, bananas an apple and a cup of coffee is the definition of breakfast in that case they serve breakfast..not to forget even a boiled egg..... Service of the reception was friendly and good. Nevertheless 130 usd/night/room for 3 persons was not too bad considering the spot. Oh yeah, they got a really nice rooftop-bar! Dear Robin V, Thank you so much for taking the time to review your experience with us. I'm so glad to hear that you enjoyed the rooftop bar‚Äì aren't the views up there just gorgeous? We hope you and your kids enjoyed your stay and hope to see you again soon. Next time, remember to book directly through our website for the best deals! Liz from Apple Core Hotel

reviews.title: Great hotel
reviews.content: Me and my partner stayed here for 5 nights part of our 5 week tour of america. Our room was great, clean and warm, a decent size... Loved the shower. Maid service everyday with clean fresh towels. Staff really helpful, didn't have any problems with the lift . breakfast on the second floor really good to start your day. My only downside is the expensive rooftop bar. Defiantly stay there again.

reviews.title: High Tax City
reviews.content: Stayed at the NYMA hotel, great place to stay. No complaints. BUT why do I have to pay a JAVITS CONVENTION FEE, I never was in it I don't even know were the place is. is this a New York City rip off. Breakfast is Adequate for a good start to the day

reviews.title: Family reunion
reviews.content: This hotel is well positioned between 5th & 6th avenue, the rooms had everything you need including a microwave, fridge and tea and coffee making facilities. The rooms were very clean and comfortable with maid service every day, they were warm and there was ample fresh towels everyday. Breakfast was included which was good, it was located on the second floor, it included cereal, yogurt, eggs, fresh fruit and many different types of bread including bagels and cream cheese, there was also a toaster if required. We found this helpful as it got you going until you found somewhere to eat for lunch. Above reception there was free hot drinks all day long and the staff were always really helpful. They also have a roof top bar which is really cosy with great views of Empire State. The only downfall is the drinks are expensive which is expected but they were not worth the money. Overall we would definitely stay here again

reviews.title: Average rating only due to location !
reviews.content: This is my second - and final - visit to this hotel. It is in great location for exploring Manhattan but hotel is now very dated and in my opinion, quite dirty - especially curtains in bedroom...would not take much to wash them and freshen up room. Very unhappy with my room on arrival and asked for move which was accommodated next day - second room certainly slightly bigger but not much better in decor/cleanliness. The cleaners do their best but rooms need deep clean to improve their appearance. And as for Rooftop Bar - what a rip off !!!! Very expensive and bar tender almost demanded tip - for what....I went to bar and paid extortionate price for pleasure ! Would not recommend this at all which is a pity as view is amazing on roof

reviews.title: Christmas break
reviews.content: Stayed at this hotel in December for a Christmas break with my husband, location is fantastic and most tourist attractions are a walk away. Had a fantastic breakfast each morning, typically bagels, waffles, pancakes, cereals fruit and yogurt, however this is exactly what I expected to eat for my breakfast in New York so was quite nice. Rooms were very clean and comfortable, beds were huge. Customer service was fantastic and the concierge new exactly the right advice for us when we asked. I would definitely stay in these apartments again.

reviews.title: Great price, nice place!
reviews.content: My boyfriend and I recently stayed at Nyma when we visited NYC for a concert. The price was fantastic for the city although I was a little nervous based on some of the reviews I had read. I am so happy that we decided to give Nyma a chance! Check in was a little slow but that is to be expected with how busy the place was. After a long car ride I just wanted to get to the room and shower. We stayed on the 10th floor. I was pleasantly surprised when we entered the room. It was pretty big for the city! The room was very clean and I was happy that we had a private bathroom lol. I've stayed in places before in NYC that were double the price and everyone on the floor shared one bathroom. So this made me happy. The water pressure was great! Plenty of towels. I liked the soap and shampoo dispensers that Nyma supplies. I have long hair and those little travel bottles don't do it for me, plus it all smelled great. I loved that the Empire State Building was directly across from our room! The bed was super comfy. We checked out the rooftop bar. It was really neat and cozy. The hotel itself is smack in the middle of Korea Town. There are plenty of choices for food. We are pizza people. If you are too I highly suggest New York Pizza Suprema! Omg. Best. Pizza. Ever. They are within walking distance to the hotel and also offer FREE delivery:) The free breakfast at the hotel wasn't too bad.
