All in all we enjoyed our stay at the Nyma and will definitely be return customers! Dear Dani K, WOW‚Äîthank you so much for taking the time to write such a detailed review. We think the location is pretty great, too‚Äîand how about those views?! We can‚Äôt wait to see you again on your next trip to the city. Next time, book your stay directly through our website to receive the best rates available. Liz from Apple Core Hotels

reviews.title: Good Hotel
reviews.content: It was a really nice stay overall. We were in NYC from Dec, 24th to Jan 01st. The breakfast was ok with several donuts, toasts, coffee and juice, it was a standard meal. The only problem we faced was the elevator. It¬¥s really really slow! If you forget something in your room going up and down might take you 20 minutes. Regarding the rooftop bar, it was really nice and the staff friendly although it was a bit pricey...

reviews.title: Great hotel
reviews.content: We were both incredibly excited to visit New York for the first time, our stay at this hotel did not disappoint us and is a fond memory of our time in the city. Check in was quick and easy and first impressions of our room were good. We found it to be a good size, including the bathroom, and very clean. The bed was huge and incredibly comfortable. Great amenities - large TV, coffee making facilities, safe, ironing board/iron, soap in the bathroom. Another plus is the free wifi, which was actually very good, I never had a issue with it being slow. The only negatives I have were that the room was a little dark, even in the middle of the day with the curtains open and there was a funny smell in the corridor. We chose to get breakfast out most days but we did have breakfast at the hotel twice during our stay. Good selection of cereal, bagels, toast, muffins, pancakes, waffles, fruit, yoghurt, boiled egg and beverages. I've probably forgotten things too! You can't go wrong when it's free. We found a table straight away both times despite eating at peak time. The location was fabulous, just a few minutes from a subway station where you can be anywhere in the city in a matter of minutes. Times Square was close by, Macy's was across the road (pretty much) and there were a good selection of shops and restaurants a stones throw away. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. We had seen previous reviews about slow elevators however only found them to be an issue one time. The rest of the time we didn't wait more than a few minutes which we were happy with. Overall we found the hotel to be excellent value for money and would definitely stay again. Dear Ris26, I‚Äôm so happy to hear you had a great stay and made some new memories here in New York, and thank you for taking the time to review your visit with us. We look forward to seeing you next time‚Äîand if you book your future visits directly through our website, you‚Äôll receive the best rates! Liz from Apple Core Hotels

reviews.title: Girls Christmas Holiday Weekend
reviews.content: You can't beat the location; right in the middle of Korea-town and one block from the Empire State building. Everyone from the people at the front desk to the cleaning ladies, were extremely friendly and accommodating. The rooms were clean and fresh, and since the price included breakfast, it was a no brainer. This is our second time staying at the Nyma, and I would definitely stay there again. Dear Chicana2K, WOW‚Äîthank you for your kind words. We love our staff, and especially love to hear when they go above and beyond. We look forward to welcoming you back on your next trip to New York‚Äîand be sure to book directly through our website for the best available rates! Liz from Apple Core Hotels

reviews.title: Good stay until the issue at the end
reviews.content: Last year I stayed at this hotel because of the great prices offered. I have heard stories of how small rooms in NY can be. This room to me was not that small. I traveled with my husband, 13 yr old son and 2 yr old daughter. The hotel is in a great location. Centrally located to everything. When we arrived to the hotel it was around 11am and the hotel was able to give me my room already which was nice. We had a small issue with the AC which was fixed right away.The room has a microwave and small fridge which is a plus considering my daughter still drinks milk before bed. The rooftop bar is a cute little place that has some yummy drinks. The chocolate martini was fab. I have two complaints though. The first is the elevator. During breakfast time it is very difficult to get on the elevator. This is something the hotel probably cannot change so just beware you might have to wait at times. My other complaint had to do with the car service I ordered from the hotel. First of all it was an older mini van. I would expect something nicer. When I got to the airport after the driver left, we noticed that there was some type of cream colored grease on a piece of luggage that I had just purchased for this trip. When I called the hotel the next morning to complain they told me that the driver had nothing in his vehicle like that. I explained to the manager that if it wasn't the van it must of been the room my luggage was stored in. In the end they did nothing regarding the damage to my bag. Because of that, I will not stay again. I am going back to NY in a few weeks but will stay across the street at a different hotel. Other than that issue, my stay was good.

reviews.title: Great stay at nyma
reviews.content: The location was great! We had friendly service, a clean and quiet room plus a good rate. Though, I would stay above 6th floor if street noise is an issue for you. Easy access to subways. BTW, Subways were super easy to use. Not sure why tourists shy away from them. I can understand some of the negative reviews about nyma but smaller rooms and older hotels don't really bother us. I usually rely on the hotel provided soap and shampoo so I wasn't a big fan of the liquid dispensers. The bed was super comfortable. I think it was one of those memory foam mattresses. Anyway, will stay there next time in NYC. Happy travels. Dear Dan S, I‚Äôm thrilled you had a great stay with us at NYMA! It‚Äôs our pleasure to provide our guests with the best accommodations, amenities, and service, and do it without breaking the bank. We can‚Äôt wait to see on your next trip to NYC‚Äîand be sure to book directly on our website for the best available rates. Liz from Apple Core Hotels

reviews.title: Perfect hotel Perfect location.
reviews.content: Having read the previous reviews for this hotel i was a little worried however i was very happy and relieved when we arrived. The reception staff were friendly which made for a very easy check in. Our room was perfect for the 2 of us with everything we could need. It was clean and tidy with the most comfortable bed i think i have ever slept in!!! The best thing came when we opened the curtains and saw the amazing view of the Empire State building!!! That was an amazing surprise as our normal luck it to be over looking a car park!!! Breakfast was exactly what was needed... coffee tea juices bagels waffles pancakes,,, the perfect food to set you up for a day of sightseeing! The location of the hotel is perfect... you are literally at the centre of everything!! All in all it was perfect!!! :)

reviews.title: AMAZING HOTEL RIGHT IN THE CITY
reviews.content: Stayed here form 01/11/2016 to 01/17/2016 first time ever in NYC & needless to say I had an awesome time at this hotel but truth be told I was more in the city than in the hotel since time square is only a few blocks away. The hotel is located right in Korea Town which I found extremely interesting due to all the unique places to eat and things that could be found. If you‚Äôre looking for an extremely modern hotel this might not be your choice, hotel is a little out date but for the price can‚Äôt beat it and whose going to stay in the hotel when your walking distance to everything. Pro: - Hotel has good room service, clean towels every day. - Room was a double bed room and had more space than expected. - FREE breakfast is always a good thing not to mention buffet. Props to Michael who was in the breakfast room and always made sure everything was stocked super nice and had everything nice and tidy. - GREAT LOCATION & very affordable, I can‚Äôt stress this enough, I had read other reviews stating that it was very noisy but of course if your right in the city what‚Äôs to expect. - Check in & Check out was very smooth, nice and easy the staff at the front desk were very nice and sweet. Customer service I would rate 100 because staff is ALWAYS willing to assist you. - If it‚Äôs your first time or have any questions about where to go, subway inquires or things to do concierge Zra is you go to girl, this girl was awesome she knew EVERYTHING there is to know what trains to take, what things to see in what cities, what to do, where to eat, etc. This girl helped us so much, I can‚Äôt thank her enough! - Rooftop bar is a must check out, awesome view. - Train station right down the street. Cons: - During breakfast time waiting for the elevator is a pain, it could have been due to the dates which we stayed but it was better to take the stairs. - Elevators are slow. Overall this hotel suited our needs, it was the first time in the city and I can say that this hotel was awesome had a great time, staff where super nice. I would totally stay here again & recommend it hands down. Dear tahiramarie, WOW‚Äîthank you for such a thorough review! Beyond the elevator speed, it sounds like we managed to deliver services that helped make your visit a great one. We hope to see you during your next stay in Manhattan. Next time, try booking directly through our website for the best available rates and even better service! Liz from Apple Core Hotels

reviews.title: Koreatown nyc
reviews.content: room was great a king room was over 2x bigger than standard hallways are very narrow and the elevators are super slow as staff are also using them day staff very helpful but to be in this location walk to Amtrak

reviews.title: Probably the worst hotel I have ever visited
reviews.content: Fantastic location but apart from that it was awful. Customer service in this place is non existent, the lifts take approximately eight minutes to arrive after you press the button. The third floor for the week I stayed there smelt of Marajuana and the steps of urine. The gym equipment (the only one) was out of order and one of the treadmills did not work. Breakfast... don't bother. Extremely disappointed. Wouldn't recommend neither return. Dear Robby M, I‚Äôm glad the location was fantastic, but I am truly sorry to hear that we didn‚Äôt create a better experience for you during your stay. Please understand that your review matters to us, and we will use it to improve our ability to meet and exceed our guests‚Äô expectations going forward. I hope you‚Äôll consider giving us another chance in the future. Liz from Apple Core Hotels

reviews.title: Great location. Suited our needs
reviews.content: Arrived from the airport and the welcome was friendly and helpful. A porter took our luggage to the room which was not the biggest room (family room for 4 with 2 double beds) but I believe this is normal in New York. We had everything we needed though - coffee maker, iron, toiletries. Took a trip to the rooftop bar which afforded a fab view of the Empire State Building. The biggest shock was when we got into bed. They were the most comfortable beds any of us have ever slept in. Absolutely beautiful and gave us a great nights sleep. Breakfast was continental but very plentiful and lots of choice. It was to a good standard too and you could help yourself to as much as you like. The news was on every morning which helped for knowing what the weather would be doing. The staff were very helpful at reception. The coffee lounge on the mezzanine floor was a welcome addition after a day sightseeing. And we were able to leave our bags on our last day and come back and collect later. The location of the hotel was amazing. Very central in the middle of Korea town with plenty of food outlets nearby and a subway station at the end of the road. A great place to sightsee from and not overly expensive. Would recommend it.

reviews.title: Amazing location
reviews.content: The hotel is really good value for money! Absolutely insane location, right next to the Empire state building in a Korean part of Manhattan. Would 100% recommend to anyone visiting NYC. The room is pretty basic but I didn't spend much time in the hotel anyone, only to sleep. The breakfast is alright, continental. Again, I only had a quick breakfast and off I went to explore the city. There is a lovely rooftop bar with a lovely view of the Empire state building. I would definitely stay there again!

reviews.title: Very rude staff
reviews.content: Staff was rude, and didn't seem to know what was going on, wouldn't listen, had my reservation magically canceled and had no explication even when I showed him my confirmation email, got conflicting info from two different guys at front task, and they had no interest in helping. Would never recommend or stay here.

reviews.title: Despite some staff members being friendly....
reviews.content: It didn't hit the mark. One of those hotels where they update the lobby but the rest of the hotel is gritty and out of date. The breakfast is pretty poor for its star class. I stopped going after a few visits and bought from outside. I had asked a meme bet of staff at breakfast if we could have hot coffee as it was like warm... he pointed to the microwave ....I read other reviews where people said similar of breakfast and the lift is really slow but thought it couldn't that bad. Yes it's enough for me not to return. There are hotels in the same price range doing better out there Dear Guest, I‚Äôm truly sorry to hear that we didn‚Äôt create a better experience for you. Please understand that your review matters to us, and we will use it to improve our ability to meet and exceed our guests‚Äô expectations. The complimentary breakfast selections we offer are meant to help kick start your day and get you to your first destination without delay, but I understand your frustration. I hope you‚Äôll give us another chance: next time we‚Äôll have something more to your liking! Liz from Apple Core Hotels

reviews.title: Good Location and VFM, but Very Basic
reviews.content: Stayed here on business in November 2016. I ended up here for a night at the end of a recent business trip, as I had to extend a day and couldn't stay on at my existing hotel. The main factor was cost, and this hotel matched those expectations. The hotel is in a very central Midtown location in Korea Town (great food all around). Most of the tourist sites are also close enough including Times Square, Empire State Bldg, Madison Square Park, Union Square, and the shopping at Heralds Square. Also close enough to most businesses in the Midtown area. The hotel checkin was smooth and I ended up chatting with the reception staff, a friendly guy from Delhi, for a bit. The room I had was quite large (for NYC) and on a high floor. It was quiet and spacious, about all one can ask for in NYC. The aircon worked well, as did the TV. The bed was a bit hard for my liking...I remember thinking when will the mattress give a bit. The quietness surprised me since the street level in K Town is quite noisy. Cleanliness levels were fine...nothing to remark on either way. Overall decent but all was very basic...but I guess that's their USP...value and decent lodging. I didn't eat breakfast here or avail any other service. As several people have mentioned, the elevators were slow but thankfully I didn't have to use them much. Overall, it's decent enough but a bit too basic for my preference. If it weren't for the work budget, I probably wouldn't stay here. But, it serves the purpose, and that's all that matters.

reviews.title: Good location
reviews.content: Very handy location, in walking distance of main shopping areas. There is a smell of smoke lingering the halls. We also had a constant smell of bleach in our room and the corridor. Staff were pleasant to deal with. The breakfast may be complimentary but we did not eat it. There is not a lot on offer for it at all. Dunkin' donuts around the corner, we got breakfast from there. Dear Fiona G, Thank you for your review. We hope you had a great time in New York City and we hope you visit again soon. Please contact us directly to book your next stay. Liz from Apple Core Hotels

reviews.title: Love this place
reviews.content: Stayed for a night. Excellent price. Love the rooftop bar! Great location to Penn Station. I loved all the Korean ambience on the block, plenty to eat. The room was very clean, nice bed and amenities. Definitely will stay there again. Dear dirtyjim1359, Thank you for your review. We hope you had a great time in New York City and we look forward to welcoming you again soon. Please contact us directly to book your next stay. Liz from Apple Core Hotels

reviews.title: Awful hotel
reviews.content: Tons of people smoking outside the entrance, so you have to walk through a cloud of cigarette smoke before even entertaining the hotel, but the smell doesn't goes away. We checked in fine and then waited at least 10 minutes (no joke) for the slowest elevator and then it was a mad rush to get on, people were incredible rude, but figured let them all take the elevator and be rude to each other. Our room (1210) was a mixture of cigarette smoke and Febreeze! The room was so run down, god knows what we were walking on with that carpet, heard every door slam and the ice machine! When looking at the floor plan by the elevator, we had the smallest room on the floor there. The TV didn't swing out so not sure how you could watch tv if you wanted. The bathroom was equally disgusting - nothing say we don't trust you like built in soap dispensers. I guess you get what you pay $200+ for a quick overnight stay, but I'm sure I could find something more comparable and modern than this dump. Dear SuferBetty, Thank you for your review. We‚Äôre sorry you were not more pleased with your stay. Some of our rooms are smoking rooms, but we do have many non-smoking rooms available as well. Unfortunately, we cannot control those smoking outside the hotel. The elevators can get a bit held up during busy hours of the day. We apologize for any inconvenience. Our housekeeping staff works very hard to make sure the rooms and bathrooms are cleaned thoroughly. We will continue to work with them to ensure we are maintaining the highest standards of cleanliness. We sincerely apologize for any inconveniences you faced during your stay. We are continually working on improving our services for our guests. We pride ourselves on providing a great value in a great location. We hope you give us another chance in the future. Liz from Apple Core Hotels

reviews.title: Not smoke free
reviews.content: Just checked in and on the 3rd floor. Room STINKS so bad of smoke... Yuk! Room size is adequate and lobby is small. For $300/night would expect a little more. No frills hotel. Not sure I would return. They do offer free breakfast and I'm hoping it's better than the smelly room. Dear MARY G, Thank you for your review. Our hotel is not a smoke free hotel and we do have smoking rooms on every other floor. You can always request a room change if the smell is too unpleasant for you. Liz from Apple Core Hotels

reviews.title: Perfect!
reviews.content: We are just finishing our visit here at the nyma and have enjoyed every second!! We came here for a week on the 9th December 2017 for my birthday and honestly could not fault this hotel! The door staff are very friendly, the concierge were very helpful when we checked out they ensured they booked us a taxi to the airport from our hotel so it was 1 less thing to worry about. We had to pay $100 deposit when we arrived which we weren't made aware of so that was a bit inconvenient but we got it back at the end of the week so it paid towards our taxi. The hotel is in a brilliant location! Central to everything!! The rooftop bar has great views of the empire state building especially at night! The rooms were clean and efficient and we're cleaned very well each day! The only thing I would change is the air con / heating system it is so loud! Even when turned off it some how manages to turn itself on and make a noise / blew out cold air which wasn't ideal in December, however, the trip was so tiring we slept through it every night! If I was revisiting new York city I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. Couldn't think of a better location! It was our first time in new York city and I've loved every minute! Thanks again for all of your hospitality. Dear KarleyReed_x, Thank you for your kind review. We‚Äôre glad you enjoyed your first trip to New York City. We hope you have another opportunity to visit again soon. Please contact us directly to book your next stay. Liz from Apple Core Hotels

reviews.title: Clean and excellent location
reviews.content: I visited here with my partner for a 5 night stay before Christmas. We thought the location was perfect as most tourist attractions uptown are just a walk away. The rooms were clean with a comfortable king size bed and television. The downside was the breakfast which consisted of paper plates and bowels and a selection of pastries. However this didn't bother us too much as being in NYC we were keen to try out all the diners for our breakfast. Overall I'd recommend the nymph, very good value for money. Dear kendall2202, Thank you for your review. We hope you had a great time in the city and we hope to see you again soon. Please contact us directly to plan your next trip. Liz from Apple Core Hotels

reviews.title: Great price, great room, great staff
reviews.content: We visited the first weekend in December 2016 and were pleasantly surprised the friendly staff not only said they could hold our luggage since we'd arrived earlier than check-in, but they also delivered our luggage to our room when it was ready. I've stayed in MANY hotels around the world and was very impressed with how much all the staff went out of their way to say hello, can we help with anything. I would not hesitate to go back and stay here again. Great location, too. Dear Peg T, Thank you for staying with us. We‚Äôre glad you enjoyed your stay and hope you had fun in the city. We hope to see you again soon. Please contact us directly to book your next trip. Liz from Apple Core Hotels

reviews.title: Way better than it's competitors
reviews.content: We've stayed in so many of the mid price ranged hotels in this area over the years. No loyalty here, we usually go with the cheapest. My husband and I both agreed this was our favorite so far. Primarily because of the large size of our king room and how quiet it was. The staff is super friendly, everything was spotless and the location is perfect. Herald Square is a few blocks away where you can catch a subway to get you anywhere in the city you want to go. This hotel is a really good choice to stay while visiting the city. Highly recommend. Dear AuntJeanie, Thank you for your review. We‚Äôre glad you enjoyed your stay and hope you had a great time in New York City. We hope to welcome you again soon. Please contact us directly to plan your next trip. Liz from Apple Core Hotels

reviews.title: Perfectly Midtown
reviews.content: It was our first stay in NYC, we live in Philly so we normally come in for the day. The location is great, walk to the Empire State Building, Broadway (at 6th Ave) and the Subway. Its exactly what you should expect for NY, small but nice room, no fridge in the rooms, the bathroom was bigger than we expected for Manhattan. The elevator is the slowest elevator I have experienced in a while. Lucky for us we were on the 3rd floor and were able to take the stairs. If you do take the stairs; they are slightly steeper than what you may be used to. The price was very good and that was all we cared about for that particular weekend. If we were going to stay over in NY again, we would probably stay here again. Staff was alright at the front desk but we checked in at a bad time. The housekeeping staff was INCREDIBLE, so very nice even with our requests. Its walking distance to a CVS, which we needed twice in the 2 nights we were there. Dear DWhite1157, Thank you for your kind review. We‚Äôre glad you enjoyed your time in New York City. We hope you visit again soon. Please contact us directly to book your next stay. Liz from Apple Core Hotels

reviews.title: Great Location
reviews.content: First time in NY so didn't really know what to expect, hotel is in a great location right next to the empire state building, the roof top bar gives a fantastic view of the aforementioned. The hotel is a clean comfortable no frills type of place. Our room was on the sixteen floor and was very quiet. Breakfast is basic, but we had no problem getting a table although the dinning area is small and busy. Like others have mentioned the elevators are slow, there are only two to serve 17 floors, but other than that I would definitely recommend the NYMA for its location, cleanliness and comfy beds Dear Andrew H, Thank you for staying with us. We hope you enjoyed your time in New York City and we hope to see you again soon. Please contact us directly to book your next stay. Liz from Apple Core Hotels

reviews.title: Simple and Clean but...
reviews.content: Very central, 1 min from Empire State Building and about 5 Mins from Macy's, MSG and Penn Station. Not beautiful by any means, but it's clean and it's easy to find with the close proximity to Empire State. I would recommend a non-smoking room. Unfortunately I didn't mention this in the booking and unfortunately the smell of cigarettes lingered in the room from previous visitors. Friendly concierge helped get car to airport and it was very pleasant. Would definitely return. Dear Adrian G, Thank you for your review. We‚Äôre sorry you received a smoking room. We are always happy to move guests to a different room if there are any available. We look forward to seeing you again in the future. Please contact us directly to plan your next trip. Liz from Apple Core Hotels

reviews.title: Def recommend!
reviews.content: Have travelled to New York the past few years with family for some Christmas shopping. This was the best hotel we have stayed in by far. We have stayed in much more flashy hotels but this was by far the most clean comfortable and best value for money! Brill location, close to macys, Empire State, subway. It was so central & walking distance to Times Square. There was a really nice Japanese restaurant next door called amiko. Room was really clean, we had 2 double beds, there was a free safe in our room, a microwave, fridge freezer, coffee maker, ice machine next to our room, free tea coffee all day in lobby, wifi was free and worked great, and a free breakfast in the morning, breads bagels waffles pancakes eggs fruit yoghurts juices.. The room was really quiet and we never heard a thing the entire time we were there. Def recommend hope to return again next year. The lift wasn't even that slow? We loved it. Dear Jenna C, Thank you for your review. We‚Äôre glad you enjoyed your stay and hope you had a great time Christmas shopping. We hope to welcome you again soon. Please contact us directly to plan your next trip. Liz from Apple Core Hotels

reviews.title: K-Town Gem!
reviews.content: I love staying at the NYMA in Koreatown. This hotel is situated in mid-town Manhattan. The staff is super friendly and helpful. I have stayed here numerous times. The hotel is very clean and offers a complimentary breakfast. My recent stay was during Thanksgiving to attend the Macy's Parade with my husband and teenage son. We enjoy staying at the NYMA. The proximity to the Empire State Building and Macy's is within a 5 minute walking distance. Times Square is a 10- 15 minute walk. I love the location of this hotel. Close proximity to Subway access at the end of the street. The rooftop bar at the hotel has heaters and has a gorgeous look up view of the Empire State Building. Great location!!!! I would like to see the hotel update the rooms a little. However, the cleanliness and friendliness of the hardworking staff will always bring me back! Love the NYMA! Dear margo43, Thank you for staying with us when your visit New York City. We‚Äôre happy to be your go-to hotel when you‚Äôre in town. We look forward to seeing you again soon. Please contact us directly to plan your next visit. Liz from Apple Core Hotels

reviews.title: Best location to discover New York
reviews.content: Just home this morning from a 6 night stay at the nyma hotel which I had booked back in February for myself and 4 others - my daughter (12), sister, friend and her daughter (15). Unfortunately I made the mistake of reading updated reviews of the nyma during the few days leading to our trip and got quite nervous that i may have made a mistake in booking this hotel, even though I am a firm believer of NOT believing everything I read as there is no pleasing some people (but there was so many negative reviews)! I need not have worried! We made an excellent choice in this hotel and have come home with great memories of New York unspoiled by a bad hotel. The hotel was extremely clean at all times even during the very busy breakfast period, our rooms were too and more than adequate to meet our needs - had a safe, tea/coffee making facilities, flat screen TV, iron,hairdryer, shampoo, soaps etc.... Of course cleaned every day with fresh towels (some rooms had fridges too). Yes, I agree with the reviews about the slowness of the lifts but that was at the very busy breakfast period when housekeeping needed to use the lift as well as the customers (obviously no service lift!). But then, when on holiday, what's the rush? As for the breakfast? I'm still trying to figure out what the problem was? there was plenty of choice - fruit, yogurts, cream cheese, pancakes and/or waffles, boiled eggs, plenty of bread for toasting - brown and white, bagels, jams, syrups donuts of many varieties, tea/coffee, juice, etc... and everything topped up every few minutes leaving nothing to run out of! and STILL very clean during the breakfast 'rush hour'. Yes, the breakfast areas are very small, but it's a buffet and you want to get out and explore, everyone came in, ate and left! no waiting around for tables - and STILL the place was very clean and not a single member of staff appearing to be harried or rushed and all very nice, polite, courteous and friendly. We found that all the staff were very helpful. Nothing was a problem to them. WiFi signal excellent too. We did not use the gym nor the rooftop bar, so cannot comment on those. The ESB is literally around the corner, with Madison Square Gardens, Penn Station, Macy's and Herald Square within a block or 2. The only criticism I have is the fact that the signage is not lit up outside. It would be nice to be able to see the hotel from a distance (end of the block). We will definitely come back to Nyma and have already started to recommend this hotel to people for 2017! Keep up the great work! Dear Sharonf2007, Thank you for your kind review. We‚Äôre glad you enjoyed your time in New York City. We hope you have another opportunity to visit again soon. Please contact us directly to plan your next trip. Liz from Apple Core Hotels

reviews.title: Great location, clean and friendly.
reviews.content: Spent 3 nights over Thanksgiving period. Stayed in a king room. Staff very friendly and helpful. Very busy on Korea st in the evenings and night. Hotel great location for many of the sights and close to Penn station. Brekkie had nice coffee and good stodgy carbs to get you through the day. Main Breakfast room a little overly warm what with the toasters and such. Great donuts! Nice little spot with tv and coffee just off reception to chill on our last day prior to leaving. Dear Thwibbles, Thank you for your review. We hope you had a great time during Thanksgiving and we hope to see you again soon. Please contact us directly to book your next stay. Liz from Apple Core Hotels

reviews.title: Good lower midtown location
reviews.content: Stayed here during Thanksgiving in a Deluxe King. "Deluxe" adds a refrigerator and microwave. Good location in Korea Town, close to Metro & Macys parade route on 6th Ave. Within reasonable walking distance to Midtown attractions & Times Square. Clean rooms, friendly staff. Can check your bags if you want to sightsee before check in or after check out. Dear Thomas M, Thank you for your review. We hope you enjoyed Thanksgiving in the city and we hope to welcome you again soon. Please contact us directly to book your next stay. Liz from Apple Core Hotels

reviews.title: Loved it
reviews.content: Stayed here with my family for 5 nights. Can't fault anything at all with this hotel. Rooms clean and spacious. Hotel staff v friendly , courteous and helpful.location excellent. Will definitely return. Got an extension on our room from 12 checkout time to 4 for 58 dollars, was well pleased. Dear carolynn m, Thank you for your review. We‚Äôre glad you enjoyed your stay and hope you had a great time in the city. We look forward to seeing you again soon. Please contact us directly to plan your next visit. Liz from Apple Core Hotels

reviews.title: Like an expensive Motel 6
reviews.content: This is a functional hotel, with absolutely no ‚Äòbells and whistles‚Äô. There are about 176 rooms in this 17 story hotel with 2 elevators carrying 22 people in total. The housecleaning staff must also use the same elevators. Be prepared to spend time staring at the elevator display sign. The breakfast room has one table for every 11 hotel rooms packed into about 400 square feet of space that also contains the food in the typical buffet style. It is not a leisurely experience. The available food items are meant to end the stomach growling, nothing more. The person on duty does his job but he does not add to the dining experience as he is dressed like he slept on the street the previous night. The internet and the television work sporadically. Overall, the hotel needs redecorating. The furniture is chipped, some doors don‚Äôt open properly and the wallpaper is coming off the walls. For New York, however, it is relatively inexpensive, the rooms are reasonably clean and quiet, the beds are comfortable and the housecleaning staff do their job well. Dear Durward2013, Thank you for staying with us. We‚Äôre sorry you were not more pleased with your stay. The elevators can get a bit held up during busy hours of the day. We apologize for any inconvenience. We are continually working on improving our free breakfast to better satisfy our guests. The majority of our guests are very happy with their stay. We offer an excellent value in a great location. Most hotels in Manhattan do not offer free breakfast, wifi, and domestic phone calls. We hope you reconsider us for any future visits. Please contact us directly to plan your next stay. Liz from Apple Core Hotels

reviews.title: Great location, no issues.
reviews.content: Stayed here for 6 nights. Great location right beside 5th Avenue. Very handy for Metro and attractions. Good and basic breakfast which was included in room price. Two double beds for 3 of us, but room was a little on small side. No need for the chest of drawers. Room and bathroom clean. Lifts very slow as stated by other reviewers. Good wifi. Staff friendly. Would stay here again. Dear ashewood1, Thank you for staying with us. We‚Äôre glad you enjoyed your stay and hope you had a great time in New York City. We‚Äôre sorry the room felt a bit small for 3 people. Our rooms vary in size somewhat, but most are about average for hotel rooms in Manhattan. We hope to see you again soon. Please contact us directly to plan your next trip. Liz from Apple Core Hotels

reviews.title: Compact and clean
reviews.content: First time New York and nyma hotel. Good location . Approx 20min walk to Times Square. Stayed 5th floor looked out onto courtyard so quiet . Stayed family room . Two double comfy beds slept well. Good amenities. Very clean in good order. Shower good. Breakfast plenty of choice and complimentary beveridges in small guest lounge all day. Rooftop bar didnt use as had child and weather cold. Staff not over friendly but seemed efficient. Room maid lovely and deserves big tips. Information area in lobby helpful. Paris baguette next door great . Used couple times for snacks in rooms. Would use hotel again. Out all day sight seeing so this hotel perfect. Dear Gaynor T, Thank you for your review. We‚Äôre glad you enjoyed your stay and hope you had a great time in New York City. We hope to welcome you again soon. Please contact us directly to plan your next stay. Liz from Apple Core Hotels

reviews.title: Security and Safety Issues
reviews.content: This is was my 4th stay at this hotel. I've stayed here in the past because it was clean and near places I was visiting, but I had never had any concerns in the past, so it was upon this 4th stay I've learned the most important thing you can know about how a hotel truly function is to see how they respond in emergency situations, because no matter what, these arise. At 11:30 pm on Saturday October 8th, 2016, someone starting banging and kicking on my hotel door on the 5th floor. I braced myself against the door while my roommate called security. They said someone would be right up. Five minutes later, the man (I could see through the peep hole by this time) was still banging on my door, kicking it, and then turning around and running and ramming into my door and another right across the hall from me with his body. By this time I could tell he was drunk or high, but even as myself and the other guest in the room across from mine kept screaming "wrong door," he kept trying to ram the door down and would say in response, "How can it be the wrong door?" I continued to hold the door, and my roommate called down AGAIN and was told someone was STILL on their way and should be there soon. We begged them to hurry. After more than TEN minutes of continuously kicking and banging on my door and the one right across the hall, the man threw up, and then stumbled off. We called down again and told the front desk the man had left, but he threw up. They said thank you, they would watch for him (they could see him on the security cameras in the hall) and would send up house keeping to cleanup the throw up. Thirty minutes later he was back. screaming, but not kicking this time. We called again. He did leave this time and I didn't know what had happened. 15 minutes later, he was back screaming in the hall. We called again. I heard security this time talking to him. We were called at 1:30 and told they had taken him out of the hotel and he would not be back. The next morning I asked to speak with manager of the hotel because we had another night to stay in the hotel and I wanted to know what they were doing in regards to instances like this to ensure that security was able to respond to a call in less than ten minutes when someone was trying to break down a door! Had he had more malicious intent, or been successful who knows how this will end. I was told there was no manager in that day and they wouldn't be in until the next day. I asked again when I checked out the next day and was told the manager would not be in until after I had checked out. I spoke with the guest with the room across from mine the Sunday and they had made similar calls repeatedly as he banged our doors for that 10-15 minute period. with no one coming up. I emailed the manager and explained the situation after I returned hom. He replied and told me that the person trying to break down doors was a guest in the hotel, and he had been all over the hotel on multiple floors and they had trouble catching him. I emailed back and told him that he was in front of my door and didn't move from my view for over ten minutes and had they responded to my initial call in 10 minutes he woudln't have had a chance to roam the hotel. I never received a response to this. Guest or not, hotels need to have something in place to respond to situations that are as potentially dangerous as this. No, you can't stop the occasional guest who does inappropriate things, but you can have a plan in place that ensures the safety of your guest when things do arise. I will no longer stay here because my security is more important that any of the benefits of this hotel. I don't feel security if the hotel is unable to respond in over ten minutes when myself and another guest repeatedly called for over ten minutes tell the front desk someone was trying to kick down my door. Dear c9ann, Thank you for your review. We sincerely apologize for not being able to handle the security issue quicker. This is not something that happens in the hotel often either with guests or non-guests. We did do our best to catch the guest. We will continue to work hard on our security efforts if something like this were to happen again. We hope that you will give us another chance for your next trip to New York City. Liz from Apple Core Hotels

reviews.title: Not worth the money
reviews.content: My spouse and I met my niece and her partner here for the night. What you actually get is far different from the beautiful photos that are seen online. Breakfast was horrible with absolutely no seating sufficient enough to accommodate even a third of the guests. There was nothing but carb loaded items and pre-peeled boiled eggs for breakfast if you could even get to the counter. After fighting my way to the counter I was extremely annoyed that there was not even creamer available for the horrible coffee. I was so disgusted I just left everything. The hallway always smelled of smoke and not the kind of smoke from cigarettes. The worst part of the whole stay though is hoe they processed the accounting. They had pre-authorized and held the cost of the room plus incidentals however after checkout instead of just releasing the difference from the hold amount and the cost they proceeded to charge the FULL amount of the room. This caused serious problems by tying up almost $1000 for one lousy night and forced us to shorten our stay. I have stayed at several hotels in Manhattan all for around the same price range but they all had much higher standards. As a note to management your patrons don't care if you offer free WiFi and breakfast if they are otherwise treated terribly and have a horrible experience. Breakfast means nothing if you don't eat it! The lifts are also the slowest I have ever experienced! Word to the wise spend a bit more and stay with a reputable chain without shady accounting practices that puts the blame one their guests instead of taking accountability ( I personally have several years in customer service including hotel management and have never experienced this). Dear Margrette D, Thank you for your review. We‚Äôre sorry you were not more pleased with your stay. The majority of our guests are very happy with their stay because of our excellent location and competitive prices. We hope that despite your experience with us, you enjoyed your time in New York City and we hope you reconsider us for the future. Liz from Apple Core Hotels

reviews.title: Would stay again
reviews.content: We were very happy with our room. It was basic but clean and the bed was very comfortable. The elevators are slow but it seems to be a busy hotel. Free breakfast was decent, but the breakfast area is very small and it's hard to get a seat every morning. Having free wifi was great! Hotel was in a great area and could walk to most thing. Would definitely recommend to friends and will stay again next time we are in NYC. Dear ag080, Thank you for your review. The elevators can get a bit held up during busy hours of the day. We apologize for any inconvenience. We hope you had a great time in the city and we look forward to welcoming you again on your next visit. Liz from Apple Core Hotels

reviews.title: Still A Great Value
reviews.content: My husband and I just spent another 3 nights at nyma last month, a decision based on our previous stay two years earlier. Prices all over Manhattan have really jumped up since our last trip but even at the current AAA rate, it was still a relative bargain compared to any other place we were considering. And once again, we were really only in the room to sleep. Unfortunately I forgot to request a room away from the street but we were away from the elevator. As a result, on the up side we had a pretty good view of the Empire State Building from our window -- which probably would have been more exciting had we not previously lived in Manhattan -- and on the down side we heard lots of banging and thumping in the wee hours when there must have been materials being delivered or moved for the adjacent construction site. Aah, New York! Always under construction! However, we had one day planned for downtown and the other for uptown which once again made this midtown location ideal for us. Both Penn and Grand Central stations are an easy walk, the Fifth Avenue bus is practically outside the door. Other than the construction noise (which is a gamble at any hotel in any large city and beyond the hotel's control although you would think there'd be a noise ordinance governing construction sites) which only disturbed me our final night, the room was clean and well lit, the bathroom a bit small but adequate, the water pressure good and the complimentary toiletries still in wall mounted dispensers. But the all important rubber mat was waiting in the shower, the bed was comfy, the a/c efficient and fairly quiet so, really, what more do you need when you are going to be out seeing the sights every waking minute? Dear FootlooseAndGFree, Thank you for sharing your experience on Tripadvisor. We‚Äôre glad you enjoyed your second stay with us and we hope to see you again soon. Liz from Apple Core Hotels

reviews.title: Excellent 'budget' hotel
reviews.content: Great location, free breakfasts and WiFi and a huge room with a fridge and microwave. The views from the rooftop bar are spectacular, the staff are very friendly and the location is top notch. We hacked the breakfast by bringing our own real orange juice, vegemite and avocados (surprisingly difficult to find in NYC). Good selection of cable channels and for the price, you won't find better in midtown. Highly recommended Dear Lawrie C, Thank you for your review. We‚Äôre glad you enjoyed your stay and hope you had a great time in New York City. We hope to see you again soon. Liz from Apple Core Hotels

reviews.title: Unfortunately not worth it!
reviews.content: This was my fourth time in NYC and I've paid really decent prices and had no problems. As we were going to get married we thought the roof top bar would provide some great photos and the free breakfast clinched it for us. When we arrived and first walked into the room the smell was vomit inducing. The maid had just been in and we concluded the smell was something that had been sprayed. It smelled like a public bathroom. It was so bad we put the do not disturb on the door for our entire stay so it didn't happen again. On the first night we had just gotten into bed around 1am and 20 minutes later we were woken up by a young man banging on our door and trying to get into our room. After I shouted at him he disappeared but came back later, banging on all the doors and disrupting the entire floor. I called reception and their response was, 'yeah a few people have called about him'. That was it. The breakfast is decent but there are not enough seats, you can take the food to your room but everyone else will have the same idea and the elevator is so slow there will be 10 people waiting infront of you. The doormen were very nice, other staff not so much. Location can't be beat though. If you are the kind of person that takes photos of every crack in a tile and chip off the wallpaper avoid. If you are looking for a similar price but a decent stay go to one of The Pod hotels. Dear Phunky_Phish, Thank you for staying with us. We‚Äôre sorry you were not more pleased with your stay and we apologize for the disturbance. We hope you enjoyed your wedding in the city despite the stay, and we hope you reconsider us for any future visits. Liz from Apple Core Hotels

reviews.title: Could be improved
reviews.content: Apparently we did not get a "newly renovated" room. The room had an unpleasant smell, was old, in need of repair (tile, vents, caulking, curtains). But the staff was courteous, and the location was great. Dear linda m, Thank you for staying with us. We‚Äôre sorry you felt the room was old and in need of repair. We hope that despite your room, you enjoyed a pleasant time in the city and we hope to see you again soon. Liz from Apple Core Hotels

reviews.title: Not great for the price
reviews.content: I visited with my partner and family for one night. After tax we paid about $340 for a room with 2 double beds and you definitely don't get value for money! The room was comfortable, but service wasn't very friendly and the atmosphere wasn't very nice at all. The elevators were ridiculously slow as well! Breakfast room was pretty mediocre fare- all carbs and boiled eggs in a crock pot which just looked disgusting. Overall the room was not bad but I thought it was overpriced for a low range hotel in Korea town. Dear Livvie W, Thank you for your review. We‚Äôre sorry you did not feel like you received a good value for the price. Our rates vary throughout the year, but we always have very competitive rates. Most hotels in Manhattan do not offer free breakfast, wifi, and domestic phone calls at our price range. We hope you consider us again for any future visits to New York City. Liz from Apple Core Hotels

reviews.title: Okay for the price, but not great
reviews.content: The room we got was not one from the pictures, it looked much older in reality. Not as clean as we expected. There were hair on the bathroom floor and in the bed... Very dirty rugs, wall paper peeling off and you can hear everything outside and even inside. Our room was next to the gym and elevator, so we woke up to the sound of the threadmill or people talking next to the elevator. We got a smoker room, and they tried to cover the smell with cheap air freshener. The result was a very strong unpleasant and nauseating smell. The bed was ok and so was the breakfast. Basic, but not horrible. The location was from walking distance from all the biggest attraction in NYC. We picked the hotel for the price and location and in that sense it was the best we could find. We only went to the hotel to sleep, so it didn't bug us that much. But if you're picky, you might want to pay more and get a higher end hotel. Dear Guest, Thank you for your review. We‚Äôre sorry you were not more pleased with your stay. We are continually improving our services as our guests‚Äô comfort is very important to us. We will continue to work hard to maintain the highest standards when it comes to cleanliness. We hope you had a great time in New York City and we hope you reconsider us for any future visits. Liz from Apple Core Hotels

reviews.title: Mid-Price Manhattan
reviews.content: Going to NYC was always going to be a tough ask to find a reasonably priced hotel in The Big Apple. The NYMA Hotel's location is in an excellent location, Penn Station is 2 blocks away and 34th and Herald Square station is at the end of the block ( about 60 meters away from hotel), which was great as we relied on the Subway to get around New York. The room was standard, was clean,functional, it had the amenities expected (but no pens or note pad or CNN, BBC). Our accommodation also included breakfast, which can be summed up as standard fare, but it kept us full (which is the goal) Housekeeping, Doormen and Buffet (breakfast) staff very friendly and professional. There was one concierge staff member (male) who wasn't helpful when we asked him for information on how to get to a particular place we wanted to go to.. It seemed like it was a big effort for him to look into it for us. If I were to go back to New York I would stay at the NYMA again. Dear Luv2tripabout, Thank you for staying with us. We hope you had a great time in New York City and we‚Äôre glad you enjoyed your stay. We look forward to welcoming you again soon. Liz from Apple Core Hotels

reviews.title: extremely poor quality for $ 250 / night
reviews.content: The room is old and lacks basics like electrical plugs next to the bed. The counter drawers open by itself from old. The bed is big and comfy. The corridors have a strong smell, not quite chemical cleaning product... not sure what it is. The breakfast room is a mess, super small for the size of the hotel so gets packed, everything served in paper plates and bowls, no health option. You do yourself a favor having breakfast outside. The staff is quite unwelcoming, telling you to "figure out a plan B" in case your payment, that has worked already, doesn't cover all the stay. Well located but incredibly noisy, even on the 12th floor. Dear emily984, Thank you for your review. We‚Äôre sorry you were not more pleased with your stay. We are continually working on improving our services as our guests‚Äô comfort is very important. The majority of our guests are very happy with their stay. We offer an excellent value in a great location. Most hotels in Manhattan do not offer free breakfast, wifi, and domestic phone calls. We hope you reconsider us for any future stays. Liz from Apple Core Hotels

reviews.title: Great location, standard room
reviews.content: For the price this hotel is really good value for money when compared to neighbouring hotels. We stayed for six days and found the location unbeatable! The subway stations on 34th street means you can get to Central Park or downtown very easily! It was a great hub! The hotel is located in Korea town, and I would ignore any other comments left by other reviewers on noise! It was fine, we could hardly hear anything ( we were based on the 13th floor, out of 17th). In terms of the hotel, the room is standard - don't expect anything special. There was enough room and the facilities were adequate. The only negative thing about this hotel was the lifts - officially the worlds slowest lifts, and the breakfast! However if you walk down the street there are plenty of deli options, so we didn't actually eat at the hotel. The staff are helpful and they provide a luggage room between check out and your flight. Would Defo recommend on the basis of the location vs. Price. Dear Hiral P, Thank you for your review. We‚Äôre glad you enjoyed your stay and hope you had a great time in the city. The lifts can get a bit held up during busy hours of the day. We apologize for any inconvenience. We hope to welcome you again soon. Liz from Apple Core Hotels

reviews.title: Good location, good value
reviews.content: Nyma hotel is a good hotel to spend some night in NYC (1-3nights). Empire Estate is only 3 min walking and there are many shops and restaurants around the area and subway. The price is very good, it provides quite completed breakfast and the rooms are full equiped. Dear Ramon C, Thank you for staying with us. We‚Äôre glad you enjoyed your stay and hope you had a great time in New York City. We hope to welcome you again soon. Liz from Apple Core Hotels

reviews.title: Excellently located, comfortable rooms
reviews.content: We stayed here in mid September as a first tour of NYC for my wife and my third time in the city. We planned our itinerary (as anyone who is only in NYC for 3-4 days should always do if you want to see as much as possible) and chose NYMA on the strength of both its location in Manhattan and the reviews we'd read on here. As my title states, the hotel is EXCELLENTLY located. As it was my third time here, and nearly ten years since the last visit, I felt confident enough to navigate the public transport network system in order to get from JFK to Manhattan. Penn Station is ridiculously easy to get to from JFK either via the Long Island Rail Road or the subway. From Penn Station you're looking at less than 7 minutes in almost a straight line to get to NYMA. At this point I would strongly suggest that anyone reading this with a smartphone downloads an App called "citymaps2go" by a developer called Ulmon. This app was absolutely superb for use offline (data charges with EE in the states are astronomical) and the search facility for anything you could want to look for also works offline once you've downloaded the map of the city you want. So, the hotel - well we were put into a room on the very top floor, which was great as it was situated about 4 steps from the rooftop terrace bar. The downside of this is that when visitors to that bar leave it (it closes at 2300 in the week and 0100 thur fri sat I think) they have zero regard for the fact that they're still on a floor with rooms, and tend to make a lot of noise whilst waiting for the only lift. The main reason I didn't need to complain to the hotel (or to the inconsiderate individuals making the noise) was because we were generally so exhausted by our busy schedule that we slept like logs! The aircon is a must in most hotels and the mini heatwave that NYC was experiencing when we were there meant that we had ours on through the night. Whilst we didn't need to use the hotel services or staff for anything, my experience with them was that they were helpful and friendly. The free safe in the room was a nice touch given that most places charge for such amenities. Breakfast - in a nutshell, don't bother. It's likely that whoever you book with, it will be offered as "free". There's a reason for that. It's rubbish. You wouldn't pay for it if you were served it and the fact you're serving yourself in a room that seats about 25 people means it's just a gimmick. If everyone resident in the hotel actually used the breakfast facilities each morning it'd exceed NYC fire regs by about 10:1. Something tells me the hotel knows this! We popped in to sample it despite having already planned to eat out each morning. Delis and diners are easy to find within the local area and if you find a good one the food is amazing. Overall, we would definitely stay at NYMA again, the location and comfort exceeds any negatives we could have picked at - just make sure you find a good breakfast! Dear Playa_de_Blues, Thank you for your review. We‚Äôre sorry you were not pleased with our free breakfast. We offer this to all of our guests and it is open from 6:30am-10am, so not all guests are grabbing breakfast at the same time. We hope you had a great time in New York City and we hope you visit us again soon. Liz from Apple Core Hotels

reviews.title: old hotel but excellent staff
reviews.content: i didn't like the first room that they ushered me so i told the bellboy and he kindly took us to a nicer room.. love the staff that catered to our needs... very nice people and i feel really like a family rather than a customer. Good location as well close to times square, bryant park and korean resto nearby was really good. will write a separate review about it we will be coming back! Dear Shelathexplorer, Thank you for staying with us. We‚Äôre glad you enjoyed your stay and hope you had a great time in New York City. We look forward to welcoming you again soon. Liz from Apple Core Hotels

reviews.title: Youth Hostel for 4 star price tag!
reviews.content: This hotel is an insult even to a youth hostel. My small family paid US$365 a night for a single room crammed with 2 double beds. There was no room for our suit cases or anything else. On arrival we were shown 2 dark, stale rooms on the 5th floor with carpet so worn is held years of odour! We told the hotel we were bitterly disappointed so they put us on the 14th floor in a slightly lighter room of the same size. At around 3:30pm each night we were woken by an ancient ice machine that dropped ice regularly of its own accord. Breakfast: it was included so we had hope. What greeted us in the windowless and crammed room was the tip box and several rubbish bins filled with paper plates and plastic utensils. The coffee, from an urn, was weak and disgusting. There were the cheapest tea bags and 2 low fat mills. To eat: bagels, donuts, cold pancakes, bread, boiled eggs, apples or bananas..That's it! I've been to more welcoming youth hostel on previous travels through Europe, before having a family. When we asked for a price reduction the manager practically laughed in our faces. There are dozens of other decent hotels in the very same NY block! My family moved down the road to the Radisson and were immediately greeted by smiling door men and bellboys. Our luggage was safely stored and we were given a neat, clean room overlooking Broadway with enough space for 3 suitcases and some! And all for US$100+ less per night! Dear J H, Thank you for your review. We‚Äôre sorry you were not more pleased with your stay. Our rooms vary in size somewhat, but most are about average for hotel rooms in Manhattan. Our rates vary throughout the year and even throughout the week, but we always offer very competitive rates. Most hotels in Manhattan do not offer the free amenities that we do like breakfast, wifi, and domestic phone calls. We hope you and your family enjoyed your time in the city and we hope you reconsider us for any future visits. Liz from Apple Core Hotels

I got early and check in was only at 3 pm, fortunately the attendant arranged one room for me before my meeting. Breakfast is poor though and there was not enough space to all guests. Dear Augusto P, Thank you for your review. We‚Äôre sorry you were not more pleased with the free breakfast. We are continually working on improving it. We do have an extra room adjacent to the main breakfast room with a few more chairs and tables for our guests. We hope you choose us again for any future lodging needs when visiting New York City. reviews.title: Worst Hotel I Have Ever Experienced!
reviews.content: A horror from start to finish! FILTHY!!! Bed was all lumpy and wavy. Wallpaper was peeling off everywhere. Paint was missing from all moldings and door-frames. Old, dark, drab, depressing. Industrial soap in commercial dispenser falling off wall, the type one encounters in public restrooms of stores. Dirt marks on everything. Closet doors warped and unable to close. TV on opposite area of room to bed, not enabling watching from bed.. Desk also facing away from TV. Horrible odours in room and throughout hallways. Lobby and hallways depressing and ugly, narrow, old, dark. WORST hotel I ever stayed in and I stayed in many, all over the world. Musty odours and dirt-caked on everything. Linens and towels were of Dollar Store calibre. I did not want to touch anything anywhere in the room or bathroom. Would not use the moldy tub on a bet! Breakfast was very poor quality in every respect. I WOULD EXPECT TO FIND BETTER AND CLEANER IN A $50 HOSTEL OR FREE SHELTER. Absolutely nothing in the way of redeeming features!!! And for all this I paid $229 CDN. I've stayed in lovely, clean hotels for a fraction of this cost. Dear Joyce O, Thank you for your review. We‚Äôre sorry to hear your experience was anything less than perfect. The conditions of your room were not up to our usual high standards. We pride ourselves on our clean and comfortable rooms. We will discuss the issues you faced with our housekeeping staff. We can assure you that your experience was not typical. The majority of our guests are very happy with their stay and find their room to be clean and comfortable. We also offer an excellent value in a great location. We hope you reconsider us for any future visits to New York. Liz from Apple Core Hotels

reviews.title: NYLO*****
reviews.content: Our home away from home! Dear halpey1, We‚Äôre pleased you were able to take advantage of our minifridges. Sorry that the noise from the air conditioner was an issue. We appreciate your being so understanding and we‚Äôve made note of your room number so we can make sure it‚Äôs been repaired. Hope you‚Äôll stay with us next time you‚Äôre in New York. Warm regards, Connie

reviews.title: Nice location
reviews.content: NYLO is located in the UWS. Close to subways and buses. Easy access to all parts of NYC. Low key, restaurant and bar attached. Great that you had a chance to visit our roof deck. We appreciate your review and hope you‚Äôll stay with us next time you‚Äôre in New York. Warm regards, Connie

reviews.title: Disappointed

Dear MC6912, We always want our guests to feel well taken care of and we regret that that wasn‚Äôt the case during your stay. We should have handled your valet request more promptly. The room conditions you describe certainly aren‚Äôt up to our usual standards and I‚Äôd appreciate the chance to connect so I can better understand what went wrong and ensure we fix it going forward. Could you please email me at cwang@nylo-nyc.com? We hope you‚Äôll give us a chance to make this right next time you‚Äôre in the city. If you have any concerns know I can always be directly reached through my email. Warm regards, Connie

reviews.title: The NYLO, New York

The deal breakers for me; unavailability of Refrigerators in the rooms, and no microwave too! Dear calebiniolou, We‚Äôre happy you liked our overall vibe. Good news, minifrigdes and microwaves are both available upon request. We know how many tempting grocery stores and restaurants there are in the neighborhood and always want to give our guests options. We‚Äôre sorry we didn‚Äôt let you know about that option when you checked in. We hope you‚Äôll consider giving us another try. Warm regards, Connie

reviews.title: NYLO at Upper West Side
reviews.content: Location can't be beat and it still was surprisingly quiet and peaceful. It is located two blocks away from a subway station and the area is full of restaurants, bakeries, supermarkets and shops. I have stayed at other hotels in the area but this was my favorite so far Dear Cristina D, Happy to hear you enjoyed exploring the Upper West Side and found your room to be pleasantly quiet. We‚Äôre honored to be one of your top picks in the area and hope you‚Äôll stay with us again sometime soon! Warm regards, Connie

reviews.title: LJR
reviews.content: This hotel was suggested by my nephew who was getting married in NY. We had a great experience. Parking valet was definitely a must. The location of the hotel was ideal. The front desk and other staff were very pleasant and helpful. Dear lindarP3135IP Great to hear your nephew recommended us. We're happy the valet parking came in handy and that you found our location convenient. We're lucky to have a lot of great people as members of our staff and we appreciate your acknowledging their hard work. Hope the wedding was lovely. Thanks for your review! We hope you'll stay with us again if you return to New York. Warm regards, Connie

reviews.title: Serviceable, but No Towels
reviews.content: Stayed 5 nights in king bed room. Price-wise, this is about as reasonable as you are going to get in the Upper West Side of Manhattan. Rooms are decorated ala Ikea. Halls are grey and dark. One day, morning room service resulted in no towels at all. Had to call that night to get towels. Concierge did not answer the phone and the voicemail was full. Called front desk at 10 PM for the towels; towels finally came at 11:00 PM. Hotel is generally clean, but dirty socks from a previous guest were left in our room closet. No refrigerator in room. Very loud air conditioner; it will wake you up every time it comes on. Room doors stick so you hear everyone going in and out of their rooms with a slam. Dear V M, Happy that you found our hotel to be valuable, but I want to apologize for the issues you had during your stay. The housekeeping oversights are not acceptable. We should have been more responsive in delivering your towels and more attentive when cleaning your room. I'm sorry to hear that the air conditioner prevented you from getting a good night's sleep. We hope though that you'll consider staying with us again. If in the future you run into any issues, know that I can also be contacted directly through my email cwang@nylo-nyc.com and I'm always happy to help. Warm regards, Connie

reviews.title: Love this hotel
reviews.content: We always stay at NYLO whenever we are in NY and that's multiple times per year. Staff is exceptional and suite rooms are spacious and comfortable when bringing the kids. If there is ever an issue the staff handle things really well and work hard to resolve it. We will continue staying here! Dear bradmarak, We're proud to have you as a regular and happy that our suite is comfortable for the whole family. Thank you for acknowledging our staff's dedication to resolving issues and for your gracious review. We can't wait for your next visit! Warm regards, Connie

reviews.title: NYLO
reviews.content: NYLO was great hotel in a wonderful neighborhood! All staff was friendly and helpful. The Queen suite was spacious enough for a family of 4. The lobby area was comfortable and had great live music. Didn't get a chance to enjoy the neighboring restaurants but all had great reviews. Dear E3161NXmelissad, Delighted that our neighborhood and the suite was a great fit for your stay and that you had plenty of room for the whole family. Great that you found our staff to be helpful and that you had a chance to see the LIVE @ LOCL series. We agree that our neighboring restaurants are great and we hope to have you back again soon so you can try them out! Warm regards, Connie

reviews.title: Exceptional Customer Service at NYLO!
reviews.content: We enjoyed a 5-night stay at NYLO in May. We requested a quiet room, which, unfortunately, resulted in a room with all windows facing the alley. The front desk staff was amazing. Despite limited availability, they changed the accommodations to a larger and much brighter room~no charge. On Mother's Day, we walked into the restaurant for our included breakfast 5 minutes after 11 am, and the restaurant manager refused to accept our vouchers because, unbeknownst to us, after 11 it is brunch~not breakfast. The front desk again handled the situation beautifully and took care of the situation. The accommodations are clean and comfortable. Housekeeping staff is gracious. Bar has lovely special events. We will be back! Dear Judy S, Great to hear that our team was able to get everything sorted out, and that you got the guest room experience you were looking for. We appreciate your patience during these inconveniences and for taking the time to acknowledge our hard-working staff. I look forward to sharing your comments with the front desk and housekeeping teams. Glad that you got a chance to see our LIVE @ LOCL series. We look forward to having you back for the next special occasion. Warm regards, Connie

reviews.title: Love the Hotel Nylo
reviews.content: Wonderful hotel - among my top favorites now after a recent business trip. Classy industrial hotel. Great staff. Spacious rooms and service. And love the neighborhood. Ramona George at the front desk took care of all my needs from recommendations to places to eat, etc. I usually stay at the Refinery hotel in NYC but now this is on my list. Dear Michael M, Happy that we were able to make an impression on you. Great that your room was comfortable and that you appreciated our neighborhood. Thank you also for acknowledging Ramona's dedication. We are lucky to have her. We're proud to have joined the list of your favorite hotels in the city and look forward to having you back soon. Warm regards, Connie

reviews.title: Good but...
reviews.content: Great location, reasonably priced and well maintained rooms, everything is within walking distance frm the NYLO, definitely my choice fr next stay in the city. I wish they had an earlier bkfst too. Dear Harel2013, Great to hear that you found your stay to be valuable and that our location was convenient for exploring the city on foot. We appreciate your feedback on Serafina's breakfast offerings. We're grateful for your loyalty and look forward to your next stay! Warm regards, Connie

reviews.title: I love New York in June

The rooms are clean and well maintained, and the hotel is close to Central Park, music venues The Beacon Theatre and Lincoln Center, museums, and restaurants. Dear Jennifer L, We‚Äôre happy to hear you liked our rooms. Great that you‚Äôve enjoyed exploring the neighborhood. Thanks for listing some of the Upper West Side highlights. We‚Äôre sure other guests will find them helpful. We‚Äôre grateful for your review and hope you‚Äôll stay with us again soon. Warm regards, Connie

reviews.title: Regular guest
reviews.content: The NYLO is a great hotel on the UWS with a boutique ambience. Centrally located on the UWS close to all of the museums and great UWS restaurants. Cozy and quaint bar with prewar feel with modern guest rooms. Excellent staff We‚Äôre honored to have you as a regular and we‚Äôre happy to hear you love our overall vibe. Great that you‚Äôve had an easy time getting around and have enjoyed LOCL. Thanks for acknowledging our staff and for your review. We look forward to your next stay! Warm regards, Connie

reviews.title: Honeymoon Stay
reviews.content: Spent a week at The NYLO for our honeymoon. They graciously upgraded us from a standard room to a Junior Suite. Huge balcony added a nice touch to this suite with character. Staff was always accommodating, and the maid service very prompt. The only downside was a dark lobby and bar area, and the quirky oddity in the room of having nowhere at the sink to hang your towel. The Upper West Side location is amazing, right at Broadway, steps from Amsterdam, and less than a 10 minute walk from the beauty and serenity of Central Park. Dear Dave L, We‚Äôre so happy you enjoyed the upgrade and had a great experience with our staff. Congratulations on your marriage! Thanks for choosing to spend such a special occasion at our hotel! We hope you‚Äôll stay with us again if you return to New York. Warm regards, Connie

reviews.title: NYLO for our first trip to NYC!!!

Huge thanks to the staff at NYLO for all their help navigating the city and getting to our scheduled events!!! Dear reneeseaman, We‚Äôre happy you enjoyed your stay with us and your first New York adventure. Great that you had fun exploring the neighborhood as well as hanging out in the lobby. Nice you had a chance to see the flower market. Thanks for acknowledging our staff! We‚Äôll be sure to pass on your review. If you return to New York for a second trip we hope to see you again! Warm regards, Connie

reviews.title: Very convenient and cool hotel!!!
reviews.content: It's si nice and comfortable during stay. Thank you so much! Staffs are perfect and room amenities are clean. During stay, I could sleep very well! reviews.title: Quite satisfactory!

reviews.title: 3 Quick Days

Hope you‚Äôll be back soon- maybe for a longer stay. Warm Regards, Connnie

reviews.title: Hip and comfortable in UWS

Great to hear you felt like our photos online gave you a good sense of our rooms and that you had enough space to relax. Happy the AC smoothed itself out and that you intend to return. We‚Äôre looking forward to your next stay! Warm regards, Connie

reviews.title: Cosy & warm
reviews.content: The location is excellent, the upper west side has numerous restaurants. Feel good experience at the hotel, feels like home, very nice lobby & bar. The bed was excellent. A small complaint was handled efficiently en well. Dear 531guyn, Great to hear you‚Äôve enjoyed exploring the Upper West Side. We‚Äôre so happy you‚Äôve felt at home when you‚Äôve stayed with us. We‚Äôre delighted our staff was able to get any issues sorted out and we appreciate your patience while we got it taken care of. We hope you‚Äôll stay with us again next time you‚Äôre in the city! Warm regards, Connie

reviews.title: Expected More...
reviews.content: I was there over a busy holiday weekend, and the customer service reflected as much. Arrival experience was average for what you'd expect of this level of hotel. I had to remind the staff of my breakfast/welcome drink tickets which were included in my booking. I also had a complimentary upgrade that was not honored (of course, that's not guaranteed and I knew that beforehand, but the staff member who checked me in didn't mention that until I spent a good 5 minutes searching for the pass and proving I had one). In the end, she did manage to upgrade the bed size in our room, so that was something. But the overall customer service experience was lacking. The room was a nice size with above average space for NYC and modern d√©cor. I can take there being no bathtubs (I knew that going in as I called beforehand), but I do wish they had - and expected - a hot shower with good water pressure. I wanted more than a room to place my bags in for this trip, and spent the extra money to get it. Unfortunately, that wasn't the case here. I will say the hotel itself has a really nice atmosphere and you can't beat the location! Dear yloynaz, We‚Äôre sorry to hear about the bumps you encountered at check-in. We‚Äôre glad that the larger bed partially made up for us not being able to offer you a full upgrade. Thanks for your feedback on your shower‚Äôs water pressure. We've pulled up your room number and will be sure maintenance attends to it. For future reference, we have tubs in some room types, available upon request. We‚Äôre happy you liked our overall vibe and location. We hope next time you‚Äôre in New York you‚Äôll consider giving us another chance. If you run into any issues during a future trip know that I can always be directly reached through my email cwang@nylo-nyc.com and I‚Äôm happy to help. Warm regards, Connie

reviews.title: Convenient location in Upper West Side and comfortable stay

Dear 609vickiew, Happy to you found your room had everything you needed and that you were able to get a sound night‚Äôs sleep. We put a lot of care into our common areas on the first floor and it‚Äôs great to hear you could see them being a fun place spend time. Thank you for your recommendation! We're looking forward to having you back. Warm regards, Connie

reviews.title: Great place in awesome real nneighborhood.
reviews.content: NYLO works hard to maintain friendliness and service in a great real Manhattan neighborhood. The lobby smell is a little sweet but the overall experience is terrific. Avoid midtown at this Upper Wrst side gem -- take the subway downtown for touristy things. Dear 361gregoryg, Thanks for noticing our staff‚Äôs dedication. We‚Äôre happy you‚Äôve the appreciated the more residential nature of the Upper West Side, while also finding it easy to reach sightseeing attractions. We hope you'll stay with us again sometime soon. Warm regards, Connie

reviews.title: very nice staying
