Rooms are not as big as is shown in the pics, but that is predictable. Would like to highlight that one of the front desk associates was very helpful and nice, she moved us to a better room as the one they gave us when I arrived had no view and that wasn't what I have booked. Dear Juan H, Great to hear you enjoyed our rooms and your stay overall. Thanks for letting us know you didn‚Äôt feel like the pictures on our site gave a good sense of room size. We‚Äôre grateful for your taking the time to acknowledge our front desk and we'll be sure to pass on your kind words. We‚Äôre happy they were able to get everything sorted out. We hope you‚Äôll stay with us again next time you‚Äôre in New York. Warm regards, Connie

reviews.title: Great upper west side hotel
reviews.content: NYLO at 77th and Broadway is an excellent location and the hotel is very clean, well serviced and very friendly. reviews.title: Girl's Weekend in NYC!
reviews.content: Loved the location of the NYLO. Lots of great restaurants within walking distance. Easy to get around The staff was very friendly and the room was great except for no counter space within the bathrooms. I did not like the limited WiFi service that was provided. We stayed for two nights and WiFi was only available for one day. Live music in the lobby on the weekend was a nice treat. Dear marcias370, Thanks for choosing our hotel for your girls' weekend! Happy that you loved the neighborhood and found our staff accommodating. Sorry to hear about the issues you had with WiFi. If the next time you stay with us you have any problem feel free to reach out to me directly through my email cwang@nylo-nyc.com and I‚Äôll take care of it. Happy you got a chance to see our LIVE @ LOCL series. Hope you‚Äôll stay with us again next time you‚Äôre in New York! Warm regards, Connie

reviews.title: BE WARNED - PARTY HOTEL
reviews.content: We experienced a terrible (Saturday) night at NYLO NYC as the room next to ours was in party mode - the occupants noisy and inconsiderate throughout the night. And when we complained (after midnight) the hotel staff were entirely unhelpful - security came three times and just shared a laugh with the occupants of the room about the people (us) who had complained. After all, it was Saturday night, what did we expect? The front desk even lied to us, saying a manager was a) on the premises [not true] and b) was dealing with the matter [also not true]. The NYLO staff seemed to think it was okay to have a party because the occupants had paid for their room. In the end, we had to insist on being moved to another room (by now it was 3am) so we could get at least a partial night's sleep. We felt abused, mistreated and unsafe. I would warn against having a room with a balcony, as we did, as the party was both in and outside the room on the adjoining balcony. In all my years of travelling and staying in hotels I've never been treated as badly as I did at NYLO NYC. Avoid. Dear Simon F, We‚Äôre so sorry to hear about your experience. The comfort and security of all of our guests matters to us above all else, and the way you were treated is completely unacceptable. We know what an important part of any trip a great night‚Äôs sleep is and we deeply regret that we didn‚Äôt resolve this issue more promptly. We should have relocated you after you first made us aware of what was going on. We will be reviewing what happened in detail with our staff and will be reaching out to you privately to try to make this right. My deepest apologies for this mistreatment. Warm regards, Connie

reviews.title: ok place to stay...
reviews.content: Two comments; one, construction has been ongoing for several years and they start at 7am(?). Two, the hotel has a non-optional extra fee for internet, bottled water etc. The lobby is informal with a bar that opens onto the street and two nicely decorated separate spaces. Dear rontl1615YC, Happy you enjoyed your stay overall. Unfortunately, construction is indeed ongoing, however, we have many rooms that aren‚Äôt impacted, though not all include views. We‚Äôre updated your guest profile to reflect that you would prefer a quiet room. Our goal with our Urban Fee is to simplify the checkout process and we‚Äôre sorry that you‚Äôve been frustrated. We‚Äôre taking steps to try to make it as a clear as possible as we know it‚Äôs an important consideration for guests on a budget. Great to hear you like our common areas on the first floor. We appreciate your review and we hope you‚Äôll stay with us again! Warm regards, Connie

reviews.title: A very nice upper west side hotel.
reviews.content: Our king deluxe room on the 9th floor was perfect. Totally clean, wonderfully comfortable mattress, room for all of our stuff. The complimentary drinks and continental breakfast vouchers were a very nice touch. We have stayed in the NYLO for many years and will be back. Dear Cindourm, Delighted to hear your room was a great fit for your stay and you had plenty of room to spread out. Happy you enjoyed drinks at LOCL and breakfast at Serafina. We‚Äôre honored to have earned your loyalty and look forward to your next stay! Warm regards, Connie

reviews.title: Excellent hotel. Excellent location. No complaints.

Dear pl_colb, Happy to hear you had a chance to check out our LIVE @ LOCL series. Great that you loved our staff and found their advice helpful. Warm regards, Connie

reviews.title: Nice area

However the hotel rooms were a bit tatty and the cleaning left a lot to be desired. Dear Kev824, Happy our hotel made for a pleasant break and that you liked our staff. We‚Äôre sorry to hear you felt your room could use some updating and that the cleaning was not up to standard. We‚Äôll be sure to take a look at the room you stayed in and to share your feedback with our housekeeping team. Thank you also for your feedback on Serafina‚Äôs breakfast offerings. reviews.title: NYLO experience
reviews.content: The hotel is interesting and lively. The location is very good. The room was relatively small with a very small window! Relatively speaking the size of the room was small compared to the luggage we had. Dear bane2017, We‚Äôre fortunate that LOCL attracts a mixture of regulars and travelers who are a lot of fun; we‚Äôre glad you had a chance to enjoy it. Happy our location was a good fit and that our staff was helpful. We‚Äôre sorry to hear you wanted more natural light; we‚Äôve made a note in your guest profile so we can try our best to make that happen for your next visit. For future reference, mini fridges are available upon request. We appreciate your feedback and hope you‚Äôll stay with us again for your next New York adventure. Warm regards, Connie

reviews.title: Michael's Review
reviews.content: - Needs better cleaning - Internet more difficult to connect than necessary. - Its been 2 days since I have returned and I still have not received my receipt (email) - First time visitors (sister in law) should be treated special. Dear Michael D, We‚Äôre sorry to hear about the issues you had during your latest stay. I‚Äôd appreciate the chance to get more details about what happened and would be grateful if you‚Äôd email me at cwang@nylo-nyc.com. I‚Äôd also be happy to send you another email receipt. We always want all of our guests to feel special and regret that that wasn‚Äôt the case. We certainly hope you‚Äôll consider giving us another chance to make this right next time you‚Äôre in the city. Warm regards, Connie

reviews.title: NYLO NYC is a gem
reviews.content: I recently stayed at NYLO NYC for a quick visit. The staff is kind and friendly. The location is fantastic - great restaurants within walking distance, easy to get to nearby neighborhoods and attractions. I felt safe being a woman on my own day or night in the neighborhood and the hotel. Like NYC hotels, the rooms aren't big but I was on my own and really only there to sleep and shower so it wasn't an issue. Overall great place to stay and great value for NYC. Dear Liz V, Great to hear you found our staff accommodating and had a great experience exploring the neighborhood. We‚Äôre happy you felt at ease in the area and overall thought your stay was a good value. We appreciate your review and hope you‚Äôll stay with us again. Warm regards, Connie

reviews.title: Fabulous Place to Stay!!
reviews.content: The rooms were clean and updated, and the location ideal, with plenty of entertainment, food, and drinks within walking distance. It's also a very short walk to the subway too. However, the best part of staying at the NYLO was the outstanding customer service. The staff is AMAZING!! Highly recommended. For future visits to NYC, this hotel will be my first choice. Dear ajackl, Awesome to hear we‚Äôll be your top choice going forward! We‚Äôre happy you‚Äôve loved our rooms and location. Our staff is a big part of what makes our hotel special and we so appreciate you acknowledging their hard work. We look forward to sharing your review with them! Thanks for your recommendation. We‚Äôre looking forward to your next visit! Warm regards, Connie

reviews.title: rough start, great finish
reviews.content: I booked a "panoramic" room for our stay - an upgrade from the standard. I was hoping for something a little better than basic, and was disappointed when we arrived. The room did have a balcony with a view, which was great, but it was small and no frills, with blackened grout in the shower and a single robe hanging in the closet, when the booking was clearly for two people. But I figured, oh well, we're here to see the city, not the room, and didn't say anything. However, early in the morning after our first night, we were awakened by a very loud noise that sounded like there was a helicopter landing nearby. The walls were shaking and the windows were rattling - there was definitely no more sleeping. I called down to the front desk, and they said they would send someone up. No one came. So we got dressed and headed downstairs to find some breakfast. On our way out, we asked again. They said they would send someone up, so we went out to get something to eat. When we came back, that's when things got a whole lot better. Turns out it was a broken fan, and not only did they switch us to a new room, they upgraded us pretty significantly - to a suite! It was huge, with a sitting area, balcony, and windows on three sides. And no broken fan noise or mold in the shower. We were so pleased! So the rest of our stay was amazing. Thank you so much for making it a great experience! Other things we loved: The location - we like staying in real neighbourhoods (hate anything near Times Square), and this definitely fit the bill. Absolutely loved the Upper West Side. RedFarm - awesome food, right in the same building. We had lunch there twice. Zabars just up the street. Three blocks from the park. Insanely comfortable bed, with bedding that was the perfect weight and texture. Great pillows, too (I'm picky). We received two complimentary sparkling wines, which we enjoyed in their beautiful lobby bar. Close to two subways stops, so getting around was easy. Warm, responsive service - everyone was friendly and nice. Dear ttoronto, We‚Äôre sorry to hear your stay got off to a rocky start. Thanks for letting us know you didn‚Äôt feel like you got a great sense of your room before you arrived. We definitely should have attended to the issues you mentioned when you first made us aware of them. We‚Äôre so glad our staff was able to get everything sorted out and that the upgrade made up for the initial inconvenience. Thank you for listing all the things you love about our hotel! We‚Äôre sure other travelers will find it useful. We hope you‚Äôll stay with us again! If in the future you run into any issues, know that I can also be contacted directly through my email cwang@nylo-nyc.com and I'm always happy to help. Warm regards, Connie

reviews.title: Good to be back
reviews.content: Always enjoy going back to NYLO NYC! Got off to a bit of a rocky start (not happy with the noise in the first room 1507 - which despite the skepticism by staff needs to be sorted out) but once we were moved we had no complaints. Since our last visit the lifts have been sorted out and the wifi greatly improved. The hotel has a certain charm about it and the bar area downstairs and the lobby have a great feel. Great neighborhood and would highly recommend the hotel. Dear R4834ZKjustins, Sorry to hear about the issues you initially had with noise. We regret that we weren‚Äôt initially more receptive to your comments. We appreciate your listing your room number and we‚Äôll definitely look into that. Happy the rest of your stay was great and that you found many aspects had improved since you last stayed with us. Great to hear you‚Äôve enjoyed LOCL and found our location convenient. Thanks for your recommendation! We hope to be seeing you again - perhaps sometime soon! Warm regards, Connie

reviews.title: Modern Hotel in an Excellent Location
reviews.content: We really enjoyed our recent stay at the NYLO. The Upper West Side location is great with very convenient access to the subway at 72nd or 79th streets. The hotel is very clean and modern. Our queen-queen suite was very large with a great view of Broadway. Beds are comfortable, too. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We asked about a refrigerator for our room, and the bellman had one sent up for no extra charge. My only complaints: the bathroom was tiny, and they had no bar soap the first day of our stay. Otherwise, our stay was excellent. The bar downstairs is quite good, and we enjoyed the two restaurants that share the building. Tip: The valet package is a good deal. Parking in Manhattan can be quite expensive. Dear Jim M, Great that you found it easy to get around the city from our hotel. We‚Äôre happy that that you liked our decor and enjoyed the view of Broadway. Nice to hear that our staff was helpful and that the complimentary mini fridge was useful. Thanks for letting us know you were missing soap. We apologize for the oversight. We‚Äôre pleased that you also had a chance to try Serafina, Red Farm and LOCL. We hope you‚Äôll stay with us next time you visit New York. Warm regards, Connie

reviews.title: Staycation
reviews.content: I stayed here for an anniversary evening with my husband. We had a comfortable stay, and a great night's sleep -- so great that we slept through the continental breakfast! I would definitely come back. Thank you for choosing to spend this special occasion at our hotel. It means a lot to us to get a great review from a local and we appreciate your stopping by. Congratulations on your anniversary! We look forward to your next stay with us. Warm regards, Connie

reviews.title: Great location
reviews.content: Great location for reunion on upper west side. Accessible to all locations without the tourist overload. Would have loved access to better coffee at the hotel and cleaner floor in room, but the bed was very comfortable, drinks were good and staff friendly. I requested early check in and late check out and both were accommodated. Had a minor issue with the keys (all 3 at different points stopped working), but overall, a pleasant experience. Dear patriciahS3219BM, Happy to hear you had an easy time sightseeing without feeling overwhelmed. Thanks for letting us knowing about the condition of the floor in your room and how you found our coffee selection lacking. We‚Äôre always looking for ways to improve and appreciate your feedback. We‚Äôre sorry about the issues with your room key; we know what a nuisance that can be. Great that you were able to get a good night‚Äôs sleep and that you found our staff helpful. We appreciate your understanding and hope you‚Äôll choose to stay with us again on your next New York trip. Warm regards, Connie

reviews.title: A lively bar and a quiet hotel near the subway and park make NYLO an excellent hotel stop. The breakfast that comes wit
reviews.content: A lively bar and quiet rooms near the subway and not far from Central Park add up to an excellent hotel choice for a Manhattan stay. Lincoln Center is in walking distance. The full breakfast that comes with the package of extras is worth every penny. Dear Diana R, We‚Äôre happy to hear you enjoyed the atmosphere at LOCL and found our location to be ideal for your stay. Great that you also enjoyed the breakfast at Serafina. We appreciate your review and hope you‚Äôll stay with us again on your next visit to NYC. Warm regards, Connie

reviews.title: Great hotel in premier neighborhood
reviews.content: The front desk team is excellent. Carlos helped via email even on his day off. Ramona and Tasha greet you every morning with warm smiles and great suggestions. I'm very impressed by the room size, decor, and professionalism of staff. Dear clayton c, Thanks for taking the time to call out Carlos, Ramona, and Tasha. We‚Äôre lucky to have such a dedicated team and we look forward to letting them know you noticed their hard work! Happy to hear you had a great stay all around. We look forward to your next trip! Warm regards, Connie

reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay
reviews.content: We recommend this hotel to all of you, it is a wonderful nice and clean hotel and the service is super! The bed was awsome! The metro was just 2 blocks further. Just a walking distance to Central Park. Dear 426raymonds, Great that you found our hotel to be excellent overall and our staff to be helpful. We‚Äôre happy our proximity to the subway and Central Park came in handy. We appreciate your recommendation and hope you‚Äôll stay with us again next time you‚Äôre in town. Warm regards, Connie

reviews.title: Convenient, clean, and comfortable
reviews.content: NYLO was an excellent choice for our stay in NYC. The location was great and close to a major subway station that connected us to the rest of the city quickly. Great restaurants nearby including Levain bakery, Alice's Tea Cup, and the hotel's restaurant and bar were also fantastic. The hotel's lounge, business, and bar spaces were always in use and made the atmosphere very lively. Our room was spacious and a good size for four people. The beds were incredible, especially for my mom and grampa who I was travelling with. Overall, very convenient, clean, and comfortable. Will definitely recommend and would love to stay again on my next trip to the city! Dear ashleyep2017, Happy to hear our hotel was a good fit for your latest trip. Thanks for giving some details about our neighborhood‚Äôs highlights; we‚Äôre sure other guests will find them helpful. We put a lot of care into our common areas on the first floor, including LOCL, and we‚Äôre glad you had a chance to enjoy them. Thanks for your kind words and recommendation! We look forward to your next stay! Warm regards, Connie

reviews.title: NY Stay
reviews.content: Overall, good deal for the price. Lovely location. Helpful front desk. I don't recommend including the Serafina breakfast with your stay. You are very limited in your options, and they include an odd breakfast green salad. Dear Melanie B, Great to hear that you felt like your stay was a good value and liked our location. We‚Äôre glad you found our front desk accommodating; we‚Äôd like to think they‚Äôre a big part of what makes NYLO special. We‚Äôre sorry to hear you didn‚Äôt care for breakfast at Serafina. We try to offer a variety of breakfasts to suit differing dietary needs; however, we‚Äôre fortunate to be in a lovely neighborhood with tons of restaurants that might be more suitable to your tastes. We hope you‚Äôll choose to stay with us again if you return to NYC! Warm regards, Connie

reviews.title: Adequate for one night stay
reviews.content: I have stayed here more than once and it is a terrific location with a market across the street, CVS and close to subway. When you get a room with no view it can feel claustrophobic not being able to see the sky out the window. It seems clean and functional and the bed was very comfortable. I also like the wood floors. When I tried to clean the TV remote (which I always do because it doesn't usually get cleaned) the wipe turned black... it could be just that one remote. I had a TV not plugged in apparently but they took care of it right away. Service was great - lobby always bustling at happy hour. The room is very small but functional for one person. Bathroom likewise - ok for one person for one night. It's true it's challenging to hang towels in there. I'm trying another hotel in the neighborhood a few weeks from now and I'll see how it compares. Dear redmonkey, It‚Äôs great to hear you‚Äôre becoming a regular. We‚Äôre glad our location and proximity to CVS have come in handy. We‚Äôve made a note in your profile and we‚Äôll try our best to place you in a room with a window in the future. We‚Äôre glad you‚Äôve enjoyed the hardwood floors and your bed. We appreciate your letting us know about your remote. We‚Äôll be certain to check in with our housekeeping staff to make sure it isn‚Äôt a persistent problem. Thanks for letting us know you had issues finding a spot to hang your towel. We appreciate your feedback and hope you‚Äôll return! If you have any issues, no matter how small, on a future stay know that I can be reached through my email (cwang@nylo-nyc.com) and am always happy to help. Warm regards, Connie

reviews.title: Great location and nice rooms!
reviews.content: Christine, the conceirge was just so nice and lovely! You know how sometimes it feels like people are nice to you because they have to? Not Christine! Super helpful with any question you throw her way! Thank you =] The location of the hotel made sight seeing petty convenient. The American Museum of Natural History and Central Park is a short 2-3 block from the hotel (as is Shake Shack). We were there on a Sunday so part of Broadway was closed off for famer's market! And for any art/design lovers. One of the pieces that Banksy created during his trip to New York is a 3 min walk from the hotel, on 79th and Broadway. Be sure to check it out! Dear chiuies_chiuies, Thanks for going out of your way to call out Christine. We‚Äôre lucky to have her on our team and look forward to sharing your review with her! We‚Äôre fortunate that there‚Äôs so much to see and do nearby (the Banksy piece is also among our favorites). We hope you‚Äôll stay with us again next time you‚Äôre in New York! Warm regards, Connie

reviews.title: Good clean Hotel
reviews.content: The location is really good. The room was simple but clean, no frills. The rooms were a good size for NY. Close to a subway station and many restaurants Loved the lobby. I would definitely stay there again Dear lf421, Happy that you‚Äôve found our location convenient and our rooms well suited to your needs. We‚Äôve put a lot of thought into our lobby space and we‚Äôre so glad you‚Äôve enjoyed it. We‚Äôre looking forward to seeing you again soon! Warm regards, Connie

reviews.title: Great hotel. Great location. Great stuff
reviews.content: We have been there every year for few years. Every time for more than a week. Great hotel, great location. A little expensive but at least we know what we get. Rooms are nice. Bathroom a little small but bed so comfortable that you do not care. Go eat breakfast at cafe 82. Do not eat at the restaurant below... Dear Gambizon, We‚Äôre thrilled that you are regulars and we appreciate your loyalty. Nice that you‚Äôve enjoyed our location and that you‚Äôve found our beds comfortable. For future reference, we try to offer rooms for every budget but some of our more upscale rooms feature larger bathrooms if that‚Äôs something that‚Äôs important to you. We‚Äôre also happy to hear you‚Äôve found a favorite restaurant in the neighborhood. We‚Äôre thankful for your review and look forward to your next trip! Warm regards, Connie

reviews.title: Great experience the first visit, second visit I didn't sleep
reviews.content: This was my second time here. First time was great but this time our neighbors sounded like they were in our room. I think the rooms were actually a suite. I didn't sleep while I was there. I did not have time during the day to switch rooms but this room isn't acceptable for anyone Dear jaxie0072017, We‚Äôre sorry to hear about the issues you had during your most recent stay. We know how important a solid night‚Äôs sleep is for any trip. We have adjacent rooms available as they're sometimes preferred by families and large groups and apologize for the inconvenience. We‚Äôve made a note in your guest profile so we can be sure to place you in a quiet room if you choose to come back and hope you‚Äôll give us another chance to make this right. I can also be reached directly through my email cwang@nylo-nyc.com and I‚Äôd be happy to personally resolve any issues that come back no matter how brief your stay. Warm regards, Connie

reviews.title: Incredibly helpful staff!
reviews.content: I rarely give such shoutouts, but Ramona was super helpful! I was not happy with the first room I was offered (too noisy), and Ramona cheerfully worked to find me an alternative, despite the fact that the hotel was very full. She also helped switch our package to include valet parking. All this with great cheer and efficiency (and she didn't even know it was my birthday!). Thank you, Ramona! A great stay. Dear stelker2017, We‚Äôre lucky to have Ramona on our staff and appreciate your taking the time to acknowledge her hard work. We‚Äôll be sure to share your review with her. We‚Äôre so glad she was able to get everything taken care of and we‚Äôre grateful for your being so understanding. Happy belated birthday! We appreciate your choosing our hotel for such a special occasion and hope you‚Äôll stay with us again next time you‚Äôre in New York. Warm regards, Connie

reviews.title: Hidden UWS gem.
reviews.content: Really, really comfortable bed. Nicely decorated with a great lobby bar. Perfect location for visiting the city. Lots of great restaurants and bars nearby. Walkable to Times Square and Central Park. We never stay anywhere else in the city. Great value, great property. Dear Roland d, Great to hear you were able to get a great night‚Äôs sleep. We‚Äôre happy you found our location convenient for sightseeing and could see our hotel being a good fit for a variety of travelers. We‚Äôre delighted to hear you‚Äôll be back! We appreciate your loyalty and look forward to your next trip! Warm regards, Connie

reviews.title: Not up to standard
reviews.content: I appreciate the lobby bar, game room, friendliness and location but ask for a hotel to do better at the basics than the NYLO does. I am in a superior king that looks out on the inner walls of the building, with clattering A/C, a weak shower that's very hard to set on a stable temperature, and spartan furnishing. In addition to the bed, for example, there is a desk chair, a table (=desk) and some lockers arranged to look like a dresser. Maybe that's all hip, but as a hotel room it just doesn't work very well. For the money the A/C should not interfere with sleep, there should be a place to sit that is comfortable (and not the bed), and it should be possible to shower comfortably. Oh, and the plastic cups are tacky, the Keurig an environmentally unsustainable way to make pricy and poor coffee. The staff is very friendly and location is great...but there are other, better choices for the money in this part of NYC. Internet is not free because they charge a daily amenities fee.... Dear ejhArlington, We're happy you've found our staff helpful and have enjoyed our location. We're sorry to hear about the issues you had during your most recent stay and regret that our furnishings weren't to your taste. We know what an important part of any stay a great's night sleep is and are sorry about your noisy air conditioner. We've pulled up your room number and we'll be sure to have a technician check on it. We'll also be looking at the shower pressure. We try our best to be environmentally conscious and appreciate your suggestions about our coffee options. We're sorry that your last stay didn't meet your expectations and hope that next time you're in New York you'll consider giving us another try. Know that our staff is always more than happy to help with any concerns and that I can personally be reached through my email cwang@nylo-nyc.com. Warm regards, Connie

reviews.title: Excellent Hotel
reviews.content: I highly recommend this hotel. It has a very friendly staff which makes you feel at home. I love the location and having a CVS across the street really helped. It is close to the subway and close to many great restaurants. I definitely will stay here again. Dear jmdiamond2016, Happy to hear you had a great experience with our staff and loved our location. We‚Äôre lucky there‚Äôs so much to see and do nearby. Thanks for your review and for your recommendation! We look forward to your next trip. Warm regards, Connie

reviews.title: Hip hotel with nice bar
reviews.content: The hotel room was clean with nice bed and good amenities and bigger than many other NYC rooms these days. I loved the bar and the overall vibe of the place. But I dinged it a star for two reasons: 1) valet parking took way more than an hour, when they asked for 45 minutes; 2) I was e-mailed a coupon to upgrade my room and then they acted like I was nuts when I checked in, saying nothing was available. Either grant the upgrade immediately in the reservation (rather than give a coupon), or stop making false offers. Neither of those things would deter me from recommending so long as you don't have a car. And don't take the bait to promote them on social media for a false promise of room upgrade. Dear smmphd, Great to hear you thought our rooms were pretty spacious and enjoyed LOCL. We‚Äôre sorry to hear about the issues you had with valet parking. I want to personally apologize for the misunderstanding with the room upgrade. This is definitely not the experience we strive to provide guests so I would appreciate the opportunity to get to the bottom of this. If you're willing, please email me (cwang@nylo-nyc.com) the details of your reservation so that I can look into this further and make this right. We hope that next time you‚Äôre in New York you‚Äôll consider giving us another try. Warm regards, Connie

reviews.title: Boutique but a bit outdated
reviews.content: I frequently stay at the NY NYLO; it is a good value for a NYC stay. Used a 14th floor suite this time, and the room had views in both East and West directions. Spacious; well-maintained, water in room, updated bathroom with broken shower hose, but usable. Furniture is out of date but definitely serviceable. Staff friendly and helpful. Small bar in lobby, and a Serafina (mediocre) restaurant attached to lobby.Try Red Farm around the corner on Broadway. Dear jmgott, Great to hear that you feel your stays are valuable, and that you enjoyed the suite during your most recent stay. Thanks for your feedback on our furniture, and for your compliments about our staff. We hope you‚Äôll stay with us again when you visit next time. Warm regards, Connie

reviews.title: Nice experience for one night stay
reviews.content: Room was clean, staff courteous and helpful. Bell service was helpful. Concierge was pleasant and helpful. Free cocktail was a nice gesture (Sangrai or Champagne) I preferred a free mixed drink rather than Sangria.. Dear karenbB648NL, Great to hear you found our staff helpful. Thanks for calling out our bell service and concierge for their hard work. We're grateful for your feedback on the kinds of drinks you‚Äôd like to see incorporated into our welcome drinks. We hope to see you again soon. Warm regards, Connie

reviews.title: A good experience
reviews.content: A good hotel with excellent staff who responded well to requests for help and advice. Comfortable room. Tea/coffee provision seemed rather mean with just one choice of tea, coffee and de-caf for 2 people. Bathroom had nowhere to hang wet towels. Dear G4009YSrichardd, Happy to hear you found our staff attentive and liked your room. We appreciate your suggestion of adding a wider selection of coffee and teas. We‚Äôre always looking for little perks our guests might enjoy. Thanks for letting us know about the oversight of not having a place for wet towels. We appreciate your review and hope you‚Äôll stay with us again next time you‚Äôre in town. Warm regards, Connie

reviews.title: Just OK
reviews.content: Just OK. First visit was excellent. This is our second visit and experienced different issues each day from non working amenities, no hot water and non so clean lobby. We considering not returning and explore other properties next time. Dear joseac834, We‚Äôre sorry to hear about the issues you encountered during your most recent stay. We always want every stay to be excellent and we regret that that wasn‚Äôt the case. I‚Äôd appreciate the opportunity to connect with you about the details of your stay so we can better understand what went wrong and remedy any lingering problems. We hope that next time you‚Äôre in New York you‚Äôll consider staying with us again and giving us a chance to make things right. If you‚Äôre willing to share more about your stay please contact me through my email cwang@nylo-nyc.com. If you choose to stay with us again I can also be contacted directly through my email if any issues arise and I‚Äôd be happy to help. Warm regards, Connie

reviews.title: Great location
reviews.content: Were upgraded from a tiny room to a gorgeous King Deluxe room full of natural light overlooking Broadway, and spacious. A pleasure to come back to after a day's sightseeing. Great neighbourhood, close to 79th St subway. Bed was very comfy. We'll be back. Dear TripRaps, Happy to hear you enjoyed the upgrade and the view of Broadway. Great that you had a chance to explore the neighborhood and were also able to unwind after sightseeing. We‚Äôre looking forward to your next visit! Warm regards, Connie

reviews.title: Nice Hotel
reviews.content: The room was small with a queen bed but decent. The bathroom was a good size. The sheets were really nice and the bed was very comfortable. The hotel restaurant, Serafina, served really good Italian food. The hotel is about 3 blocks from Central Park and the Museum of Natural History. There's a decent bar that serves food or you can order take-out from Serafina's and eat in the bar area. It's a pet friendly hotel which was important for us. Dogs are allowed in the bar and outside dining area but not the restaurant. Everyone from the bellman to the front desk receptionists were very helpful. I would definitely go back to the NYLO. Dear Emcg518, Happy you found your room adequately large and were able to get a good night sleep. Great to hear you had a chance to try Serafina. We always look forward to welcoming guest‚Äôs dogs and we‚Äôre pleased it made your stay better. Thanks for noticing our staff‚Äôs dedication. We look forward to your next trip! Warm regards, Connie

reviews.title: Great hotel that aims to please
reviews.content: I have stayed at NYLO multiple times and have always found the staff to be courteous and attentive to needs. On my last trip there was a bit of a bump in the road but I decided to give it one more shot -- everyone has an off day. On this trip the staff went out of their way to make up for last time with a nicer room, late checkout. I had never been in one of their Jr. Suites and, although it was an internal room (421) it was really large and comfortable- 2 beds, a large bathroom and a comfortable sitting area with sofa and chairs as well as a desk. I guess the other plus is that there are no noises from the street. Kudo to Maria and Bryan, two of the managers, who made sure we will come back again. Dear Phil W, We‚Äôre delighted to hear you're becoming a regular. We really appreciate your giving us another try and we‚Äôre happy our staff made it up to you on your latest stay. Great to know you found your interior room quiet. We‚Äôre fortunate to have Maria and Bryan as part of our team and are grateful for your acknowledging their hard work. We‚Äôll be sure to share your review with them and we‚Äôre looking forward to your next stay! Warm regards, Connie

reviews.title: Nice hotel not trying hard enough
reviews.content: Location, coolness and freshness count for a lot, but I got the feeling that there is no one in charge of quality control at NYLO, except after the fact. I was checked into a cute little room with one window whose blackout shade was obviously broken. Engineer when called came quickly and broke it some more, giving me a fix. OK, the price was right, but I still felt abused. The next day I was upgraded into a fairly palatial room without toiletries or bathrobe and slippers from the defective room. When I checked out I complained and got a $27 refund of the city fee that really should be part of the room rate. Dear SusanJ13, Happy you found our location convenient and enjoyed our hotel‚Äôs overall atmosphere. We‚Äôre sorry about the issues you had with your blinds. We regret that we weren‚Äôt able to fix it or offer you an upgrade sooner. We know how disruptive changing rooms can be. We hope that next time you‚Äôre in New York you‚Äôll consider staying with us again. If you have any concerns during a future stay I‚Äôd like to personally make sure they‚Äôre resolved as soon as possible. I can be reached through my email cwang@nylo-nyc.com. Warm regards, Connie

reviews.title: Great Hotel but not as good as in recent years!
reviews.content: Staff were very prompt, helpful and courteous. Room was not as clean as usual. No soap in Bathroom for two days. We had to go to front desk to get some for our room. front desk staff were great, bar staff were great also. Definitely more positives than negatives. We will go and stay there again, though and overall highly recommend the NYLO. Dear louisrissin, Sorry to hear about the housekeeping oversights during your most recent stay. We‚Äôre happy to hear our staff was able to get everything taken care of and that the LOCL staff also did a great job. We look forward to your next trip! If you have any issues during a future stay, I can also be reached directly through my email, cwang@nylo-nyc.com. Thanks again for your recommendation. Warm regards, Connie

reviews.title: Stay at NYLO - New York
reviews.content: The NYLO staff was courteous and very helpful. One of the staff members at the reception desk spend time explaining to me the way I had to take the subway to arrive midtown for a reception dinner. He even draw a map that was perfect! I did not get lost. Great directions! I enjoyed my stay at the hotel very much. The location is excellent. Dear Martha-Lucia S, Happy you found our staff to be helpful and that they gave great directions. We‚Äôll be sure to share your review with our front desk staff! Great to hear our location was a good fit. We hope you‚Äôll stay with us again next time you‚Äôre in New York. Warm regards, Connie

reviews.title: Ok hotel but many better in the area.
reviews.content: This hotel is ok. Very expensive for what you get. Hotel staff not friendly. Rooms ok. Don't expect anything big here just an uncomfortable bed. The ONLY good thing about this hotel is location location location If that is all that you care about, then go for it and accept the rude staff and uncomfortable rooms. Better than sleeping on the street. Dear Ron B, We always want all of our guests to feel welcome and taken care of from the moment they arrive and we‚Äôre sorry that wasn‚Äôt the case with your stay. I‚Äôd appreciate a chance to find out more about your trip to ensure the problems you encountered are addressed through my email, cwang@nylo-nyc.com. We‚Äôre glad our location was a good fit for your trip and hope you‚Äôll consider giving us another try next time you‚Äôre in town. Please feel free to reach out to me directly if you have any issues during a future stay. Warm regards, Connie

reviews.title: Birthday Trip
reviews.content: My TV never worked. Even after I reported it to the front desk multiple times. But overall it was a pleasant trip. The air conditioning went out at one point but was quickly fixed. There was an issue with a valve . Dear 300britanyt, We‚Äôre sorry you had issues with your TV; we definitely should have addressed that the first time you brought it to our attention. We appreciate your patience while we got everything taken care of with the A/C and your choosing our hotel for this special occasion. Happy belated birthday! We hope you‚Äôll stay with us again next time you visit New York. Warm regards, Connie

reviews.title: Family wedding weekend
reviews.content: We stayed over Memorial Day weekend and had a clean and comfortable room and bed. The front desk and housekeeping staff were all professional and friendly. Jessie at the front desk showed wonderful grace under pressure! As we were checking in a very irate, short man who identified himself as Dr. so and so, stormed in front of us, and demanded that Jessie call Christine (manager) immediately. She said one moment, sir, I am serving these people now. He kept ranting and repeating himself. What a jerk! Jessie maintained her composure, finished checking us in, and then turned to Dr. Jerk. We love the NYLO, which is close to our daughter's apartment and close to great restaurants, bars, delis, shopping, museums, Central Park, the subway, etc. One caution, avoid Serafina, the restaurant that is attached to the NYLO. The hostess was a sourpuss who seated us at a dirty table between two tables that had not been cleared, so we left, of course! Dear Karen A, I'm honored that you chose the NYLO for such a special occasion. Great to hear our rooms were a good fit for your trip. Thanks for noticing Jessie‚Äôs professionalism. We‚Äôre lucky to have her as part of our team! Happy you love our location. Sorry to hear about your experience at Serafina. Hope you‚Äôll stay with us again next time you‚Äôre in town! Warm regards, Connie

reviews.title: Nice neighbourhood but be aware of the Urban Fee
reviews.content: Stayed here for 3 nights. The rooms are clean and the location is in a nice and (to be New York) quiet neighbourhood. If you're planning a trip you should be aware of the $27/night urban fee that will apply. What really annoyed me was that when we checked out my card was charged with the fee without the staff telling me and without getting a receipt for it. Unacceptable. Dear davidchristoffersson, Happy you liked our location and the Upper West Side‚Äôs more residential vibe. Our goal with the Urban Fee is to streamline the checkout process and we‚Äôre sorry you were frustrated. We should have done a better job of communicating it to you. We know what an important consideration it is for guests on a budget. We hope you‚Äôll choose to stay with us next time you visit NYC. Warm regards, Connie

reviews.title: Great adventure
reviews.content: Worthy of every penny spent . Remember to add valet parking in your booking. Savings will be great. Very clean and smoke free rooms. A great bar and diner. Will be spending time there again on July 4 weekend. Dear kennethcN1653CD, Great to hear you felt like your stay was a good value and found the valet parking convenient. Nice that you had a chance to try LOCL and Serafina. We appreciate your review and are looking forward to your Fourth of July trip! Warm regards, Connie

reviews.title: Great value and service
reviews.content: I have been to the Lex NYC several times and think it is a great hotel. The staff at the front desk are always very welcoming. The rooms are basic but are well appointed and very clean. They have nice letters with restaurant and other recommendations in the room and usually a little sweet treat. I haven't ever had any problems sleeping from street or other noise. I absolutely love this location in Gramercy. Highly recommended.

reviews.title: Great Service, good location
reviews.content: In town for Governor's Ball, I must thank the front desk personnel (especially Maurice and Derek) for all their help. Navigating through an unfamiliar city can be difficult, but the staff here is very helpful. The only downside during our was the lack of a refrigerator in the room. This location is good for exploring Manhattan.

reviews.title: 1st leg honeymoon
reviews.content: What a lovely hotel to start off our honeymoon, we were greeted by fabulous friendly staff who were very helpful in advising us on directions and nice places to visit. Our room was lovely and neat with a gift of wine for our honeymoon. Approximately a 30minute walk to Times Square which allowed us to simply take in our fantastic surroundings. We were only there for 2 nights but even the morning of departure (5am) whilst we waited for our private car which they had arranged for our airport transfer which was the same price as a taxi but more comfortable and included all the hidden costs, we were offered coffee and pastries. Thank you so much, we would definitely recommend this hotel. Ceri and jack (15/05-17/05).

reviews.title: Amazing Anniversary
reviews.content: I cannot speak more highly of the service we received from The Lex the two nights we stayed. We stayed in the Superior Queen room. The room was large, specially for rooms in NYC. The balcony was wonderful and the bed was super nice. The Lex does other simple things with their rooms to make a person feel appreciated, like keeping the hair dryer in the room rather than having to call down, or the neat tissue paper flower. The bed was comfortable and everything was clean! Now to give a huge shout out to Romeo! Romeo was the teller the night we checked in! He was wonderful! Super nice, helpful, and quick. But Romeo did a couple of things to make him stand out as amazing! He made sure 3 different times he was saying our last name correctly. It is not an easy name, and appreciated. When we got to our room he called and made sure everything was satisfactory later. He even sent up a bottle of wine after we said it was our anniversary. We have MANY choices of hotels, but we will be choosing the Lex every time!

reviews.title: Number 1 out of 3 hotels on our USA trip
reviews.content: Brilliant hotel, great location. The staff were incredibly helpful and accommodating. Nothing was too much trouble, they made you feel welcome and always acknowledged you when you were in the lobby which goes a long way! We would definitely stay again if we went back to New York, sadly my husband left my bag of magnolia bakery goodies when we left so I hope the staff enjoyed them! :) Hello Gilbertlovesjulie, WOW!!! Thank you for such an amazing review. It is an honor to be classified by you as the number 1 hotel out of the 3 that you have stayed during your trip to the United States. We hope you are able to plan a return trip soon. Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager

reviews.title: What a boutique hotel should be.
reviews.content: In NYC for a graduation and needed a clean, convenient, comfortable place to hang our hats. The Lex was the perfect fit. Super friendly sincere staff, clean comfortable room, modern bathroom with excellent water pressure. Continental breakfast each morning plus free bottles of water in the room each day. We have paid $5.00 for a bottle of H2O in another NYC hotel. Housekeeping very good as room and bathroom were immaculate. Not crowded, very happy, will come back on our next trip to NYC. Hello cinzerillo, Thank you for your excellent review and for choosing the Lex Hotel NYC during your visit. I am thrilled to read about your stay with us and how your enjoyed yourself. We will look forward to you future stays with us. Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager

reviews.title: Under performing
reviews.content: The Lex advertises as ‚ÄúA Boutique Hotel‚Äù above the entrance. Strong Pro: All front desk personnel were very nice, personable and helpful. Wish we could give the hotel a 5 rating just for them! but, there are other considerations. Pro: Clean room and bathroom, continental breakfast provided in lobby, location -Baruch College, Madison Square Park many restaurants nearby. Strong Con: Very expensive (high $400s incl. tax) for what you get; poor or lax security: (no one was in lobby for several minutes when we arrived), door on first floor to accommodations behind check-in desk unlocked, left open at times; Complimentary water bottle had already been opened, drunk from (see pic) Con: Unattractive room with pictures on wall glued to wall, floor light in corner of room had no on/off switch - you had to unplug it; room and bathroom needed updating, lighting in room so low that it was not possible to read in bed at night room and during day room was gloomy, there was no safe in room, view = a wall about 6 feet from window (see pics) covered in thatch (?). Very odd place!

reviews.title: They stuck me in the basement
reviews.content: I arrived very late, having been delayed by the airline. The hotel was full, so I got one of the two rooms in the basement, which were very noisy--that is where the laundry and various other services are located--and sub-par. Given that I had paid top dollar for a room during graduation season, which is very busy, I was a bit shocked. The manager was not available to talk with me on either of the two occasions I tried. I would not stay here--I did not feel welcome, and I would never pay $400 to sleep in a basement room. At the very least, they should have warned me ahead of time. I did not find the Lex hospitable.

reviews.title: Brilliant boutique hotel in excellent location
reviews.content: Wow! From the moment we arrived the staff were very warm, welcoming and approachable-special mention to Maurice. Everywhere was immaculately clean. Breakfast ( pastries, muffins, fresh fruit, tea, coffee and juice) is served in the lobby. Complimentary tea/coffee are also available on request. Cheese and wine also served early evening on Tuesdays. We stayed in a cosy room which was a good size,on the top floor facing onto Lexington Ave. Other reviewers have complained about the street noise but this was definitely not a problem and we had the window open throughout the night. Comfy bed and pillows. Good wifi connection. Complimentary toiletries We would definitely stay here again if we ever return to New York and wouldn't hesitate to recommend Greetings Higog, I am honored to be a part of such a talented team of passionate hoteliers who are truly invested in ensuring our valued guests feel the sentiments you allude to in your review via our refreshingly personable and genuine guest experience. I will be sure to pass along your praise to Maurice and our entire team as we love to celebrate experiences such as yours. We thank you for your excellent rating and eagerly await your return! Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager

reviews.title: The best
reviews.content: This sweet place has all the charm and hospitality you could want! Small but manageable and very clean! Housekeeping was immaculate! My experience from booking over the phone with angelica, the above and beyond care of Derek, and even the sweet kindnesses of George made our stay one of tbe most pleasurable and memorable! Location is convenient! The best is found at The Lex! Hello Ashley H, Thank you very much for taking the time to review our hotel and for your generous 5 star rating. I am thrilled that you had a great stay and enjoyed the staff, services and amenities. I will be sure to pass you compliments along to Angelika, Derek, George and the rest of the team. I hope during your next visit to NY you stay with us again. Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager

reviews.title: Perfect Stay in NYC
reviews.content: I have had the opportunity to stay at the Lex Hotel twice this year! One was for business and the other a mix of business and pleasure. I have to admit, this is the ideal hotel for either type of travel. The hotel is conveniently located and close to everything - both for business appointments and to all the fun attractions. We visited the Statue of Liberty, Ground Zero, Central Park and of course Times Square. All less than 15 minutes away. The rooms are very clean and comfortable and well equipped with outlets and USB chargers. Complimentary WiFi works excellent! The breakfast is super convenient as well, but the absolute best part of our stay is the service. All of the team members went above and beyond and made our stay special during every interaction we had with them. I will most definitely stay at Lex Hotel during my next trip to the "Big Apple"! Greetings Alexandra Oscar S, Thank you so much for the review of your recent stay here at The Lex NYC. The team and I are thrilled that you enjoyed your stay so much and we hope to have the opportunity of welcoming you back again whether for business or pleasure. Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager

reviews.title: Good hotel poor breakfast
reviews.content: I stayed in suit. Room was good. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was poor. Specially after 8:30 it is hard to find something to eat. I was very disappointed. Hotel location is very good.

reviews.title: Great hotel and service
reviews.content: Loved to stay at the Lex, can highly recommend it! Good location, close to subway and Madison Square Park. Modern, nice, spacious (by NYC standards) and affordable rooms. Breakfast are pastries, juice and coffee but there are several places to go nearby if you want something more filling. Excellent service with friendly and helpful staff (special thanks to Derek for being a star!) that made us feel like home. Dear Emma E, Thank you for taking the time to leave feedback about your stay with us. The team and I are delighted that we were capable of providing you with quality service and accommodations. Your comments about Derek have been passed along to the whole team! We look forward to welcoming you back home in the near future. Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager

reviews.title: Great stay
reviews.content: I stayed at Lex in April with my boyfriend. Overall a really pleasant stay and I would definitely go back if the price is right again. My positives: +great location +good value +free breakfast items to start the day +helpful and polite staff +wine and cheese reception on Tuesdays +clean +modern +free drinks (tea, coffee, hot choc, water) +good size room despite being the cosy room What could improve: -our cooling/heating unit was noisy so we had to turn it off during the night. Not as much of a problem as the temperature was quite moderate in April. -noisy neighbours woke us up at 5 am! I called reception to complain and they stopped. Not 100% the hotel's fault but as we found out these people had just checked in after a night out. -shower not great as it is a fixed unit so a bit of a challenge to use. I have the impression though that this is typical to NY hotels. Hello Marialena P, It is a delight to know that you had a great stay with us. I'm glad you were able to take full advantage of everything we have to offer here at the Lex NYC. Please don't be a stranger. Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager

reviews.title: Highly recommended!
reviews.content: I really loved this hotel. Very modern, clean and comfortable rooms. Complimentary water, coffee and a nice small breakfast. Beautiful modern decoration. Friendly and helpful staff. Excellent location! Very close underground station. A few minutes walk to Madison square park, A few more to Union square. I also had a nice walk to the High Line and Chelsea market. A short bus ride to MoMA and Times Square. Hello Anat A, Wow! what a great review. We love to see happy guests and we are thrilled that you enjoyed your stay with us. Please don't be a stranger and give us call next time you are in NYC. We will ensure another perfect stay for you. Warm Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager

reviews.title: Quality hotel at a very reasonable price
reviews.content: Given the very reasonable price of this hotel my expectations were not very high. Wow was I wrong. The location is convenient, the staff attentive and friendly, the room was perfect for our needs. When we return to NYC we'll definitely stay again. Hotels in NYC are pricey, but you'll not get much better value than this. Hello Mark G Thank you for sharing your experience with us. Our goal at the Lex is to change the common perception that you get what you pay for. At the Lex you pay a little but you get a whole lot for it. We take a great deal of pride in providing great service and a flawless facility. We are happy that we have made you a believer in the Lex motto ‚Äú Lex is the Best‚Äù. We look forward to you staying with us again in the near future. Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager

reviews.title: FANTASTIC FIND in a convenient location
reviews.content: The Lex is a sweet, friendly boutique hotel. The rooms are cozy, beds are comfy and the bathroom is spacious. The staff is super friendly (Romeo at the front desk is great!), knowledgeable and remembered small details about my stay. The complimentary continental breakfast in the lobby is just perfect. Fresh fruit, pastries, juices and coffee. If you're looking for a well-located, small hotel with very nice staff in the middle of Manhattan - the Lex is the perfect choice. Hello love2travel1009, Thank you for sharing your experience with us and the travel community. We take a great deal of pride in know that our guest is happy with everything we offer from rooms all the way down to the breakfast. We look forward to you staying with us again in the near future. Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager

reviews.title: SO IMPRESSED!
reviews.content: I'm a regular in NY and I'm usually underwhelmed with the hotels but The Lex is my favorite. I've stayed here four times between Dec and March and between the staff who could not be nicer, the cleanliness of the room and the location, I can't stay anywhere else when I'm in town. I've stayed in nearly every room type they offer and I cannot come up with a single complaint. They've even gone so far as to having little chocolates ready when I check in. Absolute first-class service. Hello The_Doyenne, Thank you for being a repeat guest. I am glad that we can provide you with the comfort that you need while travelling. We look forward to continue providing you with first- class service. We will see you soon. Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager

reviews.title: Clean, friendly and comfortable
reviews.content: This place is one of the better and progressive hotels in the Manhattan area. They have all the amenities plus that of comparably priced hotels. The internet speeds were very fast for streaming media among other things. We will be staying again. Hello clvandhey, Thank you for taking the time to write a review.We look forward to your return and providing you with another excellent stay. Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager

reviews.title: Little gem in the neighborhood
reviews.content: What a surprise to find this small nicely appointed hotel . Lots of good restaurants nearby and a good continental breakfast included. Nice linens and bathroom and coffee or tea anytime. The Staff was friendly and helpful. Greetings ktquilt, I am glad that we can be a nice surprise for you. In a city as busy as New York; its the surprises that remain memorable. Thank you for sharing your experience with us at the Lex Hotel. We hope to have you return in the near future. Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager

reviews.title: Solid choice for price/service/location
reviews.content: I had a great stay for 3 nights at the Lex. The room was comfortable, clean and large for NY standards. Staff were very approachable, helpful and willing to assist any guests requests. I would stay there on any visit in the future, and recommend it highly for comfort, great hospitality, value and location. Hello Purplecow80 and thank you for taking the time to share your feedback on your recent visit with us. Nothing is more important to our team then 100% guest satisfaction and we are delighted to see your fantastic review. I will be sure to share your comments with the team and we hope to have you back as our valued guest shortly. Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager

reviews.title: Very nice little hotel
reviews.content: This hotel is in an excellent position in Manhattan, within walking distance to Madison Square, Broadway, Union Square etc, and still it is very reasonably priced. The rooms are in the small side, but there is room for everything; they are clean, very brand-new looking, and nice. Breakfast takes place in a very tiny place, but we never had problems finding our place. Staff is super nice. Overall, this is an excellent place for a visit in New York City. Hello Enrico543, I wanted to personally thank you for your stellar review on our hotel. It is comments such as yours that motivates the team at the hotel to achieve excellence. We all have pride and passion when it comes to servicing our guests and it is great to see that this proved true during your visit. We would love to have you back as our valued guest shortly and we wish you well until that time comes. Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager

reviews.title: Great service! Highly recommend
reviews.content: I stayed at The Lex to attend college tours with my daughter and had chosen it due to its great location and boutique style atmosphere. The accommodations are clean and comfortable, and the staff is very helpful and friendly. In particular, Derek went over and above to make sure we had everything that we needed and made us feel like it was no inconvenience at all. He is the epitome of great customer service! Hello SavvyRE17, Thank you! I am pleased to know that you enjoyed your stay with us and I will be sure to inform Derek of your high praise. He is a valuable member of our team and we are lucky to have him. I hope you and your daughter enjoyed the College tours. We hope you return soon. Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager

reviews.title: Great stay in NYC
reviews.content: Perfect location to explore the city, walking distance to a lot of attraction and plenty of dining options in the neighbourhood. Clean and tidy rooms, helpful and friendly staff. Our stay lived up to the great reviews. Would definitely recommend this great little hotel! Greetings BradandSimone, Thank you for such a great review. I am glad that we matched up to our reputation for you. We look forward to welcoming you back for another great stay. Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager

reviews.title: A very pleasant stay
reviews.content: A friend recommended this hotel and it did not disappoint. The location is perfect, with several restaurants within walking distance, and it's close to public transportation. Our room was very large by NYC standards. The wifi is free (and good), which is rare in most hotels. The coffee and tea service is a nice touch. We would definitely stay again. Hello SouthernBelle74, I am glad that The Lex NYC was recommended to you and that we did not disappoint you. Thank you for taking the time to review your experience with us, to better help future travelers to make the decision to stay with us. We hope to have you return in the near future. Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager

reviews.title: A perfect spot in midtown!
reviews.content: My husband and I stayed at The Lex NYC for five nights in March 2017, and what a terrific visit. The hotel is centrally located with ready access to public transportation for visiting spots in uptown and downtown. Check in was a breeze, and we immediately felt welcome and comfortable. The room was modern and exceeded my expectations in terms of comfort and cleanliness. The modern decor and comfortable bed made me feel like a got a real bargain. Our room was on the 6th floor above Lexington, but the city noise didn't bother us at all. We slept like babies after long days filled with lots of sight-seeing. We often try a choose hotels located away from the larger tourist areas to get a real sense of an individual neighborhood. The Lex fit the bill. Lexington Ave has plenty of small restaurants and 3rd Ave provides a wide variety of small eateries as well. The Hummus Kitchen and Penelope's which are both only 5 minutes away, and the food in little India is fantastic. We discovered a old fashioned pinball arcade right around the corner - what a fine discover indeed. Greetings luka34, I wanted to personally thank you for your stellar review on our hotel. It is comments such as yours that motivates the team at the hotel to achieve excellence. We all have pride and passion when it comes to servicing our guests and it is great to see that this proved true during your visit. We would love to have you back as our values guest shortly and we wish you well until that time comes. Best Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager

reviews.title: Holiday
reviews.content: Lovely hotel walking distance to most sights we didn't bother with buses and taxis as we walked to places quicker. Unfortunately it snowed while we were here and lots of places were closed because staff not being able to get too work. They were quick too clear pavements but they shovelled snow into gutters and made it impossible to cross roads ha. Hello Ian B, Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback on your recent visit with us. Nothing is more important to our team then 100% guest satisfaction and we are delighted to see your fantastic review. I will be sure to share your comments with the team and we hope to have you back as our valued guest shortly. Best Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager

reviews.title: Almost perfect modern boutique hotel
reviews.content: I've just got home from spending a week at the Lex. Overall it is a brilliantly located, stylish, clean and modern hotel that I would definitely recommend. Staff are welcoming, pleasant and extremely courteous - I found Rumel and Maurice to be particular nice as they always offered me my favourite black tea on arriving back at the hotel after a chilly day out and about! Having complimentary tea and coffee to be brought to your room is a nice touch. The breakfast was better than I expected - although there isn't huge variety (hot drinks, juice, croissants, mini sweet pastries, two types of muffin, apples, oranges and bananas) what is there is delicious, good quality and plentiful. It set me up for the day and I enjoyed watching the world go by from the comfort of the lobby each morning whilst planning my day. I had a cosy room, and it surpassed my expectations in terms of size, cleanliness and design. Lovely toiletries, spotless, great bath and shower, large extremely comfy bed and a bathroom light that makes sound effects! :-). The reason I have given 4 and not 5 is because firstly the air conditioning is VERY loud and woke me up multiple times most nights, and secondly because on arriving at the Lex I was given room 302, which I had the misfortune to spend one night in. It has an adjoining door (locked, not that it made any difference!) with the next room and I could hear every single word the loud couple said. I asked straight away if I could be moved, and the staff were very understanding but said they were fully booked that night. However I could be moved the next day. So I packed up everything (I had just unpacked!), had a sleepless night listening to the couple make a lot of noise and the next day my bags were moved to a quiet haven known as room 701. Much better! So although this was handled well, as I was a solo traveller staying for a week, it annoyed me that they thought they could put me in an extremely noisy room and get away with it. So beware room 302 - I'm not sure how many other (if any) of the rooms have this issue but don't expect the noise will get better - it won't! All in all though after this bad start my room and stay were faultless, and I would definitely stay again. Hello InfiniteStarla Thank you for a sharing your thoughts and experience with us so we may address your concerns and build on the things we do well. Our location and staff are the things that makes us great. We will look in to the AC issue you report, to ensure this is not an annoyance to you and our future guest. Our goal here it to make sure you enjoy a worry free stay. We look forward to seeing you again. Kind Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager

reviews.title: Lovely stay
reviews.content: This is a belated review as we stayed in The Lex at the end of October 2016. The hotel is modern and very well appointed. We had one of the rooms on the ground floor behind the lift, despite this we heard virtually no noise from the reception area or the neighbouring rooms. The room was very clean and quite spacious (for NYC rooms) the bed very comfortable and the bathroom was a reasonable size with plenty of hot water and a good shower over the bath. The location of the hotel was well situated on Lexington Avenue, we walked a lot including at night and the area felt very safe. The reception staff were really helpful and gave us several recommendations for local restaurants. The hotel provided a continental type breakfast with coffee, hot water and orange juice, a really good start to the day especially when we were awake about 4am on our first day in NYC, it would have been a long wait for breakfast in any of the local diners at that time of day. On our last day there was a problem with our taxi booking, the reception staff tried their best to resolve this with the taxi firm and then ordered us another taxi when our failed to materialise. I would be very happy to stay in The Lex again on our next trip to New York. Hello Auntmolly89, Thank you for such a great review. I am ecstatic to know that our staff assisted with making our hotel a great place to stay. They strive to make each guests stay amazing and I am glad we succeded with you. We hope you do stay with us again sometime soon. We await your return. Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager

reviews.title: Nice for the Price
reviews.content: Nothing extravagant here - but fit our needs for visiting our son who lives around the corner. Not so easy if arriving by car, there is no drop off area, just parked cars along the whole block and, being NYC, never an available space. Expensive overnight parking is a ten minute walk away. Rooms small, staff friendly. The "breakfast" is some baskets of muffins and croissants and a pot of coffee served in the entryway, "lobby" of the hotel. Bedding very comfortable and room very clean. Hello dtoohey Thank you for taking the time to write a review. I am glad that we were able to enjoy your stay with us while visiting your son. We look forward to your return in the future. Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager

reviews.title: Had a great stay at the Lex Hotel NYC
reviews.content: Staff was very warm and very helpful. Room was small but clean and very comfortable. Room was also very hi-tech with usb charging ports and all (only problem was that sometimes it had to many leds on). Breakfast was very simple but good. Greetings OttoMK, Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us at the Lex NYC. I am glad that you had an enjoyable stay. We look forward to welcoming you back in the near future. Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager

reviews.title: Great hotel and nice area
reviews.content: Great hotel, Derek was AMAZING!!! Went above and beyond for me and any questions I ask, great service would definitely stay here again Derek made feel like I was at home. The room was really good and the laundry service was great can not fault this place at all really good. Hi Chris D, Thank you for taking the time to review your stay with us at The Lex NYC. It is wonderful to know that you had a fabulous experience with us. We look forward to your return so that we can provide you with yet another fabulous experience. Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager

reviews.title: Inexpensive small hotel
reviews.content: I stayed here for 3 nights in January 2017. The most impressive thing about this place was the helpfulness of the staff. Every person was friendly and went out of their way to help with anything. When I arrived, the front desk clerk helped me find a room that was quiet and not bathed in light early in the morning. She let me look at several rooms and did it all with a smile. The room itself was pretty basic, without even so much as a chest of drawers to put your clothes. The desk was a narrow strip of plastic, barely sufficient to hold even a laptop. I know that they were trying to save money on furniture but for even a little bit more money on furnishing the rooms, they would feel much more comfortable. The bed was comfortable. People who don't like loud heater/air conditioners: beware! As other reviewers have noted, the fan on the heater/air conditioner is extremely loud and (at least in my room) couldn't be turned to "low". There's not a lot in the immediate neighborhood (other than Indian restaurants on Lex) but it's a short walk to subway stations and other good things a few blocks west. Bottom line: Very friendly and helpful staff, very basic rooms but inexpensive. Hi Jh555, Thank you for a sharing your thoughts and experience with us so we may address your concerns and build on the things we do well. Our location and staff are the things that makes us great. We will look in to the AC issue you report, to ensure this is not an annoyance to you and our future guest. Our goal here it to make sure you enjoy a worry free stay. We look forward to seeing you again. Kind Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager

reviews.title: Amazing gem
reviews.content: This hotel is a gem in the city. The rooms are roomy and comfortable. The staff are warm, professional and kind. It's all about the personal touch! So very helpful with recommendations for where to dine. I hate it's taken us this long to find them! If you are coming to NYC this place is the hotel to stay at. Hi Debbie S, The best diamonds are found in the ruff. I am very happy you found great happiness in staying with us here at the Lex hotel. We hope to provide you with even more exceptional service on your next stay here at the lex hotel. Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager

reviews.title: First rate in every area! Thank youto all our new "friends" at the Lex NYC
reviews.content: Our trip to NY was not for pleasure but because our daughter was having major surgery at a nearby hospital. We looked into many hotel, before deciding on the Lex, but what a wonderful choice it was. Being a small boutique style turned out to be perfect. The staff knew us by name and were aware of our circumstances. They were so very kind to us, inquired about our daughter and said they would work with us in anyway to make our stay as stress free as possible. The front desk staff were top notch. I don't want to name names because I would not want to forget anyone. One really super person was Angelika, one of the managers. Angelika recommended a Junior suite since our daughter would be with us the evening before surgery. We had a nice quiet room in the back of the hotel. The beds were super comfortable, the bathroom was large and more than adequate. They provided the usual necessities; shampoo, conditioner, lotions, body wash etc. but they were a better quality than I expected. The one thing I was concerned about when booking a hotel in NYC was that it was clean. I never had to worry at the Lex. Everything was spotlessly clean! Each morning they provided a lovely continental breakfast consisting of juice, fruit, pastries, muffins and croissants. Again, much more than I expected. Coffee, tea and ice were. Not only did you get your coffee but it was delivered a gentleman, with a wonderful smile. He could not do enough for you. Another unexpected treat was their weekly gathering. Wine and cheeses were served in the lobby for two hours. After a particularly rough day spent in an ICU room, we made it back just as the reception was coming to a close. It was no nice to have a glass of wine and enjoy some cheese.hour win time and they made certain we could have a bit. They were so wonderful!! I highly recommend the Lex NYC to anyone visiting NYC. It is so much more personal than the larger hotel. The staff cannot do enough for you. They are so pleased to be of help and never make you feel as though you are a bother. For us, it was the best choice. I cannot think of anything negative to say. I would have liked a small refrigerator and microwave Since our schedule did not allow time for eating out. But with all the pluses we managed very well. I have recommended it to a few friends already and they are surprised to hear about the "little gem" we found. In the past I have found Trip Advisor reviews to be most helpful. I wanted to share this with all my Trip Advisor friends and I truly hope this review convinces you to try the Lex when you go to NYC. Since our daughter is still not doing well, we will probably be back in the city again next week. Without a doubt, the Lex will be our choice! . Hi Kathy N, Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us and all the readers on trip advisor. Our goal here at the Lex is to make sure you have a great stay very way possible, it is wonderful to know that you had a fabulous experience with us. We look forward to your return so that we can provide you with yet another fabulous experience. Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager

reviews.title: Easy choice - stay here!
reviews.content: As a student who was traveling to NYC on a budget, this place is a God-send. The service at the front is top-notch (escpecially you, Derek). The rooms are impeccably clean and well-decorated. The free breakfast is terrific. The location is hard to beat. And all for the kind of prices (under $150/night) that a student can afford? I kept expecting there to be some "catch" that I wasn't understanding. But after 2 restful, pleasant nights at The Lex, I realized that this is a just a fantastic hotel. Please stop your search now and book The Lex for your next NYC trip. Hi Sean C, Thank you for taking the time to review your stay with us at The Lex NYC. It is wonderful to know that you had a fabulous experience with us. We look forward to your return so that we can provide you with yet another fabulous experience. Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager

reviews.title: Excellent service and great value
reviews.content: My wife and I stayed at the Lex Hotel last week for three nights. I highly recommend it. Although it is a budget style hotel, service from reception is excellent and friendly, with good advice on the local area. Angelica and all the other staff were first rate. Room is not big (we had a "cosy room"), but was fine for our needs. The bed and bed linen was very comfortable. The bathroom was excellent. We had requested a quiet room, which is what we got at the rear of the building. No traffic noise at all. I'd guess that if your room faces Lexington Avenue, it could be noisy. A basic breakfast is provided at no extra cost (tea, coffee, pastries and fruit). Complimentary coffee and tea can also be brought to your room, which we took advantage of. It's not located in a classy part of Manhattan, but we felt comfortable walking around at night and it's close to the subway and about 10 minutes walk to Union Square. Plenty of restaurants nearby. Highly recommend Penelope's at 159 Lexington Avenue for fresh, reasonably priced meal and Florian at 225 Park Avenue for a more stylish dinner. Two minor issues were that (1) the air conditioning unit was noisy when it came on (for about 5 minutes every 45 minutes, but we got used to it and it didn't wake us up) and (2) it would have been good if the room had a small fridge.
