We will be heading back to the Lex next time we are in New York. I wanted to personally reach out to you and thank you for sharing your comments on your recent visit with us. It was a true pleasure to have you at our hotel. I'm also happy that we were able see all the great things our neighborhood had to offer. We take a great deal of pride when it comes to servicing our guests and it is great to see that we hit our goal of 100% satisfaction during your stay. Thank you and we hope to see you again very soon. Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager

reviews.title: Three C's: Clean, Comfortable and Convenient
reviews.content: Decided to try a small, boutique hotel close to the East Village and saw lots of positive reviews on TA. Price was fine, and management accomodated us with a super quiet room and an upgrade ( we did give up our city view in return for a courtyard view of the water towers but it was dead quiet and we actually slept). The desk guys were great-thanks Maurice- and the rooms were REMARKABLY CLEAN. Beds were extremely comfortable. Nothing super fancy here- just a really nice place to stay. Greetings JennAndDeanGo2Dinner, I wanted to personally thank you for your stellar review on our hotel. It is comments such as yours that motivates the team at the hotel to achieve excellence. We all have pride and passion when it comes to servicing our guests and it is great to see that this proved true during your visit. We would love to have you back as our valued guest shortly and we wish you well until that time comes. Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager

reviews.title: Outstanding service
reviews.content: Rumel (at the front desk) went above-and-beyond to make my stay special. He was so kind and thoughtful! I had lost my phone at a restaurant. Not only did he call the restaurant for me, he sent a bottle of wine to my room to cheer me up. Then, when the phone was found, I received a thoughtful congratulatory note in the morning with my coffee. Another fellow, Derek, was also sweet and made me feel so welcome! Would absolutely stay again! Hello Thrilled1, Its a pleasure to hear that Rumel and Derek went above and beyond to provide you with an outstanding stay. They are both important members of our team; as they are great at what they do. I will be sure to pass your compliments along to them. We will be awaiting your future return. Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager

reviews.title: Great Boutique Hotel
reviews.content: My husband and I had another wonderful stay at The Lex. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The accommodations are clean, and the bed are comfortable. We look forward to another visit. A great location, within walking distance of Eataly, and other great restaurants. Greetings Knoxvillevol, Thank you for staying with us again and for reviewing your experience. We look forward to many future returns for you. Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager

reviews.title: Excellent-No Complaints!
reviews.content: If you are looking for a small, minimalist boutique hotel-this is a great find! Couldn't ask for nicer, more helpful front desk staff. Clean, comfortable bed, quiet (which is not easy to find in NYC), and decent bath towels. You can't beat the price plus a free continental breakfast. Pastries are fresh and there is a nice selection of fresh fruit. Will stay here again, as it is convenient to the 6 subway line. Hello Karyn M, Thank you for such an amazing review. 5 stars and a happy guest is all that we can ever ask for. We will look forward to your future stays with us. Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager

reviews.title: 'We‚Äôd certainly book again.'
reviews.content: We booked two Cozy Queen rooms at the Lex NYC for a five-day family stay in mid-January 2017. The rooms Both rooms were pretty small, though the clue for that was sort of in the name when we booked them. But bigger and more expensive options are available. The rooms we had, however, were absolutely fine to stay in and nicely decorated, with comfortable beds, flatscreen TVs and separate shower rooms, with free toiletries. The shower was quite big and the water pressure very strong, and the rooms were well maintained and cleaned to a decent standard, too. Staff The hotel staff were all fabulous, with the front desk in particular always polite and keen to help. They were knowledgeable about the direct area and happy to provide advice about getting around the rest of New York, too. Breakfast Breakfast was served in the lobby area and it was croissants and Danish pastries, plus coffee and tea. Some guests stayed in the lobby, while others took cups and plates of food up to their rooms. There was always a plentiful supply of everything. Summary The Lex NYC is exactly as advertised. It‚Äôs a boutique hotel for travellers on a budget. It‚Äôs very good, too, and the area it‚Äôs in provides easy access to most of New York‚Äôs big sights via either nearby subways or on foot if you don‚Äôt mind getting out and about. We give it a deserved four and a half if we could and we‚Äôd certainly book again. Hello Paul B, It is a true delight to read how much you enjoyed your stay with us. We would love to welcome you back to the Lex Hotel for another amazing stay. Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager

reviews.title: Small hotel, very nice and helpfull staff, excellent location, it was good, very good staying there.
reviews.content: Boutique hotel, in an quiet , excellent well come, morning breakfast good enough, personal treatment, cosi room, and great location.If you come with suitcase and takes a Cab, you need to tell the driver where to go, tell him 25 St, Lexington Ave. It helps a lot. Took my driver time to get there, till l have called the Hotel for directions. If you want to get to up town by the Sub,get to 23th and you will take the R line, or down town take the 6 line. Dear 293984Sarahsu, It is a delight for me to read how happy you were with your experience at The Lex NYC. Our team always strives to go above and beyond and it is great that you were able to notice that during your stay. We eagerly await your return. Warm Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager

reviews.title: Great service, good price
reviews.content: The staff has a very clear purpose and training regarding customer care, they are really nice. Rooms are small but tidy and complete. The breakfast is a nice touch that you love when in New York (where everything is so expensive) The neighborhood is nice, you have several bus stops and metro stations around, either way you could walk and find the main sites in Manhattan within 1 hour walk. It is fairly close to Penn Station. Appreciated everything regarding this hotel. Hello SaraSalazar, Thank you for such an amazing review. I am glad that you enjoyed your stay from the very moment that you got to the hotel. We look forward to welcoming you back and providing you with another excellent stay. Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager

reviews.title: Great hotel at great price!
reviews.content: I stayed 3 nights with a family member. I had looked at a number of properties and The Lex had good reviews. The price was very reasonable so I selected this hotel. It is in a nice area, just north of Noho, and is immaculately clean. They offer a continental breakfast, and provide complimentary water. Our room held a queen bed with nightstands on either side, and had a large window. You are in New York; there are traffic noises at all hours. The bathroom was surprisingly large and was stocked with shampoo, conditioner, bath gel, lotion, hair dryer, and soaps. Everything was very clean and tidy. Most impressive was the customer service the staff provided. They are kind, helpful, and made our stay so pleasant. I will happily stay here again and would recommend it to anyone who is looking for a good place to stay in Manhattan at a reasonable price. Dear Pam W, Thank you so much for taking the time to write us such an amazing review. I will surely share this review with the entire staff as this is one of many reviews that demonstrate where our dedication and professionalism has taken us. Once again thank you we hope to have the privileged of welcoming you again in the near future.

reviews.title: The best
reviews.content: The Lex is a small boutique hotel on Lexington Avenue. The rooms were very adequate although they have no king size beds. They were clean and the house tell staff were awesome. I wish I had gotten the names of the young man at the desk. There were three of them that we came in contact with And they were so willing and gracious to help. We will return there next time we visit New York City. Dear Kathy H, Thank you for staying at the Lex Hotel NYC and for taking the time to post your review of the hotel on Tripadvisor. I am sure the team will be overjoyed with your feedback and I am delighted to see that you found the location to be so convenient. Once again, thank you for choosing the Lex Hotel NYC and I do hope it won‚Äôt be too long before we have the privilege of welcoming you back to the hotel.

reviews.title: Stylish, Clean and in a Great Neighbourhood
reviews.content: The Lex NYC is a small boutique hotel and is conveniently located. We liked that the hotel is in a neighbourhood, rather than in a tourist area. The rooms are clean and stylish. The staff are gracious, personable and service-oriented. Continental breakfast was a nice amenity. Have read that walls are thin; it was quiet during our stay and not an issue for us. We were comfortable and felt very much at home. There are some great Indian restaurants, Dhaba and Bhatti in the neighbourhood. Grocery, natural food and coffee bars are also nearby. Hello Lily, Thank you for your review and I am glad you had a wonderful stay! Please reach out to me directly for your next visit. We will love the opportunity of making your next review a 5 star review. We are looking forward on seeing you again, have a Happy and wonderful New Year

reviews.title: Wonderful!
reviews.content: This hotel is a real gem in a great location. We stayed in a cosy double that was more spacious than we expected. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom clean. So lovely having a bathtub, which although shallow, allowed us to soak our tired legs after walking 12 miles a day! All amenities are provided - toiletries, towels, hairdryer, safe, ironing board, and bottled water. You can also order tea, hot chocolate and coffee to your room at any hour of the day (so good when you are jet lagged!). Breakfast in the morning consisted of muffins, pastries, fruit, tea, coffee and fruit juice. Lovely way to start the day and kept us going 'til lunchtime. The hotel is in a great location on Lex' Avenue - we walked almost everywhere because it was such a great way to experience the city. Although just a short walk away you can catch the subway from 23rd Street. The Newark Express bus stop is also walkable (15 mins Uptown on 41st Park/Lex), so you don't need to bother changing lines on public transport if you're flying in to Newark. Lastly, just wanted to comment on how friendly and welcoming all the staff are. They were all willing to help/explain/recommend things and always accommodating. They rang to check everything in the room was okay, and called the day before we checked out to see if we needed anything. They also spoiled us with a bottle of wine and biscuits on arrival for our anniversary - wonderful touch. All in all, when you're travelling on a budget but want to experience something a little different to a chain hotel - stay here! It's always a blessing to feel the satisfaction of your stayed in your words. Thank you for such an amazing review, it means a lot to be recognized. Looking forward to provide you with another great experience in the future.

reviews.title: A real gem
reviews.content: I lived in NYC for decades so I know it's hard to find a hotel that is in a good location as well as excellent service. I stumbled on this gem while searching for a place near Grand Central Station. The service is outstanding, and they offer free coffee, wi-fi and continental breakfast -- that's rare in NYC (and please take note Big Hotel Chains). The rooms are small but pleasantly appointed and, unlike the Pods, you have a separate bathroom. Very pleased. Hello gibletNewYork, "A real gem"; the title alone makes me happy. Our team strives to make sure that each guest gets the experience that you had with us at The Lex NYC. To us, in a city like New York excellent service is a must. We hope to welcome you back soon for another great stay. Warm Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager

reviews.title: Perfect!
reviews.content: My friend and I decided on a whim to stay at The Lex. Read the reviews on Trip advisor and it was absolutely perfect. The staff were beyond friendly from the first phone call when I booked with Remel, and the girls at the desk when we arrived (I think Michelle) and sweet Angelica at night when we were on our way out and about were all perfect!!! The hotel was Super clean, non pretentious , quiet, and comfortable..... If you want hustle and bustle stay in Times Square. If you want clean, quiet, great price and a super friendly down to earth staff stay here! Hello lovemy3children, What a true treasure it is for me to read how much you enjoyed your stay with us. Thank you for taking the time to share your great experience with us. We feel strongly that we have some of the best talent that NYC has to offer and they all enjoy what they do each and every day. I am delighted that you had the opportunity to be on the receiving end of such talent. I will be sure to pass your compliments along to Rumel, Michelle and Angelika. Please don't be a stranger. Warm Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager

reviews.title: Pretty good place
reviews.content: A very good place. The staff helps a lot, has a good knowledge of the good spots and the room its pretty comfortable. I would like to thank all the employees for pointing me the interesting places(and giving me a map) and helping me charging my phone(I though I would lost my way to talk to my family, that was a relief) and thanks for providing daily water and keep the room clean. Hello Bruno S, Wow! what a great review. We love to see happy guests and we are thrilled that you enjoyed your stay with us. Please don't be a stranger and give us call next time you are in NYC. We will ensure another perfect stay for you. Warm Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager

reviews.title: Great boutique hotel, wonderful location and excellent staff!
reviews.content: Stayed here for 3 night on a business trip. I enjoyed my room on the 7th floor away from Lexington and slept well. The bed was great. The layout of the room was oddly shaped and I had no desk to work at. Small and simple breakfast (coffee and croissants) included in the price and complimentary bottles of water in the room. Very good! The location is wonderful and the surrounding neighborhood has 100s of ethnic food options. Had both great Indian and decent Lebanese food while here. The best here though is the staff. They defy the New York stereotypes of busy and rude. Friendly and helpful all around. I'll be back to stay here for sure. Hello Anders B, Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with Trip Advisor. I am pleased to know that you enjoyed your stay with us. We look forward to your return to our hotel. Warm Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager

reviews.title: Great Location, crazy crowded!
reviews.content: The staff was very friendly and accommodating. The guys at the door were amazing and real pro's. Not able to check in until 4pm, so we ate elsewhere. The Lobby is tiny for the size of the Hotel (somewhat typical in NYC as space is at a premium) and you are not able to linger much. Rooms are nice and older in design as the building is an older one. Concierge Lounge is small and overcrowded, but fine. All in all a good place and good experience!

reviews.title: Very nice boutique hotel in NYC. Convenient location.
reviews.content: Very professional staff. Gave recommendation for great Japanese restaurant...Natsumi right around the corner. Clean nice sized rooms. Free coffee or hot chocolate delivered to your room Would stay again for sure. Hello CharltonDon, Thank you for the great review. See you again on your next visit to NYC. Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager

reviews.title: Long Weekend in the Big Apple
reviews.content: For NYC a relatively small,boutique hotel but with a warm and welcoming feel as a result of Superb people on the front desk! We were made to feel welcome like returning family...really outstanding customer service. Rooms are compact,clean and modern. I believe there are bigger rooms higher up. I was on the second and sometimes the noise was higher than I would have expected..rooms fairly close together but over all excellent value and a great position if you want to be away from the madness! Plus if you like a curry it's the centre of the curry world in Manhattan. A real winner and one to go back to..I would suggest it's rating should be higher! Thanks Guys. Hello MSM848, When I think about travelling I think about service and how welcome the staff of the location make me feel and here at the Lex that is how we approach every guest. We make sure we treat all as if they are an extension of our own families. We would love to host you again in the very near future. Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager

reviews.title: Great boutique hotel
reviews.content: I visited family in NYC and this hotel was perfect for a night stay. It was modern, clean and included breakfast. Good location. I would stay again. Although the room is small, that is typical in NYC. Also nice TV set. Modern bathroom. Hello cubangirl90212, Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts and experience with all our future and past guest. We hope to see you again in the near future. Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager

reviews.title: Nice find!
reviews.content: Will definitely stay here again. It's clean & updated with a friendly, helpful staff. Priced reasonably for NYC & very comfortable. 24/7 coffee & tea service.....who does that?!!! And the size of the bathroom was a very pleasant surprise for a Manhattan hotel. We were visiting family in Stuyvesant Town, so the location was great for us. Hello lbapple, Service is the name of the game and we strive for nothing but 100% in everything we do. I am very happy that you enjoy our free 24/7 coffee & tea service. We will continue to build our business around servicing your, keep your eyes peeled we have a more great add-on services to come. Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager

reviews.title: Amazing staff, enjoyable stay!
reviews.content: The room was very clean and attractive. Small, but that's normal for NYC. What really set the place apart was the extremely friendly and helpful staff. Wow! They were so happy to assist with anything needed and were very warm and friendly. Everyone was great and Derek and Rumel especially went above and beyond. Hello Omi T, First let me say thank you for great review, our staff take great pleasure and pride in making sure you feel our warm and welcome energy at all points of interaction. I know how travel can be very hectic and stressful, so we make sure we are all here to give you the service and attention to make your trip a breeze. We look forward to seeing you again. Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager

reviews.title: Great place to stay in mid-town Manhattan
reviews.content: Enjoyed this boutique hotel oasis in the Murray Hill area of Manhattan. The room was not large but the bed was comfortable and linens very crisp and clean. The staff above all were super nice and friendly. We would definitely stay again! Hello JPPennyStPaul, Thank you for such a great review. I am ecstatic to know that our staff assisted with making our hotel a great place to stay. They strive to make each guests stay amazing and I am glad we succeded with you. We hope you do stay with us again sometime soon. We await your return. Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager

reviews.title: Great staff, great location
reviews.content: Hotel is located in Midtown with restaurants, sights, and Metro stop nearby. Modern look, good sized room, free WiFi and continental breakfast. Staff are welcoming, helpful with daily planning, and excited to ensure you have the best experience inside the hotel and out. No coffeemakers in room but a call to the front desk and you'll have a fresh hot cup delivered to your room within minutes. Hello kimkH9509QW, Thank you for sharing your experience with us at The Lex NYC. I am glad to know that future travelers can read about your experience and choose to have as great of an experience as you had in NYC by staying with us. We look forward to welcoming you back in the near future. Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager

reviews.title: Awesome boutique hotel in Murray Hill
reviews.content: Can't recommend this hotel enough. Great location on Lexington between between 25th and 26th Street. Immediately upon arrival, we were informed that our room had been upgraded, which was a great way to start our vacation. The hotel is super chill and not in the slightest bit pretentious. Our room was very nice and had everything that we could possibly want and/or need. Special shout out to Rumel, Maurice and Derek in the front desk. These guys were not only cool and super friendly but also extremely helpful, accommodating and knowledgeable. I hope management realizes what a valuable asset it has in these three employees. Will definitely be back and will also recommend this property to all my family and friends. Keep up the good work. Hello, Ricky731 I am overjoyed to see that we made vacation in the big apple an awesome one. I agree with you that our team members are our most valuable asset here at the Lex and I make sure they know it in every way. We hope to see you again on your next vacation in the big apple. Kind Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager

reviews.title: Super Friendly Boutique Hotel
reviews.content: Good location on Lexington and 27th. Clean and friendly. Just a hotel but a lot of restaurants and bars in walking distance. Parking around the corner in garage. A lot of perks: wifi, chocolate, water, continental breakfast, authentic team members to help you find anything. I found this place on a random search but at $250 all in - a value in NYC. Room size is fine and bathroom was very clean. Hello Sandra f First we would like to thank you for choosing The Lex, it was our pleasure to host you. Here at The Lex we strive for excellence and our goal is to make you the guest feel like a VIP at all times. Our team is always glad to go above and beyond for you with any and all request you might have. We look forward to seeing you again on your next trip to New York City. Kind Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager

reviews.title: Super friendly and helpful staff. Good location
reviews.content: The rooms are small, but not unexpectedly so, and very clean. In NYC you don't spend a lot of time in your room anyway. The staff are super friendly and helpful. The room heating is from a reverse-cycle air conditioning unit, which is fairly noisy, and is located quite close to the bed (because the rooms are small). This might disturb some sleepers. This is quite minor, but the sheets on the bed seemed to be not big enough to go around the foot of the mattress, which means that they were almost always in a ball by morning. On the plus side, the housekeeping staff were very accommodating in allowing us to sleep off our jet lag in the mornings. As a result, we didn't make it downstairs for the free breakfast on any of the four mornings. We would stay there again for sure. Hello Andrew C, On behalf of the staff here at the Lex hotel I would like to thank you staying with us. I am glad to see that our team continues to make our guest day with a bright smile, warm welcome, and their can do attitude. Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts and experience with us, we will always aim to make sure all your needs are met with a smile. We hope to see you again very soon. Kind Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager

reviews.title: Sub-par. Not ok.
reviews.content: Ancient filthy air conditioner sounds like an airplane. No table in the room! Staff were friendly but kept postponing helping me get another room. 'Please speak to the night manager.' 'Please to the morning manager.' Elevators are a joke. Mobs waiting to go up and down. I finally abandoned hope and took the stairs several flights every day. Hello Lalbkk, We have four differnt type of rooms here at the Lex that range from small to large. Based on your review it seem like you book our smallest room which is the cozy queen and it does not come with a desk. I am sorry we were unable to find you a room change, please note this request is based on availablity. Please feel free to reach out to me directly at gm@lexhotelnyc.com so we can make sure your next stay is to your specifications. Omar Sayeed General Manager The Lex Hotel NYC

reviews.title: What a Gem
reviews.content: Great boutique hotel. Clean, modern and quiet. Derek and the rest of the staff were excellent. Incredibly friendly front desk that went out of their way to meet our needs. I haven't had customer service like this in years. A++ Hello jrod0707 The best diamonds are found in the ruff. I am very happy you found great happiness in staying with us here at the Lex hotel. We hope to provide you with even more exceptional service on your next stay here at the lex hotel. Omar Sayeed General Manager The Lex Hotel NYC

reviews.title: Reunion
reviews.content: We booked the hotel because is around the corner from our son's apartment. The location could not have been more convenient. The hotel does not have bells and whistles but, it does have a very friendly, professional staff. Our room on the 6th floor was spacious and very clean. The bed was very- very comfortable which is a great plus after a long walking day. The hotel gets you going in the morning, with a simple and limited breakfast: coffee, tea, few pastries and a banana, apple or orange; small but, much appreciated. They offer free Wi Fi - which not many hotels in this big city offer. The hotel is close to subway and bus stops. Our stay at The Lex was a week long and pleasant. Yes, we would recommend this hotel to friends and family. Hello Jennifer M, We very pleased you enjoyed all we have to offer at the Lex hotel. I would like to thank you for recommend our hotel to family and friends. Omar Sayeed General Manager The Lex Hotel NYC

reviews.title: Staff
reviews.content: Thank you to the Front Lobby/check in Staff. Derek your recommendations for dinner and assistance with departure, was 5 star service. Room was small and no roll away was available. They assisted to solve my problem with addition of enough pillows and blankets to make a very coffe extra bed for one. Hello 1311gatts Thank you for the great review. We will be sure to let Derek know you enjoyed the suggestions. We look forward to see you again. Omar Sayeed General Manager The Lex Hotel NYC

reviews.title: Great hotel in a great location
reviews.content: The staff, accommodations, and location were perfect for a trip to New York. It all started when they stored our luggage when we arrived from the airport. They called us on the phone when our room was ready (way ahead of schedule.) The hotel was new. Everything was bright and clean. The elevator was fast, the bathroom clean, large, and modern. The front desk staff were helpful and gave great suggestions about what to do, where to eat, and how to get there. The location is right in the middle of everything, but in a neighborhood, not in a crowded area. It was easy to get to the subway and to every part of the city. The area around the hotel was an established neighborhood with many places to eat without having to eat at a chain restaurant. Hello picturetakingone, I are very happy you experience all 3 of our top priorities here at the Lex which are service, personality, and cleanliness. Our staff have been trained to always go above and beyond your expectations. We hope to see you again very soon. Omar Sayeed General Manager The Lex Hotel NYC

reviews.title: Gem far off the standard chains & business hotels ...
reviews.content: We found "The Lex" checking out lufthansaholidays.com, searching for something beyond the US standard stuff (I am on business trips to the US quite often and fed up by the usual chains - sorry, no names here ;-), booking it after x-checks (hotel internet site, tripadvisor, others). We were not disapponited and can confirm the super-positive ratings here: Extremly friendly and helpful front desk (Nari & Michelle who welcomed us, together with Rumel, Derek and Maurice), very clean and well maintained, good size of rooms (no ball room but completely sufficient), good start-out breakfast, and good location (Lexington Av). Additional remark: our room (601) was facing Lexington Av., we switched off AirCon, kept the window open and ... slept well (yes, this is no country-side-wellness-inn, but whoever lives in the center of a German city should be able to cope with it). We can definitely recommend it ! Hello SE-MUC-DE We are very happy that you enjoyed your stay here at the Lex hotel. We like to call the Lex your home away from home with someone to service you. We look forward to see you again on your next business trip to New York Yours Truly Omar Sayeed General Manager The Lex Hotel NYC

reviews.title: Excellent hotel.
reviews.content: The LEX is an excellent hotel. We stayed for 6 nights all was great. Very friendly and helpful staff. Good service, nice breakfast, coffee and tea 24/7 available and last but not least great bed. Not to forget: very good location in the middle of NYC!!! Good value for money. Hello Marleen O, Wow! Thank you for such a great review. You have seemed to enjoy every aspect of our hotel and that pleases me. Having guests enjoy their stay as much as you have is our goal each and every day; with you leaving this review we get to know that we have succeeded. We hope to have you come and stay with us again soon in the near future. Kind Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager The Lex Hotel NYC

reviews.title: Excellent
reviews.content: Just back from a fantastic stay at Lex Hotel NYC. Great location - away from the business of 5th Ave etc. But within a short walk of midtown and Union Sq and lots of other places worth visiting. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful and really make this Hotel a nice experience. Hotel in general is nicely done up and very clean and tidy. Room very comfortable and clean. Having wifi available even on the 7th floor was very handy. Breakfast is coffee, juices and pastries in the lobby and works very well. Perfect when you are busy with going out and about in NY! Would absolutely recommend this Hotel! Hello Mlane10, Thank you for recommending our hotel to future travelers and for taking the time to share your experience with us here at the Lex NYC. I am delighted to know that you had an excellent stay and we look forward to welcoming you back to the hotel in the near future. Kind Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager The Lex Hotel NYC

reviews.title: Great hotel
reviews.content: I would like to express my gratitude to the front desk staff of Lex hotel ‚Äì Maurice, Derek, Rumel and the other ladies (sorry, don't know their names). All gave us a homey feel and were absolutely great. Their attitude and willingness to help were outstanding and I definitely recommend this hotel. It's the best hotel I have ever stayed in. Hello Tamar1983, On behalf of the team here at the Lex we want to thank you for staying with us during your exciting to the big apple. As a valued customer our goal is to make sure you feel like family at all times, and I must say you have become a big part of our family. We hope to see you again in the future and be sure to visit Nightmares Fear Factory on your next visit to the states. Kind Regards, The Lex Hotel NYC

reviews.title: Good hotel comparing to what you are paying
reviews.content: I stayed in Lex Hotel in Oct 2016 with my wife. He just wanted the hotel to sleep as we spend all the day walking around the city. It's a good hotel comparing to what you are paying. The location is good as well. The air condition wasn't good. Mr. Maurice is very nice gentlmen and was very helpful :) ! Hello AhmedAlJowder, Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us and fellow travelers. Our location and staff makes this hotel very special to all of our guest. We hope to see you again on your next trip to NYC Kind Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager The Lex Hotel NYC

reviews.title: Great Location, Great Staff
reviews.content: Perfect hotel for a short city break in NYC, ideally located within touching distance of all the major sites on Manhattan. Room was ideal (double bed, good shower / bathroom) and for the one issue that arose, the staff were on hand to help immediately. Big thanks to Maurice, Rumel, Michelle, & Nari on the front desk for being extremely friendly and helpful. If / when I come back to NYC I'll most likely stay here again. Thanks again guys!!! Hello Chippy1307, I wanted to personally thank you for your astounding review on our hotel. Our hotels location is a huge selling point of ours and we are very proud that our valued guests have many choices of what to do in our immediate area. We hope to see you back real soon. Kind Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager The Lex Hotel NYC

reviews.title: A convenient hotel
reviews.content: Conveniently located hotel within walking distance of Times Square and all the shopping/ attractions around the area. Downside, no coffee making facilities but a quick ring to reception or a chat with staff and you can get a coffee/ tea. Continental breakfast included in the package and sets you up for the day. The beds are comfy, bathrooms spacious but very little storage space, most of our stuff is still in our suitcases. Lots of eateries in and around the area, including a deli next door if required. As we are not spending a lot of time in the hotel,we are out exploring & enjoying the city,the room meets all of our needs.. AND I don't know what they are spraying in the room, but after a day out and about,when we return the room smells lush! We are still here, 1 more night to go, I would definitely use the hotel again for an inexpensive and convenient place to stay Hello Michelle t, Thank you for the great review. I am glad we were able to be the hotel of choice for all of your needs. It is great to hear that you will stay with us again when you visit NYC. We look forward to welcoming you back. Kind Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager The Lex Hotel NYC

reviews.title: Love this place!
reviews.content: This this has become my go to hotel when in New York City. Really convenient to the office, and the value for the money can't be beat! The front desk staff is always friendly, welcoming and helpful. For a boutique hotel the rooms are a good size. really clean, comfortable beds and modern decor. Also love the location. Really close to the flat iron building, warehouse district and fifth Avenue shopping. Great Indian restaurants very close by as well! Book with confidence, this place is great! Hello Wingsnbeer, Thank you for choosing The Lex for your trip to the big city. I am very happy you had a great time at our hotel we are always looking for ways to make your stay even more enjoyable, so keep an eye out for our rooftop lounge area coming in 2017. We look forward to hosting you again during your next trip to New York City. Kind Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager The Lex Hotel NYC

reviews.title: Amazing hotel with great staff
reviews.content: Words cannot express how impressed I am with this hotel. It is in a great location and offers breakfast. The bathrooms are spacious and rooms cozy. I was a fan of the amazing orange and lemon infused water in the lobby which I could help myself to 24/7. The thing that really impressed me about The Lex NYC is it's fantastic staff. I received a warm and friendly welcome from Derek and Maurice, who continued to go above and beyond throughout my stay here. Rumel, Michelle, Angie and Nadi were also fantastic - I noticed how genuinely friendly and receptive they are with all their guests, and I personally felt that they were always going out of their way for me - available to offer me advice and have a chat when I wasn't sure where to go or what to do for the day. The housemen James and George were also great, and they always actioned my requests efficiently. If I could rate this hotel 10/5, I most definitely would. Thank you for accommodating me in such friendly luxury! Hello Pasteque69, WOW! Thank you for taking the time to leave such a fantastic review. Reading this review puts a smile on my face. The amount of customer service that you have described is exactly what I feel makes our hotel special. As you have mentioned the names of every front desk agent, you can see that they strive to go above and beyond to provide a guest with a once and a lifetime experience. The best part is that it is genuine. We can't wait for you to return and then maybe you will want to rate us 12/5. Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager

reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Value,Wonderful Staff
reviews.content: Absolutely loved this hotel. Great location, were able to walk everywhere. Close to the subway. Clean rooms with comfortable beds. No frills but a great value for the price. Bottled water in rooms, small continental breakfast and coffee and tea delivered to your room anytime were all nice touches. The best part was the staff. All were very friendly, welcoming, helpful. Maurice gave us a warm welcome and gave us great recommendations on things to do. Our room wasn't ready but he actually called us to notify us when the room was available. Rumel also gave us great recommendations of things to do. Because of them we were able to see and do so much in the three days we were there. They helped us plan out our days very efficiently and mapped it out for us. Rumel gave us excellent recommendations for places to eat. He was spot on. Rumel even booked our shuttle to the airport and prinedt our boarding passes. The hotel staff really made a difference and made our stay wonderful. Would definitely come back without question and would highly recommend this hotel. Hello izzynowakowski, Thank you for taking the time to leave a such an amazing review. I am glad you had such a wonderful experience at The Lex NYC. Our staff looks forward to making everyone's stay a great one; I will be sure to commend Maurice and Rumel for assisting in providing you with an exceptional stay. We look forward to your return in the future. Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager

reviews.title: Comfortable room near Gramercy Park
reviews.content: Just a very short walk from Gramercy Park, the Lex provides larger than expected rooms, a very courteous and helpful staff, and a lovely continental breakfast, all at a rate less than one pays for boring chains. I will be back. (Thank you again, Nari, for advising me the staff brings free and prepared tea and coffee to the rooms.) Hi Kfv333, Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us. Our team at the Lex hotel strive to provide you with a great room and experience. We are pleased to see that you had great stay. We look forward to seeing again in the near future. Kind Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager The Lex Hotel NYC

reviews.title: Good service
reviews.content: Verry pleased with our stay, the straff were verry service orientated!! The only thing I would point out to a future visiter is that the breakfast consists of pasterys (so if you are a hungry morning person like me, you will need a second breakfast :)) Hello Matistan I am very happy to see that you enjoyed our great service. The staff here number one goal is to provide you with outstanding service. We look forward to seeing you again on your next trip to NYC Kind Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager The Lex Hotel NYC

reviews.title: Much Better than Expected
reviews.content: We needed a last minute hotel close to Beth Israel. Found this hotel on the web. Great surprise.Beautiful hotel. Huge room with a deck. Beautiful bathroom. Extremely clean and helpful staff. Breakfast included. Would stay here again in a heart beat. A great find cannot say enough how we were pleasantly surprised. Not cheap but not expensive by NYC standards. Hello Drjeff, Here at the Lex we aim to please all your needs. We are happy to see that we were able to meet and exceed your expectations. We are glad to hear that you will be back. I look forward to seeing you again on your next visit to the big apple. Kind Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager The Lex Hotel NYC

reviews.title: Cozy and modern
reviews.content: From the moment we walked in, we could tell the Lex was something special. Maurice warmly welcomed us to the hotel, took our bags, and worked on getting our room ready even though we arrived before check-in. The room is nice, clean, and spacious by NYC standards. Very cozy. Modern and not extravagant. Maurice's attention to detail and hospitality certainly adds to the positive experience. Hello Daniel K W, Here at the Lex Hotel be are big believers in first impressions. We are all here to meet the needs of our guest. We all strive to go above and beyond with our friendly attitude, warm welcome, detailed service, and quality of the rooms. We will be sure to thank Maurice for his exceptional service and ensure that all our current and future guest gets the same service you received. Thank you for choosing the Lex and we hope to see you soon Kind Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager The Lex Hotel NYC

reviews.title: Great find
reviews.content: We stayed at the Lex for five days and really enjoyed it. The "Cozy Queen" room really had plenty of space, there was almost no noise from the city or anyone else, the hotel super clean, the staff friendly, and the location in Midtown great steps from two subway lines. You get free water every day, free wifi, and complimentary decent breakfast. Especially for the price (and this is on the more affordable side in Manhattan), this place can't be beat. Hello GrmnHE, We are very happy that you took the time to share your experience with us at the Lex hotel and all the great travelers who visit Trip Advisor. We are always looking to hear from our guest so we may improve our product and service to ensure the guest is having a experience at all times. We look forward to see you again. Kind Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager The Lex Hotel NYC

reviews.title: Clean, friendly, no frills, great location. I'll be back!
reviews.content: I stayed with a friend for the weekend, she was there all week. This is a small, boutique hotel so if you need room service, rollaways and a big breakfast buffet this is not your place. If you want a clean, comfortable room and friendly helpful stuff in a great location this IS your place! The room was not "built around" the queen bed. We had plenty of room for walking around each other and all our stuff. The bed was very comfortable with nice linens. The bathroom was large by NYC standards and had good shower pressure. Our room was on the 4th floor on a rear corner. We had little to no street noise. Most nights were very quiet. I do think if you had a noisy person in the room next to you that you could hear them, we did only a few times. Our room had a small balcony. No view but extra space. Coffe and small continental breakfast in the lobby each morning. There is a small bodega next door and larger one just a block away. Plenty of good, reasonably priced restaurants nearby. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. I want to call out Rymel specifically for his customer service. The staff were able to quickly hail cabs, even on a rainy Monday morning. They walked me to the cab holding an umbrella and ensured neither I nor my luggage got wet. I expect that at the Intercontinental but was pleasantly surprised at it here. I will be back. Super clean! Super friendly! Great location in midtown close to tourist areas but not touristy. Hello, RTR24 First I would like to thank you for stay with us at the Lex hotel. Being a small boutique hotel we have the opportunity to make every experience a great one. Our best value at the Lex hotel other than the facility itself, is our service and attention to detail. We make sure every guest who enters our hotel feel like a VIP with the little things we do. I am very happy to see we were able to make your stay a memorable one, we look forward to see you again on your next trip to New York City. Kind Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager

reviews.title: Highly recommend!
reviews.content: The rooms were very clean and comfortable. Everyone of the employees that we encountered were extremely friendly, helpful and accommodating. Free continental breakfast was available every morning. They even provided complimentary bottled water everyday, such as nice touch, and very appreciated! We would book here again. Hello, Maryvargas21 On behalf of the staff here at the Lex hotel I would like to thank you staying with us. I am glad to see that our team continues to make our guest day with a bright smile, warm welcome, and their can do attitude. Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts and experience with us, we will always aim to make sure all your needs are met with a smile. We hope to see you again very soon. Kind Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager

reviews.title: The Lex - Short name but BIG on service and comfort!
reviews.content: Upon arrival at the Lex, a staff member greeted us at the front door. The front desk personnel was extremely courteous and efficient. We had an excellent room on the 7th floor, facing Lexington Avenue. Although it was not as large as what I am used to, it made use of space and it was very clean and comfortable. Coffee makers are not provided but the hotel offers 24 hour coffee service delivered straight to your room! Complimentary water is provided daily as well as morning pastries and coffee in the lobby. Our location allowed for lots of sightseeing on foot and it was great to come back to the pleasant staff and quiet room. We stayed at the Lex for 4 nights and can not express enough how professional yet accommodating everyone was and we would recommend this hotel to all in a heartbeat. Hello, Yvonne S Thank you for a wonderfully review. I am pleased to see that all the things we practice and preach here at the Lex hotel is being delivered from the moment you walk into our doors until the day you leave. All of the members of our team are travelers as well, and we all love to feel special when we stay at any hotel. With that mentally we are able to provide you our extended family with nothing but the best. We hope to see you again Kind Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager

reviews.title: Excellent Friendly Hotel
reviews.content: What a fantastic little hotel. Friendly staff always available to help. The added bonus of breakfast every morning. On hand 24 hour room service, so when you just fancied a coffee it wasnt any trouble. It was very clean and I would hestitate to stop again. Even looked after our luggage for a couple of days whilst we went to a different hotel to watch the US Open Tennis. Hello debrap47 First we would like to thank you for choosing The Lex, it was our pleasure to host you. Here at The Lex we strive for excellence and our goal is to make you the guest feel like a VIP at all times. Our team is always glad to go above and beyond for you with any and all request you might have. We look forward to seeing you again on your next trip to New York City. Kind Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager

reviews.title: Modern Low Frills in a Great Location
reviews.content: We had a modern compact rooms (as pictured on the site) with a balcony facing the next building (no views from any room). Great friendly staff (thanks Omar) in a great location just east of Madison Square Park at the southern edge of the Flatiron/Nomad hotel area. No frills hotel with complimentary continental breakfast held in the small lobby. Limited storage and a loud AC are minor annoyances for the benefits of the location if the price is right. Hello, SDK_CAN Thank you for a sharing your thoughts and experience with us so we may address your concerns and build on the things we do well. Our location and staff are the things that makes us great. We will look in to the AC issue you report, to ensure this is not an annoyance to you and our future guest. Our goal here it to make sure you enjoy a worry free stay. We look forward to seeing you again. Kind Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager

reviews.title: Great stay in The Lex
reviews.content: This was our 1st time on NYC so don't have anything local to compare it to, but found it to be a very nice hotel with excellent staff. The location of the hotel is in midtown and is within walking distance of lot of the main attractions. It took around 5-10 minutes to walk to Madison Square Park and then a short walk onto 5th into the Flatiron district. If walking is not your thing then you are only a couple of blocks from the subway or cabs are very frequent and easy to flag down outside the hotel. There are also great restaurants close to the hotel if you don't fancy venturing too far on an evening. The staff in the hotel were very helpful and informative. Our bags didn't arrive on our flight and the staff were excellent in directing us to a pharmacy and clothes shops to get some emergency stuff to see us through until they arrived. The various members of staff we met were very friendly and couldn't do enough for you. This is a basic hotel which is reflected in the price but it doesn't pretend to be anything further. If you are expecting waiter service and gold elevators then this is probably not the place for you. but if you want, like we did, just a quiet, clean hotel with somewhere to lay your head after a busy day then this is perfect. The rooms were clean and tidy with a nice bathroom. We didn't have the breakfast in the hotel but it looked good with pastries and coffee available. There was a deli next door which has a load of other food available if you wanted something bigger All in all it was a great trip and the Lex did everything we asked of it to make it that way. We will be booking again on our next trip to NYC. May be sooner than I think if my bet with the guy on reception comes off and Kel Brook wins on Saturday, he promised me a free trip to NYC. Ha ha Thanks for a great trip . Hello, Thank you for choosing The Lex for your first trip to the big city. I am very happy you had a great time at our hotel we are always looking for ways to make your stay even more enjoyable, so keep an eye out for our rooftop lounge area coming in 2017. We look forward to hosting you again during your next trip to New York City. Kind Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager

reviews.title: Pleasant Boutique Hotel - minor inconveniences
reviews.content: Stayed 4 nights in Sept - over the Labor Day weekend. The very good - very pleasant staff: clean, comfortable, modern room: Excellent climate control (wall thermostat); good size bathroom w/ fine (Eden) toiletries & quality linens: good water pressure (hot & cold): most efficient (& unobtrusive) housekeeping: totally free, strong, in-room wi-fi (still sadly a NYC rarity). Our room, at the rear of the hotel, was very quiet, despite being on the 2nd floor. While the location (lower Lexington Ave) is not the greatest scenically in NYC, it is a short walk to Madison Square Park (Shake Shack, Eataly,), Park Ave, Broadway, 5th ave restaurants and shopping, and to mass transit (M23 crosstown bus) and several subway routes along 23rd st. Because I booked through a 3rd party site, I emailed the hotel prior to our stay re room type and was informed ', , ,the room that will be provided will be a standard room, ,with a view of the city.' So much for that, we were given a 2nd floor room, with a sliding glass door, which opened only about 8 inches (due to a 'stop' in the tracking rail), and directly onto pipes coming from the ground and several huge industrial metal tanks (water?) - see attached photo. The Standard Queen is a typical NYC Boutique room (i.e., on the small side - with about a foot and a half clearance from each side of the bed to the wall). The narrow armoire is curiously (& IMHO, inefficiently) designed, with the hanging rod going from the center back of the closet to the front, allowing for only 5 or 6 tightly stacked articles of clothing - a bit inconvenient and insufficient for a couple - not to mention the design results in at least 2/3 wasted/unusable space. Also, coffee & Ice, while available for delivery by calling the front desk, would be more convenient if made accessible to hotel guests at all times in the lobby. Surprisingly, I would still recommend the Lex hotel overall, based upon value for those looking for a most modern, comfortable, and affordable NYC option.

reviews.title: Excellent Service!!
reviews.content: Amazing, friendly, knowledgable, and helpful staff. Great place!!! The room was spacious and clean. Modern, well-stocked with a great balcony. The staff was always very helpful with issues like parking and baggage handling. Hello matthewlR9073RT, Thank you for taking the time to write an excellent review. I am happy to read that we were a "Great place!!!" for you to stay. Please don't be a stranger and come stay with us again soon. Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager

reviews.title: Clean and affordable hote
reviews.content: I have stayed at this hotel several times. The staff is always polite and helpful. The hotel is small but comfortable. It is also very clean. During this visit we got a room facing the street side, it is very noisy. So when you book ask for a room that does not face the street. The metro station is close to it ( green line 6) get off on 23rd street. W

reviews.title: Good budget option
reviews.content: This place is no frills, but if you are looking for a somewhat affordable room in NYC, it's a good option. My room was on the basement level, which means there were no real windows. But it seems like maybe the basement rooms are larger, so that's the tradeoff. My room was pretty big and the bathroom was enormous. The rooms are very minimal when it comes to decor, but they are clean and have everything you need (hair dryer, iron, high quality toiletries and flat screen TV). The air conditioning works really well, so expect your room to be pretty chilly. The AC unit is also a bit on the loud side, but the noise is a steady fan noise, so it didn't bother me. The staff at this hotel is incredibly friendly and nice. They are very eager to help and did a great job arranging a very affordable ($50, inclusive of tip) town car to take me to La Guardia from the hotel. They also let me hang out in the air conditioned lobby for a long time so I could avoid the sweltering heat while I killed time between checking out and heading to the airport. If you are looking for a place that is clean, has friendly service and is in a good location (very short walk to Madison Square Park, Union Square, Eataly, lots of shopping, etc.), this is a good deal. It's not super cheap, but by NYC standards, it's pretty darn affordable. My room was $282 a night (including taxes) while the other hotels I typically stay at were around $500-$600 per night that same night.

reviews.title: Great boutique hotel in NYC
reviews.content: We spent a quick week end in NYC and stayed at the Lex. It's a small cozy hotel with a GREAT staff. Close to everything we needed and love about New York, the hotel is conveniently close to a long term parking garage (no discounts for hotel guests available, but super safe and accessible) The rooms are super clean and well arranged, if you're looking for a large room in NYC get ready to drop the big bucks and the Lex might not be for you. The size of the room was perfect for our needs. I do have to say the soundproofing could use a bit of improvement for the connecting rooms but apart from that it was great! Most definitely going to stay at the Lex Hotel again! Hello Sabrina P, Thank you for the 5 star review. I am glad we were able to be the hotel of choice for all of your needs. It is great to hear that you will stay with us again when you visit NYC. We look forward to welcoming you back. Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager

reviews.title: My NYC Summertime Fun Trip
reviews.content: So we booked this hotel because it offered a suite and a balcony at a very good rate. We even called in advance to make sure that we where getting a balcony and they said yes. When I checked in the hotel on Monday July 11, I was told that the balcony was out of order due to renovations of the outside of the building. What a disappointment! The hotel manager right away offered free breakfast for the entire stay for all three of us and some extra Marriott points Great! The room was great until time to sleep. My son was going to sleep on the sofa bed but it was so uncomfortable you can feel all the springs. He called front desk to ask for a bed topper which they did not have. But was able to get some extra blankets but it was still uncomfortable. They felt bad and discounted the room for that night and offered to change rooms with two queen beds the following morning if we wanted. The next day they changed out the sofa bed with a new one but still the mattress was horrible. I got a call from the manager and explained the problem so he offered a rollaway bed verses changing rooms.. Our room was very nice.. the sofa bed was the problem.. Now its the second night, the roll away bed was just as bad.. We gave up!! On day three we went to K mart and purchased a full size egg cratered topper for the sofa bed and WE FIXED the sofa bed problem. We laughed and still laugh at ourselves carry this egg crate bed topper from K Mart on the subway to our hotel.. The only thing I can say is GET some egg crate toppers for these darn sofa beds so that your guest can sleep comfortable. It was a $20.00 investment for me and your hotel got to keep the topper which probable got thrown away by the cleaning people. Other than the disappointment of the balcony being out of order and having to keep my window shades closed all day because men where on it working and the horrible sofa bed mattress this hotel was very nice and all the staff was so kind. Audrey the lady who was cleaning my room was wonderful! The bar in the lobby was great! breakfast was amazing. Yes I would back and I would love to have the same room when the Balcony in order so that I could enjoy it. Maybe next summer! My bed king size bed was great I am giving the sleep quality a very good rating only based on the sofa bed. I am trying to be fair here.

reviews.title: What a gem!!
reviews.content: Me and my husband stayed here for s weekend getaway and I gotta say I was blown away. The location is ideal close to almost everything and the subway is only a few blocks away The staff is fantastic, always smiling and ready to assist. There's a cool chic vibe in the lobby but the hallways are a bit bare. We were fortunate enough to get upgraded to a balcony room which was a great perk. I wish the breakfast had a bit more to offer but none the less it is complimentary and the pastries were fresh, Great way to start the day. The housekeeping team does a great job as our room was spotless everyday, which is so pleasant to come home too after a long day of sightseeing. That's right I said home because that is how the staff at The Lex makes you feel. Keep doing what you are doing and we will definitely be back. Cheers! Hello zai s, Thank you for such an amazing review. I am glad to read we were able to be a home away from home for you. That is the type of experience we hope all of our guests have with us. Thank you for sharing your five star experience with future travelers. We will await your arrival in the future. Regards, Omar Sayeed General Manager

reviews.title: Great, welcoming staff, but request higher room
reviews.content: The staff was extremely approachable and helpful. They looked like they enjoyed their jobs-- always great to see. I was bummed that while I was the only one in my group to call in advance to request a higher up, corner room, I was the one who got a room with a weird view of and access to the heating/cooling equipment immediately out of # 207's window. It felt awkward to have sliding glass door access to that kind of mechanical space. And I wasn't sure if maintenance workers would be accessing the space immediately outside my window, so I just kept the blinds closed the entire time-- which defeats the point of this room having a sliding door or even eye level windows. A window higher up on the wall that acted more like a skylight would seem to make more sense both for security and aesthetics. But the rest of the room was well designed, even spacious for a single traveler. The bathroom was a great size particularly! And the complimentary wifi, water, and coffee (upon request) were a great touch. I would highly recommend and would stay here again-- just on a higher floor for sure.

reviews.title: NYC Break
reviews.content: The hotel is very modern inside and very clean. It's around a 30 minute walk to Times Square the "Big Bus Tour" hop on hop off buses pick up in Times Square for all tour routes although the tours themselves take a long time due to the NY traffic. Although clean the hotel itself doesn't have any tea/coffee facilities within the room, you can request hot drinks via the reception desk, however I would expect them to be within the room as standard. Breakfast is served at 7:30 until 9 which we found extremely early, given this was our fourth stop on a USA trip this was the earliest breakfast one which we didn't sample. All in all a decent hotel ideal as a base.

reviews.title: Not a good stay - pot smoke and dodgy housekeeping
reviews.content: I wanted to write a good review for this hotel because the desk staff were brilliant. But frankly, that was it. We stayed for a week and couldn't wait to leave. I provided feedback to the hotel a few days after we left and have had no response so I feel obliged to leave this review. Housekeeping was rubbish. Day one, excellent. Day two, came in to our pyjamas and belongings slung onto the floor. Day three, toiletries removed and not replaced etc etc. It was very shoddy. On the weekend, we wished to stay inside to watch the wimbledon final on TV before venturing out. The most horrific stench of pot smoke invaded the room. After about an hour as it got stronger and stronger, we had to go out. I complained at the desk and was told 'Yeah we know'. Great. So we had to find a bar to watch the final in. Location - ok if you're happy to get around by walking or subway but not much in the immediate vicinity. Although, the restaurants recommended were good. I have stayed at a number of 'boutique' hotels at the same price point in the city over the last 5 years and this doesn't come anywhere close to the others, the Distrikt, for example is MUCH better. Really disappointed the hotel chose to ignore my complaints and thus I have to leave this review. But seriously, don't stay here.

reviews.title: Boutique as it says...small, clean, personal, in a great location...
reviews.content: Very hepful people at the desk, nice breakfast in a very short room, but cosy, nice decoration, super bath, very clean and tide...in a GREAT LOCATION...What else to ask somebody in the center of New York?

reviews.title: 9/10 would recommend to anyone
reviews.content: The only thing that I had a problem with was the room size, it was a little small but I was not spending very much time in there. The price and location were unbeatable and the staff were very friendly and helpful, they told me several places to go and the best things to do with my time.

reviews.title: Perfect Location for all things NYC!
reviews.content: After a long flight from the UK and a VERY long taxi drive from the JFK, we were so ready to put our feet up! We were greeted by the most lovely young lady (I do wish I had took her name) with the best smile we had seen all day. Smooth and friendly check in, offered us everything we could have wanted and even gave us tips on where to get the best doughnuts! Our room was lovely. Perfect size for what we wanted, which was dumping the bags and going out in the City! Cleanliness was tip top, couldn't have faulted that at all. I believe our Housekeeper was called Mary, she deserved every penny of the tip we gave her, so thank you. The coffee machine was a lovely touch, enjoyed using that every morning with the smell of coffee filling the room. The wireless charging radio was a god send, I had left my phone charger in the UK and I was so happy to have this in the room. The bathroom was wonderful, brilliant shower and clean towels daily. The location was perfect. Right next to Port Authority and 2 minutes walk into Times Square, and you couldn't hear a thing so you could get a good night's sleep ready for the next day! There are some road/building works going on around the Hotel, but they didn't bother us at all. Workmen were very courteous and kindly moved over if you needed to get past. We had originally booked a shuttle back to JFK after our 4 night stay, but cancelled that and took a pre-booked cab from the Hotel. The hotel booked it all for us and was there on time! Would never use a shuttle again knowing that this service is available. From arrival to departure, we loved every single thing about this hotel. From the comfy beds, the free ice water in reception to the smiling faces of the Staff every morning, noon and night. It was perfect. We will DEFINITELY be back. Thank you again for everything. See you soon!

reviews.title: Fantastic, no complaints!
reviews.content: Great location, friendly staff, surprisingly quiet room, zero complaints. Staff even happily accommodated our need to store luggage from checkout (12 pm) until we had to catch our train out of the city (8 pm). Really highly recommended!

reviews.title: A bit of a strange one
reviews.content: This hotel feels sandwiched between to other well known hotels. The cleaner kept leaving our hotel door open after cleaning the room and when we complained to reception they appeared disinterested. While the hotel has an excellent location for Times Square and Central Park however I don't think we would stay here again

reviews.title: Check-in was a mess!
reviews.content: We arrived on a Tuesday to Distrikt Hotel. Our room wasn't ready early so we dropped our bags off and came in at 4:00, an hour after check-in time. We were the only people checking-in at that time yet it took 25 minutes to check in. The woman checking us in said she wasn't sure if our room was ready (even though it was past check-in time?) and she would go check on it herself. Why would she leave us downstairs and go upstairs to peek in our room? It was very weird. She ended up using the walkie talkie to ask a bell man to check on our room which was more efficient but still strange to me. Then she had me do a "mobile check-in" on the ipad where I entered all the information I had already provided. Such a waste of time- if you're going to have mobile check in then have kiosks. Don't make guests check in twice. And finally she couldn't print room keys on her own for some reason and had to wait until her front desk colleague wasn't busy and he printed our room keys. When we finally got up to our room we waited for our luggage. Finally someone arrived and he brought us someone else's luggage. So then we had to wait again. As far as the room was, it was nice. The mattress was terrible though. When we finally got to our room, there was a letter on the desk addressed to Ms. Van Hess. No idea who Ms. Van Hess is. I called down to the front desk and they told me they write those for everyone and our rooms got switched at one point. When I opened the letter it was general hotel info including wifi info. For a hotel that promotes water conservation, what a waste of paper this was! The letter was addressed to Ms. Van Hess and that was the only personalized part. But that means they have to reprint a letter for each guest when they could just laminate it and put it in the hotel info notebook like the rest of hotels do. Another advantage to that is if rooms get switched at the last minute then it isn't obvious. Not surprising after the letter but there is not a recycling bin in the room. I had requested a high level room with a nice view. We got a level 4 room with a view of the Port Authority. I only mention this because it added to our sour first impression- I know that simply requesting something doesn't mean the hotel can accommodate us. Good things about this hotel: Leo was super nice when we were checking out.

reviews.title: Disgraceful hotel
reviews.content: Worst hotel I ever paid for and the staff don't care and they refused to give us back a refund do not trust the website at all its all lies and fake advertising the smell as soon as we walked in was horrible and no place to rest in the lobby it's like they found a gab between buildings and build this hotel it's the same of my car

reviews.title: Pretty good stay
reviews.content: Our stay at distrikt hotel was simply great, very good location in manhattan, beautiful room with enough space for an one week stay. People were very friendly. An excellent rate for this hotel which is highly recommandable

reviews.title: Great guest service!!!
reviews.content: The location of the hotel was excellent. The room was very comfortable and clean. The staff at the front desk was very helpfull at all times specially the ladies that work the graveyard. Thanks for making us feel at home.

reviews.title: Great experience
reviews.content: The district hotel is a five star hotel. The customer service was excellent from the beginning to the end of my stay. Great location only minutes from time square. The rooms were cozy and clean! I would definitely come back.

reviews.title: Central to New York
reviews.content: Welcoming, clean, useful central location to Times Square, Central Park, Penn Station. Convenient and reasonably priced hotel restaurant Hotel management need to clarify with agents the policy on breakfasts with room charges.

reviews.title: it's ok!
reviews.content: It is well located because you are not in Times Square (so you can sleep) but you are soooo close. But I was expecting a bit more. The bed linen had some holes, the cupboard is really tiny. People working there are really helpfull and always with a smile, that and the location makes it an ok hotel to stay (but not for long, you don's have space to store things)

reviews.title: Perfect - not too close, not too far
reviews.content: This hotel was ideal: close enough to everything to be convenient, but far enough away not to hear all the Times Square noise. It was beautiful. We would totally stay here again. The tv reception wasn't great, but who cones to New York City to watch tv? We really enjoyed our stay.

reviews.title: great locarion safe and comfortable
reviews.content: This is our go to place when we are coming in to the city for shows or museum visits. It is clean. The staff is courteous and friendly. The hotel is warm and safe and inviting. The location is excellent. The room is always clean and the nights are quiet even though you are in the middle of the city. You do not hear the noise of the streets, especially on the higher floors. I wish they had a restaurant though

reviews.title: Perfect location
reviews.content: I spent 5 nights at the Distrikt hotel and came away more than happy. All we needed was a clean comfortable room and bed, and a decent bathroom.The Distrikt hotel had all this, plus very friendly staff, and a fantastic location. Only a few minutes walk from Times Square, but very quiet in the room (I was on the 16th floor). The room was small but had a really comfortable bed, and a decent shower, it also had a clock radio that had several built in phone chargers which was useful. The hotel doesn't provide meals, but does offer decent snacks, and has a nice intimate bar. The rooms are kept clean by a good team of housekeepers. Across the road is the Port Authority transport hub which was great for sorting out excursions. It's not the most sumptuous hotel ever, but it's decent, and comfy and ideal for a short stay. Highly recommended.

reviews.title: Great small hotel
reviews.content: If you want great service and friendly staff then this is your place. Our group has been coming here for 4 years and we plan to keep coming back! You will love this place. It is small and quaint and a perfect location.

reviews.title: Boutique doesn't have to mean basic
reviews.content: Overall we just felt it fell-short of being a 4-star hotel. The check-in experience was fine but it was the little and basic things that let it down and stopped it from being a 4-star hotel eg the TV kept cutting out, they ran out of breakfast items first thing in the morning, on the last day we gave our luggage to the porter whilst we went out in the morning. When the taxi turned up it took him 1/2 hour to retrieve our luggage - there was no sense of urgency there. It just felt very frustrating and I think they can do so much better.

reviews.title: Great Little Hotel
reviews.content: Stayed in this hotel for 4 days in May/June and it's a great little hotel. Staff extremely friendly and check-in very quick. Nice touch to have fruit infused water in the reception area to take as you please. Didn't eat in the bar/restaurant area as seemed quite pricey but a great little space to relax in. Rooms were a little on the small side but for a solo traveller more than adequate. Had all the amenities one would need, extremely comfortable bed, and the working aircon was a huge bonus. Location wise it's about a 4 minute walk to times square. Extremely convenient if exploring that part of the city. However, a great find is 2 doors down from the hotel. A great little coffee shop/cafe where everything on the menu is $2. All fresh and all good quality. Extremely useful. Only a couple of gripes. Having to re-connect to the wifi daily was a slight annoyance and the connection kept cutting in-and-out making it tricky whilst working. But just a small gripe. The only other is that, being a small/narrow hotel, the walls are paper thin. On my floor i could hear the noise from all the other rooms around me. Unfortunate that one of these was a crying baby every morning at 5.30am but this is just bad luck on my part. Additionally, the elevators are VERY slow but, again, just a small gripe. All in all, a wonderful little hotel that ticks pretty much all the boxes if you want a stay in a great NYC location and just need a base.

reviews.title: Another excellent stay
reviews.content: I've been staying at Distrikt since the year that it opened and it remains my go-to hotel in the city for its proximity to Broadway and the friendliness of the staff. Rooms feel airy and are always impeccably clean and it's competitively priced against the other hotels around Times Square.

reviews.title: Nice Hotel
reviews.content: Sorry for the delay in posting this review. This is a vertical splinter of a hotel: 30-some stories high, with only about 5 rooms on each floor. As a result, there is little in the way of amenities on each floor, but the hotel staff work hard to compensate. If I wanted ice, they would deliver it to our room, no charge (a tip would be up to you). And when we asked for an second luggage rack, one was delivered fairly quickly. They were also willing to deliver a small refrigerator if I wanted it, but our room was on the small side, even by Manhattan standards. The modest eating space in the hotel was apparently in flux while we were there. But the hotel offered a decent if not exciting breakfast at a pretty decent price - so if you just want to get and eat some basic food pretty quickly without fuss so that you can get to your sightseeing, it was just fine. We stayed there using a middle-level Priceline offer (not the name your own price option), where we were pretty sure which hotel we would probably get, and would stay there again in a similar situation. As an aside: the hotel seems well-connected with tourists from abroad - not a complaint, just an observation. This actually added a bit of charm to interactions in the elevators. Some other reviewers were a little troubled by its proximity to a parole office and its clients. Because we were there on a holiday weekend, the office was never open. In this part of Manhattan the numbered east-west streets tend to be more grungy than the north-south avenues in general - not sure if the parole office makes any difference. We always felt safe. The hotel is not far from Penn Station, near some useful subway lines and stops, and not far from Ninth Avenue, which has more restaurants and shops that are frequented by locals.

reviews.title: Distrikt first stay
reviews.content: It was a great sleep! The location is handy and close to the subway. The hotel is small and quiet. Not much street noise and close to Times Square. It was the first time we stayed at this hotel chain.

reviews.title: Ideal Location
reviews.content: Overlooking Hell's Kitchen and just a few minutes away from Times Square, the Distrikt Hotel is the ideal location for anyone wanting to enjoy some of the city's most iconic landmarks....Looking forward to my next stay! Thank you for your positive review! We agree that our location is very ideal and are happy to hear that overall your stay was phenomenal. We appreciate your positive feedback and look forward to seeing you on your next visit to the Big Apple!

reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.title: Excellant stay

Service was good with chances of improvement at the bar. Thank you for your positive feedback! We are happy to hear that our location and accommodations were satisfactory during your stay. We appreciate your honest feedback and hope you choose Distrikt the next time you visit New York City!

It's near terminal building, so not very pretty. - Greeting and welcome wasn't great, not very friendly, functional at best. However different team later on was smiley and helpful.

TV uses local channels + HBO and is reasonably responsive. Bathroom is well-sized but not large, excellent water pressure and showerhead. Overall a solid choice at a great price-point, good staff (at least after 10 pm when I checked in), will return in the near future

The lobby has a nice, warm feel to it, and it has a dispenser filled with fresh, lemon/lime water for the guests (yes!). Kodos to Netanya Smith for great customer service. She secured for us a beautiful room on the Harlem floor that had a great view of the City (I believe each floor has a name). Be sure to ask for her when you check in. The rooms are small without giving up comfort. And for the location, Times Square, the price is right. I will be staying there again.
